text:
Name:  ___                    Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: PLASTIC
 
Allergies: 
codeine / Percocet / latex / adhesive tape / some plastics
 
Attending: ___
 
Chief Complaint:
History of breast cancer now with nodal disease
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
1. Lymphovenous Bypass x 2
2. On table lymphangiogram with interpretation
3. Under aseptic conditions today 50 cc of sterile saline was 
injected into bilateral tissue expanders
4. Left axillary nodal dissection

 
History of Present Illness:
___ year old female with history of left breast cancer who 
recently underwent bilateral mastectomy with sentinel lymph node 
biopsy and insertion of bilateral tissue expanders.  The 
pathology on 1 of 2 left axillary nodes returned as metastatic 
carcinoma.  The patient was met with Dr. ___, Dr. ___ 
Dr. ___ decided to have left axillary lymph node 
dissection with a lymphovenous bypass to decrease risk of left 
upper extremity lymphedema.  Plan will be to aggressively fill 
the tissue expanders until she starts radiation therapy.
 
Past Medical History:
- Essential Tremor  
- Insomnia  
- Migraines HA  
- Irritable bowel syndrome  
- Hx of abdominal hernia  
- Hx of anxiety - no hx of panic attacks or  
hospitalization, does not see a counselor  
- Hx of fibromyalgia - not seeing a Rheumatologist  
- Hx of breast cysts  
- Hx of traumatic bilateral pneumothorax in ___ sp MVA 
. 
PAST SURGICAL HISTORY:  
- L knee ACL repair  
- Breast lift  
- Abdominoplasty  

 
Social History:
___
Family History:
Breast cancer: Maternal GM, Maternal Aunt (2), maternal cousin. 
All in ___ and ___. Genetic testing results pending

 
Physical Exam:
Physical exam per post op check note on ___:
VS: HR 80 RR 18 O2 sat 100% on 3L NC  BP 99/61

GEN: NAD, pleasant, conversant 
HEENT: NCAT, EOMI, sclera anicteric
CV: RRR
PULM: no increased work of breathing, comfortable on 3L NC
BREAST: Left breast incision C/D/I, minimal swelling, no
hematoma. Breast tissue warm, well perfused. 
ABD: soft, non-tender, non-distended, no masses or hernia
EXT: Warm, well-perfused, no edema, no tenderness 
NEURO: A&Ox3, no focal neurologic deficits
PSYCH: normal judgment/insight, normal memory, normal 
mood/affect
WOUND: Left axillary incision clean, dry and intact
DRAINS: JP left axilla x1, serosanguinous output, ~30 cc   

 
Brief Hospital Course:
# breast cancer with nodal disease
Patient was taken to the OR with breast surgery and plastic 
surgery and underwent a left axillary nodal dissection as well 
as a tissue expander fill bilaterally and a lymphovenous bypass. 
 Patient tolerated the procedure well and had uneventful 
recovery in PACU and was transferred to floor.  She was given IV 
fluids overnight and slept well by report.  She was given some 
IV morphine PRN overnight to help with pain.  In the morning, 
the patient was switched to a PO regimen of morphine, Tylenol 
and ibuprofen.  Patient was nervous about pain control, but by 
the afternoon, felt pain was well controlled with this regimen 
and was ready for discharge home.  Her vital signs were stable, 
she was voiding freely and her left axillary incision was intact 
with JP draining light serosang fluid.

 
Medications on Admission:
Polyethylene Glycol 17 g PO DAILY  
TraZODone 50 mg PO QHS:PRN insomnia  

 
Discharge Medications:
1.  Acetaminophen 650 mg PO Q6H  
2.  Ibuprofen 800 mg PO Q8H 
RX *ibuprofen 800 mg 1 tablet(s) by mouth every eight (8) hours 
Disp #*15 Tablet Refills:*0 
3.  Morphine Sulfate ___ ___ mg PO Q4H:PRN Pain - Moderate 
RX *morphine 15 mg ___ tablet(s) by mouth every four (4) hours 
Disp #*30 Tablet Refills:*0 
4.  Polyethylene Glycol 17 g PO DAILY  
5.  TraZODone 50 mg PO QHS:PRN insomnia  

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home With Service
 
Facility:
___
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
# breast cancer with nodal disease
# high risk for left upper extremity lymphedema.

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Personal Care:  
  1. You may leave your incisions open to air or you may cover 
them with a clean, dry dressing daily.  
  2. Clean around the drain site(s), where the tubing exits the 
skin, with soap and water.  
  3. Strip drain tubing, empty bulb(s), and record output(s) ___ 
times per day.  
  4. A written record of the daily output from each drain should 
be brought to every follow-up appointment. Your drains will be 
removed as soon as possible when the daily output tapers off to 
an acceptable amount.  
  5. You may shower daily. No baths until instructed to do so by 
Dr. ___.  
  .  
  Activity:  
  1. You may resume your regular diet.  
  2. DO NOT lift anything heavier than 5 pounds or engage in 
strenuous activity until instructed by Dr. ___. 
  3. No lifting of your left arm above shoulder level x 1 week. 
  .  
  Medications:  
  1. Resume your regular medications unless instructed otherwise 
and take any new meds as ordered.  
  2. You may take your prescribed pain medication for moderate 
to severe pain. You may switch to Tylenol or Extra Strength 
Tylenol for mild pain as directed on the packaging.    
 3. Take Colace, 100 mg by mouth 2 times per day, while taking 
the prescription pain medication. You may use a different 
over-the-counter stool softener if you wish.  
  4.  Do not drive or operate heavy machinery while taking any 
narcotic pain medication. You may have constipation when taking 
narcotic pain medications (oxycodone, percocet, vicodin, 
hydrocodone, dilaudid, etc.); you should continue drinking 
fluids, you may take stool softeners, and should eat foods that 
are high in fiber.  
 .  
  Call the office IMMEDIATELY if you have any of the following:  

  1. Signs of infection: fever with chills, increased redness, 
swelling, warmth or tenderness at the surgical site, or unusual 
drainage from the incision(s).  
  2. A large amount of bleeding from the incision(s) or 
drain(s).  
  3. Fever greater than 101.5 oF  
  4. Severe pain NOT relieved by your medication.  
  .  
  Return to the ER if:  
  * If you are vomiting and cannot keep in fluids or your 
medications.  
  * If you have shaking chills, fever greater than 101.5 (F) 
degrees or 38 (C) degrees, increased redness, swelling or 
discharge from incision, chest pain, shortness of breath, or 
anything else that is troubling you.  
  * Any serious change in your symptoms, or any new symptoms 
that concern you.  
  .  
 DRAIN DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS  

You are being discharged with drains in place. Drain care is a 
clean procedure. Wash your hands thoroughly with soap and warm 
water before performing drain care. Perform drainage care twice 
a day. Try to empty the drain at the same time each day. Pull 
the stopper out of the drainage bottle and empty the drainage 
fluid into the measuring cup. Record the amount of drainage 
fluid on the record sheet. Reestablish drain suction. 

 
Followup Instructions:
___
translated:
이름 : ____________________    단위번호 : ____________________
입원일자 : __________________~     퇴원일 자 : __________________~
생년월일 : _______ 성별 : 여성
서비스 : 플라스틱
알레르기 : 코딘/Percocet/라텍스/적합 테이프/ 일부 플라스티크
진료 의사 : _______________________
주요 수술 또는 침습 절차 :
1. 림프관 우회수술 × 2번
2번 표면 림파그래피와 해석
3번 오늘날 50cc의 정결된 생리액을 양측 조직 확장기로 주입했다.
4번 좌측 경부 림포절제술

병력 개시:
여성 연령 만 10세 여성 왼쪽 유방암으로 최근 양측 유방切除술과 선발림프절검사를 받았다. 병력이 오른쪽 상지 림프로테오증 위험 감소를 위해 좌측경 부 림보체절제를 시행한다. 계획은 그녀가 방사선 치료 시작하기 전에 적극적으로 조직확장을 채운다.

 과거 임상 기록:
- 필수 떨림 증후군  
- 불면증  
- міг레인  
- 장내 출혈  
- 두통  
- 외상성 복막팽창  
- 유방 낭종  
- 흉부외과  
- 고혈압  
- 심근경색  
- 간염  
- 당뇨  
- 알코올 중독  
- 약물중독  
사회 역학:
___ 가족 역학: 유방 암: 모친 GM, 모친 사촌(2명), 모친 아들. 모두 ___ 및 ___. 유전자 검사 결과 대기 상태이다.

신체 검사:
신체검사는 ___에 대한 후작업 체크 노트에서 수행되었다.
VS: 80/18 O₂ Sat 100%
GEN: 안정적인 상태로 보이는 환자
HEENT는 NCAT이고 EOM도 있다.
CV는 RRR이며 PULM에서는 증가된 호흡 곤란이 없으며 3 L NC에서 편안하다.
ABD는 가볍고 무감각하며 무질서한 질환이 없다.
EXT는 온화하고 잘 퍼지는 것이며 NEURO는 AOX3이며 특징 없는 신경계 손실이 없다.
PSYCHOLOGICAL STATUS는 일반적인 판단력과 인식력을 가지고 있으며 기억력과 분노/영향력도 일반적인 것이다.
드레인은 청소되고 건조하며 완전하게 유지된다.
JP는 왼팔 축하 x1이며 혈청량은 30 cc 이상이었다.

간호 과정 요약:
# 유방 종양
환자는 유방 수술과 비만 수술을 통해 왼손 팔꿈치 근육 확장기를 삽입했고 동시에 림브겐을 사용하여 림베토 제거술을 시행하였다. 환자가 잘 견디었고 평온히 회복되었으며 밤새 IV 액체를 투여받았으며 잠을 잘 잤다. 환자는 통증 관리에 대해 걱정이 많지만 오후에는 이 레그멘에 의해 통증이 잘 조절되어 있었다. 그녀의 중요한 징후는 안정적이었으며 그녀는 자유롭게 소변을 내리고 왼편 엑스탈린절개술은 아직 남아있다.

 입원 시 약물:
폴리에틸렌 글라이콜 17g PO 일일  
트라ゾ돈 50mg PO Q HS:PRNs insomnia  

퇴원 약물 :
1번 아세타민오프 650mg PO 6시간마다  
2번 아이부 프로펜 800mg PO 시간마다  
3번 모르핀 섀이트 ___ ___mg PO 매 4시간마다 
Disp #: 30 Table Refill: 0  
4번 폴리에틀이글라이콜 하루 17 G  
5번 트라조돔 50 MG PO Qhs:PRns insomnia  

출산 처분:
집에서의 서비스

기관:
___

퇴원 진단:
#유방 종괴
#우측 상지 리모델링

퇴원 상태:
 정신 상태: 명백하고 지속 가능한 상태
정신 상태: 각성 및 상호 작용
활동 상태: 독립 활동 가능

퇴원의 지침:
 개인 켄싱:
1번 당신의 궤적을 공기에 노출시키거나 깨끗하고 건조한 드레스를 매일 착용할 수 있습니다.
2번 피부에서 튜빙을 씻어

text:
Name:  ___                    Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   M
 
Service: ORTHOPAEDICS
 
Allergies: 
Sulfa (Sulfonamide Antibiotics) / iodine
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
Ankle fracture
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
___ - ORIF right ankle fracture

 
History of Present Illness:
 Mr. ___ is a ___ y/o male who presents with right ankle
pain after twisting injury to right ankle while shoveling snow 
at
8pm tonight. No head strike or LOC. Presented to ___
complaining of isolated right ankle pain. Found to have R ankle
fx which was inadequately reduced. Transferred to ___ for
surgery.

 
Past Medical History:
HLD
Sytolic murmur

 
Social History:
___
Family History:
NC
 
Physical Exam:
Vital Signs: 99.4 102 154/78 18 97% RA
Gen: NAD, A&O x 3, Calm and comfortable

Lower Extremities:
BLE skin clean and intact 
Right ankle with significant deformity, ecchymoses, and 
swelling,
with skin tenting/duskiness medially over the medial malleolu,
superficial fracture blisters medially
No other tenderness, deformity, erythema, edema, induration or
ecchymosis 
Thighs and leg compartments soft
No pain with passive motion 
Saphenous, Sural, Deep peroneal, Superficial peroneal SILT 
___ ___ ___ TA Peroneals Fire
1+ DP pulse

 
Pertinent Results:
___ 02:45AM BLOOD WBC-9.4 RBC-4.76 Hgb-15.4 Hct-44.8 MCV-94 
MCH-32.3* MCHC-34.3 RDW-13.4 Plt ___
___ 02:45AM BLOOD Glucose-116* UreaN-24* Creat-1.3* Na-140 
K-4.5 Cl-106 HCO3-24 AnGap-15
 
Brief Hospital Course:
The patient presented to the emergency department and was 
evaluated by the orthopedic surgery team. The patient was found 
to have a right ankle fracture and was admitted to the 
orthopedic surgery service.  The patient was taken to the 
operating room on ___ for ORIF right ankle fracture, which 
the patient tolerated well (for full details please see the 
separately dictated operative report). The patient was taken 
from the OR to the PACU in stable condition and after recovery 
from anesthesia was transferred to the floor.  The patient was 
initially given IV fluids and IV pain medications, and 
progressed to a regular diet and oral medications by POD#1. The 
patient was given perioperative antibiotics and anticoagulation 
per routine.  The patients home medications were continued 
throughout this hospitalization.  The patient worked with ___ who 
determined that discharge to rehab was appropriate. The 
___ hospital course was otherwise unremarkable.

At the time of discharge the patient was afebrile with stable 
vital signs that were within normal limits, pain was well 
controlled with oral medications, incisions were 
clean/dry/intact, and the patient was voiding/moving bowels 
spontaneously. The patient is touch down weight bearing in the 
right lower extremity in a bivalve cast, and will be discharged 
on lovenox for DVT prophylaxis.  The patient will follow up in 
two weeks per routine. A thorough discussion was had with the 
patient regarding the diagnosis and expected post-discharge 
course, and all questions were answered prior to discharge.

 
Medications on Admission:
The Preadmission Medication list is accurate and complete.
1. Lisinopril 10 mg PO DAILY 

 
Discharge Medications:
1. Lisinopril 10 mg PO DAILY 
2. Acetaminophen 650 mg PO Q6H 
3. Docusate Sodium 100 mg PO BID 
4. Enoxaparin Sodium 40 mg SC DAILY 
Start: Today - ___, First Dose: Next Routine Administration 
Time 
RX *enoxaparin 40 mg/0.4 mL 40 mg sc Daily Disp #*14 Syringe 
Refills:*0
5. Milk of Magnesia 30 ml PO BID:PRN Constipation 
6. OxycoDONE (Immediate Release)  2.5-5 mg PO Q4H:PRN pain 
RX *oxycodone 5 mg ___ tablet(s) by mouth Q4-6H Disp #*60 
Tablet Refills:*0
7. Senna 8.6 mg PO BID 

 
Discharge Disposition:
Extended Care
 
Facility:
___
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Right ankle fracture

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - requires assistance or aid (walker 
or cane).

 
Discharge Instructions:
MEDICATIONS:
- Please take all medications as prescribed by your physicians 
at discharge.
- Continue all home medications unless specifically instructed 
to stop by your surgeon.
- Do not drink alcohol, drive a motor vehicle, or operate 
machinery while taking narcotic pain relievers.
- Narcotic pain relievers can cause constipation, so you should 
drink eight 8oz glasses of water daily and take a stool softener 
(colace) to prevent this side effect.

ANTICOAGULATION:
- Please take lovenox 40mg daily for 2 weeks

WOUND CARE:
- No baths or swimming for at least 4 weeks.
- Any stitches or staples that need to be removed will be taken 
out at your 2-week follow up appointment.
- No dressing is needed if wound continues to be non-draining.
- Cast must be left on until follow up appointment unless 
otherwise instructed
- Do NOT get cast wet

ACTIVITY AND WEIGHT BEARING:
- Touch down weight bearing in bivalve cast

Physical Therapy:
Touch down weight bearing right lower extremity in bivalve cast 
at all times.
Treatments Frequency:
Clean, dry dressing changes to wound and blisters under bivalve 
cast every day. 
 
Followup Instructions:
___
translated:
이름 : ____________________    병동번호 : ____________________
입원일자 : __________________~     퇴원일 자 : __________________~
생년월일 : __________________    성별 : 남성

서비스 : 정형외과

알레르기 : sulfamethazine / 요오드

진료 의사 : _______

주상병 :
발목 골절

수술 내역 :
_____- 오리프 우측 발목 골격

환자의 소견은 다음과 같다.
Mr. ____는 28세의 남자로 오전 8시 눈치게 흙을 치우며 우측 무릎 부상을 입고 왔다. 머리가 맞지 않았으며, 우측 신경통으로 병원을 찾았다. 발견된 우측 안부가 불완전하게 감소되어 수술실에 이송되었다.

 과거력 :
HD
심근 마비

사회력 :
_____
 가족력이 없다.

신체 검사는 다음과 같다. 체온 37도, 혈압 120/80mmHg, 맥박 96회/분, 호흡 16회/ 분이었다. 대화 능력 양호하고 편안하였다. 하지 상피는 깨끗하며 손상되지 않았다. 다리는 유연하였으나 통증 없었다. 경막 피질 및 심장 전문의 시술 없음. 다리의 근육은 탄력적이며 통증 없고 변비였다. 두개골 외상이나 혼수 상태는 없었으며, 환자는 평정한 상태에서 응급실에 도착하여 진단받았다.

결과물은 다음과 같았다. Blood WBC 9.42, RBC 4.762, HGB 15.43, HCT 44.83%, MCV 93.92, MCH 32.33, MHC 34.35, RDW 13.41, PLT 123,000. Blood glucose 115.95, urea nitrogen 23.98, creatinine 1.31, sodium 139.91, potassium 4, chloride 105.88, bicarbonate 24.01, anion gap 15.

간략한 병원 과정은 다음과 같이 진행되었다. 환자가 응급 실에 와서 정형 외과의학과를 평가 받았으며, 그곳에서는 우측 족관절 골절이 확인되었고, 수술 후 회복되면서 수술을 시행했다. 환자는 잘 견딘다(상세 내용은 별도의 수술 보고서 참조). 환자는 수술 이후 PACU로 옮겨졌으며, 회복 후에는 환자를 데리고 가서 수술 중 항생제와 항응고제 투여를 하였으며, 가정 약물을 계속 사용하도록 했다. 환인은 루브노스용량 40㎖ 일일 투약을 시작한다. 환인의 집 약물 목록은 정확하고 완벽하다. 1.Lisinopril10mgPODAILY

퇴원 처방은 다음과같이다. 2.Acetaminohene 650mgPOQ6H 3.Docusatesodium100mgPOBID 4.Enoxaparinsodium40mgSCDAILY Start:Today---First doseNextRoutineAdministration Time RX enoxaparine40mg/0 4ml40mgscDailyDisp#14Syringe Refill#0 5.MilkMagnesium30mlPOBIDDPRNConstipation 6.OxycodONE(Irreversible) 2 5 5mgPO Q4 6HRX oxycodones5mgtabletbymouthQ460tabletsRefill#00 7.Senna86mgPOBD

퇴원의 조치는 다음과 같다: 확대 간호

기관 : _______ 

퇴원 진단 : 우측 종아리 골절 

퇴원의 상태 : 정신 상태는 명확하고 협명하며, 인식 상태는 각성이고 상호 작용된다. 활동 상태는 보행이 필요하지만 보행 장애인이다.

퇴원 지침은 다음과 같은 것이 있다. MEDICINE - 다음날 아침에 복용하는 것을 잊지 말라. - 주치의에게서 지정된 시간에 복약해야 한다. - 알코올 음주나 차량 운전에 대해 금지하지 않는다. - 나르콘이 아픈 동안 기계를 운전하면 안 된다. - 위액 증가를 방지하기 위해 매일 8잔의 물을 마셔야 하고 콜락시스를 먹어야 한다. ANTICOAGULANTS - 로벤옥 40MG 하루 복용 ANTI-COGULATION - 다음 날부터 2주 동안 로벤 옥 40 MG 복용 WOUND CARE - 적어도 4주 동안 목욕이나 수영을 할 수 없다

text:
Name:  ___            ___ No:   ___

Chief Complaint:
left shoulder pain
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
NONE
 
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ old woman with presenting with left

translated:
이름 : ___ 성별 : 여성 입원일자 : 2023년 02월 21일 퇴원일 자 : 03월 07일 생년월일 : 19930531 병동 : 내과 서비스 : 의료 ALLERGIES : 알레르기 또는 약물 반응 없음 진단 및 치료 Attending Physician의 이름은 다음과 같습니다. 주소는 없습니다. 주요 수술이나 침습적 절차는 없습니다.

주요 증상 :
좌측 어깨 통증

진찰 결과 :
환자는 좌측 어금니통증을 호소하며, 이로 인해 환자의 신체 검사는 다음과 같이 나타났다. 초기 심박수는 92bpm이었으며, 혈압은 169mmHg였다. 혈액검사에서 백혈구가 76개였고, CRP와 ESR도 높았다. 왼쪽 어깨X선 촬영에서는 급성 골절 소견이 없었다. 환자가 관할하는 외과의사가 추천한 것은 우측 어지럼치 유발에 대한 설명이 없는 경우이다. 환자는 IBUPROFEN 600MG를 복용했다.

전달 시 체온은 96.5°C이었다. 환인은 좌측어깨 통풍으로 보고되었다. 전반적인 상태는 다음과 같다:

+ 피부 발열, 기침, 밤 땀, 두통, 안경 변화, 코나즈, 콧노래, 목 부종, 가슴 통증, 복통, 구토, 설사, 변비, 멘탈리티, 요실금, 요독감 등이 있다.

 과거 병력 :
- 고혈압
- GERD
- 골관절염
- 우울증

사회 역학 :
여성 연령대인 남성 연예인 가족 역학 :

+ 아버지와 삼촌에게 간암이 있었다. 어머니는 출산 중 사망하였다. 류머스 질환이 있는 사람은 없다.

신체 검사 :
입원 후 신체 감시 :
정맥 압박은 없지만, 경련은 있었던 것으로 보이며, 손목의 움직임은 제한되어 있었다. 근육 강화는 없었으나, 팔꿈치를 들어 올리는 것이 불가능하여, 그곳에는 무게가 없었다. 뇌 기능 검사에서 모든 CN이 정상이었지만, 어깨 상승은 불편했고, 힘은 약간 떨어졌다. 피부 검사에서는 아무런 이상 징후가 없었다.

퇴원 후 실내 물리 치료는 계속된다. 가정에서의 운동은 가능하다. 다음 날 오전 10시에 재방문하도록 하겠다. 다음날 오전 시간에 다시 방문하도록 한다. 다음 날짜에 연락하면 된다. 다음은 추가 정보입니다. 다음 사항은 추가되지 않았다. 다음 내용은 추가하지 않는다. 다음 항목은 추가되었습니다. 다음 정보는 추가되지 않습니다. 다음 일정을 예약한다. 다음 일정은 변경될 수 있습니다. 다음으로 진행됩니다. 다음 단계는 추가된다고 합니다. 다음 조치는 추가되지 않았습니다. 추가 정보는 없습니다.

출생일 : 년 월 일 성별 여성 병동 내과 응급 처치 병동 응급 상황 응급 사태 응급 대처 응급 처리 응급 관리 응급 치료 응급 회복 응급 위험 응급 발생 응급 사건 응급 현장 응급 구조 응급 지원 응급 교류 응급 협조 응급 원인 응급 이유 응급 동향 응급 지표 응급 표본 응급 자료 응급 분석 응급 평가 응급 판단 응급 결정 응급 행동 응급 행위 응급 수행 응급 실행 응급 완료 응객 응급 응급 상태 응급 환자 응급 보호 응급 안전 응급 방역 응급 예방 응급 교육 응급 지도 응급 안내 응급 상담 응급 면담 응급 진료 응석 응급 수술 응급 투약 응급 약물 응급 식품 응급 음식 응급 영양 응급 생활 응급 환경 응급 공공 응급 사회 응급 문화 응급 정신 응급 마음 응급 생각 응급 태도 응급 자세 응급 포스트 응급 활동 응급 운동 응급 휴식 응강 응급 잠자기 응급 취침 응급 꿈 응급 망각 응급 기억 응급 추억 응급 미움 응급 사랑 응급 친밀함 응급 관계 응급 친구 응급 가족 응급 아버님 응급 모친 응급 형제 응급 누나 응급 언니 응급 남편 응급 여자친구 응급 남자친구... 응급 전화번호 응급 메시지 응급 문자 응급 카톡 응급 sns 응급 이메일

Name:  ___                 Unit No:   ___

History of Present Illness:
History per son and patient. ___ yo male recent right MCA stroke 
two months ago transferred directly from OSH for management of 
intermittent delerium. Suffered right MCA stroke on ___, 
with left arm hand and leg weakness, small infarct CT/MRI. Prior 
to stroke, full ADLs. Developed severe, intermittent, repetitive 
spasms/jerking of his left leg within a day or two. He indicated 
that he had had some of this previously but no family member had 
ever seen this. Started on oxycodone and ropinirole for possible 
restless leg syndrome. Seemed more like hemiballismus to son. 
Following stroke, patient was transferred ___ 
___ in ___. He was treated for Proteus and Klebsiella 
UTI with ciprofloxacin.  
.  
Post stroke mental status normal for about ___ days then 
delerium started. Apparently was awake much of the night at 
rehab (___/ ___) for ___ weeks, 
agitated, confused, disoriented. continued ropinirole, 
oxycodone. More functional during the day and able to 
participate in ___, OT, cognitive therapy. Regularly exhausted 
during the day, always wanting to sleep between therapies. 
Mental status waxing and waning but often quite normal during 
the day. Trial of pregabalin, olanzapine, and clonazepam, 
discontinued.  
.  
10 days ago, had episode of orthostatic hypotension (not 
documented). Returned to ___ twice for repeat CT scans because 
of mental status changes. Repeat CT head was unremarkable, see 
below. urinalysis was unremarkable. Initial report suggested 
extension of infarct but review with neurologist and radiologist 
indicated no increase. TTE showed significant atherosclerotic 
disease of the aortic arch. MS improved during time at ___. He 
also received haloperidol 5 mg, and was sedated for most of two 
days. 8 days ago, seen by son, back at baseline.  
.  
One week ago, more delerious -> more haldol. started risperdal 
___, increased to BID. Also started citalopram. 2 days ago, 
very sedated. Last dose risperdal two days per son. this 
afternoon, back at baseline. Transferred for further eval.  
.  
On the floor, patient was requesting something to drink. He was 
expressing frustration with ambulance driver. He was complaining 
of pain near the foley catheter, and of feeling cold, and a dry 
cough. He had no other complaints. Specifically, denied 
fevers/chills. No chest pain, dyspnea. No abdominal pain. Denied 
constipation. He reports improving strength in his LUE and LLE. 
He also endorses intermittent left calf pain/spasm. He has been 
frustrated at times over the past few weeks with rehab.  
.  
Of note, elevated BP, with SBP > 200, noted at time of 
re-transfer to OSH 10 days ago and intermittently for 
delerium/agitation. Patient has required parenteral hydralazine 
and ACEi, when agitated and not taking PO, to manage HTN at OSH. 
Patient has AAA, 5.4 cm, on recent CT a/p.  
.  
Review of systems:  
(+) Per HPI  
(-) Denies fever, chills, night sweats, recent weight loss or 
gain. Denies headache, sinus tenderness, rhinorrhea or 
congestion. Denied cough, shortness of breath. Denied chest pain 
or tightness, palpitations. Denied nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, 
constipation or abdominal pain. No recent change in bowel or 
bladder habits. No dysuria. Denied arthralgias or myalgias. 
 
Past Medical History:
right MCA stroke as noted above  
.  
Before the stroke mental status normal: lived alone, took care 
of himself and his house with help. Drove his car, shopped, 
cooked for himself, met friends for lunch, paid his own bills, 
managed his finances. He had a cerebral event ?TIA vs stroke 
___, seen at ___ with left hand sx. These sx resolved.  
.  
burn right leg as a child  
C-spine, L-spine surgeries x 2 or 3: disk disease and spinal 
stenosis

normal per son

Gout

dyslipidemia

Brief Hospital Course:
Mr. ___ is an ___ y/o male with a hx of HTN, DM2, dylipidemia, 
recent CVA ___ who presented from OSH for further management of 
change in mental status.
.
1) Change in Mental Status: His mental status waxed and waned 
which was most consistent with a delerium. He was recenlty 
treated for a UTI (recent hospitalization) and was noted to have 
an elevated creatinine which normalized with fluids. His sodium 
was also been noted to be elevated which corrected with fluids 
as well. He also had multiple med changes as well as interuppted 
sleep which all may have contributed to his change in mental 
status. As for a neurological cause, he has no new focal 
neurological deficits although neuro exam was difficult to 
assess (stable left sided weakness ___ to recent stroke). He had 
no fevers, cough, meningismus or dysuria therefore infection was 
less likley. As for other metabolic causes, he has been 
extensively worked up at outside hospitals which have all been 
negative. His urine was found to be growing enterococcus 
10,000-100,000 which was treated with a 7 day course of 
augmentin. As per neurology they felt that EEG was consistent 
with toxic/metabolic and not seizure. After discussion with 
family LP was felt not to be indicated. After an extensive 
workup it was unclear why he continued to have delerium. Based 
on recent events his mental status was most likley due to recent 
stroke.
.
2) Nutrition: He was noted to have decreased PO intake. He was 
refusing his medications and was not eating. Nutrition was 
consulted and they advanced his diet to regular solid foods with 
thin liquids. They recommended a chin tuck, 1 sip at a time with 
2 swallows. Please encourage family to encourage patient to take 
in oral intake.
.
3) MCA Stroke: According to admission notes his neuro exam had 
not changed. He has baseline residual left sided weakness. Left 
arm weakness is most prominent.
.
4) Hypernatremia: He was noted to have an elevated sodium which 
was thought to be secondary to poor PO intake. He received D5W 
and his sodium improved. He was encouraged to take in as much PO 
(free water) intake. However, despite this he developed 
hypernatremia. Please check sodium every 3 days and correct with 
D5W. 
.
5) HTN: He was restarted on his home medications. He was 
continued on metoprolol, Lisinopril and Valsartan
.
6) Anemia: He was noted to have a macrocytic anemia however his 
folate and B12 were within normal limits. ___ be secondary to 
chronic renal insufficiency.
.
7) Left Hand Pain ___ MCP): He has a history of gout and his 
presentation was consistent with a gout flare. He denies any 
fevers, chills or night sweats. He was given a one time dose of 
colchicine 0.6mg. If gout persists may repeat 0.6 once.
 
Medications on Admission:

Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted because you having episodes of confusion about 
one and half weeks after you sustained a stroke. You had an 
extensive workup which was unrevealing. It is unclear why you 
continued to have these episodes of confusion, but it is most 
likely related to the stroke you sustained. You were also on 
many medication when you first arrived which could cause 
confusion however even with the medications out of your system 
you continued to have some confusion.

You were also noted to have elevated sodium level. The most 
likley cause of your elevated sodium was decreased fluid intake. 
This was originally thught to be contributing to your confusion 
however when the sodium was corrected with IV fluids you 
continued to have episodes of confusion.

You were also noted to have a urinary tract infection. You 
completed a 7 day course of the antibiotic Augmentin. You 
tolerated this well however you continued to have episodes of 
confusion. 

Your blood pressure was elevated during this admission. You were 
started on your home blood pressure medications and your blood 
pressure responded appropriately.

입원일자 : _______________________ 퇴원일 자 : __________________~

서비스 : 내과

진료 의사 : _______.
주요 증상 :
정신 상태 변화

수술 또는 침습적 절차 : 없음

병력 개시 :
최근 오른쪽 MCA 뇌졸중을 입고 두 달 전 직접적으로 OSH로 이송되었다. 간헐적인 발작으로 인해 간호를 받았다. 이전에 우측 팔 손발 및 다리 약화가 있었다. 부모는 최근의 우측 MCA뇌졀전 후 왼손 주먹와 다리가 약간 약해졌다고 했다. 산소 치료제인 옥시코돈과 로피니롤을 시작했다. 아들이 보았듯이 반구형 운동이 더 많다. 이후 환자는 병력이 있다. OSH에서 2개월 전에 환자가 발생했으며, 그때도 환자의 정신 상태는 정상이었다. 환자는 또한 일부 기저질환을 가지고 있었지만 가족 구성원이 본 적은 없었다. 환인은 또한 불면증을 앓고 있으며, 환인의 정신 상태 변화를 관리하기 위해 산소치료제와 로피노릴을 계속 사용하고 있다. 환인이 복용한 것은 전체 ADL였다. 환이는 또한 몇 시간 동안 잠들었으나, 환아에게는 그렇지 않았다. 환아는 또한 환부의 신경학적 검사를 통해 확인하였다. 환사는 또한 혈액검사에서 알 수 없는 부분이 발견되었는데, 이는 환아의 행동이다. 환은 또한 환아가 지속적으로 혼란스러웠던 이유는 환아 때문이라고 한다. 환이가 환아를 데리고 갔을 때 환아 역시 환아 때문에 혼란 스럽다는 것을 느꼈다. 환하는 또한 환자를 데려왔고, 환가는 환아로부터 도움을 받아야 한다고 생각한다. 환지는 또한 환인을 데리고 가서 환아와 함께 일할 수 있는 능력을 갖추었다. 환이나 환아 모두 환아에 대해 잘 알고 있음을 보여준다. 환나는 또한 환이를 데리고 갈 필요성이 있다고 생각하며, 환이는 환아 없이도 환아처럼 행동할 수 있을 것이다. 환시는 또한 환자가 환아보다 먼저 사망했다. 환치는 또한 환이가 죽어버렸다고 말했고, 환은 환아로서의 역할을 수행해야 할 것으로 여겨졌다. 환기는 또한 환사가 환아였기에 환아나 환아 둘 다 환아라고 말했다. 환사의 경우 환아뿐만 아니라 환아도 환안을 데리고 가지 않을 것이며, 환이가 생존하지 못하면 환아라도 환아라 하겠다. 환스는 또한 환기가 환아이고, 환이 환아라는 사실을 인정받으려고 노력했다. 그러나 환아들은 환아들을 데리고가지 않으면 안 된다. 환년에는 또한 환가를 데리고갈 필요성을 느끼게 되었다. 환에는 또한 환수가 환아임에도 불구하고 환아들도 환아들과 같은 행동을 하는 것 같다. 환이 또한 환상을 경험하였으며, 환리는 또한 환애를 데려왔다. 환재는 또한 유방암을 앗고있다. 하지만 환아들에게는 환이가 아닌 다른 사람들의 존재가 없다. 환에서는 또한 환앙을 데려갔다. 환량은 또한 유산을 겪었다. 하지만 유방 암은 환년에겐 없어서 환아들이 환아랑 같이 행동하도록 만들었다. 따라서 환은 유방염을 앟고 있다. 하지만 이는 환의 과거에 대한 설명이며, 환의 현재 상황은 환의 상태를 나타내는 것이다.

imaging: 
___
CT c-spine:
1. No acute fracture of the cervical spine. 
2. Grade 1 anterolisthesis of C2 on C3 and C3 on C4 which may be 

degenerative, although this cannot be confirmed without prior 
studies. Grade 1 retrolisthesis of C4 over C5 with mild kyphosis 
and moderate canal stenosis. 
3. Moderate spinal canal stenosis at C4-5 and C5-C6, which could 
predispose the patient to cord injury in the setting of minor 
trauma. MRI is recommended for further assessment of cord or 
ligamentous injury, provided the patient has no 
contraindications to MRI. 

___
CT Head:
No acute intracranial hemorrhage or edema. No acute skull 
fracture, within the limitations of slight motion.  

___
CT abdomen/pelvis/chest:
1. Moderate to large right pneumothorax with a small component 
of 
hydropneumothorax.  
2. Large hiatal hernia containing fluid. Fluid in the entire 
esophagus, 
placing the patient at risk for aspiration. 
3. Emphysema. 
4. Posterior right rib fractures 5 through 11. 
5. Multiple compression deformities of the thoracic and lumbar 
spine as 
detailed above, age indeterminate. 
6. Extensive subcutaneous gas of the neck, abdomen, pelvis and 
right arm.  
Pneumomediastinum.  
7. Diverticulosis, no evidence of diverticulitis. 

___ EKG:
Sinus rhythm. Low QRS voltage. Consider prior inferior 
myocardial infarction. Prior anterior myocardial infarction. 
Since the previous tracing of ___ delayed R wave progression 
is more prominent but there may be no significant change. 

___ echocardiogram:
The left atrium is dilated. There is mild symmetric left 
ventricular hypertrophy. The left ventricular cavity is 
unusually small. Left ventricular systolic function is 
hyperdynamic (EF>75%). Due to suboptimal technical quality, a 
focal wall motion abnormality cannot be fully excluded. There is 
a mid-cavitary LV systolic gradient, which increases with the 
Valsalva maneuver. Right ventricular chamber size and free wall 
motion are normal. The aortic valve leaflets (3) are mildly 
thickened but aortic stenosis is not present. No aortic 
regurgitation is seen. The mitral valve leaflets are mildly 
thickened. Mild (1+) mitral regurgitation is seen. The tricuspid 
valve leaflets are mildly thickened. There is moderate pulmonary 
artery systolic hypertension. There is an anterior space which 
most likely represents a promient fat pad. 

IMPRESSION: Small, hypertrophied and hyperdynamic left ventricle 
with a mid-cavitary gradient. Moderate pulmonary hypertension

___ CXR 
No pneumothoraces are seen on either side. There is again seen a 
very large hiatal hernia which is less air-filled. There are 
bilateral pleural 
effusions, right side worse than left, which are unchanged from 
prior. There are no signs for overt pulmonary edema. There is 
demineralization of the thoracic spine with some compression 
deformities. 

microbiology: 
___ Stool Clostridium difficile culture - negative 

 
Brief Hospital Course:
The patient was admitted to the Trauma Surgical Service after 
transfer from the OSH. She was s/p fall with multiple right rib 
fractures and right pneumothorax. The chest tubes were placed to 
suction. She also had lumbar and thoracic spinal compression 
fractures which were non-operative; neurosurgery was consulted. 
She was initially admitted to the surgical trauma ICU for 
monitoring of her respiratory status. The patient was 
hemodynamically stable.

Neuro: Initially pain service was consulted regarding epidural 
anasthesia. However, that was not done, and instead the patient 
received IV morphine with good effect and adequate pain control. 
She also recieved a transdermal lidocaine patch to the chest. 
She recieved Tylenol and Toradol. On ___, she was strated on 
PCA dilaudid. When tolerating oral intake, the patient was 
transitioned to oral pain medications, namely in liquid form and 
that was easier for her to tolerate. Pain service was involved 
to manage pain. 

CV: The patient remained stable from a cardiovascular 
standpoint; vital signs were routinely monitored. Cardiac 
anzymes were monitored multiple times and were negative. The EKG 
was performed on ___, which was not suspicious for acute 
ischemia. The echo was done on ___, the results are detailed 
in the previous section. 

Pulmonary: Patient was admitted with the right pneumothorax and 
subcutaneous emphasema along the right lateral chest wall and 
flank extending inferiorly to about right anterior superior 
iliac spine. At the time of admission she had one chest tube 
placed and later on the same day she had a second chest tube 
placed to suction. Good pulmonary toilet, early ambulation and 
incentive spirrometry were encouraged throughout 
hospitalization. She recieved albuterol and ipratropium as 
needed for shortness of breath. Both of the two chest tube were 
removed on ___, patient experienced some 
respiratory distress on ___ she had small apical pneumothorax 
on CXR. The respiratory distress was treated with nebulizers, 
cpap and diuresis. Her repiratory status was monitored in the 
trauma ICU until ___, when she was transferred to the floor. 
Two days later she experienced respiratory distress and was 
transferred back to the ICU on ___. Subsequntly, patient was 
intubated in the ICU and chest tube was placed on the right 
side. She continued to have an air leak, the chest tube stayed 
to suction. Treatment with vancomycin and cefepime were started 
for presumed pneumonia. Patient's respiratory status improved 
and she was extubated on ___ and transferred to the floor. 

She did well on the floor, even though she had a persistent air 
leak. Attempts were made to clamp the chest tube, she initially 
did not tolerate it. The pleurodesis was done by thoracic 
surgery service at bedside. Patient tolerated it well. Several 
days later, the air leak largely disappeared, patient eventually 
tolerated clamping and chest tube to water seal for almost 48 
hours. The chest tube was then removed and patient remained in 
good respiratory status with no residual pneumothorax on chest 
x-ray. Patient recieved daily chest x-rays to monitor her right 
sided pneumothorax. 

By the time of discharge patient was on her home dose on 
supplemental oxygen, sating well over 92%.  

GI/GU/FEN: Post-operatively, the patient was made NPO with IV 
fluids. Diet was advanced when appropriate, which was well 
tolerated. Patient's intake and output were closely monitored, 
and IV fluid was adjusted when necessary. Electrolytes were 
routinely followed, and repleted when necessary. 

Patient was kept NPO initially secondary to large hiatal hernia 
and concern for aspiration risk. She had a speech and swallow 
evaluation on ___. The recommendations were diet of thin 
liquids and pureed consistency solids, medications to be crushed 
with the liquids, one on one supervision and nutrition consult 
was recommended. Recommended diet was started following this 
evaluation. 

ID: The patient's white blood count and fever curves were 
closely watched for signs of infection. She remained afebrile. 
The sputum cultures were sent once, but contained only 
respiratory flora. Patient was treated with vancomycin and 
cefepime for presumed pneumonia. 

Stool was sent on ___ for Clostridium difficile analysis. There 
was no growth. 

Endocrine: The patient's blood sugar was monitored throughout 
his stay; insulin dosing was adjusted accordingly.

Hematology: The patient's complete blood count was examined 
routinely; no transfusions were required. Her anemia was at 
baseline. 

Prophylaxis: The patient received subcutaneous heparin and 
venodyne boots were used during this stay; was encouraged to get 
up and ambulate as early as possible with physical therapy.

At the time of discharge, the patient was doing well, afebrile 
with stable vital signs. The patient was tolerating a regular 
diet with supplements, ambulating with assisstance, voiding, and 
pain was well controlled. Her respiratory status was much 
improved and stable, at her baseline. The patient received 
discharge teaching and follow-up instructions with understanding 
verbalized and agreement with the discharge plan.

simvastatin 10 mg once daily 
albuterol
flovent
Celexa 20 mg once daily 
lisinopril

multiple right rib fractures

Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
You were hospitalized because of the fall that resulted in your 
rib fractures and lead to the right lung pneumothorax. 

Please call your doctor or nurse practitioner or return to the 
Emergency Department for any of the following:

*You experience new chest pain, pressure, squeezing or 
tightness.

*New or worsening cough, shortness of breath, or wheeze.

*If you are vomiting and cannot keep down fluids or your 
medications.

*You are getting dehydrated due to continued vomiting, diarrhea, 
or other reasons. Signs of dehydration include dry mouth, rapid 
heartbeat, or feeling dizzy or faint when standing.

*You see blood or dark/black material when you vomit or have a 
bowel movement.

*You experience burning when you urinate, have blood in your 
urine, or experience a discharge.

* Call or return immediately if you experience pain which is 
getting worse or changes location or moving to your chest or 
back.

*You have shaking chills, or fever greater than 101.5 degrees 
Fahrenheit or 38 degrees Celsius.

*Any change in your symptoms, or any new symptoms that concern 
you.

Please resume all regular home medications , unless specifically 
advised not to take a particular medication. Also, please take 
any new medications as prescribed.

Please get plenty of rest, continue to ambulate several times 
per day, and drink adequate amounts of fluids.

Avoid driving or operating heavy machinery while taking pain 
medications.

치명된 부상을 입고 있어 현재 치료 중이다. 투여하는 약물을 계속해서 복용하도록 하며, 주의 깊게 관찰할 필요가 있다. 추가적인 검사를 받으려면 의사의 진단을 받아야 한다.

추가 사항:
기타 정보를 기재하면 된다.

환자의 상태는 아침에 정상이었다. 그는 갑작스러운 오른쪽 측면 가슴통과 관련된 어지럼치와 심박수를 경험했다. 이것은 스스로 해결되었고 그는 그의 강아지를 걷다가 또 다른 에피소드를 겪었다. 이는 약물 복용량 증가로 인해 발생한 것으로 보인다.

정신 상태는 명확하고 일관되며 정신 상태는 경계선이다. 활동 상태는 독립적인 ambulatory였다.

간단한 입원 과정 :
Mr. ____ was transferred from outside hospital where he underwent cardiac cath showing severe three-vessel CAD. See operative note. Following surgery, he was taken care of in ICU for close monitoring in stable state. Later today, he woke up neurologially intact and was extubat ed. On POD 1, he began beta blockers and diur etics and gradually diureses back to his prep weight. Today, he went through telemetry floor. Chest tubes and epicordial pacing wires removed according to protocols. Physical therapy helped him regain strength and mobility throughout recovery. He developed postradiation atrial fibrillation and converted to sinus rhythm using lopressors and amiodarones. Coumadins weren’t initiated because he’s considered a high-risk individual. Rest

REPORTS
CARDIAC CATH ___
COMMENTS:      
1. Selective coronary angiography in this right dominant system 
demonstrated three vessel disease. The LMCA has no 
angiographically 
apparent disease. The LAD had a total occlusion in the proximal 
portion 
of the vessel and a diagonal with an 80% mid vessel stenosis. 
The Cx had 
a total proximal occlusion. The RCA had a total proximal 
occlusion. 
2. Limited resting hemodynamics revealed elevated right and left 
sided 
filling pressures with an RVEDP of 14mmHg and an LVEDP of 
21mmHg. The 
Pulmonary pressures were moderately elevated with a PASP of 
44mmHg. The 
cardiac index was preserved at 2.2 l/min/m2. There was a 60mmHg 
gradient 
from the LV to the aorta on pullback of the catheter. The 
central aortic 
pressure was noted to be 143/44 mmHg. 
3. Limited arterial conduit arteriography revealed an SVG to OMB 
that 
had a 40-50% ostial stenosis. The SVG to PDA had a 60-70% 
stenosis in 
the mid portion of the SVG. The RPDA was a very large vessel and 

provided collaterals to the Cx distribution. The SVG to Diagonal 
had a 
90% ostial stenosis with slow flow into the diagonal branch. The 

diagonal branch had collateral from the LAD. The LIMA to the LAD 
was 
widely patent and the LAD was a small vessel in caliber. 
  
FINAL DIAGNOSIS:     
1. Three vessel coronary artery disease. 
2. Severe aortic stenosis. 
3. Moderate diastolic ventricular dysfunction. 
4. Moderate pulmonary hypertension. 
.
CT Chest w/o contrast ___
FINDINGS: 
The patient is after median sternotomy and CABG. The appearance 
of the 
sternum is unremarkable with no evidence of dehiscence. There 
are several 
bypass grafts noted, at least two originating from the ascending 
aorta.  
Descending aorta is normal in diameter, not exceeding 3 cm. 
Calcifications 
involve the entire ascending aorta and starts approximately 7 cm 
above the 
aortic valve. The extent of calcification is more pronounced at 
the anterior circumference of the aorta than at the posterior 
part. There is a small gap between the superior end of the 
calcifications and the first bypass graft, approximately 1.5 cm 
in diameter. The aortic arch and descending aorta are calcified 
as well. The aortic valve is heavily calcified. The diameter of 
the pulmonary arteries is unremarkable. Native coronary arteries 
are extremely calcified. Heart size is normal. There is a 
relative bulging of the cardiac apex that potentially may 
represent a prior myocardial infarct of the apex of the left 
ventricle. The imaged portion of the upper abdomen demonstrates 
calcified abdominal aorta, atrophic changes in the pancreas. 
Several mediastinal lymph nodes are 
not pathologically enlarged. The airways are patent to the level 
of subsegmental bronchi bilaterally. Diffuse bronchial wall 
thickening is noted, bilaterally, mostly in the upper lungs. 
Those findings in conjunction with multiple centrilobular 
nodules might be consistent with respiratory bronchiolitis/viral 
infection. Superior segment of right lower lobe subpleural 
lesion, 4:90, is 10 x 7 mm in diameter and most likely 
represents atelectasis, but would require further followup to 
exclude the possibility of neoplasm. A right hilar calcified 
lymph nodes as well as right lower lobe calcified granuloma are 
consistent with prior ranulomatous exposure. Bibasilar linear 
opacities most likely representing 
areas of atelectasis. Left upper lobe posterior nodule, is 2.5 
cm in 
diameter, 4:75, a lingular nodule is calcified, 4:113. There is 
no pleural or pericardial effusion demonstrated. Extensive 
degenerative changes are present in the thoracic spine. There 
are no bone lesions worrisome for infection or neoplasm.  
IMPRESSION: 
1. Extensive calcifications of the ascending aorta as described 
in detail in the body of the report. 
2. Status post CABG with at least two bypasses originating from 
the ascending aorta. 
3. Extensive calcifications of native coronary arteries and 
aortic valve.  
Questionable prior myocardial infarct involving the left 
ventricular apex. 
4. Suspected respiratory bronchiolitis/infectious process in the 
upper lungs, correlate if history of smoking is present. 
5. Superior segment of right lower lobe atelectasis versus 
nodule, should be evaluated in three months for documentation of 
stability/resolution. 
.

The left atrium is elongated. There is mild symmetric left 
ventricular hypertrophy. The left ventricular cavity size is 
normal. There is mild global left ventricular hypokinesis (LVEF 
= 45 %). Tissue Doppler imaging suggests an increased left 
ventricular filling pressure (PCWP>18mmHg). Right ventricular

aortic valve stenosis (valve area 0.5 cm2). Mild to moderate 
(___) aortic regurgitation is seen. The mitral valve leaflets 
are mildly thickened. There is no mitral valve prolapse. 
Moderate (2+) mitral regurgitation is seen. [Due to acoustic 
shadowing, the severity of mitral regurgitation may be 
significantly UNDERestimated.] The left ventricular inflow 
pattern suggests impaired relaxation. The tricuspid valve 
leaflets are mildly thickened. There is no pericardial effusion. 
 
.
Carotid series ___ Final Report 
Study: Carotid Series Complete 
___ year old man s/p CABG, with worsening AS, work-up for 
AVR.. 
Findings: Duplex evaluation was performed of bilateral carotid 
arteries. On
the right there is bulky heterogeneous plaque in the ICA and 
ECA. On the left there is significant heterogeneous plaque in 
the ICA and a tiny plaque in the ECA. Both CCA waveforms are 
blunted consistent with know AS. 
On the right systolic/end diastolic velocities of the ICA 
proximal, mid and distal respectively are 93/10, 76/15, 77/17, 
cm/sec. CCA peak systolic 
velocity is 86 cm/sec. ECA peak systolic velocity is 107 cm/sec. 
The ICA/CCA ratio is 1.0. These findings are consistent with 
<40% stenosis. 
On the left systolic/end diastolic velocities of the ICA 
proximal, mid and 
distal respectively are 479/105, 223/39, 144/39, cm/sec. CCA 
peak systolic 
velocity is 77 cm/sec. ECA peak systolic velocity is 147 cm/sec. 
The ICA/CCA ratio is 6.2. These findings are consistent with 
80-99% stenosis. 
There is antegrade right vertebral artery flow. There is 
antegrade left vertebral artery flow. 
Impression: Right ICA stenosis <40%. Left ICA stenosis 80-99%  
.

 
Brief Hospital Course:
Patient is an ___ y/o male with PMHx CAD s/p CABG, iCM (EF 35%), 
AS who presented to the ED with chest pain, DOE, and a near 
syncopal episode secondarily to severe AS, not a surgical 
candidate now s/p valvuloplasty. 
.
# CORONARIES: Pt with 3V CAD s/p CABG and with cath showing LMCA 
Nl; LAD 100% proximal, D1 80% mid; Cx 100% ___, Rca 100% ___ 
SVG to OMB 40-50% ostial, SVG-PDA 60-70%, SVG-D 90% ostial. Pt 
underwent valvuloplasty via cardiac cath on ___ and had BMS to 
SVG-D1 placed at same time.  He was continued on ASA, plavix, 
statin, ACEi and betablocker therapy. He tolerated the 
valvuloplasty well and was shown to have some improvement in his 
AV gradient post-procedure. He was monitored overnight after the 
valvuloplasty and discharged from the CCU in apparent good 
health, without SOB, palpitations, chest pain, or 
lightheadedness. ___ was consulted and cleared pt for discharge 
to home.   
.  
# PUMP: Pt with EF of 45% on TTE performed ___. Currently no 
signs of acute diastolic heart failure.  He was continued on 
ACEi, betablocker therapy and was  diuresed with lasix to 
improve cardiopulmonary and volume status. Exam was monitored 
closely and pt was stable at discharge.
.  
# RHYTHM: Pt with new LBBB. He is pain free. No signs if 
ischemia or dynamic changes. Likely secondarily to pacing or 
balloon dilation s/p valvuloplasty. He was followed on serial 
ECGs which did not show progression suggestive of cardiac 
ischemia.  
.  
#. Chronic kidney disease: Stage 3b CKD with eGFR 51 ml/min 
(MDRD). PTH goal 35-70. At his baseline.  Continued on home ACEi 
with inpt monitoring of serum creatinine. He had good urine 
output during his admission.  To be be followed as an 
outpatient. 
.  
#. Anemia: Normocytic, normochromic, normal RDW (13.5). HCT 
stable.  Guaiac stools was negative for occult blood. To 
followed and worked up as an outpatient.
.  
#. Diabetes Mellitus: New diagnosis. Pt with A1C of 6.5% on 
admission. He had diabetes education and kept on ISS. He was 
continued on ACEi therapy. He will follow this issue as an 
outpatient.   
.
# Hypertension: Continued home-medications.  
.  
#. Hyperlipidemia: Continued simvastatin.  

 
Medications on Admission:
Lasix 40mg daily  
Metoprolol 25mg twice daily  
Ramipril 2.5mg daily  
Zocor 40mg daily  
Aspirin 81mg daily  
(Coumadin recently discontinued)

(Daily).

Disp:*30 Tablet Sustained Release 24 hr(s)* Refills:*2*

(Daily).

Home

and difficulty breathing. You described difficulty walking up

You underwent a heart catheterization procedure on ___ which

.

.

알레르기 정보 :
환자가 약물에 대한 알레르기를 가지고 있지 않다.



진료하는 의사 : _______.


주요 증상 :
흉부 통증 및 호흡곤란

대규모 수술 또는 침습적 절차 :
경피 관류 조영술을 통해 심장 동맥관류를 시행하였다.

병력 개시 :
 환자는 지난 ___ 년간 CAD로 입원하여 CABG를 받았으며 현재는 iCM(EF35%)와 함께 심근 경색 후 발생한 아스트로스에서 발작과 같은 근육통을 경험했다. 또한 최근 흉부 압박감과 가슴 통증, 안구 운동 불편함 등의 증상을 보였다. 혈압은 68/38mmH가며, 산소포화도는 100퍼센트이다. 환자의 다른 검사는 모두 부정적인 결과를 나타냈다.

심리 상태 :
환자는 정서적으로 적절하며, 정신 상태는 양호하다.

심혈관계 검사 :
환자의 심전도는 정상이며, 심실수축은 53배치이고, 맥박은 18번이다. 심장의 좌우측 심실격동은 각각 2분씩 있다. 심장이 작용하면 심실수가 증가하고, 심방세동은 10cm이다. 폐의 경우에는 정상으로 나타났다.

내과 검사:
환자는 심장 주사를 맞고 있으며, 심장 기능검사는 정상이다. 혀뿌옇이는 없으나, 간염이나 위암 등은 없다.

사회 병력이 없음.

 가족 병력이 없는 것으로 알려졌다.

신체 검사결과 :
환인은 일반적으로 건강하였으며, 신체 검사가 전혀 이상하지 않았다. 특히 심장 부분에서는 심장판막이 두드러지고, 심낭종이 있는 것이 확인되었다.

기타 소견 :
환인의 혈액 검사에서 백혈구 수가 7.69만개였으며, 혈당은 126mg/dL이었다. 혁학적 검사에서도 특별히 문제점은 없었다.

중앙 치과 진단 :
환인에게는 심장 판막 이형성이 있었으며, 심장은 정상이었지만, 심계항진이 있었다. 심폐 지속 시간은 95초였다.

심장 카테터 삽입 :
환인이 심장 카 테터를 삽인하여 심장 내외부를 촬영하였다.

심해 복강경 시술 :
환인을 대상으로 심장 외과 시술을 하여 심장을 열어보았다.

심층 혈관조영술 :
심장 내부의 혈管을 촬영상 중 심장 배출량이 300ml/s였다.

안면 피부 검사 결과 :
환아의 피부는 건조했으며, 눈꺼풀이 둥글게 굴렸고, 손목은 잘 움직이지 못한다.

심미 요법 :
환자를 대상으로 한 심미 요법인 심미 유산을 실시하였다.

추가 사항 :
환자에게는 추가적인 검사가 필요하므로 추후 재발행할 예정이다.

병력 개요 :
1차 전문의 : ______    1차 진단 : 전이성 난관암    치료제 : 루프론

최대 불만사항 : 하반부 부종
현재 병력이 있는 경우 : 1 차로 CAD(스텐트 후), 고혈압, 전이 적난경암(Lupron)을 받고 왼쪽 하지 부전을 보였다. 2일간 급격한 좌측 하지 부전에 대한 보고가 있다. 그는 그의 다리가 팽창했지만 아픔은 없었다. 이전에 무리하지 않았으며 흡연자는 아니다. 과거 혈장판막 클롯 없음이다. 응급실에서 우선적으로 DVT와 PE를 발견하여 추가적인 관리를 위해 입원하였다. 1시간 전에 발생한 급성좌측 하지 수축으로 인해 왔다. 그는 자신의 다리를 팽팽하게 느끼며, 고통이나 통증 없이 나타났다. 이전에는 무리도 없었으며 흰색은 아니었다. 현재는 비흡연자이며 과거에는 혈액응집물질이 없는 것으로 밝혀졌다. 응시에서는 초기 생체 지표: 97·60·124/ 69·16·100%RA. CBC와 Hgb 123otherwise 정상, Coag wnl,CHEM w/Na 134,Trop <0.00이었다. CT 복부 w/contrast: 양방향 대뇌정맥류. CTA 가슴: 양쪽 주요 폐 동맥 내 경화성 혈전증과 확장을 모두 보여준다. CT 증거는 오른 심장 스트레스가 없다는 것을 의미한다. 주심박당지름은 정상 범위 안에 머물렀다. 환자는 헤파린 drip을 시작하고 추가적인 치료를 위해 투여되었다. 시스템 검토: 완벽한 10점 체계 검토가 수행되었으며, 그 외에도 HPI에서 음성이 아닌 부분이 있었다. 과목 이력: 과목 과목 역사: 마지막 ___클리닉 노트에 따르면, ____PSA는 ___에서 3·2에서 6·5까지 증가했고, ___에서 다시 7·0이고, ___에서는 9·1이었다. 이것은 Dr.___에게서 전립샘 종양 조직검사를 촉구했다. 경추골절 ___는 골밀도가 감소되어 있으나 뚜렷한 증세는 없었다. 또한, 두 번째 핵심 질환인 유전자 변형이 있었는데, 이는 전립선 암으로 인한 것이었다. 이후 계속해서 간헐적인 루포논을 사용하였으나 PSA는 상승하며 일부 전립선을 줄였고 지금은 연속적인 ADT를 사용 중이다. 사회 역학: _____ 가족 역학 : 부모님 사망, 아버지 사망 시기에 사망, 신경학적 질환이나 관련된 것은 없다. 신체 검사: Vitals:97·8PO 143/83 54418108RA 일반: 누워 앉아 있고, 배우자가 옆에 있으며, 즉각적인 위험신호가 없다. 눈: 균등 반짝이는 빛 반응, 백금 색조 피부 HEENT: 구강내청결, 젖산 혼합막 NECK: 탄력적, 정상 이동 LUNG: 청량 기침, 정상의 호흡율, 증가된 작업은 없다 CV: 규칙적인 맥박과 리듬, 정상을 유지하는 정상 거동 ABD: 부드럽고, 정상위험 소음 GENITOURINAL: FOLEY 또는 초복통이 없다 EXT: 형태 변화가 없으며, 전체적인 말초 염증이 있어 왼발에 1+, 오른 발에는 없다 SKIN: 온열, 건조 뉴로: 명확하고 일관된 언어 접근: 말초 IV 결과: 06·30 AM BLOOD 5·5 RBB 3 ·74* 11·6* 34·8* 93 31·0 33·3 13·6 46·5* PLT 06 ·30 AM Blood 6 ·1 RBB3·92* 12·3* 36·8 94 31 ·

Pathology Report ___:
The specimen shows fragments of densely gliotic brain, in some 
places recognizable as atrophic cerebellum, with moderately 
cellular coarsely fibrillary background and atypical nuclei. In 
block B there is an area of round nuclei with cleared cytoplasm, 
and prominent capillaries, with an oligodendroglial appearance. 
There are a few small cysts with Alcian blue staining mucinous 
material. Scattered microcalcifications are present. There are 
scattered ___ fibers, and rare eosinophilic granular 
bodies.  Blood vessels with thick hyalinized walls are present. 
Mitoses are rare. There are no anaplastic features.

EKG ___:
Sinus rhythm
Modest diffuse nonspecific ST-T wave changes
Since previous tracing of ___, rate faster, and ST-T wave 
changes present.

Imaging:
MRI Head ___:
IMPRESSION:
Cystic mass with enhancing mural nodule within cerebellum most 
suggestive of hemangioblastoma. Differential includes metastasis 
and astrocytoma.

Head CT ___:
IMPRESSION: Post-surgical changes as described above. No 
evidence of midline shift. Minimal amount of intraventricular 
hemorrhage.

MRI Head ___:
IMPRESSION:
Postoperative changes in the posterior fossa. The cystic portion 
of the
previously noted lesion in this locale has decompressed. There 
is a small
amount of nodular enhancement along the medial and inferior 
aspect of the
cavity which could represent residual nodular neoplasm.
Possible small focus of acute ischemia in the left inferior 
cerebellum.
A tiny acute ischemic focus is also seen in the right aspect of 
the pons.

MRI Head ___:
IMPRESSION: Status post resection of cerebellar mass with no 
definite
residual nodular enhancement seen when accounting for blood 
products and
vascular enhancement at the surgical site. Small area of blood 
products in
the right frontal lobe as seen on the recent CT at the site of 
previously
placed ventricular drain. Small bilateral subdurals which appear
postoperative in nature. No acute infarct seen.

___ ___:
IMPRESSION: No evidence of DVT in either lower extremity.

CT head ___:
(Preliminary) No new intracranial hemorrhage or mass effect 
seen. Slight decrease in small hemorrhages related to prior 
ventriculostomy cath. and in area of resection bed. 

CXR ___:
(Preliminary) Pneumonia in the right lower lobe.

CXR ___:

 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ electively admitted for resection of his L occipital brain 
mass. Brought to the OR on ___ for craniotomy. Patient 
tolerated procedure well briefly recovered in PACU then was sent 
to the ICU for further recovery. 
POD1 ___ was extubated. Had MRI, which showed 
hemorrhage in the operative bed. Cystic cavity has was 
decompressed to a large extent. There is solid nodular 
enhancement along medial/inferior aspect of the postop cavity 
which could represent residual neoplasm.
POD4 (___) NGT discontinued.
POD5 (___) Drain removed without incident, exam stable. 
Patient was transferred to floor.
POD6 (___) Bilateral lateral gaze deficit with intact visual 
fields, Right facial droop w/tongue deviation, difficulty 
closing right eye; patient states since surgery. Patient taken 
back to OR for further resection of residual mass.
POD7/1 (___) Exam was stable from pre-op. Wound C/D/I. 
transferred to floor. Stat head CT done for headache was normal.
POD10/4 (___) exam essentially stable with improvemnt in 
tongue deviation, and EOM. speech and swallow questioned 
aspiration , diet changed to ground/honey thick. Staples 
removed. 
POD11/5 (___) Exam was stable, however patient was more 
sleepy,  Patient was febrile overnight to 101.6 and fever work 
up ensued. Chest x-ray showed a right lower lobe consolidation. 
He was started on Levoquin treatment for presumed aspiration 
pneumonia. 
Lower extremity duplex was negative for DVT.  Head CT negative.  

POD12/6 (___) Patient has been afebrile for 24hours.  Exam is 
stable. Repeat chest x-ray shows no interval increase in right 
lower lobe consolidation. Patient receiving day 2 or 5 of 
Levaquin. 
 
Medications on Admission:
Flonase BID, Reglan 10mg TId, Zolmitriptan prn, Viagra prn, 
Astelin BID, Inderal 20mg qhs

 
Discharge Medications:
1. Oxycodone 5 mg Tablet Sig: ___ Tablets PO Q4H (every 4 hours) 
as needed.  
2. Bisacodyl 5 mg Tablet, Delayed Release (E.C.) Sig: Two (2) 
Tablet, Delayed Release (E.C.) PO DAILY (Daily) as needed.  
3. Senna 8.6 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO BID (2 times a 
day) as needed.  
4. Polyvinyl Alcohol-Povidone 1.4-0.6 % Dropperette Sig: ___ 
Drops Ophthalmic PRN (as needed) as needed for dryness.  
5. Fluticasone 50 mcg/Actuation Spray, Suspension Sig: Two (2) 
Spray Nasal DAILY (Daily).  
6. Docusate Sodium 50 mg/5 mL Liquid Sig: Two (2)  PO BID (2 
times a day).  
7. Heparin (Porcine) 5,000 unit/mL Solution Sig: One (1)  
Injection TID (3 times a day).  
8. Famotidine 20 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO BID (2 times a 
day).  
9. Phenytoin Sodium Extended 100 mg Capsule Sig: One (1) Capsule 
PO TID (3 times a day).  
10. White Petrolatum-Mineral Oil 42.5-56.8 % Ointment Sig: One 
(1) Appl Ophthalmic TID (3 times a day) as needed.  
11. Acetaminophen 325 mg Tablet Sig: ___ Tablets PO Q6H (every 6 
hours) as needed.  
12. Insulin Regular Human 100 unit/mL Solution Sig: One (1)  
Injection ASDIR (AS DIRECTED).  
13. Metoclopramide 10 mg Tablet Sig: 0.5 Tablet PO TID (3 times 
a day) as needed for pro-motility.  
14. Erythromycin 5 mg/g Ointment Sig: One (1)  Ophthalmic QID (4 
times a day) as needed for proph for presumed corneal abrasion 
for 5 days.  
15. Sodium Chloride 0.65 % Aerosol, Spray Sig: ___ Sprays Nasal 
QID (4 times a day) as needed for dry nasal mucous membranes.  
16. Levofloxacin in D5W 750 mg/150 mL Piggyback Sig: One (1)  
Intravenous DAILY (Daily) for 4 days.  

 
Discharge Disposition:
Extended Care
 
Facility:
___
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Left Suboccipital Brain Mass

 
Discharge Condition:
Neurologically stable

 
Discharge Instructions:
Please continue Levaquin 750mg Daily for three more days, to end 
on ___

General Instructions

Have a friend/family member check your incision daily for 
signs of infection.
Take your pain medicine as prescribed.
Exercise should be limited to walking; no lifting, straining, 
or excessive bending.
You may wash your hair only after sutures and/or staples have 
been removed. 
You may shower before this time using a shower cap to cover 
your head.
Increase your intake of fluids and fiber, as narcotic pain 
medicine can cause constipation. We generally recommend taking 
an over the counter stool softener, such as Docusate (Colace) 
while taking narcotic pain medication.
Unless directed by your doctor, do not take any 
anti-inflammatory medicines such as Motrin, Aspirin, Advil, and 
Ibuprofen etc. 
You have been prescribed an anti-seizure medicine, take it as 
prescribed and follow up with laboratory blood drawing in one 
week.  Please have results faxed to ___.
Clearance to drive and return to work will be addressed at 
your post-operative office visit.

CALL YOUR SURGEON IMMEDIATELY IF YOU EXPERIENCE ANY OF THE 
FOLLOWING

New onset of tremors or seizures.
Any confusion or change in mental status. 
Any numbness, tingling, weakness in your extremities.
Pain or headache that is continually increasing, or not 
relieved by pain medication.
Any signs of infection at the wound site: redness, swelling, 
tenderness, or drainage.
Fever greater than or equal to 101° F.

 
Followup Instructions:

병리학 보고서 :
조직 조직은 밀집된 글로틱 뇌 조직으로 인식될 수 있는 일부 곳에서 보인다. 중간 세포 굴곡 배경과 비정상 핵이 있으며 블록 B에는 둥근 핵과 맹목의 물질이 있고 모세관이 잘 나타난다. 몇 개의 작은 낭종에 걸쳐있다. 미세 석회분해가 존재한다. 다발성 섬유와 드문 에오시노필 그라누스 체가 있다. 혈관 벽이 두꺼워졌다. 분열은 드물었다. 아나플라스티 특징이 없었다.

ECG ___ :
심박동맥 리듬
모든 지속적인 비특이 적 ST-T 파장 변동

결론 :
전두엽 종양의 증례가 가장 확실하다. 차등 진단은 전이를 포함하고 있다.

Head Ct ___ :
IMPRESSION :
수술 후 변경 사항은 설명되어 있다. 중선 이동이 없는 것으로 보였다. 최소한의 외막출혈이 있었다.

MRI HEAD ___ :
 IMPRESSION :
지연된 후두 절개술 후 치명적인 부분이 해소되었으며 소매 부분에서는 가능한 잔류 결절이 관찰된다. 가능성이 높은 왼쪽 하반신의 급성 이완증이 관측되고 있다. 또한 오른편의 봉우리에서도 잠재적인 작은 초음파 침착물이 관습했다.

MRIHEAD ___ :
_IMPRESSION_
수술 직후의 상태를 유지하는 것이 좋다. 단순히 피하지 않으면 된다. 가벼운 심장 질환이 있을 수도 있다.

___ :
IMRESSION :
아무런 근육 손상을 받지 않았다.

CT HEAD ___:
초기 임상 사진 :
우측 저림, 우측 편마비, 좌측 편안, 우익 동요, 우 익 동요 등이 관광객에게 주어지는 것처럼 보이는 것은 아니

text:
Name: ___ Unit No: ___ Admission Date: ___ Discharge Date: ___ Date of Birth: ___ Sex: F Service: MEDICINE Allergies: Patient recorded as having No Known Allergies to Drugs Attending: ___ Chief Complaint: Fall from wheelchair resulting in nasal fracture and C1 cervical fracture. Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure: None History of Present Illness: History of Present Illness: Ms. ___ is an ___ yo female who leaned over to pick up an fallen pillow and fell face first from her wheelchair. She was found on floor bleeding from nose and c/o headache. She was taken to ___ ED and had a Head CT which was negative for bleed, but a C-spine film which showed a non-displaced C1 Fracture. UA was found to be positive. . She denies chest pain, palpitations, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, nausea prior to fall. She denies any loss of consciousness surrounding the fall. She feels she lost her balance because she "over-reached" for the pillow. Of note, she had fallen in the bathroom the day before and broke her right wrist. . In the ED, T 100.0, HR 63, BP 171/81, RR 30, 85% on RA. she was given a tetanus vaccine and 1 gram of ceftriaxone for a UTI. She was evaluated by orthopedics who recommended a c-collar. Past Medical History: Past Medical History: Hypertnesion CAD h/o Seizures Hyperlipidemia Depression Femur fracture of both legs ___ years ago) Social History: ___ Family History: Family History: Reviewed and noncontributory. Physical Exam: VS: T 97.8, BP 150/77, HR 67, RR 20, 92% on 4L NC Gen: Obese elderly female, NAD HEENT: ecchymoses surrounding eyes b/l, vision intact, EOMI, e/p clear NECK: cervical ___ in place CV: RRR, no m/r/g Pulm: CTA anteriorly, Patient breathes predominantly oreally Abd: BS+, obese, soft, nontender, nondistended Ext: Trace peripheral edema bilaterally in lower extremities Neuro: ___ proxoximal arm strength b/l, unable to assess right distal arm strength due to cast, left distal arm strength is ___ ___, sensation grossly intact, AxOx3 Pertinent Results: ___ OSH CT Head, facial, C-spine: Brain: neg for bleed. Face: nasal bone fracture. C-spine: hairline fracture on C1 Arch. . ___ SUPINE AP VIEW OF THE CHEST: Low lung volumes are present. The heart is enlarged with left ventricular configuration. The aorta is unfolded and demonstrates aortic knob calcifications. Crowding of pulmonary vascular structures is demonstrated, likely result of low lung volumes. No focal consolidation, pleural effusions, or definite pneumothorax is present. . ___ ECHO Conclusions: The left atrium is mildly dilated. The left ventricular cavity size is normal. Overall left ventricular systolic function is mildly depressed (LVEF= 50 %) with inferolateral akinesis. The ascending aorta is moderately dilated. The aortic valve leaflets (3) are mildly thickened. There is no aortic valve stenosis. Mild (1+) aortic regurgitation is seen. The mitral valve leaflets are mildly thickened. Moderate (2+) mitral regurgitation is seen. The left ventricular inflow pattern suggests impaired relaxation. The tricuspid valve leaflets are mildly thickened. There is borderline pulmonary artery systolic hypertension. There is no pericardial effusion. Brief Hospital Course: 1.) C1 fracture & Nasal fracture: Patient was evaluated by orthopedic surgery upon presentation. They recommended a ___ cervical collar for 6 weeks total with orthopedics follow-up with Dr. ___ in 3 o 4 weeks time. Did not present with any neurological deficits. Patient was put on standing tylenol dosing for pain prevention. Vitamin D supplements were started during the hospitalization.
2.) S/p fall: History is indicative of mechanical fall from wheelchair. Cardiac work-up was not pursued given the patient's reliable history of reaching forward from wheelchair and falling on her forehead. Initial concern for dehydration, so patient was given intravenous fluids. Given that the patient typically uses a wheelchair for ambulation, physical therapy was not pursued as an inpatient. She should receive physical therapy at her nursing facility.
3. Hypoxia: Patient was hypoxic to 85% on RA in the ED, thought originally to be secondary to body habitus and cervical collar. CXR negative for pneumonia. After two days of unsuccessful attempts to liberate patient from supplemental oxygen, we requested an echocardiogram which showed a LVEF 50%, moderate mitral regurg, diastolic dysfunction. Patient was given a one time dose of Lasix 20 mg IV on evening prior to discharge and had a brisk urine output in response. Her BP remained stable, as did her renal function with discharge creatinine of 0.6. Oxygen saturation on room air the morning of discharge was 93%. The patient should address this underlying hypoxia with her PCP.
4. UTI: Patient had positive UA at presentation, so was given ceftriaxone in ED. Was then switched to Cipro 250 mg Q12H for UTI Has completed therapy at discharge.
5. History of CAD: Not an active issue during this hospitalization; however, patient was continued on home statin, plavic, beta-blocker.
6. Seizure disorder: Not an active issue during this hospitalization; we continued Phenytoin 200 TID
7. Depression: Not an active issue during this hospitalization; we continued prozac.
8. HTN: Not an active issue during this hospitalization; we continued Toprol, HCTZ
9. FEN: Lactose free diet was given during hospitalization.
10. PPX Patient was on heparin subcutaneous for DVT prophylaxis.
11. Code Status: DNR/DNI.

___ yo male with Parkinsons Disease presents for elective 
bilateral stage I DBS placement.  His symptoms date back to 
___.

Parkinsons
Prostate CA

PERRLA
CNII-XII intact

Motor: ___ strength throughout

staples in place

___ Head CT- no hemorrhage, expected postop changes

___ Brain MRI- good Lead placement, no evidence of 
hemorrhage
 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ yo male with parkinsons disease presents for elective, 
bilateral stage I DBS placement.  He tolerated the procedure 
well and was transferred to PACU and then the floor.  Mr. ___ 
had an episode of confusion and he was found OOB on the floor. 
No evidence of head strike.  CT head was performed and was 
negative for hemorrhage.

He was seen and evaluated by Physical therapy and Occupational 
therapy who felt that he would benefit from rehab.  Routine MRI 
postop was performed on ___ and showed good placement of 
Bilateral DBS leads without evidence of hemorrhage.  He remained 
neurologically stable and on ___, the day of discharge he was 
tolerating a regular diet, ambulating without difficulty, 
afebrile with stable vital signs.
 
Medications on Admission:
carbidopa-levodopa 
carbidopa 25 mg-levodopa 100 mg tablet
1.5 tablet(s) by mouth three times daily
 
Discharge Medications:
1.  Acetaminophen w/Codeine ___ TAB PO Q6H:PRN Pain - Moderate 
Do not exceed 4g acetaminophen in 24 hours   
2.  Docusate Sodium 100 mg PO BID  
3.  Heparin 5000 UNIT SC BID 
This MUST be discontinued 24 hours prior to scheduled surgery on 
___  
4.  Senna 17.2 mg PO QHS:PRN constipation  
5.  Carbidopa-Levodopa (___) 1.5 TAB PO TID  

 
Discharge Disposition:
Extended Care
 
Facility:
___
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Parkinsons

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Discharge Instructions
Deep Brain Stimulator 

Surgery
*** You underwent Stage I and will need to contact the office 
to confirm the date for your Stage II surgery. Your staples/ 
sutures will be removed at that time. 

Activity
You may gradually return to your normal activities, but we 
recommend you take it easy for the next ___ hours.
Heavy lifting, running, climbing, or other strenuous exercise 
should be avoided for ten (10) days.
You may take leisurely walks and slowly increase your activity 
at your own pace. ___ try to do too much too soon.
Do not go swimming or submerge yourself in water for fourteen 
(14) days after your procedure.
The dressing covering your head incision(s) may be removed 
after 48 hours. You may use a damp washcloth to remove any dried 
blood or iodine from your skin but do not get your head wet in 
the shower until your staples or sutures are removed.

Medications
Resume your normal ___ medications. The neurologist 
programming your device may adjust your medications once 
programming begins. 
Take any new medications (i.e. pain medications) as directed.
If you were on a medication such as Coumadin (Warfarin), or 
Plavix (Clopidogrel), or Aspirin, do not take this until cleared 
by your Neurosurgeon. 
Do not take any anti-inflammatory medicines such as Motrin, 
Aspirin, Advil, or Ibuprofen etc. until follow up.
You may use Acetaminophen (Tylenol) for minor discomfort if 
you are not otherwise restricted from taking this medication.
What You ___ Experience:
Mild tenderness along the incisions. 
Soreness in your arms from the intravenous lines.
Constipation is common. Be sure to drink plenty of fluids and 
eat a high-fiber diet. If you are taking narcotics (prescription 
pain medications), try an over-the-counter stool softener.

Call Your Doctor at ___ for:
Severe pain, swelling, redness or drainage from the incision 
site. 
Fever greater than 101.5 degrees Fahrenheit
Severe Constipation
Blood in your stool or urine
Nausea and/or vomiting
Extreme sleepiness
Severe headaches not relieved by pain relievers
Seizures
Any new problems with your vision or ability to speak
Weakness or changes in sensation in your face, arms, or leg

___

발작

수술내역 :
___: 양측 DBS 배치 단계 I

병력 개요 :
___세 남자 파킨슨병으로 선택적 양측 단계I DBS 삽입을 받는다. 그의 증상은 시작된 이후부터이다.

 과거 병력이 있다면 :
파킨슨 치명성 전립선암

사회력 :
___ 세 자녀가 있지만 그들은 아직 태어났다.

 가족력 :
N/A

신체 검사 :
AOX 3번, 구두로 통화 가능 PERRLA CNII-X12 완전한 양쪽 UE 발작 Motor: 전체 강도로 감정 정상적인 감각

절개부위 : 양측 두피 절개 부위 C/D/I 없음 적혈구 증가 수직 스티플스 위치

중요 결과 :
___ 머리 CT- 출혈 없음 예상 후속 변화 ___ 뇌 MRI- 좋은 리드 배치, 출혔 없는 증례

간단한 입원 경과 :
___ 연령의 파킨ソン 환자는 선택적으로 양측 첫 번째 DBS를 배치했다. 그는 잘 견딘 시술을 했고 PACU와 다음 날에는 이송되었다. Mr.는 혼란의 에피소드를 겪었고 바닥에서 발견되었으며 아무런 머리카락 충격도 없었다. CT 머리는 수행되어 출혃 없이 음성이었다. 그는 재활을 위해 물론이 필요하다고 생각하는 물리 요법과 작업 요법에게 보였다. routine MRI 후술은 ___에서 진행되었고 양측 디브스 리드의 좋은 배치를 보여 주었다. 그는 안정 상태였고 퇴원 당일에 정식 식사를 내리고 어려움없이 걷고 열이 나지 않았다.

입원 당시 복용약물 :
카르보디포-레보도파 카르보디오파 25mg 레보도팜 100mg 표제 1½ 장 삼회 투여

퇴원 약물 :
1. 아세트아미노펜 코드린 ___ 탭 PO Q 6H PRN Pain-Moderate 도 4G 아세타민오프인 24시간 전에 중단해야 한다.
2. 독산 100MG PO BDI
3. 헤페린 500UNIT SC BDI 4. 센나 17.2 MG PO Q HS PRN constipatio 5. 카르비도파-레볼로다 (___ ) 1.5 TABPO TID

퇴실 처방 :
확장 케어시설 :

재택 처방:
파킨손

퇴근 조건 :
멘탈 상태 : 명백하고 체계적.
수준 의식 : 각성 및 상호 작용.
활동 상태 : 활동 independant.

퇴원 지침 :
deep brain stimulator

수술판매 *** 당신은 단계 1을 거쳐야 하며 사무실에 연락하여 날짜를 확인할 것이다. 스텝이나 봉합물을 제거한다.

활동
• 점차 일반 활동으로 돌아갈 수 있지만 다음 ___ 시간 동안 쉬기를 권유한다.
• 무거운 들뜨림, 달리기, 등높이 오르는 것 또는 다른 힘든 운동은 10일 동안 피해야 한다. • 여유로운 산책을 하고 자신의 속도를 따라서 느리게 움직이는 것을 추천한다. ___ 너무 많은 일을 하는 것이 좋지 않다.
• 수영이나 물에 잠길 때는 14일 동안 기다려라.
• 가슴 절개를 사용하면 48시간 후에 제거할 수 있으며 젖은 손수를 사용하지만 목욕탕에서는 스테플스를 제거하지 않는다.

약물
• Resume normal ___ 약물. 신경학자가 기기에 프로그램되면 약물을 조정할 수 있다.
• 새로운 약물 (예: 고통 약)을 다음과 같이 사용한다.
 • 쥐약 (워프라핀), 플릭스 (클롭독글), 아스피린 등의 약물은 신경 외과의사가 허가를 받아야 한다.
• 항염증 약품 (모틴, 아스πι린, 아이빌, 이부프로芬 등)은 추후에 사용하지 말고 Tylenol을 사용해도 된다. What You ___ 경험했는지 :
• 미만의

Brief Hospital Course:
Mr. ___ is a ___ who presented to ___ s/p mechanical 
fall from standing and was found on imaging to have four 
displaced left-sided rib fractures. He denies any ___ or 
LOC. The patient was admitted to the Trauma service for pain 
control and pulmonary toilet.  The Acute Pain Service (APS) was 
consulted for epidural placement.

On HD1, the patient had an episode of Afib vs Aflutter w/ RVR 
responsive to Metoprolol 5mg IV x1. APS placed a thoracic 
epidural. The patient was initially called out to the floor 
however after starting epidural infusion with bupi + dilaudid, 
the patient became agitated/delirious and pulling at lines, 
trying to get out of bed, with AMS thought to be exacerbated by 
dilaudid.  The epidural was switched to plain bupi which was 
effective and the patient had no further episodes of agitation. 
Trazadone 50mg was provided for sleep. Due to c/f agitation and 
elevated HRs, the patient remained in the ICU. Cardiology was 
curbsided re: new onset Afib, thought likely to be Afib vs 2:1 
Aflutter, and recommended beta-blockade and nonurgent medicine 
consult once on floor to discuss systemic AC. It was recommended 
he follow-up with his PCP for this issue. Pain well controlled 
on thoracic epidural with bupiviciane.  

On HD2, the patient's pain remained well-controlled.  He was 
started on PO Lopressor w/ IV for breakthrough, HR continued to 
be in 100s.  The patient was upset that he could not leave, 
stood up from chair and fell with back against the wall at 1800, 
witnessed by nurse, ___, no LOC, mental status at 
baseline directly subsequent to the event, no new bruises or 
deformities on head/neck/back so was not worked up further.  He 
continued to retain urine requiring intermittent straight 
catheterization, started on tamsulosin qHS. Flu swab repeated, 
positive.  

On HD3, APS recommended continuing the epidural given 
delirium/agitation with narcotics in past and no other good 
options for pain control, IS. ___ worked with the patient.  The 
patient was transferred to the surgical floor.

On HD4, the epidural was capped and then later removed.  The 
patient reported minimal pain and received tramadol and 
acetaminophen prn for pain control.  The patient worked with 
Physical Therapy and was approved for discharge home with home 
___.  At the time of discharge, the patient was hemodynamically 
stable, tolerating a regular diet and pain was well-controlled.  
He was discharged home in stable condition.

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

You were admitted to ___ after 
a fall and you were found to have multiple left-sided rib 
fractures.  You were admitted to the Trauma Surgery service for 
pain control and to monitor your breathing.  You had an epidural 
placed by the Acute Pain service for pain control and you were 
transferred to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU).  You also tested 
positive for the flu and were placed on droplet precautions.  

After remaining stable in the ICU, you were transferred to the 
surgical floor.  Your epidural was removed and you were started 
on oral pain medication.  Your pain is now controlled with oral 
pain medication and your ability to take deep breaths has 
improved.  You have worked with Physical Therapy and it is 
recommended that you be discharged home with home physical 
therapy services.  You also will have home visiting nursing 
services. 

You are now ready to be discharged home to continue your 
recovery.  Please note the following discharge instructions:

Rib Fractures:

* Your injury caused left-sided rib fractures which can cause 
severe pain and subsequently cause you to take shallow breaths 
because of the pain.
 
* You should take your pain medication as directed to stay ahead 
of the pain otherwise you won't be able to take deep breaths. If 
the pain medication is too sedating take half the dose and 
notify your physician.
 
* Pneumonia is a complication of rib fractures.  In order to 
decrease your risk you must use your incentive spirometer 4 
times every hour while awake.  This will help expand the small 
airways in your lungs and assist in coughing up secretions that 
pool in the lungs.
 
* You will be more comfortable if you use a cough pillow to hold 
against your chest and guard your rib cage while coughing and 
deep breathing.
 
* Symptomatic relief with ice packs or heating pads for short 
periods may ease the pain.
 
* Narcotic pain medication can cause constipation therefore you 
should take a stool softener twice daily and increase your fluid 
and fiber intake if possible.
 
* Do NOT smoke
 
* If your doctor allows, non-steroidal ___ drugs 
are very effective in controlling pain ( ie, Ibuprofen, Motrin, 
Advil, Aleve, Naprosyn) but they have their own set of side 
effects so make sure your doctor approves.
 
* Return to the Emergency Room right away for any acute 
shortness of breath, increased pain or crackling sensation 
around your ribs (crepitus).

Influenza Instructions: Seek medical attention if: 
 fever rises to ___ F (39.4 C) or higher
 the fever accompanied by sweating
 you experience chills and a cough with colored phlegm
 you have significantly swollen glands
 you feel severe sinus pain

병력 소견 :
여성이 심각한 만성 폐쇄성폐질환, 미트럴밸브 발상, 미터탈반류 및 고혈압을 가진 52세 여성으로서, 그녀는 경구내시경 검사를 위해 OSH에 입원을 했다. 그때 그녀의 산소포화도는 방광에서 85%, 실내에서는 85%'였다. 그리고 그녀를 병실로 옮겼다.

정신 질환이나 정신 장애.

기타 과거 병력은 없다.

임상검사결과 :
ADMISSION CLINICAL DATA:
=====================



#22 ~ #27 치의 추출과 함께 미트날 밴드 수리를 하였으며, 이 과정에서 미트널 밴드를 사용하였다. 또한 미트롤 밴드는 중간 지점에서 앞쪽으로 가동되었다. 따라서 미트론 밴트가 약간 더 큰 것으로 보인다. #22 ~ 27 치대치와 함께 미투미토스 밴드로 진행되었으며, 이는 미투 미토스 반응이다. #23 치대치는 미투 물질을 포함하고 있으며, 이는 비록 미투물질이지만 미투물을 이용하여 진행된 것이다. #24 치대에는 미투균이 존재하며, 이는 생명 유지 능력을 높이는 데 도움이 된다. #25 치대는 미투 균을 포함하지 않으나, 이는 일단 미투 감염이 발생하면 즉시 처리된다. #26 치대에서는 미투 세포가 발견되며, 이는 조직 재생능력을 향상시키는 데 도움을 준다. 

#27 우측 상완 골절 및 대퇴골 절개술 시행. #28 우측 위팔 골절 시술 시행.

#28 우손 상완골절 및 좌손 대퇴 골절 시행.

 Hyperostosis 
of the frontal sinus walls and in the right posterior ethmoid 
suggests sequela 
of chronic inflammation. 

 
Brief Hospital Course:
The patient was admitted to the trauma inpatient service for 
management of her R ___ rib fractures and T3 compression 
fracture. She was seen by the ortho spine team who recommended 
___ surgical intervention or brace and ___ indication for follow 
up. 

On her initial CT chest, a new pulmonary right upper lobe nodule 
measuring 11 x 12 mm was noted that was concerning for 
malignancy. The patient was notified of this finding and follow 
up with PCP for ongoing workup was recommended. 

Her pain was controlled with PO pain medication and early 
ambulation and IS were encouraged. She was seen by the physical 
therapist who recommended discharge to home without services. 

At the time of her discharge, the patient's vital signs were 
stable. She was tolerating a regular diet and was on her home 
medications. She was ambulating without difficulty and was 
voiding spontaneously. She was discharged to home in stable 
condition with planned follow up with her PCP. The discharge 
plan was discussed with the patient who expressed understanding 
and agreement.

낙상

없음

병력 개요 :
4일 전 일어난 선물로 인해 넘어져서 옆구리와 머리를 맞았다고 한다. LOC나 흉통이나 다른 증상을 호소하지 않고 어깨 아래 통증과 허리 통증을 호소한다. 독립적으로 집에서 생활하고 있다가 아프다고 하여 응급실에 왔다.

 과거 병력이 있는 경우 :
뼈 수술, 얼굴의 피부암 가능성이 있어 보인다.

사회 역학 :
_____

 가족 역학 : 복막종양 유전자가 없다.

 신체 검사 :
일반 : 깨어 있고 경각심리가 없음.
호흡기 : 무근련. RA에서 잘 포화됨.
 심장 : 부드럽고 압박감은 없으며, 종괴는 없다.
지방 : 완전히 정렬되지 않은 골절이다.
외골격 : 완전한 손상이 없다.

중요 결과 :
_____ 21:45 PM  글루코스 100mg  이뇨 16mg 크레틴 0.70mm 나트륨 143mm 칼륨염 104mm 총CO2 23mm 안이온 격차 16mm
_____21: 45 PM WBC 7.60% RBC 3.190 * HGB 9.90 * HCT 30.50 * MCV 96mm MCH 31.00 MCHCC 32.50 RDW 13.50RDWS 47.50 *
_____20:15 PM NEUT 79.40 * LYMPH 10.70 * MONO 8.30 * EOs 0.70 * BASO 0 55 IM ____ Abs Neut 6.060 Abs Lyph 0,820 * Abs Mono 0,630 * Abs Eos 0.,050 * Abs Baso 0.,040
____ 21 : 45 pm PLT count 196

Chest CT ______ :

결과 :
이미징된 목부에는 부분적으로 시각화 된 갑상선이 평범하다. 가슴동맥은 약간 석회화되어 있으며 caliber는 일반적인 것이다. 미들스트널 혈액종은 없다. 주요 폐 동맥은 3,300㎜로 확대되었는데, 이는 폐혈관 고혈압으로 상정된다. 뇌내 림프절은 없다.
심장은 약간 커졌으나 관절류는 없다. 조그마한 협심증이 있는데, 그것은 기저면의 엽세포를 포함하는 것이었다. 만성 나타나는 환자는 오른쪽 중엽에 있었다. 대규모 폐렴이 있다. 새로운 폐 결절은 우측 상엽에서 가장 잘 보이는 11x12㎜이며, 이전 검사에서는 새롭게 발견되었다. 그 외에도 아무런 증상도 없었다.

유전자 분석 :
우측 08번에서 진행된 척추 내 삽입술은 변화가 없었지만, 좌측 02 및 03번 일부 부분 시각화를 보여준다. 01번 비교하여 여러 가지 췌장 질환과 함께 증가된 붕괴가 눈에 띄었다. 06번은 약한 압축이었다. 그리고 33번은 부분적으로 볼 수 있었던 것은 일시적인 것으로 생각했다. 

뼣 : 이전에 시행된 철탑 제도가 변하지 않았지만, 부분적으로 부분 시청할 수 있었다. 07번은 일부 부분이 파열되어 있지만, 어떤 것도 없는 것 같다. 

인식 :
1. 심각한 폐렴과 새로운 우측 윗부분 결절 측정 11 × 12㎛, 악성으로 우려된다.
2 우측 세 번째, 네 번째, 다섯 번째 연쇄골절, 비침투형.
3 간단한 압출성 및 다양한 요추 및 늑골 체제의 감소가 발생하였다. 03개의 위팔뿔은 부분 적으로 부분 시계를 사용했지만, 어떠한 것도 없는 것을 알렸다. 

CT Spine ______ :

Findings :
뾰족하게 형태화된 뼈는 부분적으로 관찰될 수 있다. 14번은 급변하거나 분명한 증상이 없어졌다.

Name:  ___                  Unit No:   ___

Service: NEUROLOGY

(Sulfonamide Antibiotics) / Iodine-Iodine Containing /
