Attending: ___
 
Chief Complaint:
left arm numbness, headache
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
none

 
History of Present Illness:
Patient is a ___ year old right handed woman with PMH of
Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (thought to be in remission), deep venous
thrombosis (thought to be provoked by cancer hypercoaguable
state), recurrent shingles, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and
glaucoma whom neurology has been consulted for assessment of
headache and left arm numbness. 

Patient reports that symptoms started ___ AM with gradual 
onset
feeling of mild to moderate achiness and soreness behind the 
left
ear.  There was some mild radiation to the left occipital region
and upper neck.  Patient could not wear glasses because the
pressure from the rounded portion was causing pain to the
affected area.  Patient could also not lay down because pressure
of placing head to pillow was causing pain to this area.  
Patient
denied that the pain she was experiencing was only in the 
context
of items touching this area, it was present without being 
touched
and was aggravated with being touched.    

Patient by ___ ___ had near resolution of symptoms and thought
she was OK.  Pertinently, they did not fully abate but were
minimal. 

Patient reports that ___ ___ that her same symptoms again
gradually came back. Patient's symptoms progressed over night. 
First there was additional involvement of the left frontal
temporal portion of the head and then involvement of the left
neck, shoulder, and arm.  Patient reports that there is a mild 
to
moderate headache of the left frontal temporal region and
describes it as an achiness, but cannot further describe it. 
Patient denies that there is a throbbing, pulsating, numbness,
burning, or tingling quality.  Patient then started to have
involvement of the left neck, shoulder, and arm down to the 
hand.
Patient reports that she has pain in the left neck, shoulder, 
and
upper arm that is described as a soreness.  Patient does not
think that there is anything wrong with her forearm, but says
that her entire hand feels funny and unlike the right hand.  

Patient could not sleep last night because of the above symptoms
and perhaps because of the anxiety that they were causing. 
Patient called son at 4AM to bring her to the hospital. 

Pertinently, patient never has headaches, if she does it is a
sinus headache and is located at the bridge of her nose.  

Patient has not had any problems with cognition and does not 
feel
confused.  There has been no change with vision.  Patient and 
son
both agree that her face looks like it normally looks like and
there is no slurring of her voice.  Her voice might sound a ___
weaker than normal with perhaps has a raspy quality.  No
difficulty with swallowing.  Patient, currently, denies symptoms
in trunk and left leg. 

Patient has felt alittle bit more tired than normal over the 
last
week. Uncertain why has felt more tired.  Patient denies any
trauma to her head or falls.  Patient does not think that she 
has
slept on the left side of her body.  No concern for currently 
for
infection.  No infections in the last six months.  No weight 
loss
or night sweats.  

Review of symptoms:
No chest pain.  No difficulty with breathing.  No congestion in
the chest.  No abdominal pain.  No diarrhea or constipation.  No
pain with urination.  No increase in urinary frequency.  No
rashes or swelling in the legs.  No depression or stressors in
life, everything is going well.  

 
Past Medical History:

Brief Hospital Course:
Patient is a ___ year old right handed woman with PMH of
Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (thought to be in remission), deep venous
thrombosis (thought to be provoked by cancer hypercoagulable
state), hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and glaucoma who presented 
with headache and left arm numbness. 

She has a history of intermittent left shoulder pain usually 
provoked by activity. She developed fairly severe left cervical 
high paraspinal pain after she had been doing cleaning etc 
around the house, on ___ which worsened the following day to 
involve the left upper trapezius and the left arm down to the 
wrist. Left hand tingling and weakness have resolved. Troponins 
have been negative.

On examination she has tenderness over the left cervical
paraspinal muscles, the left upper trapezius, and over the
anterior left shoulder. She has trouble with forward flexion of 
the arm, which elicits pain at the shoulder. Rotator cuff 
impingement signs are
negative. 

CBC revealed normal white count. Basic metabolic panel is
normal. Vitamin B12 and folate are normal. Hemoglobin A1c was
normal. Cholesterol was 225, triglycerides 165, LDL 143. TSH
2.9, CRP 4.4, sed rate is pending. UA was normal. Lyme is
pending at time of discharge.

MRI of the brain revealed atrophy, white matter disease,
potential discogenic disease at C3, incompletely evaluated.

Her overall picture is consistent with musculoskeletal pain. 
Although a component of cervical radiculopathy may have been 
present, the quick resolution of
symptoms argues against it. The characteristic of the pain, with 
a deep soreness, worsened by shoulder movements and neck 
movements points to musculoskeletal etiology.

[] Orthopedics clinic follow up for shoulder pain.
[] She should follow up with a cardiologist for her EKG findings 
of LBBB
[] She is ordered for an outpatient MRI C-spine. These results 
will need follow up.

소견: 좌측 팔 뇌물감, 두통

수술 내역: 없음

병력: 환자는 40대 여성으로 비만혈중당증을 동반하고 있으며, 현재는 전신 부종이나 발열은 없으나, 최근 몇 달간 지속적인 우울 증상과 함께 심한 허리 통증을 호소하였다. 또한, 지난해에 경추부 골절로 인하여 수술을 받았으며, 이후에는 허리와 다리가 불편하며, 특히 밤잠이 잘 안 오고 있다. 그리고 최근에는 가슴 통증도 있고, 흉막염으로 진단받았다. 또한 혈압이 높아지면서 고혈압 치료를 하고 있었다. 그리고 당뇄가 있으므로 항문 유착증이 있어 조심해야 한다. 마지막으로, 최근에는 피부염이 있었는데, 이때부터 몸이 무겁게 느껴지고, 체온이 상승하는 현상을 보였다. 또한 손발이 얼어붙어서 움직이지 못하거나, 손발끝에서 아프다. 그리고 목마른 느낌이 들기도 하며, 소변을 볼 때는 힘들었다. 그리고 요즘은 식욕이 좋지 않아서 음식을 먹기가 어렵다. 또한 배가 고픕해서 변비가 생겼다. 하지만 지금은 괜찮다고 한다. 그리고 오늘 아침에 잠시 동안 머리를 숙이고 앉으면서 허리에 통증이 발생했다. 그리고 그 후에도 계속해서 허리통증이 나타났다. 그리고 이번에는 더 이상의 통증 없이 평범하게 생활할 수 있을 것으로 생각된다. 그러나 아직까지는 완전히 회복된 것은 아니라는 점을 감안하면, 추가 검사를 받아야 할 것 같다. 다음은 추가 검사의 내용이다. 추가 검사는 다음과 같이 진행되었다. 추가검사 결과는 다음과 같았다. 추가적으로 추가 검사가 필요하다면 추가 검사 결과를 참고하여 추가 검정을 시행한다. 추가적 검사 시기는 추가 검찰 결과를 참조하여 결정한다. 다음날인 2023년 02월 22일에 추가 검인을 실시하였고, 추가검출결과는 다음과 같은 것이 확인되어졌다. 추가 적 검사에서는 추가 검체가 발견되지 않았다. 추가적인 추가 검시는 추가 검사항목을 참조하도록 한다. 추가 사항은 추가 사항을 참석하여 추가 사항이 있는 경우 추가 사항에 대한 설명을 구두로 설명하도록 하겠다. 추가 정보는 추가 사항참조하되 추가 사항 중 추가 사항이라면 추가 사항의 추가 사항과 관련된 추가 사항들을 추가 사항으로 작성하도록 하는 것이다. 추가 상황은 추가 상황을 참작하여 추가 상황에 따른 추가 상황이 발생하지 않는 것을 원칙으로 하여 추가 상황 처리를 하도록 하겠습니다. 추가 사유는 추가 사정에 따라 추가 사정이 발생하기 때문에 추가 사례를 제외시키지는 않고 추가 사정을 포함하여 추가 사치로 작성하려고 합니다. 추가 자료는 추가 자료를 제공함으로써 추가 자료가 필요한 경우 추가 자료에 대해 추가 자료 요청을 하도록 한다는 것입니다. 추가자료는 추가자료를 통해 추가자료가 필요한 부분을 추가자료로 작성하여 추가자료요청을 하였습니다. 추가정보는 추가정보를 통해 해당되는 추가정보에 대해서 추가정보요청이 이루어진 상태입니다. 추가사항은 추가사항을 통해 추가사항이 되는 부분을 추후 추가사항으로 작성하여 추후추진될 예정입니다. 다음 날인 2019년 11월 21일에 추가사항 추가사항에 관한 추가사항요청건이 추가되었으니 추가사항추진을 위해 추가사항처리 절차를 밟힐 예정이오니다. 추가사유는 기존에 추가사용자가 없었던 상태에서 추가사망자의 가족 구성원이 되어 추가사명을 변경하였음에 따라 기존의 추가사명이 삭제되고 새로운 추가사명의 추가사인이 되었다. 추가근황은 추가근무시간이 증가하면서 추가 근무 시간이 늘어나고 추가 근태가 많아졌지만 추가 근육통증은 줄었음을 알 수

이름 : _______________________
Unit Number : _______________________



입원일자 : ____________________
퇴원일자는 : ____________________

생년월일 : _______ 년생
성별 : 남성


서비스 : 의학과

알레르기 정보 :
알레릭 기증 없음 또는 부작용 약물 반응 없음

진료 담당자 : ___________________________________________________________

주요 병력 :
BRBPP


수술 및 침습적 절차 :
없음

병력을 설명하면 다음과 같습니다:
50세 남성이 심박 수위가 낮은 과거와 함께 PPM 후에 발생한 이환으로 전신 혈전증과 같은 증상 없이 현재의 소변에서 단일 에피소드의 출혈을 보였습니다. 그는 일요일 아침 식사 후 대장 내시경 검사를 받았으며, 그 다음 날에는 간헐적인 두통이나 실명 등의 징후를 나타내지 않았습니다. 복부 통증이나 직장출혈 시 통증도 없습니다. 이전에 동일한 경우는 약 10여 년 전에 있었고, 요즘까지 계속해서 지속되어 왔습니다. 또한 구토나 설사는 없었으며 잘 먹었습니다. 그의 이전 출혔 사건 이후, 그는 '안구종'이라고 알려졌으며, 캡슐 내시 경검사가 보여준 것처럼 작은 장관에서의 정확한 위치를 찾지는 못했습니다. ED에서는 초기 VS는 97·3 87·8 126·7 67·0 19·0%이었으며, 심초음파는 80번의 심실 패서 리듬을 보이며 SGARBOSSA 기준을 갖추지 않은 상태였다. 위장은 상담하여 계속되는 BRBPP로 인해 의학 입원이 필요하다고 권유하였으나 혈액형이 안정되고 환자의 동맥 압력이 안정되었다. 트로포닌은 0.03에서 <0.010으로 추락하고 있다.



과거 병력:
50년간의 좌측 측두골 신경계 질환이 있고, 무리 없는 뇌졸중은 없었다. 그리고 50년 동안의 왼쪽 측두체 신경염이 있었다. 그리고 지난 50년에 간염이었다. 그리고 마지막으로 50세 때의 우울증이 있었다.


사회 역할:
50대 여성이다.

 가족 역할 :
어머니는 자신의 나이에 대한 GI 출형인데다가 아버지 역시 자신의 낭치기에 사망하였다. 그리고 가족 중에서도 뇌동맥류가 없었다.

 체질검사:
입원 당시의 체질 검사:
VS: 96·8 ℃, BP: 140/60 mmHg, HR: 82 beats/min, RR: 18 breaths/min, SpO2: 99%
일반적으로 잘 생긴 노인 남자

흉부 : CT scan bilateral, no rh/wheezing, good airflow, resp effortless, no accessory muscle usage
심장 : Rhythm regular, no murmurs, NL S1/S2, pacemaker placed in left superior thoracic area
복부 : Normal bowel sound, soft and nontender, nondistended, no rebound or guard, no mass
四肢 : No edema; 2 + pulse radials and DP
신경 : Awake, alert and oriented x3, cranial nerves II XII grossly preserved, muscle power 5 out of 5 throughout, sensory preservation throughout, reflexes symmetrically present

 퇴원 당시 체질 확인:

 심장 : Regular rhythm ; no murmur ; NL S 1/S 2 ; pacemaker located in left super ior thoracic region

Name: ___ Unit No: ___ Admission Date: ___ Discharge Date: ___ Date of Birth: ___ Sex: M Service: MEDICINE Allergies: Penicillins / Keflex / Gentamicin / Cipro Cystitis / clindamycin Attending: ___ Chief Complaint: Left leg pain Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure: None History of Present Illness: ___ hx melanoma metastatic to bone ___ biologics/ipilimumab now on vemurafenib, prostate ca ___ TURP, SCC ___ excision, hx left hip MSSA arthritis, PE on coumadin, L leg lymphedema with recurrent cellulitis presents with venous stasis and consideration for left leg amputation. He was initially diagnosed with melanoma in ___. Underwent a L leg lymph node dissection with resulting LLE lymphedema. Has been having recurrent infections, most recently in ___ treated with vanc and then linezolid. He had previously been on minocycline for suppression, which caused some ___ pigmentation. About a month ago presented with severe L sided pain and erythema and subsequently had 3 admissions to ___, ___, ___ for venous stasis dermatitis. Was hospitalized for intractable pain, failure to thrive related to left leg. In addition, he has had a reddish thigh papular lesion on his left leg similar in appearance from a melanomatous lesion that had been resected from his posterior neck last year. Being admitted now for consideration of left leg amputation given that he has responded so well to venfurafenib. He reports recent back/hip pain exacerbated by movement, denies pain elsewhere other than in his leg. REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Denies fever, chills, night sweats, headache, vision changes, rhinorrhea, congestion, sore throat, cough, chest pain, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, constipation, BRBPR, melena, hematochezia, dysuria, hematuria. All other 10-system review negative in detail. Past Medical History: PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY: -___: Wide local excision of a 1.5-mm thick superficial spreading melanoma from inner aspect of left thigh; sentinel lymph node biopsy negative -___: Biopsy-proven recurrence in left inguinal area, which on review, was felt to be within the lymph nodes with evidence of extracapsular extension into the resection margin. He underwent left inguinal node dissection with pathology revealing metastatic melanoma in the soft tissue, not extending to the margins. He received adjuvant radiation therapy to the inguinal area -___: Adjuvant interferon therapy, course complicated by urinary tract infection (off interferon from ___ through ___ while on antibiotics). -Interferon discontinued on ___ due to prostatitis flare. -___ Diagnosed with prostate cancer ___ 3+3 -___ New RUL nodule on CT -___ CT torso: 25 x 23 mm right upper lobe nodule and a 3mm R apical nodule with no other disease in the chest, abdomen, or pelvis. -___ PET-CT: FDG avid lesion in the right upper lung 2. FDG avid bilateral hilar nodes FDG avid lesion in the inferior left abdominal wall FDG avid mass in the left scapula and multiple FDG avid skeletal sites. -___ MRI Brain: No evidence of intracranial metastases. -___ Scapular Bx: Malignant epithelioid malignancy, S-100 positive, and negative for keratin cocktail, MART-1, and HMB-45. Similar to primary melanoma. BRAF V600E Mutant -___ consented for DF-HCC ___ ___ or Dacarbazine). Deemed ineligible due to prostate cancer. -___ to ___ C1D1-C6D1 Dacarbazine 1000mg/m2 -___ CT torso with no new lesions, slight decrease in groin met, stable bony disease -___ MRI brain without CNS disease -___ to ___ C7D1 to C10D1 Dacarbazine 1000mg/m2 -___ CT with stable disease -___ C11D1 Dacarbazine 1000mg/m2 plus zoledronic acid -___ to ___ Admitted for L hip pain. Found to have a septic joint. -___ L hip washout, cultures grew MSSA. OPAT treatment w Daptomycin c/b recurrent osteo -___ Re-washout, started telvanacin for recurrent osteo -___ CT torso with unchanged appearance of the skeletal and pulmonary metastases -___ L hip replacement/prosthesis placed -___ CT torso showed stable pulmonary and bone mets -___ CT torso showed stable pulmonary and bone mets -___ CT torso showed stable pulmonary and bone mets -___ CT torso showed stable pulmonary and bone mets -___ CT Torso: Slight interval progression of metastatic disease in the bilateral lungs and left paratracheal lymph node. Osseous metastatic disease appears stable by CT. -___: Posterior soft tissue neck biopsy c/w melanoma, 1.0cm -___ CT Torso Interval mild progression of pulmonary nodules and AP window lymph node. Unchanged osseous metastatic disease. Extensive inflammatory change about the left hip presumably the sequelae of prior recurrent infectious process. -___: Ipilimumab initiated ___: Pathology: Skin, right scalp, parietal, biopsy (1A-1D): Malignant epithelioid neoplasm present within the dermis and consistent with malignant melanoma; present at the specimen margins -___: 4th dose of ipilimumab given -___: CT Overall worsening of metastatic disease with new or increased in size of pulmonary nodules, anterior chest wall deposits, osseous involvement and central lymphadenopathy. MRI of head/orbits: No acute intracranial abnormality. -___: Initiation of vemurafenib -___: Seen by Dr. ___ of dermatology for new-onset seborrheic keratoses as well as actinic keratoses due to vemurafenib. Treated with cryotherapy. -___: Discharged from ___ service for left wrist cellulitis for which he received IV vancomycin and was switched to oral linezolid for one week after discharge. -___: CT Torso-Significant interval improvement with resolution of much of the soft tissue component along a right tenth rib metastasis. Multiple liver lesions have resolved. Others are decreased in size. The nodule in left adrenal gland has decreased in size. Mesenteric lymphadenopathy and omental nodules have resolved. No new lesions are seen. -___: SCC of back lesion -___: Further excision of SCC lesion -___: Admitted for nausea/vomiting/diarrhea; found to have cellulitis treated with Vancomycin then Linezolid, ruled out for Cdiff ___: CT scan stable, no new disease PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: -MSSA Osteomyelitis of the L hip ___ L THA (___) with prosthetic CoNS THA infection ___ IV abx and removal of prosthesis in ___, on lifelong suppressive minocycline -Diabetes, A1C 6.5 in ___ -Hx of pulmonary embolism/DVT, stable on coumadin -Hyperparathyroidism, stable -___ 6+6 prostate ca, followed by Dr. ___ TURP -"Hepatitis:" Hep B and C serologies negative, ? h/o hep A -___ appendectomy Social History: ___ Family History: noncontributory Physical Exam: ADMISSION PHYSICAL EXAM: VS: 132/68 84 18 98% on RA GENERAL: NAD HEENT: NC/AT, EOMI, PERRL, MMM, lesion on back of neck, approximately 0.5cm in diameter, erythematous, non-tender CARDIAC: RRR, nl S1 and S2, no murmurs LUNG: CTAB no w/r/rh ABD: +BS, soft, NT/ND, no r/g EXT: LLE pitting edema to waist, extreme darkness of skin bilaterally but much greater on the left shin compared to right, red papules are appreciated intermittently from the upper thigh to the mid-shin, non-tender, variable in size PULSES: 2+DP pulses bilaterally NEURO: CN II-XII intact. SKIN: Warm and dry DISCHARGE PHYSICAL EXAM: VS: 98.4 124/62 97 18 98% on RA GENERAL: NAD HEENT: NC/AT, EOMI, PERRL, MMM, lesion on back of neck, approximately 0.5cm in diameter, erythematous, non-tender CARDIAC: RRR, nl S1 and S2, no murmurs LUNG: CTAB no w/r/rh ABD: +BS, soft, NT/ND, no r/g EXT: LLE pitting edema to waist, extreme darkness of skin bilaterally but much greater on the left shin compared to right, red papules are appreciated intermittently from the upper thigh to the mid-shin, non-tender, variable in size PULSES: 2+DP pulses bilaterally NEURO: CN II-XII intact. SKIN: Warm and dry Pertinent Results: ___ 07:18PM ___ PTT-41.4* ___ ___ 07:18PM WBC-UNABLE TO ___ 07:18PM CALCIUM-10.2 PHOSPHATE-2.2* MAGNESIUM-2.4 ___ 07:18PM ALT(SGPT)-10 AST(SGOT)-10 ALK PHOS-96 TOT BILI-0.7 ___ 07:18PM estGFR-Using this ___ 08:54PM PLT COUNT-167 ___ 08:54PM PLT COUNT-167 ___ 08:54PM NEUTS-82.8* LYMPHS-10.5* MONOS-6.1 EOS-0.4 BASOS-0.2 ___ 08:54PM WBC-6.3 RBC-2.55* HGB-7.8* HCT-24.6* MCV-96 MCH-30.6 MCHC-31.8 RDW-17.2* ___: CT ABDOMEN PELVIS WITH CONTRAST 1. 6.0 x 5.4 cm heterogeneously enhancing mass along the left aspect of the L5 vertebral body invades into the paraspinal musculature and the left L5 neural foramen. Enhancing soft tissue extends into the left posterior spinal canal and displaces the dural sac. MRI could be obtained to further evaluate for spinal cord involvement. 2. Lucent lesion in the L4 vertebral body has enlarged since ___. Other lucent and sclerotic lumbar spine lesions are similar to prior. 3. Splenomegaly with two 6 mm hypoenhancing splenic lesions, which may represent benign entities or less likely metastatic disease. Attention to these lesions is recommended on followup imaging. 4. Stable configuration of left hip replacement with increased left lower extremity edema. Heterogeneous hyperdensity surrounding the hip prosthesis has increased since ___, but soft tissue thickening and ectatic vasculature in this region are chronic. ___: CT LEFT LOWER EXTREMITY 1. Extensive soft tissue thickening in the left inguinal region causing marked attenuation and irregularity of the traversing common femoral vein and to a lesser extent the common femoral artery. While no enhancing mass is identified in this region and the findings likely reflect chronic inflammatory changes and scarring, a metastatic focus cannot be excluded. 2. There is a 5 cm centrally necrotic metastatic mass arising from the left lateral aspect of the L5 vertebral body extending posteriorly to the paraspinal soft tissues causing complete obliteration of the L5-S1 neural foramen and partial obliteration of the inferior L4-L5 neural foramen. 3. Multiple probable metastatic lesions in the soft tissues of the lower extremity: 2 cm oval lesion posterior to the proximal femur, 1.7 cm lesion adjacent to the profunda femoral vessels, and two 7 mm lesions overlying the vastus lateralis muscle. 4. Multiple metastatic bony lesions: Lucent right L4 vertebral body focus, sclerotic right L5 vertebral body focus, and scattered nonspecific left ischial tuberosity and iliac crest foci are present. 5. Dense intra medullary lesion in the femoral shaft just distal to the last antibiotic bead could represent another bony metastasis. 6. Status post Girdlestone procedure with a moderate joint effusion with peripheral enhancement. ___: CT CHEST WITH CONTRAST: 1. No new or enlarging pulmonary nodule or mass. Stable small nodules, as described above. Follow up on routine oncologic imaging is recommended. 2. Progression of osseous metastatic disease, with new or more conspicious lesions at the right scapula and T1. Additional foci of osseous metastatic disease are stable. Brief Hospital Course: ___ hx melanoma metastatic to bone ___ biologics/ipilimumab now on vemurafenib, prostate ca ___ TURP, SCC ___ excision, hx left hip MSSA arthritis, PE on coumadin, L leg lymphedema with recurrent cellulitis presents with venous stasis and c/f recurrent metastatic melanoma and treatment failure. # LLE LYMPHEDEMA: Likely from distant lymph node dissection for treatment of his melanoma. His wound care included steroid creams continued based on his home regimen. His pain control regimen included fentanyl patch with PRN morphine of which the patient required very little. He seemed somnolent and confused on admission so his fentanyl dose was reduced from 50 mcg to 25mcg with resulting improvement in mental status and continued good pain control. The patient was interested in discharge home with ___ rather than to rehab, and after ___ evaluation he was cleared for home with ___. # METASTATIC MELANOMA: Leg lesions likely melanoma in-situ per dermatology consult obtained on admission. The lesions noted were red papules which the patient noted to have been spreading over the past week and increasing in number. Dermatology had biopsied an identical lesion ___ and the result of that pathology was metastatic melanoma so it was thought to be of low utility to repeat a biopsy. CT left leg showed extensive soft tissue disease also with femoral osseous mets. A CT abdomen pelvis/CT chest revealed mutiple vertebral metastases the largest of which was at the L5 level. This is all very likely progression of disease despite venfurafenib. Per Dr. ___ are other options for the patient, so he will follow up with Dr. ___ as an outpatient to consider other therapies for his metastatic melanoma as he seems to have failed venfurafenib. # HX PE AND EXTENSIVE DVT OF LLE-likely d/t severe lymphedema. He was admitted on coumadin and his coumadin was continued at the same dose with therpauetic INR daily. Lovenox is proven to be more effective than coumadin in malignancy associated DVT, so the patient should be considered for lovenox therapy instead of coumadin. # HX OF MRSA INFECTION OF HIS PROSTHETIC HIP-Home minocycline suppressive therapy was continued during the hospitalization. Transitional Issues: -Please consider lovenox in this patient as it has been shown to be superior to coumadin in thrombosis associated with malignancy -On admission, the patient was on 50mcg fentanyl patch and was feeling confused and drowsy, his dose was reduced to 25mcg with good pain control and no sedating side effects Medications on Admission: The Preadmission Medication list is accurate and complete. 1. 환자의 주요 불편 사항은 왼쪽 다리 통증입니다.

수술이나 침습적 시술: 없다.

병력 개요는 다음과 같습니다. 멜라닌종 전이가 골에 미치는 것으로서 바이오로지컬/IPILIMUMAB를 현재 베무라페닙을 받고 있습니다. 프로스테이트 CA가 있으며 TURPP이고 SCC가 있다. 좌측 엉덩이 MSSA 관절염과 PE는 코마딘으로 치료받았다. 좌발의 림프부전 및 재발성 세포막 손상이 있어 좌측 발목 절단을 고려하고 있다.

병력이 있는 환자가 초기 진단된 것은 ____였다. 좌대뇨선 검사에서 좌대 뇌물신경계와 관련하여 수술한 결과 좌대 부정맥 혈액투석이 발생했다. 이전에는 최소 사이클라인을 사용했지만 일부 피부색소침착이 있었다. 약 한 달 전에 심각한 좌측 측면통증과 홍반과 함께 삼차례 입원해 왔으며, 이후 정맥류와 같은 증상을 보였습니다. 또한 그의 왼팔 근육에서는 유사한 종양이 있었던 것이 발견되었다. 최근 백혈구 감소증과 관련하여 병력을 가지고 있다.

체계 검사는 모든 다른 시스템에서 음성이 없는 상태이다. 체온, 기침, 밤샘 흡수, 두통, 눈 변화, 비강 내비, 폐렴, 복통, 위장관 문제, 구토, 설사, 변비, BRBP 등 모두 음성이 없었다. 과거 병력은 다음과 같다. 과두암이 있거나 암세포가 있는 경우도 있다.

과거 병력이 있다. 과다흉부 조직검사를 통해 확산되어 왔다. 또한 그곳에서 간질환이나 말초 신경계 질환이 있을 수도 있다. 또한 그는 최근 허벅지와 무릎 부위의 붓기를 느꼈다. 또한 그가 경험하는 통증은 다른 곳에서도 나타났다. 그리고 그는 최근LYMPEDEMA를 경험하였다. 또한 양성림프절을 제거하기 위해 수술을 하기도 했다. 또한 항균제를 사용할 때는 소변을 보고한다. 또한 이때는 인공심장치료를 받았었다. 또한 이는 그의 생존율을 높이는 데 도움이 되었다. 또한 이것은 그의 삶의 질 향상에도 도움을 줄 것이다. 또한 그것은 그의 생명을 연장시키는 데 도움 될 것이다. 하지만 그것은 아직 완전히 해결되지 않았다. 또한 앞으로 더 많은 연구가 필요하다. 또한 우리는 그를 위한 새로운 치료법을 찾으려고 노력하고 있다. 그러나 아직까지는 확실하지 않다. 또한 우리에게는 더 이상의 정보가 없어서 추후 추가적인 검사가 필요하다.

또한 그는 최근에 악화되었는데, 이는 그의 생활 방식 때문이었다. 또한 이러한 상황들은 그의 삶에 영향을 미쳤다. 또한 그러한 행동들이 그의 건강에 해로운 영향을 미칠 수 있다. 따라서 우리는 이러한 행동들을 중단해야 한다. 또한 이를 위해서는 더욱 강력한 방법이 필요하다라고 생각된다. 또한 그렇다면 우리는 더 나아갈 수 있을 것이다. 또는 우리는 더 큰 힘을 얻을 수 있을 것이라고 믿는다. 또한 이제부터 우리는 더 좋은 방법을 찾아야 할 것이다. 아니면 우리는 더 크게 실패할지도 모른다. 하지만 우리는 계속해서 싸워야만 한다. 또는 우리가 더 나쁠 수 밖에 없다. 또한 지금은 우리가 가장 잘 알고 있는 바대로 진행하겠다. 또한 여기서는 더 이상 설명할 필요가 없다. 마지막으로 우리는 더 이상 지속될 수 없다고 생각한다. 또는 더 이상 우리가 알지는 못했던 것을 깨달을 수 있다고 생각한다.

따라서 우리는 더 적극적으로 대처해야 할 것이다! 또한 우리는 더 많은 시간을 보내야 할 필요가 있다! 또한 우리가 원하는 만큼 더 많이 배우고 싶다! 또한 더 많은 사람들과 교감하며 살아가는 것도 중요하다! 또한 나는 더 많은 사람들이 나를 이해하고 지원해 준다는 사실에 감사드린다!

Name:  ___              Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
Patient recorded as having No Known Allergies to Drugs
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
exertional neck pain
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
cardiac catheterization with angioplasty and stenting

 
History of Present Illness:
The patient is a ___ year old woman with history of HTN, 
hyperlipidemia, and diet controlled diabetes who presented 
intially to ___ on ___ after having 1 week of 
exertional angina. She was having pain in the neck and shoulders 
after walking 2 flights of stairs at a time. She had no 
shortness of breath, diaphoresis, or palpitations during each 
event.  
  
She ruled out for MI. She underwent cardiac catheterization and 
was found to have an 80% proximal LAD lesion and a 40-50% distal 
stenosis of her OM. The LCx had 40-50% distal lesion. The RCA 
and LMCA were normal. LVEF was normal. RHC revealed normal 
pressures. For the intervention, the patient was transferred to 
___.  
  
During the intervention the LAD lesion was stented however a 
linear density was seen that was ultimately thought to be due to 
eccentric calcification and not dissection. 2 DES were placed in 
the LAD and 1 DES was placed in LCX for a 70% distal lesion. 
During the procedure she developed neck/throat pain and 
intermittently had a LBBB on her EKG. She was started on a NTG 
drip and the case was completed as planned.  
 
Of note the patient had recently stopped her lipitor (myalgias 
and myositis) and HCTZ. She states that she recently started to 
be evaluated by her PCP for anemia which so far has only shown 
hypothyroidism. She was recently prescribed thyroid replacement 
but has not yet started the prescription.  
  
On review of symptoms, she denies any prior history of stroke, 
TIA, deep venous thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, bleeding at the 
time of surgery, myalgias, joint pains, cough, hemoptysis, black 
stools or red stools. He denies recent fevers, chills or rigors. 
She denies exertional buttock or calf pain other than when on 
lipitor. All of the other review of systems were negative.  
  
*** Cardiac review of systems is notable for absence of current 
chest pain, dyspnea on exertion, paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, 
orthopnea, ankle edema, palpitations, syncope or presyncope.  

 
Past Medical History:
hypertension  
hyperlipidemia  
diabetes mellitus type 2 (diet controlled)  

 
Social History:
___
Family History:
There is no family history of premature coronary artery disease 
or sudden death. Mother died of heart disease in her ___. Father 
died of heart disease in his ___. 
 
Physical Exam:
VS: T 97.8 , BP 131/69, HR 65, RR 15, O2 100% on 2L  
Gen: obese middle aged woman in NAD, resp or otherwise. Oriented 
x3. Mood, affect appropriate. Pleasant.  
HEENT: NCAT. Sclera anicteric. PERRL, EOMI. Conjunctiva were 
pink, no pallor or cyanosis of the oral mucosa.  
Neck: Supple with JVP flat with patient flat.  
CV: PMI located in ___ intercostal space, midclavicular line. 
RR, normal S1, S2. No S4, no S3.  
Chest: No chest wall deformities, scoliosis or kyphosis. Resp 
were unlabored, no accessory muscle use. No crackles, wheeze, 
rhonchi.  
Abd: Obese, soft, NTND, No HSM or tenderness. No abdominial 
bruits.  
Ext: No c/c/e. No femoral bruits. arterial sheath in left 
femoral artery  
Skin: No stasis dermatitis, ulcers, scars, or xanthomas.  
Pulses:  
Right: Carotid 2+ without bruit; Femoral 2+ without bruit; 2+ DP 
 
Left: Carotid 2+ without bruit; Femoral 2+ without bruit; 2+ DP  


 
Pertinent Results:
EKG demonstrated (___) sinus rhythm at 65 bpm nl axis and 
intervals no significant ST-T wave changes  
  
___: post-PCI: sinus @65 with PR prolongation. nl axis. LBBB. 
 
  
TELEMETRY demonstrated: sinus rhythm with nl axis and intervals 
with periods of sinus rhythm with wide complex and leftward axis 
(LBBB morphology)    
 
CARDIAC CATH performed at ___ on ___ demonstrated:  
80% ___ LAD  
40-50% distal OM  
LMCA and RCA were normal.  
LCX 40-50% distal lesion  
RA ___  
RV ___  
PA ___  
PCW ___  
AO ___  
LV 108/14  
 
___: ___  
Right dominant system  
LMCA no apparant disease  
LAD 80% proximal lesion involving the D1 which had moderate 
ostial disease  
LCx: 70% distal lesion supplying 2 OMs  
PCI: LAD with 2 overlapping Cypher stents, LCX with 1 Cypher 
stent. Linear density seen at the distal edge of first LAD stent 
felt likely to represent eccentric calcium and not dissection.  
Optiray: 370cc  
angiomax was given during the procedure.  
  
Imaging:CXR ___ - clear lungs. no active process  
  
LABORATORY DATA:  
OSH records  
___ - CBC 6.7>27.1<179 MCV 83 RDW 15  
___ - chem 7  
Na 136 K 4.1 Cl 105 CO2 23 BUN 29 Cr 1.3 Glu 105

TnI 0.01  

___ 02:46PM BLOOD CK(CPK)-529*

___ 05:56AM BLOOD CK-MB-18* MB Indx-4.9 cTropnT-0.50*

LDLcalc-76

___ 05:35AM BLOOD Free T4-0.74*
___ 05:35AM BLOOD calTIBC-298 VitB12-___ Folate-9.0 
Ferritn-393* TRF-229

Echo ___
The left atrium is normal in size. Left ventricular wall 
thicknesses and cavity size are normal. There is mild regional 
left ventricular systolic dysfunction with akinesis of the basal 
inferior septum, and hypokinesis of the basal inferio wall and 
mid-inferior septum (RCA territory). The remaining segments 
contract normally (LVEF = 50-55%). Right ventricular chamber 
size and free wall motion are normal. The mitral valve leaflets 
are mildly thickened. There is no mitral valve prolapse. Trivial 
mitral regurgitation is seen. There is mild pulmonary artery 
systolic hypertension. There is a trivial/physiologic 
pericardial effusion.

IMPRESSION: Mild regional left ventricular systolic dysfunction, 
c/w CAD. Mild pulmonary hypertension.
 
Brief Hospital Course:
In brief the patient is a ___ year old woman with history of 
hypertension, hyperlipidemia who was referred for elective PCI 
following developing progressive exertional angina.

#CAD: The patient is a ___ year old woman with history of HTN, 
hyperlipidemia, diet controlled DM2 presenting for PCI c/b 
intermittent LBBB and anginal equivalent.  
Patient initially presented to OSH with exertional angina found 
to have signficant 2 vessel disease that is now s/p PCI with 
stent placement. The patient is was symptom free immediately 
following angioplasty with intermittent LBBB on EKG. Transfered 
from OSH due to concern regarding LBBB and concern that LAD had 
dissected during stent placement.  Patient initially had some 
nausea, chest pressure and headache following arrival in CCU, 
but EKG was unchanged from pre-cath EKG (no LBBB) and symptoms 
resolved with anti-emetics and rest.  Post-cath check was 
unremarkable, and over the next ___ hours of admission the 
patient's cardiac enzymes trended up, peaking at CK 529 and 
Troponin of 0.58.  On ___ the patient had an echo that showed 
a LVEF of 50-55%.  Patient began to ambulate on ___ and 
worked with physical therapy on ___.  Patient was restarted 
on home aspirin and ACE-inhibitor and started on plavix and a 
beta-blocker.  

#Anemia:  Patient was noted to be anemic and was transfused 2 
units packed RBC's on night of admission and on morning 
laboratories found to have an elevated TSH with a suppressed 
free T4, suggesting hypothyroidism as the etiology of her 
anemia, as iron studies, folate and B12 were normal and stool 
guaiacs were negative.  Pt was started on levothyroxine.  

 
Medications on Admission:
ASA 81mg daily  
Quinapril 20mg daily  

 
Discharge Medications:
1. Aspirin 325 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO DAILY (Daily).
Disp:*60 Tablet(s)* Refills:*2*
2. Clopidogrel 75 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO DAILY 
(Daily).
Disp:*60 Tablet(s)* Refills:*3*
3. Fenofibrate Micronized 48 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO 
daily ().  
4. Nitroglycerin 0.3 mg Tablet, Sublingual Sig: One (1) Tablet, 
Sublingual Sublingual q5minutes as needed for chest pain: if no 
relief with 1 tablet call ___.
Disp:*30 Tablet, Sublingual(s)* Refills:*0*
5. Quinapril 20 mg Tablet Sig: Two (2) Tablet PO DAILY (Daily).
Disp:*60 Tablet(s)* Refills:*2*
6. Levothyroxine 25 mcg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO DAILY 
(Daily).
Disp:*30 Tablet(s)* Refills:*2*

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Primary:
NSTEMI
Hypertension

Secondary:
Obesity
Hyperlipidemia

 
Discharge Condition:
Good. Chest pain free. Stable vital signs. Tolerating oral 
medication and nutrition.

 
Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted for treatment of exertional chest/neck pain.  
You likely suffered a heart attack and you underwent cardiac 
catheterization where we have treated the blockages with 
angioplasty and stenting.  We have found the your thyroid 
function was depressed and we have started you on a medication 
called Levothyroxine to supplement your thyroid.  You will need 
to get follow up thyroid function tests in ___, please 
discuss this with your primary care physician.

Please take your medications as prescribed.

It is very important that you continue to take both your aspirin 
and clopidogrel (Plavix) without missing a dose until your 
cardiologist tells you to stop.  Missing doses could put you at 
risk for a severe heart attack or even death. For now you should 
expect to take these medications for at least one year.

Please attend the recommended follow-up appointments.

If you develop any new or concerning symptoms such as chest 
pain, shortness of breath, severe nausea, or severe bleeding; 
please seek medical attention as soon as possible.
 
Followup Instructions:
___
translated:
이름 : _______________________
Unit No : _______________________



입원일자 : ____________________________
출산 일자 : __________________________________


서비스 : 의학과


알레르기 : 환자가 약물에 대한 알레르기가 없다고 기록되어 있다.


진료하는 사람 : _______________________________.



주요 수술 또는 침습적 절차 :
심장 카테터화와 혈관 내시경 및 스텐트 삽입을 포함한 심장 카타세라티제이션.


병력 개요 :
환자는 고혈압, 고지방혈증, 식단 조절 당뇨를 가진 39세 여성으로서 운동성 목통증을 주소로 입원하였다. 그녀는 1주간의 운동성 관상 동맥 경색 증상을 보였다. 각 사건 동안 호흡 곤란이나 땀 흘림도 없었다. 

사실은 부정적인 것으로 판명되었다. 그녀는 심장 검사를 받았고 근위 LAD 병변과 OM의 중위쪽 협착을 보여주는 80%, OM의 40~50% 병변이 발견되었다. LCX는 40 ~ 50 % 병볘이었다. RCA와 LMCA는 정상이었다. LV EF가 정상이었으며, 압력이 정상이다. 그녀는 미리 예비된 MI를 배제했다. 그녀는 신장검사에서 80 % 근위쪽 LAD 질환이 있었던 것을 확인받았다. LCx에는 40–50% 거동이 있었다. RCA 및 LMCA 모두 정상이며, LVEEF는 정상의 압력이 있는 것이 확인되었다. 그녀가 전신 검사에서 정상인 것은 확인되지 않았다. 그녀의 경우는 HTN과 고지혈구혈액질환이 있으며, 최근에 Lipitor(마유골근염 및 마유육종)을 중단하고 HCT(Z)를 중단했으며, 최근 PCP에게 아나미아 평가를 시작했다. 현재 치료약을 복용하지 않고 아직 처방된 것이다. 그 외에도 환자의 가족력은 없다. 환자는 최근에 허혈성 엉덩거나 다리의 통증을 느끼지는 않았지만, 최근 몇 달 사이에 허전증이나 무감각 상태 등이 나타났다. 환인은 최근에 PCP로부터 허형인 것처럼 나타났으나 아직 시작하지 못 했다. 환인의 과거 병력은 없음. 환인이 최근에 피부 감작이나 기타 증상 없이 진찰하였음. 환인을 대상으로 한 모든 검사는 음성이 아니었으며, 환인은 심장 리뷰 시스템에서는 현저하게 비대칭이 없는 것으로 나타났다.

임상 소견 :
환인은 HTN 및 고지형혈당을 가진 38세 여성이며, 최근 1년 간의 운동 성목통증이 있어 왔다. 그녀는 최근에 HTN을 중단했고, 최근LYP를 경험하지 않았다. 환이는 최근에 심장 발달 이상이 없었으며, 심장발달 이상도 없었다.

내과적 요법 :
HTN 및 HyperlipidemiA

사회 역학 :
여성은 최근에 안정되었으며, 가족역학은 HTN이나 심장 사망이 없었다. 어머니는 심장병으로 사망하며, 아버지 또한 심장 병으로 사망하였다. 체온은 37.8°C이고, 혈압은 130/70mmHg였으며, 맥박은 66회/min이었다. 환人は 최근에 항문 출혈이나 다른 징후 없이 진행되고 있었다. 환인들은 최근에 단백질 분해 효소 증가와 같은 임상적 지표들이 나타난다. 환자의 생체 면역 기능은 정상이 아닌 것으로 나타났으며, 혁류 유무는 정중앙이었다. 혈액 검사 결과는 다음과 같다. 혜성은 95.5%이고, 백혈포는 85.5%, 적혈금속은 13.5%(하행), 혈청 단백분해효소는 28.5 IU/L이었다. 심장 변연은 120/80 mmHg였다. 환자들은 최근 24시간 동안 심장 이완제를 투여받았으며, 이후 환자는 심장 위축이 발생하여 심장이 완전히 확장되는 상황이 되었다. 환 자는 최근에 혈장 크레아틴 kinase가 150 IU/L까지 상승하였다. 환자를 대상으로 하는 심장 혈관계는 정량적으로 정상이고, 심장은 정상적인 움직임을 유지하고 있었다. 심계측은 정량적이지 않으며, 대퇴부 및 하지의 통증은 없었다. 환자가 심장에 문제가 있다고

MEDICAL HOSPITAL COURSE:

# Acute Pancreatitis: Presented with lipase ___ to OSH c/w 
pancreatitis. While patient has history of EToH intake, the

episode to the upper abdomen. Reportedly had CBD stone on 
informal ultrasound at ___ no biliary dilation or stone 
identified here. ERCP attempted ___ but unable to visualize or 
cannulate papillae given significant gut edema.  Triglycerides 
was normal. Fulminant course was not c/w autoimmune 
pancreatitis.  Pancreatitis was complicated by firm and 
distended abdomen raising concner for compartment syndrome. 
Given difficulty ventilating (see below), he underwent bedside 
ex lap ___.  He was transferred to the surgical ICU for further 
care.

# Distributive Shock:
# GPC bacteremia:
Shock likely primarily distribute ___ pancreatitis and 
bacteremia. Blood cultures resulted as ... Required pressors in 
setting of intubation and positive pressure. He was aggressively 
bolused with IVF. Started on vanc/ meropenem (___) 

#Hypoxemic and hypercarbic respiratory failure: He became 
increasingly tachypneic throughout the day. At ERCP on HD1 he 
became hypoxemic with significant difficulty oxygenating and 
ventilating requiring paralysis and very high peak pressures. 
This was likely secondary to high abdominal compartment 
pressures leading to restrictive physiology, low lung volumes, 
worsening v/q mismatch, also possibly ARDS i/s/o pancreatitis. 
With paralysis his oxygenation only improved slightly, 
ultimately hastening surgical consult and ultimately leading to 
a bedside ex-lap to relieve high compartment pressures. 
# renal failure- Oligouric/anuric, most likely ATN. Patient 
underwent multiple treatments of hemodialysis. Prior to 
discharge, his kidney function improved and he started urinating 
on his own. His last HD was ___, and his HD access 
line was removed prior to discharge to rehab per the nephrology 
team.

was transferred to the surgical ICU. His pressors were weaned. 
His ventilatory status improved dramatically and his paralysis 
was stopped. His creatinine continued to rise and renal was 
consulted. The patient was started on CVVH. Overnight on POD1, 
the patient was brought back to the OR for wash-out and Abthera 
VAC placement.

with a wound vac in place. Prior to discharge, the patient 
started urinating and had improved renal function. Per 
nephrology, he no longer needed HD and his HD access was removed

hemodialysis for kidney failure, tube feeding for malnutrition, 
and tracheostomy. You are being discharged to rehab in stable 
condition off tube feeds with your tracheostomy removed. Please 
follow the below directions:

Please call your doctor or nurse practitioner or return to the 
Emergency Department for any of the following:
*You experience new chest pain, pressure, squeezing or 
tightness.
*New or worsening cough, shortness of breath, or wheeze.
*If you are vomiting and cannot keep down fluids or your 
medications.
*You are getting dehydrated due to continued vomiting, diarrhea, 
or other reasons. Signs of dehydration include dry mouth, rapid 
heartbeat, or feeling dizzy or faint when standing.
*You see blood or dark/black material when you vomit or have a 
bowel movement.
*You experience burning when you urinate, have blood in your 
urine, or experience a discharge.
*Your pain in not improving within ___ hours or is not gone 
within 24 hours. Call or return immediately if your pain is 
getting worse or changes location or moving to your chest or 
back.
*You have shaking chills, or fever greater than 101.5 degrees 
Fahrenheit or 38 degrees Celsius.
*Any change in your symptoms, or any new symptoms that concern 
you.

Please resume all regular home medications, unless specifically 
advised not to take a particular medication. Also, please take 
any new medications as prescribed.

Please get plenty of rest, continue to ambulate several times 
per day, and drink adequate amounts of fluids. Avoid lifting 
weights greater than ___ lbs until you follow-up with your 
surgeon.
Avoid driving or operating heavy machinery while taking pain 
medications.
 
Followup Instructions:
___

Echo ___:
The left atrium is elongated. There is mild symmetric left

(LVEF 60-70%). There is no ventricular septal defect. Right 
ventricular chamber size and free wall motion are normal. There 
are focal calcifications in the aortic arch. The aortic valve 
leaflets (3) are mildly thickened but aortic stenosis is not 
present. No aortic regurgitation is seen. The mitral valve 
leaflets are mildly thickened. There is no mitral valve 
prolapse. Trivial mitral regurgitation is seen. The pulmonary

CXR ___:
Mild cardiomegaly persists. Perihilar haziness, vascular 
indistinctness, and small bilateral pleural effusions are 
consistent with mild congestive heart failure and are unchanged 
compared to the prior examination. No focal consolidations or 
pneumothorax. A feeding tube courses 
beyond the limits of this examination. 

 
Brief Hospital Course:
Patient was admitted for excision left tongue lesion with STSG 
on ___.  Please see Dr. ___ note for 
details.  A dobhoff tube was inserted intraoperatively.  She 
tolerated the procedure well, was transferred to the PACU and 
then to floor in stable condition.  Pain was well controlled 
with IV morphine, then oxycodone and standing tylenol.  She was 
placed on subcutaneous heparin for DVT prophylaxis and 
clindamycin while her bolster was in place.  Continuous tube 
feeds were initiated on POD1.  A nutrition consult was obtained. 
 On POD1 she had asymptomatic sinus bradycardia and 
nonreproducible chest discomfort.  Given her past h/o of post op 
PE, we had a low threshold to workup the chest pain.  Cardiac 
enzymes were drawn, which initially showed an elevated troponin 
of 0.7 (her GFR was normal) with a normal CKMB.  An ECG showed 
no acute changes from baseline.  A CXR showed signs of mild CHF. 
 Medicine was consulted and recommended a CTA chest and TTE in 
addition to our initial workup.  The CTA chest was negative for 
PE and her TTE was normal except for mild hypertensive 
cardiomyopathy.  Her cardiac enzymes were subsequently negative. 
 It is unclear what caused the initial troponin bump.  On POD1 
she also developed a drug rash, which resolved on 
discontinuation of clindamycin.  She was switched to 
ancef/flagyl at that time.  On POD3 her platelet count dropped 
from 122 to 72, concerning for HIT.  However, a repeat CBC 
showed a platelet count of 123, suggesting that the initial 
alarming result was spurious.  HIT antibodies were not sent 
given her low 4T score (ie low likelihood of HIT).  On POD5 her 
bolster was taken down and she was started on clears.  The 
following day she was able to tolerate softs and her dobhoff was 
removed. She was discharged to home on POD7 in good condition.

병력 개요 :
 환자는 우측 편두통 후절개로 현재는 좌측편두통이다. ROS는 특이사항 없었다. 최근 체중 감소나 삼킴 곤란은 없다.

HTN
뇌하수체 기능 저하증

NC

 신체검사 :
전반적으로 정상. 유방은 양호하다. 복부는 비정상적이다. 심장은 정상이며 혈압은 높았다. 폐는 정상이고 흉부는 정상을 보였다. 두부와 경막 내 출혈은 없었고 뼈 골격은 정형이었다. 소화기는 정상이었으며 위식도는 정상의 반응을 보였으나 식도를 통한 배설물은 많아졌다. 간 및 담낭 조직은 정상의 상태를 보였으며 혈액학적 변화는 없었다. 혈청 단백질은 증가되었지만 전해질은 정량에 불과하였다. 혀근 강도가 약간 증대되어 있었다. 혐음은 정하고 호흡은 평활하였으며 발열이나 근육통은 없었다. 말초 순환이 정상으로 나타났다. 혁동은 정하여 혈류는 잘 흐르고 있었으며 혓골은 정렬되었다. 현음은 일부 관찰되기도 하였으나 이는 원인불명하였다.

echo ___:
좌심실은 길어졌으며 가쪽 심실은 미약하게 확장된 상태에서 정상적인 크기를 유지하는 것으로 보이는 왼쪽 심 실실실실 실실 실 실실 심실실 심 실 실 실 심실 실 심 실 심 장 실 실 현실감 있는 형태를 보여준다. 오른쪽 심장은 정상적이며 자유 벽 운동도 정상이다. 동맥판은 초점 계층이 존재하며 동맥 판은 다소 두꺼워졌으나 동맥 협착증은 없으며 동맥 역류는 관찰되지 않았다. 심계에는 다소 얇게 두껍게 되어 있으며 대동맥 밑면은 다소를 두껱게 두텁게 되었다. 대동 맥밸브 이빨은 다섯 개인데서부터 시작하여 다소 둥글게 두께가 되었으며 대동 막밸프는 관저하지 않다. 무리 손상은 관찰 되지 않았으며 심장 주위의 연조직은 다르게 생겼다.

환자가 입원하여 STSG 시행했다

      KLEBSIELLA OXYTOCA.    10,000-100,000 ORGANISMS/ML.. 
         Piperacillin/tazobactam sensitivity testing available 
on request. 

                              SENSITIVITIES: MIC expressed in 
MCG/ML
                      
_________________________________________________________
                             KLEBSIELLA OXYTOCA
                             |   
AMPICILLIN/SULBACTAM--     8 S
CEFAZOLIN-------------  =>64 R
CEFEPIME--------------   <=1 S
CEFTAZIDIME-----------   <=1 S
CEFTRIAXONE-----------   <=1 S
CIPROFLOXACIN---------<=0.25 S
GENTAMICIN------------   <=1 S
MEROPENEM-------------<=0.25 S
NITROFURANTOIN--------    ___ I
TOBRAMYCIN------------   <=1 S
TRIMETHOPRIM/SULFA----   <=1 S

 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ yo W with DM, ESRD on HD, CAD s/p multiple PCIs w/ most 
recent DES x2 to LCX, CHF w/EF ___, COPD on 2L home O2, PVD 
(R foot ulcer), OSA, Afib (not on coumadin ___ GIB) who presents 
w/ chills, malaise, fever and hypotension, found to have a UTI 
but also NSTEMI s/p cardiac cath and POBA of OM1.
.
1. Hypotension: Likely multifactorial, but mostly cardiogenic 
shock and UTI, possible pneumonia. In setting of fever, n/v and 
malaise w/ leukocytosis and relative bandemia concerning for 
sepsis. The patient grew Klebsiella from her urine culture, but 
had negative blood cultures during her admission. She did not 
have physiology of cardiogenic shock, however, her EKG had 
demand changes and she had positive enzymes. The patient's 
hypotension resolved with continued supportive care. She will 
continue Levofloxacin 250mg Qday x 6 days for a total 14 day 
course.
.
2. NSTEMI:  The patient was initially free from chest pain, 
though her EKG was concerning for ischemia. Her cardiac enzymes 
suggested that she was indeed experiencing ischemia. Due to 
previous GI bleeds, heparin could not be started on patient. As 
patient became more stable, she had an episode of chest pain, 
which resulted in cardiac catheterization that showed severe 
native three vessel coronary artery disease, patent LIMA to LAD 
and SVG to OM2, and a new total occlusion of SVG to RCA. The 
patient received successful POBA of OM1 with a 2.0 x 12 mm 
balloon and successful RFA AngioSeal. She was discharged on 
Plavix, Aspirin, Metoprolol, Statin, and Nitroglycerin PRN.
.
3. Acute Systolic Heart Failure Exacerbation: Pulmonary 
congestion worsened during early MICU stay, but was able to 
remove fluid via ultrafiltration. The patient initially was 
unable to undergo a full dialysis schedule due to hypotension, 
but she then underwent 3 consecutive successful sessions with 
improvement in her weight and subjective dyspnea. She was able 
to be discharged on her home O2 requirement. She was discharged 
on low dose metoprolol, aspirin, and statin. She does not 
tolerate an ACEI. 

4.. RLE ulcer with dx of chronic osteo:  Arterial by description 
from prior podiatry notes.  Unable to examine as pt. refusing at 
this time.  PVD not amendable to intervention per pt. 
cardiologist. Podiatry evaluated patient, felt infection not 
likely and left wound care recommendations.
.
5. ESRD, due to DM/HTN: Continued hemodialysis and 
sevelamer/nephrocaps.
.
6. Atrial fibrillation: The patient was not on anticoagulation 
secondary to history of GI bleeds. During ICU stay, her atrial 
fibrillation was difficult to control due to holding metoprolol 
due to hypotension. As she stabilized, the patient's home 
metoprolol was returned and she received amiodarone in loading 
dose and continued at 400mg Qday. By discharge, the patient had 
good rate control.
.
7. COPD: on home ___, currently at baseline. No wheezing on 
exam. Continued albuterol and ipratropium.
.
8. DM: Continued home NPH and SS.
.
9. Hypothyroidism: Continued home levothyroxine.
.
TRANSITIONAL ISSUES:
- The patient met with palliative care while she was here and 
there was some discussion about goals of care and possible 
hospice. The patient will continue to have this discussion with 
her family
- The patient can have uptitration of many of her cardiac meds 
as needed, depending on her SBP. The patient can go up on her 
midodrine to TID as needed as well.

-- aspirin 325 mg daily
-- docusate sodium 100 mg bid
-- insulin NPH & regular human (70-30) (32) units am daily
-- Flaxseed oil 1200mg daily
-- NTG prn

Activity Status: Ambulatory - requires assistance or aid (walker

Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted to the hospital because you had fever, chills, 
and fatigue at home. In the ___, you had low BP and signs of 
infection, so they stabilized you in the ICU before you were 
transfered to the cardiology service. While you were in the ICU, 
you had chest pain and positive cardiac enzymes and we found 
during a catheterization that you had a blockage of one of your 
coronary vessels, however, no intervention was undertaken. We 
continued to get fluid off with dialysis, which was initially 
limited due to hypotension. Your hypotension resolved, and we 
were able to get you on your heart failure medications and 
perform multiple dialysis to get the extra fluid off. We treated 
you for a UTI. Our podiatry colleagues evaluated your foot ulcer 
and would like to follow up with you as an outpatient. 

Weigh yourself every morning, call MD if weight goes up more 
than 3 lbs.

이름: ________________________
Unit Number: _______________________



입원일자: ____________________ 출소일자 : ____________________

생년월일: ____________________
성별: 여

서비스: 의학과


알레르기: 테트라사이클린 유사체 / 아테놀롤 / 테가더姆

진료하는 사람: _______

주민등록번호: ____________________

환자의 주장: 없음

질병의 원인과 경과는 다음과 같다:

혈액검사 결과: 혈압은 낮았고 체온도 높았다. 심전도 검사는 이상으로 나타났다. 심근경색증을 받았다. 당뇨병 환자가 있다. 심부전이 있었다. 부비동염이 있었으며, 발목 통증이 있었다.

심리 상태와 정신 상태는 정상이었다. 활동 수준은 중등도로 평가되었다. 식욕 증세가 없었다. 소화불량이 없었으나 위염이 있었다.



수술 및 침습적 절차: 좌측 심실 카테터 삽입, 중앙 라인 배치, 동맥선 배치 등이 있었다.


내과 병력: 복합적인 심장 질환이 있었다. 관상 동맥 재관류술 후에 심근 경색증이 발생했다. 간염이 있고, 고혈압이 있으며, 고지혈증이 있는 것으로 보였다. 또한, 만성 신부종이 있어 왔다. 심한 허혈로 인해 사망했었다. 심장 전문의에게서 치료를 받았다.

사회력: 어머니가 죽었고, 딸이 생겼다. 아버지가 폐암으로 사망했고, 누나가 뇌종양으로 사망했다. 손자는 대식으로 사망하고, 딸은 심각한 심장 문제를 가지고 있었다.

신체 검사결과: 일반적으로 비정상적인 상태였지만 쉽게 깨울 수 있었다. 두통이나 어지럼증은 없었다. 가슴 통증이나 호흡 곤란은 없었다.

임상 역사: 심장병력이 많아 심장전문에서 진단받았다. 다발성 골절이 있었고, 심장마비가 있었다. 심장이 약간 불안정하였다. 심박수가 빠르고, 혈중 칼슘 농도가 높은 것이 특징이다. 심계항진제 사용 시에는 심장 마비가 일어날 가능성이 있으므로 피해야 한다.

사회 역학: 가족 내 감염이 없다고 하였다. 가족 구성원의 대부분이 사망하였고, 현재는 혼자 살고 있다고 하였다.

시술 기록: 심낭염이 있을 수도 있다는 점에서 주의할 필요가 있다. 구강 세균감염이 일어나면 항생제 투여가 이루어졌다. 심미술이 진행되어야 하는 경우가 많았다. 그리고 심장 기능 장애가 있었다.

출산 이력: 심장이 좋지 않아서 심장 관련 질홀이 많이 있었다. 특히 심장 발작이 자주 발생하여 심장 전문가로부터 지속적인 관리를 받아왔다. 심장은 잘 작용하지 못하는데다가 심장 조직이 크게 변형된 것도 확인되었다. 심장을 보호하기 위해 여러 가지 방법을 시도하려고 했다. 그러나 심장 근육이 강하게 저항하며 심장 운동이 어려웠다. 심방세동이 계속해서 발생하여 많은 시간 동안 심장 분만이 필요한 상황이 되었다. 심호흡법을 통해 심장 회복력을 키우려 했지만 효과가 미약하였다. 따라서 더 큰 도움이 필요하다.

심장 전공의는 심장에 대한 이해를 바탕으로 심장 건강을 유지하려 노력한다. 심리가 안정되지 않은 상태에서 심장 과부하가 발생하면 심장 부상을 입을 위험이 있다. 따라래 심장 상태를 파악하고 적절히 관리해야 할 것이다. 심정도는 심장이 안정되도록 하고 심장 기능을 최대한 활용하도록 해야 한다. 심리 상태는 심각하지만 심장은 비교적 양호한 편이다. 하지만 심장 외에도 다른 부분에서도 심각했던 사례들이 있어서 더욱 주의가 요구된다. 심리는 심장뿐 아니라 전체 몸에 영향을 줄 수 있다. 그러므로 심장 뿐만 아니라 전체 몸을 고려하여 관리해야 한다.

Name:  ___              ___ No:   ___

Chief Complaint:

Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
Left lower extremity angiogram and Left External iliac artery 
angioplasty with stent

 
History of Present Illness:
This is a ___ gentleman with a very prolonged history of 
peripheral vascular disease.  He has undergone numerous 
bypasses, as well as bilateral iliac artery stents.  He 
presented with rest pain in bilateral lower extremities, left 
worse than right.  He was recently admitted to the hospital (___) with claudication. He underwent arterial studies that 
showed severlydecreased flow to his lower left extremity. Was 
scheduled to return as an outpatient for an angiogram and 
possible angioplasty to try to improve his  claudication. 
 
Past Medical History:

PVD, Dyslipidemia,COPD, GERD, Diverticulosis/diverticulitis, 
GIB,

(___), L calf fasciotomy (___), L fem-AT BP w NRGSV (06), removal

stenting
(___), L  fem-AT BPG (08), thrombolysis L fem-AT BPG (09),
multiple balloon  angioplasties BLE (09), R pop stent (10), b/l
LSV harvest and R  PFA-BKP with (11R)TMA (11), Multiple TMA
debridements (11), R  TAL(12),inguinal hernia repair,
appendectomy, TURP.  

 
Social History:
___

Mother died of a brain tumor at the age of ___. 
Father died of a myocardial infarction at the age of ___. 
 
Physical Exam:
Vitals: T97.9 HR 75 BP 117/58 RR 18 O2 Sat 93% RA
Gen: AAO, NAD laying comfortably in bed
___: regular rate
Pulm: breathing comfortably
Abd: +BS, soft, non-tender, non-distended. Midline laparotomy 
scar. 
Ext: warm,  Well healed R TMA amp-site.  Pulses: Fem/Pop 
palpable b/l, Right: DP, ___ dopperable, Left: ___ dopplerable

 
Brief Hospital Course:
Given above findings, the patient was taken to the operating 
room for selective catheterization of the left external iliac 
artery, abdominal aortogram and pelvic angiogram, Treatment of 
left external iliac artery stenosis with a Mustang balloon, 
stent placement.. There were no adverse events in the operating 
room; please see the operative note for details.  Pt was 
extubated, taken to the PACU until stable, then transferred to 
the ward for observation.

Neuro: The patient was alert and oriented throughout 
hospitalization; pain was well controlled

CV: The patient remained stable from a cardiovascular 
standpoint; vital signs were routinely monitored. The patient 
was restarted on baby aspirin and plavix postoperatively. 

Pulmonary: The patient remained stable from a pulmonary 
standpoint; vital signs were routinely monitored. 

GI/GU/FEN: The patient's diet was advanced sequentially to a 
Regular diet, which was well tolerated. Patient's intake and 
output were closely monitored

ID: The patient's fever curves were closely watched for signs of 
infection, of which there were none.

HEME: The patient's blood counts were closely watched for signs 
of bleeding, of which there were none.

Prophylaxis: The patient received subcutaneous heparin

At the time of discharge, the patient was doing well, afebrile 
and hemodynamically stable.  The patient was tolerating a diet, 
voiding without assistance, and pain was well controlled.  The 
patient received discharge teaching and follow-up instructions 
with understanding verbalized and agreement with the discharge 
plan
 
Medications on Admission:
The Preadmission Medication list is accurate and complete.

3. Clopidogrel 75 mg PO DAILY

Tablet Refills:*0
4. Acetaminophen 325-650 mg PO Q6H:PRN pain 
5. Docusate Sodium 100 mg PO BID 
6. Simvastatin 40 mg PO QPM 
RX *simvastatin 40 mg 1 tablet(s) by mouth at bedtime Disp #*30 
Tablet Refills:*3
7. Lorazepam 1 mg PO HS:PRN sleep 
8. MetFORMIN (Glucophage) 500 mg PO BID 
9. OxycoDONE (Immediate Release)  10 mg PO Q6H:PRN pain 
RX *oxycodone 10 mg 1 tablet(s) by mouth every ___ hours Disp 
#*30 Tablet Refills:*0
10. Senna 8.6 mg PO BID 

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Primary: Left leg claudication

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

It was a pleasure taking care of you at ___. You were 
hospitalized to receive an angiogram, angioplasty and stent to 
improve blood flow in your left leg. You are recovering well 
from your procedures. You have reported experiencing some pain 
and discomfort in your hands. Examination of your arms and hands 
were normal and these symptoms should continue to improve over 
the next several days. It is strongly recommended that you 
follow up with a visit in one month to ensure that these 
symptoms have resolved. You have been discharged in stable 
condition. Please follow the instructions below:

MEDICATION:
 Take Aspirin 81mg (enteric coated) once daily 
 If instructed, take Plavix (Clopidogrel) 75mg once daily
 Continue all other medications you were taking before surgery, 
unless otherwise directed
 You make take Tylenol or prescribed pain medications for any 
post procedure pain or discomfort
WHAT TO EXPECT:
It is normal to have slight swelling of the legs:
 Elevate your leg above the level of your heart with pillows 
every ___ hours throughout the day and night
 Avoid prolonged periods of standing or sitting without your 
legs elevated
 It is normal to feel tired and have a decreased appetite, your 
appetite will return with time 
 Drink plenty of fluids and eat small frequent meals
 It is important to eat nutritious food options (high fiber, 
lean meats, vegetables/fruits, low fat, low cholesterol) to 
maintain your strength and assist in wound healing
 To avoid constipation: eat a high fiber diet and use stool 
softener while taking pain medication
ACTIVITIES:
 When you go home, you may walk and use stairs
 You may shower (let the soapy water run over groin incision, 
rinse and pat dry)
 Your incision may be left uncovered, unless you have small 
amounts of drainage from the wound, then place a dry dressing or 
band aid over the area 
 No heavy lifting, pushing or pulling (greater than 5 lbs) for 
1 week (to allow groin puncture to heal)
 After 1 week, you may resume sexual activity
 After 1 week, gradually increase your activities and distance 
walked as you can tolerate
 No driving until you are no longer taking pain medications
CALL THE OFFICE FOR: ___
 Numbness, coldness or pain in lower extremities 
 Temperature greater than 101.5F for 24 hours
 New or increased drainage from incision or white, yellow or 
green drainage from incisions
 Bleeding from groin puncture site
SUDDEN, SEVERE BLEEDING OR SWELLING (Groin puncture site)
 Lie down, keep leg straight and have someone apply firm 
pressure to area for 10 minutes. If bleeding stops, call 
vascular office ___. If bleeding does not stop, call 
___ for transfer to closest Emergency Room. 

 
Followup Instructions:
___

병력 소견 :
이 환자는 오랜 기간 동안 말초혈관 질환을 앓고 있다. 그는 여러 번의 교정술과 양쪽 장동 맥 동맥 스텐트를 받았다. 최근에 Claudication으로 입원했다. 심장 검사를 통해 왼쪽 하퇴 골 혈액 흐름 감소를 보였다. 안경 검사와 가능한 경우 클라우디케이션 개선 위해 외래에서 복귀할 예정이다.

 가족 역학:
모친은 연령 ___에서 뇌종양으로 사망하였다. 부친은 나이 ___에서 심근 경색으로 사망하였습니다.

 신체검사 :
비타리스트 : 97.90HR 75BP 117 / 58RR 18O2Sat 93%
게노 : AAONAD lying comfortably inbed
___ : 정상 리율
펄몬 : Comfortably breathing
아브드 : BS+, soft, nontender, nondistended. Median line laparotomi scar.
엑스텐 : Warm, well-healed R TMAPsite. Pulses : Fem/Poppalpable bilaterally, Right DP,___ doppleable, left doppleble

 간단한 병원 과정 :
위의 발견으로 인해 환자가 선택된 카테터화로 이동하여 대장동맥 조영술, 요도조영술 및 유전자 조직을 시행하였다. 운영실에서는 아무런 악재가 없었다. 자세한 내용은 수술 기록서 참조한다. 환자는 확립 후 PACU까지 보내졌으며 이후 관찰실로 옮겨졌다.

신경 :
환자는 전반적으로 명확하고 일관되다.

심계 :
환인은 심각하지 않은 상태였으며 생명 징후는 매번 모니터링되었다. 환인이 포복제와 플라빡스를 재시작하였다.

 폐렴 :
환인은 폐렴 없이 잘 되었다.

내분비/유산균 :
환인의 식사는 순차적으로 일반식으로 진행되었으며 환인의 섭취량과 배설량은 면밀히 주시되었다.

면역 :
환자의 발열 곡선을 감염의 징표로서 면밀하게 살폈다.

HEME :
환인을 혈구 수가 감소했지만 출혈은 없었던 것으로 나타났다.

예방 접종 :
환인이 피하 헤프린을 받았다.

출 viện 진단 :
프라이머리 : 좌측 다리 클라ウ디케이션

출발 상황 :
멘탈 상태 : 분명하고 일치하다.
수준 의식 : 각성이고 상호 작용된다.
활동 상태 : 독립적인 ambulatory.

출국 지침 :
안녕하시며 환자를 치료하기 좋은 시간입니다. 당신은 경험하는 모든 것을 정확하게 보고해야 한다. 다음은 약물 목록 :

입원 시 약물 :
약물 목록은 정확하며 완전하다.
1.OxyCOdone (Instant Release)10mgPOQ6HPRNPain
2.AceTylenol 325–650mg

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for evaluation and treatment 
for severe tracheal bronchialmalacia.  Upon admission she had a 
CT TRACHEA prior to going to the operating for Rigid 
bronchoscopy, Flexible bronchoscopy. Therapeutic aspiration of 
secretions. Placement of Y-stent with the following 
measurements: The tracheal limb is 5.5 cm x 16 mm, right 
mainstem limb measured 1 cm x 13 mm and the left mainstem limb 
measured 2.5 cm x 13 mm. Endobronchial brushing of right middle 
lobe endobronchial lesion.  She tolerated the procedure was 
monitored in the PACU prior to transfer to the floor.  She had 
PFTs with a 6 minute walk.  Her tube feeds were restarted at her 
goal.  She continued to do well and was transferred back to 
rehab.
She will follow-up in 2 weeks for bronchoscopy and further 
management.

신체 검사 :

일반적으로는 NAD였다.
목 부위는 깨끗하고 HR은 RRR이었다.
호흡기는 양쪽 측면 크랙켄이었고 복장은 일반적인 것이었다.
외부에서는 따뜻했고 염증이 없었다.

간단한 병동 과정 :
Ms.__는 중증 경막염에 대해 진찰 및 치험을 받으려 했으며 입원 당시에는 CT TRACHEAL로 가서 rigidity bronchoscope, flexible bronchoscopys를 시행하였다. 세크리톤의 흡인치료를 시행하였으며 다음 측정값으로 Y-Stent를 설치하였다. 트렁클림은 5cm × 16mm, 오른쪽 주요 분지는 1cm ×13mm이고 왼쪽 주요분지는 2cm×13mm이다. Endo-bronchial brush를 사용하여 오른 쪽 중엎 결절을 얻었으며 시술 후 PACU에서 모니터링되었다. 6분 걷기를 수행했으며 관유액은 목표량으로 재시작되었으며 잘 나갔으나 재활실로 옮겨졌다. 두 주 후에 동종류 증식 및 추가 관리를 위해 내원할 것이다.

Name:  ___            ___ No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: NEUROSURGERY
 
Allergies: 
Penicillins
 
Attending: ___
 
Chief Complaint:
Back Pain
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
none

 
History of Present Illness:
___ female with history of ankylosing spondylitis and
chronic back pain presents to ___ ED after an abnormal
outpatient MRI T-Spine. Patient has had acutely worsening back
pain since early ___ - centered over her mid-to-low back, 
wraps
around to her right hip, associated with paraspinal muscular
pain/spasms. No inciting event, but states her pain did begin to
worsen after aggressive manipulation at the chiropractor, who 
she
has been seeing since ___. She has been seen by her PCP, who
recommended Ibuprofen 800mg TID, APAP 1000mg TID, Lidocaine
patches and Flexeril prn, all with minimal relief. She has also
been going to Physical Therapy for the past couple weeks. She 
was
recently seen in the Pain Clinic where she was told to replace
Ibuprofen with Meloxicam 7.5mg BID and started on Gabapentin for
her right hip pain thought to be neuropathic. While none of 
these
medications offer significant relief, she has still been able to
perform ADLs, although has been on "light duty" at work. She saw
her PCP last week who ordered a MRI T-Spine, which was done this
morning and read as a severe T12 compression fracture with 
severe
cord compression. She was sent to the ED and Neurosurgery Spine
called to evaluate. 
 
Past Medical History:
Ankylosing spondylitis, iritis, hypertension, exercise induced
asthma, chronic back pain, history TB exposure, history lipoma,
fibroadenoma, chronic shoulder pain

ON DISCHARGE:

[X]No ___

Sensation intact to light touch

 
Pertinent Results:
Please see OMR for pertinent lab and imaging data. 
 
Brief Hospital Course:
Mrs. ___ presented to ___ ED after complaints of chronic 
back pain acutely worsening. Patient was seeing a chiropractor 
for her back pain however underwent aggressive manipulation and 
continued to feel worsened pain for which she saw her PCP. 
Patient's PCP ordered and MRI of the spine revealing a severe 
T12 vertebral body fracture with extension into the pedicles and 
cord compression. Patient was immediately contacted and told to 
present to the ED. 

#T12 fracture
Patient was subsequently admitted to the neurosurgery service 
for further management. Patient underwent a CT of the T&L spine 
which revealed a severe T12 compression fracture with subsequent 
kyphosis and extension into the pedicle with retropulsion and 
cord compression. T12 left pedicle with lucency and concern for 
underlying lesion. Due to concern for underlying lytic lesion 
patient underwent ___ guided biopsy on ___. Patient tolerated 
the procedure well and was transferred back to the floor 
post-procedure. Patient was ordered for a TLSO brace to be 
delivered and fitted on ___. Patient also underwent MRI with 
and without contrast of the T&L spine which redemonstration 
"severe pathological compression deformity of the T12 
vertebral body with complete vertebral body height loss, 
kyphotic angulation 
and severe spinal canal stenosis with cord compression". 
Patient's pain was managed with PRN analgesics. Pathology 
results pending at time of discharge and neurosurgery office 
will contact patient once results are finalized to determine 
surgical plan. 

#Scleritis, possible anterior uveitis
Patient has h/o scleritis related to ankolosing spondylitis and 
is followed by ophthalmology. She had increased acute on chronic 
left eye pain while inpatient with injected sclera. 
Ophthalmology was consulted and recommended labs for TB, 
syphilis and lyme to rule out additional cause of scleritis - 
pending at discharge. She was continued on Pred Forte drops q1h 
around the clock and started on atropine bid. She was seen in 
ophthalmology clinic ___ for slit lamp evaluation and atropine 
drops were discontinued and prednisone drops QID. She will 
continue to follow up with them outpatient. 
 
Medications on Admission:
Albuterol inhaler prn, Mirena IUD, Amlodipine 10mg daily,
Cyclobenzaprine 5mg TID prn, Cyclopentolate 1% eye drops - 1 
drop
LEFT eye TID, Gabapentin 300mg TID, HCTZ 12.5mg daily, Lidocaine
5% topical patch, Prednisolone acetate 1% eye drops - 1 drop 
LEFT
eye q2hrs during the day, Meloxicam 7.5mg BID, was previously
taking Ibuprofen 800mg TID
 
Discharge Medications:
1.  Acetaminophen 1000 mg PO Q8H:PRN Pain - Mild/Fever  
2.  Docusate Sodium 100 mg PO BID  
3.  OxyCODONE (Immediate Release) 5 mg PO Q8H:PRN Pain - 
Moderate 
RX *oxycodone 5 mg 1 tablet(s) by mouth every eight (8) hours 
Disp #*20 Tablet Refills:*0 
4.  PrednisoLONE Acetate 1% Ophth. Susp. 1 DROP LEFT EYE QID  
5.  Albuterol Inhaler ___ PUFF IH Q6H:PRN wheezing  
6.  amLODIPine 10 mg PO DAILY  
7.  Cyclobenzaprine 5 mg PO TID:PRN muscle spasm  
8.  Gabapentin 300 mg PO TID  
9.  Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg PO DAILY  
10.  Lidocaine 5% Patch 1 PTCH TD QAM  

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Severe T12 vertebral body fracture with extension into the 
pedicles with subsequent cord compression

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Discharge Instructions
Spinal fracture 

 
You underwent ___ guided biopsy of your spinal bone around your 
fracture. Results are pending at time of discharge and you will 
be contacted when results are finalized and to discuss surgery.
 

Activity

·  You must wear your brace at all times when out of bed or if 
you are in bed and sitting up greater than 30 degrees. You 
should put the brace on while laying. You do not need to sleep 
with it on. 

·  You must wear your brace while showering. 

· We recommend that you avoid heavy lifting, running, climbing, 
or other strenuous exercise until your follow-up appointment.

· You make take leisurely walks and slowly increase your 
activity at your own pace. ___ try to do too much all at once.

· No driving while taking any narcotic or sedating medication. 

· No contact sports until cleared by your neurosurgeon. 

Medications

· ***Please do NOT take any blood thinning medication (Aspirin, 
Ibuprofen, Plavix, Coumadin) until cleared by the neurosurgeon. 

· Do not take any anti-inflammatory medications such as Motrin, 
Advil, Aspirin, and Ibuprofen etc until cleared by your 
neurosurgeon.

· You may use Acetaminophen (Tylenol) for minor discomfort if 
you are not otherwise restricted from taking this medication.

· It is important to increase fluid intake while taking pain 
medications. We also recommend a stool softener like Colace. 
Pain medications can cause constipation. 

 

When to Call Your Doctor at ___ for:

· Severe pain, swelling, redness or drainage from the incision 
site. 

· Fever greater than 101.5 degrees Fahrenheit

· New weakness or changes in sensation in your arms or legs.

 
Followup Instructions:
___

퇴직 상태 :
정신 상태 : 명확하고 체계적인 수준.
수준 의식 : 깨어 있고 상호 작용하는 활동 상태 : 보행 - 독립적.

퇴근 지침 :
스폰질 골절 

당신은 척추뼈 조영술을 통해 척수압축을 동반한 척주골절을 시행받았다. 결과는 소견이며 당신에게 최종결과 발표 후 연락할 것이다. 

활동

• 당신은 잠재 때 브레이스를 착용해야 한다. • 당신은 샤워할 때 브レイ스를 착 용해야 한다.

• 우리는 강렬한 들뜬 것을 피하도록 추천한다. • 너는 느긋게 걸어 다닌다. • 네가 너무 많은 일을 모두 할 필요 없다. • 운전하지 않는다. 

• 너는 운동을 하지 않으면 된다. • 아무것도 하지 말아야 한다.

Name:  ___                  Unit No:   ___

History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old right-handed female with history of
hypertension, diabetes, and hyperlipidemia who presents with an
episode of aphasia. Her daughter says that the patient seemed to
have some mild left sided weakness yesterday, and she was
dragging her left foot when she walked. However, she was talking
and otherwise acting like herself. This morning, Ms. ___ woke
up around 8am, and she usually is able to get out of bed and fix
herself breakfast. However, this morning, the patient just 
stayed
sitting in bed. Her daughter brought her a banana, and she was
eating it but just using her right hand. Her daughter says that
her left hand was just sitting on the bed. Ms. ___ also seemed
off, like she was going to fall over just sitting up. She was
complaining of some back pain, and they gave her some tramadol,
which she sometimes receives. They then got her into the
bathroom, and they helped bathe her. She then got dressed, and
then Ms. ___ sat down. This was around 1130am. She had been
speaking and acting mostly normally to this point, but then
stopped talking. Her daughter says that she was not speaking and
she did not seem to be responding to commands. They called EMS
who brought her to ___. On arrival to ___, she was thought 
to
have left sided weakness, left facial droop, and not speaking or
following commands.

Ms. ___ had had an episode ___ years ago where she was
admitted with altered mental status. At that time it was thought
that these symptoms were due to hypertensive encephalopathy. She
did improve but never quite returned to her baseline.

Unable to obtain a full review of systems because of language
difficulty.

IMAGING

___ ECHO
Severe aortic valve stenosis. Mild symmetric left ventricular 
hypertrophy with preserved regional and global biventricular 
systolic function. Increased PCWP. No definite structural 
cardiac source of embolism identified.

___ CXR
Compared to prior chest radiographs since ___, most 
recently ___. 
Feeding tube, with the wire stylet in place now ends below the 
diaphragm in the mid stomach. 
Lungs lung volume but clear.  No pulmonary edema.  Moderate 
cardiomegaly 
increased.  No appreciable pleural effusion or indication of 
pneumothorax. 

___ MR HEAD W/O CONTRAST
1. New acute infarct in the right anterior cerebral artery 
distribution 
involving the superior parasagittal frontal lobe, right 
cingulate gyrus and areas of right superior parietal lobe near 
the vertex, there is no evidence of acute hemorrhagic 
transformation. 
2. Stable encephalomalacia in bilateral anterior frontal lobes, 
right greater than left. 

___ CT HEAD W/O CONTRAST
1. New right anterior cerebral artery distribution infarction, 
appears 
subacute. 
2. Stable bifrontal encephalomalacia with a background of 
senescent volume 
loss. 

___ EEG
This is an abnormal video-EEG monitoring session because of a 
slower than normal background without clear wakefulness. No 
focal or 
epileptiform features were seen. 

___ ECG
Sinus rhythm. Prominent voltage in leads I and aVL for left 
ventricular 
hypertrophy. Compared to the previous tracing of ___ the 
anterolateral 
ischemic-appearing T wave abnormalities are less prominent. 
There is increased voltage recorded in leads I and aVL. Followup 
and clinical correlation are suggested.  

___ MR HEAD W/O CONTRAST
1. 2 punctate foci of low diffusion in the right frontal lobe, 
near the 
convexity, which may represent small acute infarcts versus 
artifact. 
2. Stable bifrontal encephalomalacia with a background of 
senescent volume 
loss. 

___ CTA HEAD W&W/O C & RECONS
1. Stable bifrontal encephalomalacia, likely sequelae of prior 
infarct.  No acute hemorrhage. 
2. Area of hypodensity in the medial left parietal lobe, which 
appears to have been present on the prior CT, but appears more 
prominent likely given 
differences in technique and secondary to sulcal prominence. 
3. Focal cut off of the mid right A2 segment of uncertain 
chronicity. 
4. Approximately 30% stenosis of the proximal right internal 
carotid artery by NASCET criteria. 
5. Extensive dental disease, recommend dental consultation. 

___ Video swallow 
SUMMARY:
Ms. ___ presents with a moderate oropharyngeal dysphagia,
characterized by oral phase deficits, reduced laryngeal valve
closure, and a swallow initiation delay. This resulted in
intermittent laryngeal penetration with nectar-thick liquids and
consistent laryngeal penetration with thin liquids, with thin
liquid material in the airway resulting in events of aspiration.
Recommend pt initiate diet of nectar-thick liquids and pureed
solids, pills crushed in applesauce. Standard aspiration
precautions apply. Pt will require assistance with meals during
her admission and upon return home. Prognosis for return to
baseline swallow function guarded at this time given 
neurological
changes and pending improvement to laryngeal/pharyngeal 
sensation
and airway protection. ___ and MD team re: tube feed
weaning and need for continued enteral nutrition. Provided pt
with handout on obtaining thickening packets when she returns
home. Recommend SLP f/u for continued dxtx on an outpatient 
basis
or with home visiting services. We will continue to follow to
assess diet tolerance. Please page for questions/concerns in the
interim.

RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Initiate PO diet of nectar-thick liquids and pureed solids
2. Pills: crushed in applesauce
3. TID oral care
4. Standard aspiration precautions, including:
- 1:1 assist
- Small sips/bites
5. Recommend SLP f/u upon discharge on an outpatient basis or
through home services for continued dxtx
6. We will continue to follow to assess diet tolerance. Please
page for questions/concerns in the interim.

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ yo ___-speaking F with history 
of hypertension, diabetes, HLD, old right pontine/left basal 
lacunes presents with an episode of confusion and reduced speech 
found to have an acute right ACA infarct. 

Patient was admitted for MRI which was initially negative. On 
___ the patient had an episode of fluctuating L-sided 
weakness/alertness. EEG was negative. Repeat MRI showed an acute 
infarct in the right anterior cerebral artery distribution 
involving the superior parasagittal frontal lobe, right 
cingulate gyrus and areas of right superior parietal lobe near 
the vertex, with no evidence of acute hemorrhagic 
transformation. She was seen and evaluated by Speech and Swallow 
in the context of high risk of aspiration after her stroke, as 
well as fluctuating mental status and abulia. She failed swallow 
evaluation and was made NPO to prevent aspiration. A dobhoff was 
placed and she was started on tubefeeds per nutrition 
recommendation. TTE was done for stroke work-up which was 
negative for intracardiac thrombus. Severe aortic stenosis was 
incidentally found. Cardiology was consulted who recommended 
outpatient management. She was seen and evaluated by ___ and OT, 
who recommended rehab for further care and recuperation after 
discharge. However, as she is undocumented and does not have 
insurance benefits for rehab, she will have to be discharged 
home and cared for by her family. She lives with her daughter 
and granddaughter. The most notable barrier to discharge was her 
NPO status and aspiration risk. Family meeting on ___ revealed 
that daughter would like more time to discuss PEG with her 
brother and out of country family. On ___, patient had a video 
swallow and patient was started on nectar thickened liquids and 
pureed diet, which she is tolerating well. Due to lack of 
insurance, patient discharged home with 24 hour care with 
extensive education from case management regarding resources, 
including Hoyer lift, nursing education regarding crushed 
medication administration, nutrition education regarding pureed 
and nectar thick diet and ___ education regarding transfers, 
turns in bed, etc.

Transitional issues:
-cardiology follow-up for severe aortic stenosis
-continue swallow follow-up, advance diet as tolerated

Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Right ACA stroke

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Confused - sometimes.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Out of Bed with assistance to chair or 
wheelchair.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,  
 
You were hospitalized due to symptoms of left sided weakness, 
decreased speech resulting from an ACUTE ISCHEMIC STROKE, a 
condition where a blood vessel providing oxygen and nutrients to 
the brain is blocked by a clot. The brain is the part of your 
body that controls and directs all the other parts of your body, 
so damage to the brain from being deprived of its blood supply 
can result in a variety of symptoms.  
 
Stroke can have many different causes, so we assessed you for 
medical conditions that might raise your risk of having stroke. 
In order to prevent future strokes, we plan to modify those risk 
factors. Your risk factors are:  
- Diabetes
- high cholesterol

We are changing your medications as follows:  
- please start taking aspirin and Plavix (clopidogrel) every day
- started atorvastatin 80mg daily
- started amantadine daily to increase alertness after your 
stroke

Please take your other medications as prescribed.  
 
Please followup with Neurology and your primary care physician.  

 
If you experience any of the symptoms below, please seek 
emergency medical attention by calling Emergency Medical 
Services (dialing 911). In particular, since stroke can recur, 
please pay attention to the sudden onset and persistence of 
these symptoms:  
- sudden partial or complete loss of vision  
- sudden loss of the ability to speak words from your mouth  
- sudden loss of the ability to understand others speaking to 
you  
- sudden weakness of one side of the body  
- sudden drooping of one side of the face  
- sudden loss of sensation of one side of the body  
 
Sincerely,
Your ___ Neurology Team
 
Followup Instructions:
___

병력내역 :
Ms. ____은 년齡 여성으로 고혈압, 당뇨, 고지혈증을 앓고 있는 환자로 아파시아를 호소하였다. 딸로부터 어제 약간의 경미한 좌측 부위 약함과 걸음걸이를 하는 모습이 보였으나 대개는 정상적인 행동이었다. 아침에 자각하여 일반적으로 침대에서 일어날 수 있었던 반면 오늘은 침대 위에 앉아 있었다. 딸에게서 바나나를 가져다준 후 오른손만 사용하고 왼손은 침대로 누워있다. 딸로서도 왠지 무너질 것 같았다. 또한 배가 아프다고 하였다. 이들은 그녀에게 트라마돌을 주었다. 그들이 그녀를 욕실로 데려갔으며 그녀는 목욕을 받았고 옷을 입었으며 이것은 오전 11시 30분쯤 되었다. 이후에는 더 이상 말하지 않았다. 딸이 그녀의 손발이 움직이지 않는 것을 보고 소방관을 불렀다. 병원에서는 좌측 측두부약함 및 좌측 안면하강락을 보였다. 최근에 두 차례 간헐적 좌측 약함을 보인 적이 있다. 딸과의 통신이 어려웠다. 현재 상태는 알 수 없다. 가족력이 있다. 아버지가 당뇌이다. 알려진 신경 질환이 없다.

체온 : 37.0 ℃ 혈중당량 : 10.4 mmol/L 혈청단백질 : 76 g/L 혁동율 : 95%

심장계 : 심박수 : 78/min 혈압 : 140/90 mmHg

복통 : 없음

정신상태 : 혼란스러움, 일부 언어 장애, 인식 감퇴, 운동 능력 저하, 발작, 동공 확장, 뚜렷한 증상 없는 양쪽 눈물 유출, 얼굴 근육 균형 유지, 음향 지속 시간 3초 미만, 구취 감소, 식욕 증가, 복통, 우울감, 과민반응, 기침, 체액 분비, 가슴팍, 흉곽 압박, 허리 통증, 하지 통증 등이 나타났다.

구강검사 결과 : 구강 내 검사를 시행하였는데 치석이나 출혈 등의 이상 소견은 없었다.

임상사진 촬영결과 : 심근염, 폐렴, 골절, 관절염 등이 확인되지 않았다.

영상 스와올 : 중등도의 삼킴곤란, 음식 섭취 시 다소 힘들어하는 경우가 있어 포도당 농축액과 순유산균을 권했다. 재택치료를 추천한다. 가정에서의 영양 관리는 필요하다. 영상 스와 올은 완전히 평가할 수 없었기에 추가적인 검사가 필요하다.

재판 의뢰 이유 : 급성 뇌졸중으로 인해 언어 장벽이 생겼다. 재판 의사는 진행되었다.

추가 정보 : 없음
