Brief Hospital Course:
#Dyspnea - Differential diagnosis included PNA, PE, MI and CHF 
(likely systolic), with highest suspicion for volume overload in 
setting of CHF given exam, history, imaging, and elevated BNP. 
He does have a significant DVT/PE history, but because he has an 
IVC filter and INR was supra-therapeutic when his symptoms 
began, suspicion for PE was low. Admission Chest CT showed 
bilateral effusions and bilateral LL opacities, which may 
represent infection, edema, or atelectasis. He was unable to 
complete the IV contrast portion of the CT scan and thus PE 
could not fully be ruled out. He was started on heparin drip and 
kept on this overnight until INR >2.0. Once INR became 
therapeutic, heparin gtt was d/c'd and patient was transitioned 
to home coumadin dose PO. Admission labs showed elevated CKMB 
and mildly elevated troponin. He was given NTG, morphine, 
metoprolol x1, though suspicion for ACS was low. He was 
maintained on ASA 325mg, simvastatin 20mg, and home ___. Cardiac 
enzymes were cycled and trended down. EKG was not consistent 
with acute MI. Given than he had been afebrile and with minimal 
cough, he did not receive antibiotics. Urine legionella Ag was 
negative. Attempted to obtain sputum cultures but patient could 
not generate sputum to send. The patient was given lasix 20mg IV 
x2 and met goal UOP of ___ negative, with improvement in 
symptomatic dyspnea and oxygen requirement. Patient was also 
given albuterol and ipratropium nebs prn. Echo was ordered but 
not completed before discharge to floor.  On floor cont'd 
diuresis with goal of ___ L/day.  TTE showed global 
dysfunction, dilated CM.  Cardiology following t/o 
hospitalization. W/u for global CM performed with no 
idenitifiable cause obtained.  Underwent cardiac cath which 
showed minimal disease.  Cont'd on ___, held CCB, startedon 
coreg, lasix and aldactone and cont'd on as outpt.  Will 
follow-up with Dr. ___ Dr. ___ the week for CM. 
   
.
#.NIDDM: Home hypoglycemic agents were held and patient was 
maintained on ISS.  Restarted on home meds on d/c. 
.
#.HTN: Patient given home ___ but holding home CCB. Started on 
Coreg with success in HTN control.
.
#.Gout: Asymptomatic. Allopurinol continued.
.
# PE PPx: On coumadin on admission.  INR subtherapeutic on 
arrival.  Held for procedure on heparin gtt, restarted on 
coumadin afterwards bridging with heparin gtt until therapuetic 
INR acheieved.

Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Shortness of breath, secondary to systolic Congestive Heart 
Failure
 
Discharge Condition:
Improved, INR therapeutic, hemodynamically stable

 
Discharge Instructions:
You were evaluated in the hospital for your shortness of breath 
and recent changes in your heart function. You were found to 
have a dilated heart that has reduced efficiency in its ability 
to pump blood as well as it did several months ago.  It remains 
unclear why this occurred, but cardiology was able to perform a 
cardiac catheterization that showed you only a small amount of 
disease in the arteries that supply blood to your heart.

Because we stopped your coumadin for this procedure, we had to 
keep you in the hospital to restart your coumadin and wait for 
the blood thinning effects of the coumadin to work before your 
discharge.
Please continue your home medications with the following 
changes:
Start: Coreg, Albuterol, Ipratropium, Valsartan, Lasix, 
Aldactone
Stop: Amlodopine.

Please call your doctor or return to the ER with:
* Worsening of your shortness of breath
* Chest pain or pressure
* Fevers, chills, nausea or vomiting
* With any new concerns

Name:  ___                     Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: NEUROLOGY

___ Sr
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
Episodes concerning for Seizure
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
Long-term Video EEG monitoring

 
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ woman
with a history of two prior generalized convulsions who presents
now with nearly daily episodes of abnormal sensation in her
abdomen.  She had her first seizures in ___, which was 
a
generalized convulsion following sleep deprivation on a long
flight.  That seizure lasted three to four minutes.  MRI and EEG
were both normal at that time.  She had a second event in ___,
which was unwitnessed but was heard by her husband as having 
some
loud bumps in the bathroom and she was quizzed when he found her
shortly thereafter.  She was initially started at that time on
Lamictal but had recently had that discontinued.  More recently,
for the last couple of weeks, she has had episodes that she says
occur almost every night that are characterized by a sense of
nausea or annoying in her stomach followed by a rising 
sensations
through her abdomen and chest followed by a sense of anxiety or
nervousness.  She has urinary incontinence with it every time. 
This sense of anxiety gradually progresses over 10 to 15 
minutes,
at which time it peaks and begins to subside over the hour.

In general, there are no convulsive movements with these
episodes, although apparently two nights ago, she did have some
whole body shaking without loss of consciousness.  She has
otherwise felt well recently with no fevers or chills, diarrhea,
constipation, nausea, vomiting, or chest pain.  She does not 
have
any diplopia, dysarthria, dysphagia, focal numbness, focal
weakness, or difficulty with bowel or bladder other than the
episodes of urinary incontinence.

 
Past Medical History:

- Asthma
- Nephrolithiasis

___

EEG (___):
IMPRESSION: This telemetry captured no pushbutton activations. 
Routine
sampling showed a 12 Hz posterior dominant rhythm with 
occasional
periods of bifrontal slowing and single episode of two sharp 
waves of
phase inversion at C4.
EEG (___):
IMPRESSION: This telemetry captured three pushbutton activations 
with
no epileptiform features associated. Routine sampling showed an 
11 Hz
well-organized posterior dominant rhythm during wakefulness. 
There were
no focal areas of prominent slowing and there were no 
epileptiform
features on routine sampling.
EEG (___):
IMPRESSION: This telemetry captured seven pushbutton activations 
over
four episodes. The second episode, which occurred at 19:57:44, 
showed
six to eight seconds of diffuse spike and slow wave discharges.
Clinically, the seizure was characterized by clearing the 
throat,
smiling slightly, and leaning head forward. There were no 
convulsions
or eye changes with this. A second seizure was detected by the 
seizure
detection program at 11:35:33 and consisted of 22 seconds of 
generalized
spike and slow wave discharges with a right fronto-temporal
predominance. Clinically, this event was similar to the other 
described
seizure with clearing of the throat, peering slightly downwards 
and
smiling. Routine sampling showed an 11 Hz somewhat poorly 
organized
background with occasional spikes at F4.
EEG (___):
IMPRESSION: This telemetry captured no pushbutton activations. 
Routine
sampling showed an 11.5 Hz background. Spike detection programs 
showed
occasional right fronto-central spikes or polyspikes. There were 
no
seizures captured on this recording.
EEG (___):
IMPRESSION: There were a number of pushbutton events but they 
were all
for minor symptoms and were not associated with a clear change 
on EEG.
Routine and automated sampled EEG appeared to be within normal 
limits.
EEG (___):
IMPRESSION: This telemetry captured four pushbutton activations 
which
occurred for unclear circumstances. There were no electrographic
changes associated with these and no epileptiform features. 
Routine
sampling shows an 11.5 Hz posterior dominant rhythm with no 
areas of
prominent focal slowing and no epileptiform features.
ICTAL SPECT SCAN (___):
Small focus of increased tracer uptake in the superior deep 
right temporal lobe.
CT HEAD (___):
No intracranial hemorrhage or fracture.
CHEST X-RAY (___):
No acute cardiopulmonary process.
 

 
Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a lovely ___ year-old right-handed woman with a past 
medical history including two generalized convulsions and recent 
episodes of nausea associated with a rising sensation in the 
abdomen and chest, nervousness, and urinary incontinence, who 
presented ___ for long-term monitoring and evaluation of 
these events.  The patient was admitted to the Epilepsy Service 
and Video EEG recording was performed over six days.

Investigative studies showed no evidence of contributory toxic, 
metabolic, or infectious processes.

At the time of admission, clonazepam was discontinued with the 
goal of precipitating and characterizing a typical episode.  
While telemetry did show occasional bifrontal slowing and two 
isolated sharp waves of phase reversal, there were no 
electrographic seizures in the first three days.  On ___, the 
patient experienced two brief (<30 seconds) clinical events 
consisting of a head tilt forward with smiling and throat 
clearing.  The EEG correlate demonstrated generalized spike and 
slow wave discharges with a right fronto-temporal predominance.  
There were no subsequent electrographic seizures in the course 
of the visit.

Sleep deprivation was encouraged in advance of an ictal SPECT 
scan on ___.  The study demonstrated increased tracer uptake in 
the superior deep right temporal lobe.  Collectively, the data 
were thought to support seizure as an explanation for the 
patient's presenting symptoms.  Accordingly, treatment with 
Brand Name ___ was initiated.  Clonazepam was 
re-started with a plan to taper the medication with concomitant 
increases in Lamictal. 

As the patient fell shortly before discharge, a non-contrast 
head CT was performed to ensure no injury.  There was no 
evidence of hemorrhage or other concerning changes.  At the time 
of discharge the patient was asymptomatic.

 
 
Medications on Admission:
ALBUTEROL SULFATE [PROAIR HFA] - 90 mcg HFA Aerosol
Inhaler - 2 spray inhalation q4hr as needed for asthma; Take 2
inhalations 10 min before exertion and other precipitating
factors
CLONAZEPAM - 0.5 mg Tablet - one-half Tablet(s) by mouth qam and
1 tab ___ qhs with additional 0.25mg qd prn as needed for anxiety
FLUOXETINE -  10 mg Tablet - 2 Tablet(s) by mouth daily
FOLIC ACID -  (Not Taking as Prescribed) - 1 mg Tablet - 4 
Tablet(s) by mouth daily
OXYBUTYNIN CHLORIDE - 10 mg Tab,Sust Rel Osmotic Push 24hr - 1 
Tab(s) by mouth daily as
needed for urinary incontinence
PNV COMB #2-IRON-FA-OMEGA 3 [DUET DHA PRENATAL] - 29 mg-1 mg-430 
mg Combo Pack - 1 Combo(s) by mouth daily
 
Discharge Medications:
Clonazepam 1 mg Tablet Sig: ___ Tablets ___ at bedtime for 2 
months: After achieving the target lamictal dose of 100 mg ___ 
twice daily for three days, please decrease the clonazepam to 
0.5 mg ___ at bedtime for three days before completely 
discontinuing the medication.
Disp:*60 Tablet(s)* Refills:*1*
Clonazepam 0.5 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet ___ at bedtime for 3 
days: After finishing the clonazepam 1 mg tablets, please take 
clonazepam 0.5 mg ___ at bedtime for three nights before 
completely discontinuing the medication. .
Disp:*3 Tablet(s)* Refills:*0*
Fluoxetine 10 mg Capsule Sig: Two (2) Capsule ___ DAILY (Daily).  

Lamotrigine 25 mg Tablet Sig: As Directed Tablet ___ DAILY 
(Daily): Please increase the lamictal by 25 mg every seven days 
until reaching a target dose of 100 mg ___ bid.
Disp:*240 Tablet(s)* Refills:*2*

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Temporal Lobe Epilepsy

 
Discharge Condition:
Stable.  Neurologic examination was normal on the day of 
discharge.

 
Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted to ___ for long-term telemetry monitoring to 
better characterize your seizures and optimize your 
anti-epileptic drug regimen.  While the specific symptom complex 
(GI distress, sweating, and urinary urgency+/- incontinence) 
that prompted your visit did not correspond with epileptiform 
discharges on video EEG monitoring, it is thought represent 
seizure activity.  Of note, telemetry did show seizure activity 
that corresponded with clinical episodes in which you lifted 
your right arm, coughed, and appeared distracted for about ten 
seconds.  The ictal spect scan was also helpful in identifying 
the right temproal lobe as a potential seizure focus.
* Please take lamictal 25 mg ___ daily for seven days.
* On ___, start taking lamictal 25 mg ___ twice daily for 
seven days.
* On ___ start taking lamictal 25 mg ___ morning and 50 
mg ___ every evening for seven days.
* On ___ start taking lamictal 50 mg by mouth twice daily 
for seven days.
* On ___ start taking lamictal 50 mg ___ every morning and 75 
mg ___ every evening for seven days.
* On ___, start taking lamictal 75 mg ___ twice daily for 
seven days.
* On ___, start taking lamictal 75 mg ___ every morning and 
100 mg ___ every evening for seven days.
* On ___ start lamictal 100 mg ___ twice daily.
* After you have taken lamictal 100 mg twice daily for a total 
of three days, it will be important to have a lamictal level 
measured, and the results faxed to Dr. ___ at 
___.
* Following three days on the target dose of lamictal 100 mg ___ 
twice daily (___), please adjust the clonazepam dose to 1 mg 
___ every night for three nights.
* Then decrease the clonazepam to 0.5 mg ___ every night for 
three nights before completely discontinuing the clonazepam.

* Please take all of the medications as prescribed.

* Please seek medical attention if you develop increasing 
seizure frequency or duration, changing seizure type, trouble 
speaking, difficulty walking, lightheadedness, chest discomfort, 
shortness of breath, loss of bowel or bladder function, or any 
other symptoms you find concerning.

ED 초기 체온은 98·1℃이고 혈압은 92·154/880이었으며 심박동수는 18이었다. 실험실 결과는 다음과 같다. 발열, 복통


수술 또는 침습적 시술 : 없음

병력 소견 :
___세 남자로 원래 경피성 담관염으로 진단받아 현재는 병원을 입원하지 않고 오늘은 위장 전문의로부터 입원하여 감염성 담괴의 가능성을 우려하고 있다. 최근 세 주 동안 피곤함을 느끼고 있고 두 달간 간질 발열과 함께 밤에 땀 흘리고 찬물을 마신다. 또한 지난 한 달 동안 간경화증이 진행되고 있으며, 간경변증도 관찰된다. 환자는 이들 증상들이 약물 치료 후 호전되었다고 한다. 또한 식후 간헐적인 오른쪽 가슴 통증이 있었으나 시간이 지남에 따라 사라졌다. 또한 큰 음식이나 누워서 있는 경우만 발생한다. 같은 기간 동안 배가 늘어나는 것을 느낄 수 있었다. 그는 N/V와 D를 거부하며, CP나 SOB도 없으며 건조한 기침을 앓았다. 외래에서 그의 간내 과민 반응이 있어 출혈이 없는 상태이다. 혈액 검사는 양성이었다. 혁학적으로는 정상이며, 혈청검사가 양성이므로 추가적인 조치 필요하다. 혜맥동맥류는 없었다. 혏흡기계는 정상의 상태였다. 혉압은 120/70mmHg였으며, 맥박은 72회/min이었으며, 체온은 37°C였다. 심근경색증은 없었으며, 폐렴은 없었다. 대뇌 신경학적 변화는 없었다.

임상 소견:
환자의 일반적인 상태는 안정되어 있었으며, 환자가 자신의 몸이 더 무거운 것 같다고 하였다. 환자의 심리 상태는 좋은 편이고, 정신 상태는 정상을 유지하였다. 환자에게는 2리터의 생체막 용액과 600밀리그램의 IBUPROFEN 그리고 1그램의 CEFTIAOXONE이 투여되었다. 환자를 대상으로 한 CXR은 아무런 이상 없이 나타났다. 혤법은 3점 6분위로 개선된 상태였다.

실시 적 임상 소결:
환자는 98°F까지 발열을 보였으며 109번의 맥박을 가지고 있었다. 환인은 140mmHgis의 혈압을 가지고 있었으며 16번의 호흡수를 가지고 있었다.

환자의 실시간 정보:
환자에게서는 2 리터의 NS와 600 밀리그램 IBUPARFIN 그리고 1000 밀리그람의 CEFTAIXON이 투약되었으며 환자는 96°F의 체온을 가지고 existed. 환인의 혈당은 103밀리그람이었다. 환인들은 2개월 전에 처음으로 발열이 시작되며 이후에는 매일 아침 08:00시에 500밀리그 램의 URSAODIL과 400밀리그 라ム의 NA DOLOL을 투여 받았으며, 그 다음날에는 200밀리그 럼의 AMOXICILLIN CLAVULANATE를 투여받았다. 환인이 95°F의 발열로 인해 응급실로 옮겨졌으며 환자의 혈중 알부민은 35밀리그럼이었다. 결국 환자는 항생제를 투약하였으며 환자들의 혈 중 알부 민은 33밀리그्रम으로 증가했다. 환자가 85°F의 높은 발열에 걸렸으며 환자가 아프지 않았다. 환인을 대상으로 하는 혈 청 검사는 2배로 이루어진 것이었다. 환자인 98년생의 환자는 발열, 상복부 통증을 동반한 것으로 보고되었다. 

환자의 주요 질환:
환자가 98년도에 발열 및 상복 부 통증으로 인해 입원하였다. 

추가 사항:
환인 98년에 발열 109개의 맥박과 140 mmHg의 혁마동맥강과 16회의 호흠을 가진 환자가 있었다. 

구직 정보:
우리는 환자의 모든 정보를 정확하게 기록하였다.

폐 - CTPA bilateral, no rh/wheezing, good 공기 흐름, resp labored, 접근 기법 사용 없음

복부 - N ABS, 부드럽고 ND, 무 질량 또는 HSM이 있었지만 감소된 것은 아니었다.

엽부 - W WP, no cc/e, radials, DP 2 + 외피 펄스 (팔꿈치)

피부 - 상완부에 많은 흉터가 있었다.

신경 - 깨우쳤으며 A & O x3, 모든 CN들 2 ~ XII 큰 것으로 유지된다.

Discharge Instructions:
Instructions: Dear Ms. ___, 

It was a pleasure to be a part of your care team at ___ 
___.

====================================
Why did you come to the hospital? 
====================================

-You had persistent vomiting and diarrhea.

====================================
What happened at the hospital? 
====================================

-You were given IV fluids because the vomiting and diarrhea had 
dehydrated you. 
-You underwent evaluation by the gastroenterology specialty 
team. You had a flexible sigmoidoscopy and the lining of the gut 
looked normal. This, combined with the fact that your diarrhea 
is non-inflammatory appearing (no blood in the stool), makes a 
flare of your ulcerative colitis highly unlikely to be the cause 
of your acute symptoms. Please note, the gastroenterologist took 
a biopsy of the colon lining for routine check in our lab. Once 
the results are available, the gastroenterologist will notify 
you of the result.
-Most likely your symptoms are due to a viral gastroenteritis. 
The treatment is supportive care, to drink plenty of fluids and 
eat enough to replace any losses by diarrhea, and get plenty of 
rest. It may still take several more days for all the symptoms 
to resolve entirely. It is safe for you to take Loperamide to 
slow down the diarrhea.
-We still checked your stool sample for specific bacterial 
causes that would require antibiotic treatment (such as 
shigella, salmonella, campylobacter, specific E coli strains, 
etc). It can take a couple more days to result in the lab. If 
the results are abnormal we will call you. 

It was a pleasure taking care of you during your stay! 

Sincerely, 

Your ___ team

이름 : _______________________

입원일자 : ____________________
출산일자: ____________________

알레르기 및 이상 반응 :

구토, 설사


수술이나 침습적 절차 :
가변 대장경 검사.



병력 소견 :
여성이 구토와 설사를 호소하고 있다. 환자는 herself에 대해 급성 발작을 경험했다고 한다. 그녀는 약 12회 정도로 비록 혈액과 담즙 없이도 구토를 했다. 또한 그녀가 경험한 20회의 설사는 비록 체온이 없지만 유체 상태였다. 그녀의 복부는 경련으로 인해 가려움증이 있었으나 추가적인 복통은 없었다. 그녀는 딸의 병력이 있으며 그 딸도 설사가 있었다. 최근에 숨쉬기가 어려웠던 적이 있어 프레드니손을 15일에 사용했으며 이틀 전 끝냈다.

ED에서 초기 심박동수는 98·3이었다. 진찰에서는 건조한 점막, 가볍게 하는 상복부 아픔, 팽창 없음, 회복 또는 방어없음이 관찰되었다. 실험실에서는 CRP 47.8이었으며, 생화학 시험은 음성이었다. 환자가 저혈압이었기에 2리터의 액체를 투여하여 100까지 개선되었으며 온다네트론 4mg × 1과 아세틸살리실산염 100mg ×1을 받았다. KUB에서는 장폐색이나 공기를 발견하지 못하였다. 환인은 PO를 견디지 못하였으며 C.diff PCR를 보냈다. 현재 환자는 더 이상 구토나 설사를 느끼지 않았다. 오늘 하루 세 번 물린다. 환아는 가벼운 통각 증상을 보고한다. 흉통이나 기침은 없다.

계속 시스템 :
ROS는 다른 것만 제외되어 있다.

 과거 병력 :
- 알버두스 PRN 천식
- 결핵 치료 중인 궤양성대장궤 양
- 간염

97.60/109/73
PO Sitting 16/69/97RA
일반적으로 각종 질환이 없는 상태이다.
안면에는 눈물이 나며 두개골은 평평하다.
귀와 코는 붓거나 손상되지 않은 상태이며 입 안에는 아무런 병변도 없다.
심장은 정상이고 폐는 청정하며 호흡은 편안하다.
배는 부드럽고 확장되지 않았으며 배설음이 들렸다.
허파는 평범하며 움직이는 것이 가능하다.
뇌는 평탄하며 정신 상태는 명확하다.

퇴원 후 진행 상황 :
환자는 계속해서 구토 혹은 설사를 하지 않고 있고 복부통은 없었으며 고형 식단과 수분 섭취량을 잘 감당하고 있다.

Brief Hospital Course:
Pt was taken to the OR and underwent robot-assisted laparoscopic 
myomectomy. Intraoperative finding included 8cm left fundal 
fibroid and 2-3cm right posterior pedunculated fibroid. Pt's 
intraoperative IV fluid was 1700cc, urine output was 60 cc, and 
estimated blood loss was 20 cc. No complication was associated 
with the surgery. Pt was recovering well in the PACU after 
surgery, however she did have urinary retention and nausea. 
Foley was placed and had 750 cc of urine output. She was 
admitted into the hospital for observation overnight with plan 
for voiding trial AM of POD#1.  On post operative day 1, pt had 
a trial of void, and was successful with ultrasound scan showing 
less than 50 cc residual urine. Given pt's improved condition, 
she was discharged home on post operative day #1.

(Daily).

(Daily).

Home

* You may shower and allow soapy water to run over incision; no 
scrubbing of incision.  No bath tubs for 6 weeks.

한국어:

이름: ____________________          병동번호: ____________________

입원일자: ______________________    퇴원일자는: _____________________

생년월일: __________________     성별: 여성

진료과목: 산부인과

알레르기: 아모시신/SULFA/EFFEXOR/LATEX

담당의: _______

주소증상: 유방종양

수술내역: 로봇 보조 복강경 근육 절제술

병력: 현재 임신하지 않고 미래 생식능력을 유지하고 싶다. 최근에 소변을 본 적은 없고 요로 감염이나 혈뇨는 없다. 최근 피검에서 정상적인 내분비선 측정치가 나타났다. 양쪽 난관도 정상이다.

 과거 이력: OB 역사: G5-P0-05-0.
- 그때마다 임신 중절 수술을 받았다.
- 몇 년 전에는 자발적 불임이 있었다.

성형사: 월경 시기에만 발생하는 심한 출혈 및 통풍 증상을 호소한다. 현재는 성관계를 하지 않는다. 배뇌와 대변 운동 시 고통을 호소하며, 두 달 전에 종양 검사를 받았으며 보고된 결과 정상이었다. 아직 영장 검사가 없었다. 현재 성생활은 하고 있지 않지만 오히려 반대 성별을 선호하며 콘돔 사용을 한다. 다른 질환은 없다.

질병: 1번 항문으로 인해 천명증후군이 있다. 2번 우울증과 불안이 있고, 3번 외상 후 스트레스 장애(구두, 성, 신체 학대 및 무단)를 가지고 있으며 안전하다. 4번 ADHD. 5번 허리통증 잘 치료되었다. 6번 환경 알러지증. 7번 자궁근 조직화. 8번 비침습적 자궁 근 조직.

수술 이력:
1번 더 많은 시간 전에 D & C 2회, 탭 2 회.
2번 동결 치료.

약물:
1 번 플루옥시틴 (우울증, 불안, 척추 통증).
2번 스타터라 (ADHD).
3번 싱귤라이어, 펄미코트 및 알부테롤 (천식).

알레ル기:
1개 SULFA 약물은 안피락시아스와 발진을 일으킨다.
2개 암окси실린은 안필락시아스를 일으켰다.
3개 라텍스는 불확실하여 환자가 불확실했다. 환자는 발진이 있다.

사회력:
___

가족력:
가족력이 있는 가족력: 당뇰병, 고혈압. 가슴암, 난소암 등 모든 종류의 암은 없다. 

신체검사:
신체 검사: 평온한 백인이었다. 혈압 130 / 80, 체중 152 파운드, 키 5 피트 3 인치. HEENT: 정상적이고 손상되지 않은 안면색. 목: 연골 부위, 전체 범위의 움직임, 갑상샘 결절 또는 결절 없음. 림프: 팔찌 없는 경부 림프로세스. 등: CVA 압박감이 없다. 폐: 청산 여유 공간, 좋은 흡기 노력. 심장: 규칙적인 속도 및 리듬, 음향음, 루브, 갈롭. 복부: +배설음, 부드럽고 편안함, 부풀림이 없으며, R / G 없음. 사지: 클럽팅, 푸른 색, 엽록체 없음. 골반: 외부 여자 기관지 정상. 스페쿨럼 검사는 정상이며, 이상적인 침출액이 없다.

관련 결과:
___ PM URINE MUCUS-RARE * 09 PM URINA HYALENE-1 *
09 PM URI REACTION-RBC-12 * WBC-I BACTERIA-NON YEAST NON EP <1 RENEAL EP < I
09 PM Urine Blood SM Nitrite NEG Protein NEG Glucose NEG Ketone TR Bilirubin NEG Urobilin NEG pH 6.5 LEUK NEG
09 pm urina color straw appear Clear Sp ___

간략한 입원 과정:
PT는 OR로 데리고 갔다. 내시경 찾는 포함된 8 cm 좌측 주막 섬유아밀론 및 오른쪽 후방 단순 섬유질 섬유. PT의 내시계 IV

CXR:
As best can be determined, compared to the prior torso CT, again 

relatively stable is the extensive right apical pleural 
thickening extending along the lateral margin of the right upper 
chest. The volume loss is qualitatively similar. There is a 
suture line projecting over the dome of the left hemidiaphragm. 
The left and right lungs respectively are grossly clear. The 
mediastinum is unremarkable. There is rightward deviation of the 
trachea at the level of the aortic arch. The cardiac silhouette 
is within normal limits for size. There is no effusion or 
pneumothorax. The visualized osseous structures are 
unremarkable.
IMPRESSION: As best can be determined, the volume loss of the 
right lung is relatively stable. There is no definite 
superimposed acute pulmonary process. 

CT chest:
1. Essentially unchanged CT of the chest demonstrating right 
apical fibrosis and traction bronchiectasis and stable 
appearance of pulmonary nodular opacities. 
2. A hyperdense cyst in the left kidney is incompletely 
characterized; if clinically indicated, consider abdominal CT or 
ultrasound for further 
characterization.

CT Head:
1. Intracranially, there are no findings to suggest an 
underlying mass lesion. If suspicion remains high, consider 
contrast-enhanced MRI for the 
most sensitive evaluation.  
2. The osseous lesion in the sphenoid bone as detailed above is 
nonaggressive in nature and highly atypical for lymphoma. It is 
likely a bone island or other benign entity. 

V/Q Scan:
Low likelihood ratio for recent pulmonary embolism.

 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ yo M with hyperlipidemia and distant hx of hodgkins presents 
with chest pain, fever, and leukocytosis.  
.  
# Chest pain: Cardiac causes were unlikely in the setting of 
minimal risk factors, poor response to NTG, negative CE and 
unchanged EKG. There were very mild EKG abnormalities showing PR 
depression (minimal) in lateral and limb leads originally 
concerning of pericarditis in the setting of viral infection 2 
weeks earlier and with the history of chest radiation. However, 
patient received morphine in the ER and chest pain fully 
resolved, which was thought to be to rapid to be compatible with 
pericarditis and in an asymptomatic patient would not 
necessarily require treatment. CT scan ruled out pneumonia and 
V/Q scan was low-probability for PE. Patient was discharged 
asymptomatic with PCP follow up after being given alarm signs 
and symptoms.
.
# Fever/leukocytosis: Originally with nausea and vomit 
associated with chest pain, but upon admission to the medical 
floor he was asymptomatic. Chest CT was negative for source of 
infection as well as a UA. Patient had negative blood cultures 
upon discharge, that will need follow up of final report. CT 
scan of the abdomen at ___ did not find any abdominal source 
of infection. LFTs were normal and patient did not have diarrhea 
or skin manifestations of GVHD. Differential was normal and pt 
was asymptomatic making recurrence of ca unlikely. He was 
discharge with close follow up with his PCP and CBC scheduled 
for next week. Patient was given printed order for laboratories 
and was asked to have them done at ___.
.
# SBO: Final read of abdominal CT scan at ___ reported 
partial SBO. However, patient was asymptomatic moving bowels, 
passing gas and tolerating diet. He was given warning signs and 
symptoms and was asked to follow with his PCP. 
.  
# Hyperlipidemia: Con't simvastatin  
.  
# CKD: Stable with creatinine of 1.9 (baseline) with eGFR of 40 
ml/min upon discharge. Medications were renaly dosed during 
hospitalization. 
.  
# FEN: IVF, Cardiac diet  
.  
# Access: PIV  
.  
# PPx: heparin SC  
.  
# Code: FULL  
.  
# Dispo: Home with PCP follow up.

 
Medications on Admission:
Simvastatin 40mg PO daily  
Calc/Vit.D  
MVI
 
Discharge Medications:
1. Simvastatin 40 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO DAILY 
(Daily).  
2. Multivitamin     Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO DAILY (Daily). 
 
3. Calcium 500 with Vitamin D 500 (1,250)-200 mg-unit Tablet 
Sig: One (1) Tablet PO once a day.  

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Primary Diagnosis:
Atypical chest pain
.
Secondary Diagnosis:
History of Hodgkin's disease s/p chemotherapy, radiation and 
chemotherapy.
Multiple episodes of GVHD but now resolved
Chronic kidney disease
Dyslipidemia
 
Discharge Condition:
Stable, breathing comfortably in room air, pain free.

 
Discharge Instructions:
You were seen at ___ for chest pain/pressure. Your physical 
exam was normal, your EKG had minor changes not concerning for 
heart attack and your cardiac enzymes were negative. You had a 
CT scan of your chest that was negative for infection and a scan 
that puts you in the low probability group for a blood clot in 
your lungs. Your white blood cells were high during the 
hospitalization, so we looked for other infections including 
your blood and urine, but we did not find any source. You were 
asymptomatic and pain free during the hospitalization.
.
You had a rapid heart rhytm called supra ventricular tachycardia 
that resolved spontaneously. You did not have further episodes, 
and there is a chance that it was due to a precipitant 
associated with your pain and your increased white blood cells. 
However, it needs follow up with your PCP.
.
Your medications were left unchanged.
.
You will need to check your temperature on daily basis for the 
next 2 weeks.
.
If chest pain recurs, you have shortness of breath, cough, 
palpitations, fever >100.4, abdominal pain, or anything else 
that concerns you please come back to the ER.
 
Followup Instructions:
___

이 환자는 고령의 남자로 호지킨증 후 치료를 받은 이력이 있으며 흉통을 주소한다. 그는 심장 발작이 시작된 것이며, 이는 밤 근무 중 발생한 것으로 보인다. 그는 몇 시간 동안 통증이 더 악화되었으며, 그때는 그의 부모가 사망했으며, 조카도 림프종으로 사망했다고 한다. 또한 그는 과거와 비교하여 혈액 검사가 증가했고, 심근경색마저 나타났다. 그는 수면중에 흡연하고 있었으나, 최근에는 그렇지 않다. 그리고 그는 지난번에도 비슷한 증상을 보여서 병원을 찾았다. 마지막으로 그는 심혈관 질환이나 다른 이상 징후 없이 건강하다. 그러나 그는 심각한 요양소를 가지고 있다.

최선에서 관찰되는 것처럼 이전 몸체 CT와 비교할 때 확대된 우측 상방비강 thickenings는 측방 경계선을 따라 연장된다. 볼륨 손실은 양적으로 유사하다. 좌측 반쪽 하반신의 돔 위에 봉합 선이 투영되어있다. 왼쪽과 오른쪽 폐 각각은 크게 맑다. 미디어스트린은 특징이 없다. 심장 실루엣은 크기로 정상이다. 기도의 출구 또는 흰색 엽록산이나 기타 현미경이 없다.

CT Chest :
1. essentially unchanged CT demonstrates right apex fibrosis & traction bronch ectasia & stable appearance of pulmonary nodule opacity.
2. Left renal cyst is incompletely characterized; if indicated, abdominal CT US for further characterization.

Head CT :
1 intracranialy, no underlying mass lesions suggesting. If suspicions remain high, contrast enhanced MRI for most sensitive evaluation.
2 Osseous Lesion in sphenoidal bone detailed above non-aggressive in Nature & Highly atypical lymphoma likely Bone Island or Other Benign Entity.

V/Q Scans :
Low likelihood Ratio for Recent Pulmonary Embolus.

Brief Hospital Courses :
Hyperlipidemic male with distant hx Hodgin’s presenting w/chest pain, febrile neutrophilic reaction. 

# Chest Pain: Cardiogenic causes were deemed unlikely by virtue of minimal risk factor profile, lack of response to nitroglycerin, absence of electrocardiographic evidence of ischemia, and failure to show significant ST segment depression despite presence of diffuse interstitial edema. This was felt to represent a false positive stress test secondary to respiratory tract infection rather than true myocardial infarction. Subsequent V/Q scans showed low probability for pulmonary thromboemboli. 

## Fever/Leukocystosis: Initially accompanied by nausea/vomiting related to chest pain but became asymptomatic while hospitalized. CXR revealed no abnormality except for slight mediastinal widening. Abdomen CT also failed to reveal any intra-abdominal cause of infection. Urinary sediment examination was unrevealing. Blood culture

You make take leisurely walks and slowly increase your 
activity at your own pace once you are symptom free at rest. 
___ try to do too much all at once.
No driving while taking any narcotic or sedating medication. 
If you experienced a seizure while admitted, you are NOT 
allowed to drive by law. 
No contact sports until cleared by your neurosurgeon. You 
should avoid contact sports for 6 months. 

Medications:
Please do NOT take any blood thinning medication (Aspirin, 
Ibuprofen, Plavix, Coumadin) until cleared by the neurosurgeon. 
You have been discharged on Keppra (Levetiracetam). This 
medication helps to prevent seizures. Please continue this 
medication as indicated on your discharge instruction. It is 
important that you take this medication consistently and on 
time. 
You may use Acetaminophen (Tylenol) for minor discomfort if 
you are not otherwise restricted from taking this medication.

What You ___ Experience:
You may have difficulty paying attention, concentrating, and 
remembering new information.
Emotional and/or behavioral difficulties are common. 
Feeling more tired, restlessness, irritability, and mood 
swings are also common.
Constipation is common. Be sure to drink plenty of fluids and 
eat a high-fiber diet. If you are taking narcotics (prescription 
pain medications), try an over-the-counter stool softener.

Headaches:
Headache is one of the most common symptoms after traumatic 
brain injury. Headaches can be long-lasting. 
Most headaches are not dangerous but you should call your 
doctor if the headache gets worse, develop arm or leg weakness, 
increased sleepiness, and/or have nausea or vomiting with a 
headache. 
Mild pain medications may be helpful with these headaches but 
avoid taking pain medications on a daily basis unless prescribed 
by your doctor. 
There are other things that can be done to help with your 
headaches: avoid caffeine, get enough sleep, daily exercise, 
relaxation/ meditation, massage, acupuncture, heat or ice packs. 


More Information about Brain Injuries:
You were given information about headaches after TBI and the 
impact that TBI can have on your family.
If you would like to read more about other topics such as: 
sleeping, driving, cognitive problems, emotional problems, 
fatigue, seizures, return to school, depression, balance, or/and 
sexuality after TBI, please ask our staff for this information 
or visit ___

When to Call Your Doctor at ___ for:
Fever greater than 101.5 degrees Fahrenheit.
Nausea and/or vomiting.
Extreme sleepiness and not being able to stay awake.
Severe headaches not relieved by pain relievers.
Seizures.
Any new problems with your vision or ability to speak.
Weakness or changes in sensation in your face, arms, or leg.

Call ___ and go to the nearest Emergency Room if you experience 
any of the following:
Sudden numbness or weakness in the face, arm, or leg.
Sudden confusion or trouble speaking or understanding.
Sudden trouble walking, dizziness, or loss of balance or 
coordination.
Sudden severe headaches with no known reason.

brief hospital course:
patient visited ER on admission day, ___, had a 07mm right front epidermal hematoma detected on head CT before transferring to ____. Also noted to have subgael hematomas. Repeat non contrast head CT revealed slightly enlarged epidural hematom a. Patient admitted to ICU for overnight observation. Started on 7 days course of keppra.

 On _____, patients' neurological examination remained un changed. Occupational therapy consultation ordered. Cleared by Acute care surgery service for outpatient treatment. Eating independently, voiding normally, and ready for discharge to home. Follow up scheduled with dr ___ in four weeks with non contrast ct of head.

none.

1.Acetaminohpen 325 650mg

History of Present Illness:
___ female with past medical history of diabetes,
left-sided foot drop, obesity, status post ORIF ___ for left
periprosthetic femur fracture.  She presents today from rehab
with concern for wound infection.  Nursing staff at the rehab
noted that there was purulent discharge emanating from the
proximal portion of the suture line.  This was noted to be
malodorous.  Had been soaking through multiple dressings.  A
photograph was sent to the nurse practitioner on call for

department for further evaluation.  The patient states that she
has been feeling well.  No fevers or chills.  No further
injuries.  Has been making progress with physical therapy and 
not
complaining of systemic symptoms of illness.  She has recently

See OMR
 
Brief Hospital Course:
The patient presented to the emergency department and was 
evaluated by the orthopedic surgery team. The patient was found 
to have wound erythema and mild drainage and was admitted to the 
orthopedic surgery service.  The patient was initially monitored 
on IV vancomycin for 2 days, after which patient was noted to 
have persistent erythema, therefore the patient was taken to the 
operating room on ___ for irrigation and debridement of 
the left leg, which the patient tolerated well. For full details 
of the procedure please see the separately dictated operative 
report. The patient was taken from the OR to the PACU in stable 
condition and after satisfactory recovery from anesthesia was 
transferred to the floor. The patient was initially given IV 
fluids and IV pain medications, and progressed to a regular diet 
and oral medications by POD#1. The patient was given 
___ antibiotics and anticoagulation per routine. The 
patient's home medications were continued throughout this 
hospitalization. The patient worked with ___ who determined that 
discharge to rehab was appropriate. The ___ hospital 
course was otherwise unremarkable.

During this hospital course, the patient was also evaluated and 
followed by the infectious disease service.  The patient's 
intraoperative cultures from ___ include gram-negative 
rods with mixed bacterial flora.  She was initially maintained 
on vancomycin, cefepime, and Flagyl.  Her vancomycin was held 
during the initial period for supratherapeutic trough levels.  
Patient was eventually discharged on vancomycin and cefepime 
with appropriate trough levels.

At the time of discharge the patient's pain was well controlled 
with oral medications, incisions were clean/dry/intact, and the 
patient was voiding/moving bowels spontaneously. The patient is 
touchdown weightbearing in the left lower extremity, and will be 
discharged on Lovenox for 2 weeks for DVT prophylaxis. The 
patient will follow up with Dr. ___ 1 week per 
routine. A thorough discussion was had with the patient 
regarding the diagnosis and expected post-discharge course 
including reasons to call the office or return to the hospital, 
and all questions were answered. The patient was also given 
written instructions concerning precautionary instructions and 
the appropriate follow-up care. The patient expressed readiness 
for discharge.

This patient is expected to require less than 30 days of rehab

and

RECOMMENDATIONS OR WITH ANY MEDICATION CHANGES THAT OCCUR AFTER
THE DATE/TIME OF THIS OPAT INTAKE NOTE.

 
Discharge Disposition:
Extended Care
 
Facility:
___
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Wound erythema

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - requires assistance or aid (walker 
or cane).

 
Discharge Instructions:
Discharge Instructions:

INSTRUCTIONS AFTER ORTHOPAEDIC SURGERY:

- Resume your regular activities as tolerated, but please follow 
your weight bearing precautions strictly at all times.

ACTIVITY AND WEIGHT BEARING:
-Touchdown weightbearing left lower extremity

MEDICATIONS:
  1)  Take Tylenol ___ every 6 hours around the clock. This is 
an over the counter medication.
  2)  Add oxycodone as needed for pain.  Please follow the same 
weaning schedule that you had immediately following your 
surgery, provided below for your convenience:
then 1 tablet every 4 hours as needed x 1 day,
then 1 tablet every 6 hours as needed x 1 day,
then 1 tablet every 8 hours as needed x 2 days, 
then 1 tablet every 12 hours as needed x 1 day,
then 1 tablet every before bedtime as needed x 1 day.  
Then continue with Tylenol for pain.
  3)  Do not stop the Tylenol until you are off of the narcotic 
medication.
  4)  Per state regulations, we are limited in the amount of 
narcotics we can prescribe. If you require more, you must 
contact the office to set up an appointment because we cannot 
refill this type of pain medication over the phone. 
  5)  Narcotic pain relievers can cause constipation, so you 
should drink eight 8oz glasses of water daily and continue 
following the bowel regimen as stated on your medication 
prescription list. These meds (senna, colace, miralax) are over 
the counter and may be obtained at any pharmacy.
  6)  Do not drink alcohol, drive a motor vehicle, or operate 
machinery while taking narcotic pain relievers.
  7)  Please take all medications as prescribed by your 
physicians at discharge.
  8)  Continue all home medications unless specifically 
instructed to stop by your surgeon.
      
ANTICOAGULATION:
- Please take lovenox daily for 2 more weeks

WOUND CARE:
- You may shower. No baths or swimming for at least 4 weeks.
- Any stitches or staples that need to be removed will be taken 
out at your 2-week follow up appointment.
- Incision may be left open to air unless actively draining. If 
draining, you may apply a gauze dressing secured with paper 
tape.
- Splint must be left on until follow up appointment unless 
otherwise instructed.
- Do NOT get splint wet.

DANGER SIGNS:
Please call your PCP or surgeon's office and/or return to the 
emergency department if you experience any of the following:
- Increasing pain that is not controlled with pain medications
- Increasing redness, swelling, drainage, or other concerning 
changes in your incision
- Persistent or increasing numbness, tingling, or loss of 
sensation
- Fever > 101.4
- Shaking chills
- Chest pain
- Shortness of breath
- Nausea or vomiting with an inability to keep food, liquid, 
medications down
- Any other medical concerns

FOLLOW UP:
Please follow up with your Orthopaedic Surgeon, Dr. ___. 
You will have follow up with ___, NP in the 
Orthopaedic Trauma Clinic 14 days post-operation for evaluation. 
Call ___ to schedule appointment upon discharge.

Please follow up with your primary care doctor regarding this 
admission within ___ weeks and for any new medications/refills.

THIS PATIENT IS EXPECTED TO REQUIRE <30 DAYS OF REHAB
Physical Therapy:
Touchdown weightbearing left lower extremity
No range of motion restrictions
No braces or splints needed
Upper extremity assist as needed
Treatments Frequency:
Incision may be left open to air
Dry sterile dressing for drainage as needed

무 알레르기가 있는 경우 또는 약물에 대한 과민 반응은 없다.

진료 의사 : ______.

주소 증상 :
부상 홍조

수술 내역 :
ORIF 왼쪽 대퇴골 골절 후 수술을 받았다. 그녀는 재활에서 오늘부터 감염 우려로 병원을 방문했다. 간호 직원이 근위 부분으로 배출되는 황색 분비물을 발견했다고 보고했다. 이것은 악취가 있었다. 여러 개의 드레스를 통해 흘러나왔다. 사진을 외래 진료사의 호출에게 보냈다. 환자는 잘 지내고 있다. 열이나 두통은 없었다. 더 많은 상처는 없었다. 체질증은 없었으며 신체 치료 중 진행하고 있다. 최근 다섯 번의 동정맥 경련을 겪었다.

력력력력이 있는 과거 병력 :
디아베트스, 좌측 발목 실장, 비만, 오른쪽 대궁근 주변 뇌종양.

병력 :
여성이 있고, 당뇨병, 좌 측발목실장, 고혈압, 유방암, 복합적이다.

환자의 상태 :
우선적인 알레릭지와 과민반응 없음.

주요 수술 및 침습 절차 :
수술 전 검사는 필요하다.

임상 소견 :
오른쪽 무릎 관절염, 양측 허리 통증, 좌면 피하 조직 손상 등이 있다.

수술 후 관리 :
수술후 관리는 필요하다. 수술 후 회복 기간 동안에는 식단을 제한하지 않는다.

수치 :
수치관 위험 요인은 없지만, 심각한 합병증이 있을 수도 있다.

추가 정보 :
수급량은 많으나, 수액 투여는 하지 않도록 한다.

수분 섭취 :
수분은 물론 음식도 함께 섭렵한다.

수유 :
수침법은 필요하지만, 수침법이 없는 경우에도 수침 법을 사용할 수 있다.

시술 방법 :
수치는 필요하며, 시술 전에 항균제를 적용하여야 한다.

안전 조치 :
안전 장치를 설치해야 하며, 안전 장치가 없어도 안심된다.

수용 가능 시간 :
수용 가능한 시간은 필요하다이며, 수용 불가능한 시간은 없다.

bleeding from surgical site along with an elevated INR.  She was 
admitted to monitor her INR with a goal of ___.  She is 
discharge home on coumadin 5mg and will follow up with her PCP 
___ at ___ (Phone ___ 
or Fax ___ and continue ___ and regular INR checks 
every ___. She will begin to take keflex ___ four 
times per day for 10 days. 
 
Medications on Admission:
tylenol, colace, MVI, quetiapine, senna, coumadin, oxycodone, 
lisinopril
 
Discharge Medications:
1. lisinopril 10 mg Tablet Sig: Three (3) Tablet PO DAILY 
(Daily).  
2. lorazepam 1 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO HS (at bedtime) 
as needed for anxiety.  
3. quetiapine 300 mg Tablet Sustained Release 24 hr Sig: Two (2) 
Tablet Sustained Release 24 hr PO QHS (once a day (at bedtime)). 
 
4. warfarin 5 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO DAILY (Daily): 
Target INR ___.  Followed by PCP ___ ___.
Disp:*30 Tablet(s)* Refills:*2*
5. cephalexin 500 mg Capsule Sig: One (1) Capsule PO four times 
a day for 10 days.
Disp:*40 Capsule(s)* Refills:*0*
6. Percocet ___ mg Tablet Sig: ___ Tablets PO every ___ 
hours: do not take with additional tylenol.  do not exceed more 
than 12 tabs in 24 hours.
Disp:*100 Tablet(s)* Refills:*0*

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home With Service
 
Facility:
___
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Elevated INR

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - requires assistance or aid (walker 
or cane).

 
Discharge Instructions:
1. Please return to the emergency department or notify your 
physician if you experience any of the following: severe pain 
not relieved by medication, increased swelling, decreased 
sensation, difficulty with movement, fevers greater than 101.5, 
shaking chills, increasing redness or drainage from the incision 
site, chest pain, shortness of breath or any other concerns.

2. Please follow up with your primary physician regarding this 
admission and any new medications and refills.  

3. Resume your home medications unless otherwise instructed.

4. You have been given medications for pain control. Please do 
not drive, operate heavy machinery, or drink alcohol while 
taking these medications. As your pain decreases, take fewer 
tablets and increase the time between doses. This medication can 
cause constipation, so you should drink plenty of water daily 
and take a stool softener (such as colace) as needed to prevent 
this side effect.  Call your surgeons office 3 days before you 
are out of medication so that it can be refilled.  These 
medications cannot be called into your pharmacy and must be 
picked up in the clinic or mailed to your house.  Please allow 
an extra 2 days if you would like your medication mailed to your 
home.

5. You may not drive a car until cleared to do so by your 
surgeon or your primary physician.

6. Please keep your wounds clean. You may shower starting five 
days after surgery, but no tub baths or swimming for at least 
four weeks. No dressing is needed if wound continues to be 
non-draining. Any stitches or staples that need to be removed 
will be taken out by ___ on ___ at 1:40PM. 

7. Please call your surgeon's office to schedule or confirm your 
follow-up appointment with ___ (___).

8. Please DO NOT take any non-steroidal anti-inflammatory 
medications (NSAIDs such as celebrex, ibuprofen, advil, aleve, 
motrin, etc).

9. ANTICOAGULATION: Please continue your coumadin to help 
prevent deep vein thrombosis (blood clots).  Get INR checked 
___ by ___ and results should be faxed to Dr. ___ 
___ at ___ or called ___ and dose 
coumadin appropriately.    

10. WOUND CARE: Please keep your incision clean and dry. It is 
okay to shower five days after surgery but no tub baths, 
swimming, or submerging your incision until after your four week 
checkup. Please place a dry sterile dressing on the wound each 
day if there is drainage, otherwise leave it open to air. Check 
wound regularly for signs of infection such as redness or thick 
yellow drainage. Staples will be removed by ___ at your 
appointment on ___.  

11. ACTIVITY: Weight bearing as tolerated on the operative 
extremity. CPM as tolerated. No strenuous exercise or heavy 
lifting until follow up appointment.

12. Take Keflex ___ four times per day for 10 days.

Physical Therapy:
Mobilize
WBAT
ROM unrestricted
CPM as tolerated
Treatments Frequency:
Dry sterile dressings daily as needed for drainage.
Wound checks daily.
 
Followup Instructions:
___

text:
Name:  ___                       Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
Penicillins / Amoxicillin
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
Febrile neutropenia
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None

 
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ woman with Ph- B cell ALL (t(1;19) and
del(13q), Ph-, CD20 neg, with CNS2 involvement [subsequently
cleared] treated on protocol ___, MRD negative following
induction x2, consolidation x2, now C3D36 on protocol ___,
recurrent paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia, C. difficile
colitis, and PCOS who presented from clinic with febrile
neutropenia. She reports this is her first fever while on
chemotherapy. It began yesterday and she recorded a temperature
of 101.5. She hoped that the fever would resolve with sleep. 
Last
night she developed transient hives on her back and right cheek.
Overnight she had night sweats. This morning the fever had
resolved, but soon returned at 101.2. Associated symptoms 
include
body aches. She has not received her flu shot this season.

 
Past Medical History:
PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY: 
Hematologic/Oncologic History:
- ___: Presents to primary care physician ___ 2 weeks of
headaches, fever, chills, night sweats, diffuse arthralgia, and
generalized myalgias. CBC demonstrates leukocytosis (WBC 
~50,000)
and thrombocytopenia, after which she is directed to the ___
ED. At ___ the CBC reveals WBC 50,700/uL (increased to
67,400/uL within 12 hours), hemoglobin 12.3 g/dL, and platelets
29,000/uL, with 4% neutrophils and 76% blasts. Bone marrow
aspiration and biopsy demonstrates the presence of
B-lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL), with t(1;19) and del(13q). The
___ chromosome was  negative and CD20 was negative. No
mutations were identified on targeted next generation lymphoid
sequencing. 
- ___: Enrolled in clinical trial protocol ___, a Phase
III randomized trial of blinatumumab for newly diagnosed
BCR-ABL-negative B lineage Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia in
Adults. 
- ___: Receives leuprolide 7.5 mg IM for fertility
preservation. 
- ___: Begins C1D1 of induction therapy on clinical trial
protocol ___: Daunorubicin 25 mg/m2 on days 1, 8, 15, and 22.
Vincristine 1.4 mg/m2 (cap at 2 mg) on days 1, 8, ___, and 22.
Pegaspargase ___ IU/m2 (cap at 3750 IU) on day 18. Cytarabine 
70
mg intrathecal on day 1. Methotrexate 12.5 mg intrathecal on day
15. Dexamethasone 17 mg PO daily on days ___. 
- ___: Lumbar puncture reveals 2 total nucleated cells, 56%
lymphocytes, with no evidence of ALL involvement. Prophylactic
intrathecal cytarabine administered. 
- ___: Repeat lumbar puncture reveals 2% lymphoblasts,
defining CNS II disease. 
- ___: Repeat lumbar puncture again reveals 2% lymphoblasts. 

- ___: Repeat lumbar puncture reveals 1% lymphoblasts. 
- ___: Found to have progressive antithrombin deficiency
(31%) related to asparaginase, as well as hypofibrinogenemia
requiring intermittent cryoprecipitate. 
- ___: Repeat lumbar puncture shows resolution of CNS
involvement (i.e. 0% lymphoblasts). 
- ___: Bone marrow biopsy demonstrates hypocellular marrow
with left-shifted, erythroid dominanant trilineage 
hematopoiesis,
with no morphological evidence of known leukemia. Karyotype
revelas 46,XX[20], and FISH shows no evidence of t(1;19). MRD
testing reveals the presence of 0.02% B lymphoblasts. 
- ___: Leuprolide dose deferred given concurrent 
antithrombin
deficiency and hypofibrinogenemia. 
- ___: Repeat lumbar puncture again shows no evidence of CNS
involvement. 
- ___: C2D1 of induction therapy on clinical trial protocol
___: cyclophosphamide 1000 mg/m2 on days 1 and 29. Cytarabine
75 mg/m2 IV on days ___, and 36-39. Pegaspargase
___ units/m2 [cap at 3750 units] on day 15. Mercaptopurine on
days ___ and ___. Methotrexate 12.5 mg and hydrocortisone 50
mg intrathecally on days 1, 8, 15, and 22. 
- ___: Repeat lumbar puncture again shows no evidence of CNS
involvement. 
- ___: Discharged to home. 
- ___: C2D15 intrathecal methotrexate held because of
headache. Admitted for expedited work-up of headache. This
includes temporarily holding pegasparaginase (which she
eventually receives on ___, CT head without intracranial
hemorrhage, and MRI/MRV of the brain with no evidence of dural
thrombosis, as well as a 6 mm indeterminate left frontal bone
lesion, likely suggestive of a hemangioma. The headache improves
with dexamethasone and fioricet; ultimately, the most likely
explanation is that the headache is secondary to side effect of
leuprolide. 
- ___: Resumes prophylactic enoxaparin and is discharged to
home. 
- ___: C2D22 lumbar puncture (no evidence of CNS leukemia)
with intrathecal methotrexate. 
- ___: Thrombate 2216 units administered for ATIII level of
49% on ___.
- ___: C2D29 cyclosphosphamide, cytarabine IV, and
6-mercaptopurine PO. Thrombate 3095 units administered for ATIII
level of 51%. 
- ___: Cyroprecipitate administered for fibrinogen level of
105. 
- ___: C2D36 IV cytarabine, 6-mercaptopurine and Thrombate
for ATIII level 45%. 
- ___: Develops sudden onset supraventricular tachycardia,
most likely Atrial Tachycardia. This breaks with Carotid Sinus
Pressure and IV fluids.
- ___: Evaluated by Dr. ___ Cardiology, who instructs
her in vagal maneuvers and elects to defer nodal blockade, given
that the arrhythmia appeared to originate proximal to the AV
node. 
- ___: Monthly leuprolide administered. Enoxaparin stopped,
given normalization of Antithrombin III level. 
- ___: Hospitalized for SVT 170's. Resolved with
valsalva maneuvers. CTA negative for PE. Started on metopolol.
- ___: Bone marrow biopsy demonstrates cellular bone marrow
with erythroid predominant maturing trilineage hematopoiesis and
no evidence of lymphoblastic leukemia. Karyotype reveals
46,XX[20], and FISH shows no evidence of t(1;19). 
- ___: Hospitalized for Intensification Day 1
___ protocol ___.
- ___: Hospitalized for Intensification Day 8 (___)
HD MTX on protocol ___.
- ___: Bone marrow biopsy at ___ recovery from
Intensification reveals a hypocellular marrow with erythroid
predominant trilineage hematopoiesis and no morphological
evidence of acute leukemia. Normal female karayotype, with no
evidence of t(1;19) by ___. MRD testing is negative. 
- ___: Randomized to the "no blinatumumab" arm on clinical
trial protocol ___. 
- ___: C1D1 Consolidation. Lumbar puncture with intrathecal
methotrexate performed, with no morphologic evidence of ALL in
the CSF. Leuprolide 3.75 mg administered. 
- ___: C1D5 consolidation, pegaspargase administered. 
- ___: Thrombate for ATIII level 61%. 
- ___: Thrombate for ATIII level 58%. 
- ___: Thrombate for ATIII level 57%. Cryoprecipitate for
fibrinogen 117. 
- ___: Thrombate for ATIII  level 53%. 
- ___: Receives daily filgrastim for neutropenia. 
- ___: Thrombate for ATIII level 51%. 
- ___: Filgrastim for neutropenia. Peripheral blood flow
cytometry shows no evidence of recurrent ALL.
- ___: Filgrastim for neutropenia.
- ___: Neutrophil count recovers.
- ___: C2D1 consolidation, with pegfilgrastim for growth
factor support. Lumbar puncture with intrathecal methotrexate
performed; this reveals TProt 19, Glucose 68, 1 WBC (7% PMNs, 
74%
Lymphos), and 0 RBCs. Leuprolide 3.75 mg administered. 
- ___: Bone marrow biopsy performed for MRD analysis; this 
is
again MRD negative.      
- ___: C3D1 Consolidation. Lumbar puncture with intrathecal
methotrexate administered; this reveals Trpot 26, Glucose 63, 0
WBC (3% PMNS, 73% Lymphs, 24% Monos) and 0 RBCs. 
- ___: Leuprolide 3.75 administered.

PAST MEDICAL/SURGICAL HISTORY:
PCOS
Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia developed during her
recent chemotherapy infusion and started on flecainide and
metoprolol. These were eventually held due to bradycardia and
prolonged QT.
She is undergoing fertility preservation
with monthly leuprolide.
 
Social History:
___
Family History:
Patient is adopted so this is not available currently. 
 
Physical Exam:
ADMISSION PHYSICAL EXAM
=======================
VITALS: Afebrile and vital signs stable (see eFlowsheet)
GENERAL: Alert and in no apparent distress, cheeks flushed
EYES: Anicteric, pupils equally round
ENT: Ears and nose without visible erythema, masses, or trauma. 
Oropharynx without visible lesion, erythema or exudate
CV: Heart regular, no murmur, no S3, no S4.  No JVD. Right port.

Brief Hospital Course:
SUMMARY
========
Ms. ___ is a ___ woman with ___ chromosome 
negative B-cell ALL (consolidation cycle 3, day 36 of protocol 
___, recurrent paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia, 
treated C. difficile colitis, and PCOS who presented from clinic 
with neutropenic fever and transient urticaria. The night prior 
to admission, she had a temperature of 101.5, hives on the back 
and right cheek, and night sweats. Fever resolved in the 
morning, but returned in the afternoon to 101.2, prompting her 
to come in. Workup for viral and bacterial sources was negative, 
though parvo B19 and strep A culture pending on discharge. She 
received meropenem for 2 days, and after remaining afebrile with 
no clear source of infection, was transitioned to levofloxacin. 
As her ANC was > 1000, Neupogen was discontinued. The next 2 
days, her counts dropped, and she became relatively neutropenic, 
though remained afebrile and well without signs of infection. 
Patient preferred to leave the hospital and follow-up in 
transfusion clinic the next day for blood counts and possible 
blood products.

ACUTE ISSUES ADDRESSED
======================
# Neutropenic fever
Presented with fever, rosy cheeks, urticaria on back, legs on
presentation, which resolved after meropenem and Benadryl. She 
reported a sore spot deep in her throat with swallowing, though 
no other localizing symptoms. Blood and urine cultures were 
negative, chest xray unremarkable, respiratory viral screen, PCR 
were negative. Parvo B19 and strep A culture pending on 
discharge. She was treated with meropenem for two days and 
transitioned to levofloxacin as she remained afebrile, and 
throat symptoms resolved. Ultimately it was felt her fever was 
likely triggered by either gut translocation or transient viral 
infection not picked up by the limited panel available, and 
self-resolved. 

# ___ chromosome negative B-cell ALL
# Cytopenias
Ph-, t(1;19) and del(13q), CD20 neg, with CNS2 involvement
(subsequently cleared). Treated on protocol ___, MRD negative
following induction x2, consolidation x2, presented in cycle 3, 
day 36. She had received 6-mercaptopurine in accordance with 
study schematic which was in disagreement with the most updated 
study protocol. As such, her cytopenias were expected. Her 
chemotherapy regimen was held in the setting of fever and workup 
for infection. She had received Neupogen prior to and on the 
first day of admission, this was stopped on the second day as 
her neutrophil counts were over 1000. The following 2 days, all 
lines decreased. It was decided on discharge that she should 
resume Neupogen, and follow-up the next day for cell counts, 
possible transfusion, and neupogen. She was continued on 
prophylactic acyclovir and Bactrim SS this admission.

# Penicillin allergy
# Fluoroquinolone ?toxicity
Patient described taking amoxicillin and developing face and 
body hives, facial erythema and swelling but no oral or 
respiratory symptoms ___ years ago. No subsequent exposure. She 
had never had cephalosporins. She also reported side effects 
from fluoroquinolones, including joint and body aches. This 
fever occurred through Bactrim SS. So choice of 
deescalting/prophylactic antibiotics while neutropenic was 
somewhat challenging. This is her first episode of neutropenic 
fever, and it would be of great benefit to her if question fo 
cephalosporin cross-reactivity resolved prior to any future 
fevers.

CHRONIC/STABLE PROBLEMS:
========================
# Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia
Previously diagnosed and worked up by cardiology; rate and 
rhythm control had been attempted, though caused bradycardia, so 
were avoided this admission. Patient initially placed on 
telemetry, which was unremarkable, so was discontinued. Patient 
was asymptomatic of this this admission.

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES
===================
[] ___ F/u CBC w diff tomorrow in clinic, transfuse to hgb>7, 
plt>10
[] ___ give neupogen
[] Patient should undergo outpatient penicillin testing

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,  

It was a privilege caring of you at ___.  

WHY WAS I IN THE HOSPITAL?  
-Had a fever and hives while neutropenic from chemotherapy.

WHAT HAPPENED TO ME IN THE HOSPITAL?  
- Antibiotics were given
- The rash disappeared, and fever subsided.
- Extensive workup including lab tests and x-rays did not 
identify the source of the infection.  
- It is likely that you either had a passing viral infection or 
transient translocation of gut bacteria, which is the most 
common cause of fever and neutropenia.

WHAT SHOULD I DO AFTER I LEAVE THE HOSPITAL?  
- Continue to take all your medicines and keep your 
appointments.
- Come in tomorrow and ___ for neupogen, count check and 
possible transfusion  

We wish you the best.

Sincerely,  
Your ___ Team

translated:
이름 : ________________________
Unit No : ___________________________
입원일자 : ______________________________
퇴원일 자 : ___________________________________

생년월일 : _______________________ 성별 : 여성

서비스 : 내과

알레르기 : 페니실린 및 아모시실린

진료 의사 : ________.

주소 불편감 :
체온 높은 신혈구 감소증

최근의 주요 수술 또는 침습적 절차 : 없음

병력 개요 :
여성이 B 세포 전립선암을 가진다. 그녀는 클리닉에서 발열과 신형인증으로 나타났다. 그녀는 이 병력이 처음이다. 그녀가 화학 요법을 받고 있다. 그녀의 첫 열은 화학 치료를 받으면서 발생했다. 그것은 그녀가 먼저 경험한 것이다.

 과거내과력 :
피부염, 두통, 밤에 땀 났다. 피검사 결과는 양성이었다. 혈액 검사는 정상이었다. 그 다음날 아침에는 더 이상 체온이 없었다. 그러나 곧 다시 올라갔다. 그녀는 몸살도 있었다. 그녀는 항바이러스제와 항균제를 복용하고 있다.

 임상 역사 :
피해 환자는 주치의에게 2주 전에 머리가 아프고 발열, 기침, 무더운 날씨로 인해 통증이 생겼다고 한다. 그는 또한 식욕 부전과 함께 얼굴과 손목의 홍반과 가려움증을 보였다. 그의 혈압은 높았다. 그는 항생제를 먹었다. 그리고 다음날 오후에 발열이 사라졌다. 그는 또 다른 증상을 보였지만, 이는 그가 바이러스의 영향을 받았거나 소화관 이동 때문이라고 생각한다.

 추가적인 정보 :
그녀는 이전에 항생물질을 사용했으며, 현재는 약물을 복용 중이다. 그녀는 또한 면역력을 강화하기 위해 항산화제를 섭취하고 있다. 그녀는 아직도 건강하다. 그녀는 계속해서 자신의 약을 복용해야 하며, 다음날 오면 된다. 그녀는 다음날에도 같은 증상을 보여줄 것이라 예측된다. 그녀는 지금까지 아무런 문제 없이 잘 지냈다.

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,

You were admitted for a drop in your blood level. Upon your 
arrival, we transfused you with 2 units of blood. We suspected 
that your low blood level was the result of bleeding in your 
gastrointestinal tract. To determine the location of this 
bleeding, we performed a colonoscopy and an upper GI endoscopy. 
The colonoscopy showed bleeding from a lesion at the junction 
between your small and large intestine, which was then 
successfully stopped with cauterization. Afterwards, your blood 
levels remained stable. You also required oxygen therapy this 
admission given your chronic lung issues. You were followed 
closely by the cardiology team that performed your recent aortic 
valve intervention, and they deemed you stable as well. 

Please follow-up with your Cardiology and pulmonary specialists 
as indicated below. In addition, your rehabilitation facility 
will schedule follow-up with your primary care physician.

Thank you for allowing us to be a part of your medical care.

Your ___ Care Team

병력 개요 :
Ms. ____은 37세의 여성으로, 심근 경색증 후 다발성 PCI를 받았으며 아피브리플 등도 있고 코마딘을 복용하며 고혈압, 제2형 당뇨, 중등도의 동맥 협착증을 앓고 있다. 한 달 전 코어 밸브 삽입 수술을 받았다. 흉부 불편감과 함께 1개월 전에 입원하여 흉통이 사라졌으나 혈장 검사에서 하혈량이 증가되어 구아이악 긍정이었다. 병력이 심한 경우에는 혈장을 주사했지만 혈중 헤모글로빈은 8~10.5이었고 트로포닌은 음성이었다. 가이아크 검사는 양성이였다. 심전도는 이상 변화가 없었고 심실 부종은 없었다. 심장 약물은 시작되었다. 이후 혈청검사에서 8점에서 7점으로 떨어졌다. 가족 요청에 따라 응급실로 옮겨져서 치료받았다.

Brief Hospital Course:
___ y/o male with tracheostomy and PEG, severe COPD, HFpEF, 
atrial arrhythmias s/p cardioversionx2 in ___ and ___, 
currently on coumadin, obesity s/p laparoscopic band surgery. He 
presents from LTAC with tachypnea.

# Respiratory failure: Patient presented from LTAC with 
tachypnea in setting of being weaned from pressure support to 
trach mask. Here, he was put on CMV with significant clinical 
improvement. Respiratory failure was thought most likely 
secondary to rapid weaning from ventilator with contribution of 
volume overload (BNP 7000). Infection was considered but he 
remained afebrile without purulent sputum. CXR with no 
infiltrate. He was transitioned to pressure support, given 
outpatient lasix and metolazone and diuresed approximately 1.5 
L. He underwent bronchoscopy which showed frothy fluid 
suggestive of pulmonary edema without any purulence or plugging; 
BAL cultures are no growth to date. At discharge patient was 
again weaning from pressure support to trach T-piece and 
tolerating this well.
-please monitor weights and fluid status; uptitrate lasix as 
necessary
-use t-piece for trach mask trials as tolerated
-use ET-tube suction catheter for extra long trach

# Upper extremity DVT: Patient on warfarin for DVT of left 
cephalic vein noted ___. Occlusive proximal left cephalic 
vein thrombus. On admission INR was 3.6 and warfarin was held. 
At discharge INR was 3.6.
-Please restart warfarin when INR is subtherapeutic
-Please start subcutaneous heparin for prophylaxis if warfarin 
continues to be held

# Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation: Patient in sinus rhythm or 
with wandering atrial pacemaker throughout this admission. Home 
metoprolol tartrate 50 mg q8h was continued. Warfarin was held 
in setting of supratherapeutic INR and pending ___ procedure.

# Diastolic heart failure: Patient continued on outpatient 
furosemide 40 mg daily and metolazone 2.5 mg daily with diuresis 
of 1.5 L.

vancomycin ___ through ___ per infectious disease note. He was 
continued on vancomycin in house. Of note vancomycin level was 
32 on ___ and thus dose was held.
-please restart vanc AM of ___ at 1g Q24H and recheck trough 
before third dose.

# Anxiety and depression: Continued outpatient venlafaxine and 
lamotrigine.

for weaning, and to use ET tube suction catheter, as his trach 
tube is extra long.

Name:  ___               Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
Streptomycin / Versed / Fentanyl
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
 Dizziness and chest pain
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
none

 
History of Present Illness:
 ___ y.o. ___ Speaking only Female with h.o. DM II, Afib on 
Coumadin, Pulm HTN, dCHF p/w A.fib with RVR and symptomatic 
hypotension.  
.  
Via family it appears pt woke up this morning feeling very 
lightheaded and dizzy, she decided to go an see her PCP. At the 
PCP's office she was noted to be in A.fib with a rate in the 
120s-130s as well as a sytolic blood pressure of 95. Pt was then 
referred directly to the ED given her heart rate and symptomatic 
hypotension.  
.  
She does endorse the sensation of palpations but it appears she 
has had this sensation for a long time and she denies any 
worsening of it recently. She denies any difficulty breathing, 
chest pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, fevers 
or chills. She does endorse feeling very thirsty over the past 
few days, however per the daughter the pt always feels thirsty 
and appears more swollen to her. She has also, per PCP referral, 
had ___ 9lb weight gain.  
.  
In the ED an EKG showed she was in A.fib with a rate in the 
110s, she also received a chest x-ray which per the ED read 
looked mildly fluid overloaded. She felt very thirsty and so had 
some PO fluids, in the ED she received <500 of IVF. Prior to 
transfer her vitals ranged from BP 100->110, HR 110-118 RR 20, 
Sat 99% on RA.  

 
Past Medical History:
1. Atrial fibrillation.  
2. Hypertension.  
3. Dyslipidemia.  
4. Obstructive sleep apnea with secondary pulmonary HTN (uses 
CPAP but does not know settings)  
5. Chronic diastolic heart failure.  
6. Diabetes mellitus type 2; ___ HbA1c 7.9
7. Chronic kidney disease (baseline Cr ~1.2)  
8. S/p lap appy (___) 
9. Diabetic neuropathy

___

the left

crackles

or ___.

distended, NT, ND. Non-tender hepatomegaly to 1.5 inches below 
CM with unclear Left lobe size

NEURO: AAO x 3. Appropriate. CN ___ grossly intact. Preserved 
sensation throughout. ___ strength throughout.  
.

1) BP between 110-130
2) Resolved pitting edema

STUDIES

CXR ___
Frontal view is compromised secondary to AP lordotic 
positioning.  
The lungs are grossly clear without consolidation. No 
significant pulmonary edema is identified. The mediastinum is 
unremarkable. The cardiac silhouette is borderline enlarged, 
accentuated by the positioning and technique. No effusion or 
pneumothorax is noted. Multilevel compression fractures are 
identified in the included thoracolumbar spine, which are stable 
relative to prior exams. 
IMPRESSION: No acute pulmonary process. Incidental findings as 
above 
.  

 
Brief Hospital Course:
IN SUMMARY
 ___ y.o. Female with history of diastolic CHF, A. fib on 
Coumadin, HTN, HL, CRI presenting with A. fib with intermittent 
RVR and hypotension. On admission, she was given less beta and 
calcium channel blockade than that of her home regimen. 
Nevertheless, she has been rate controlled since arrival on the 
floor save for two episodes. At 0200 on ___, the patient had 
an episode of asymptomatic bradycardia (39) with sinus pause and 
a BP of 120/70. At 0900 on ___ the patient went back into RVR 
after a stressful conversation with her husband. Despite that, 
the patient has been clinically stable with stable blood 
pressures and largely rate controlled with a persistently 
negative fluid balance. On ___ we transitioned her back to her 
home dose of diltiazem. On ___ AM, we transitioned her back on 
atenolol, but quickly returned to ___ when she went into 
RVR. EP was consulted. They discussed her at conference and 
decided that she must optimize her weight, thyroid, sleep apnea 
status prior to anti-arrythmic. She was ___ Litres negative by 
the time of discharge. She was discharged on 75 mg Toprol XL and 
Dilt XL 240 mg BID. We tried to get her ___ of Hearts monitor 
but she refused. An Rx will left in OMR and she was counselled 
for 60 minutes total on the importance of this device
.  
BY PROBLEM 

1) A. fib with RVR: Pt noted to vary with her a. fib ranging 
from ___ with no evidence of flash pulmonary edema. It is 
unclear as to the recent cause of the A. fib with RVR as it 
appears pt has been compliant with her medications. On 
admission, patient was taken off of 25 mg Atenolol and put on 
Metoprolol Tartrate 25mg PO TID. We attempted to put her back on 
atenolol and she went back into RVR. She was started on 
Diltiazem 90mg PO QID given her relative hypotension and 
increased back to home dose (given improved BP) of 120mg QID (Pt 
takes 480mg per 24 hours). She was kept on tele, with on episode 
of asymptomatic bradycardia with sinus pauses. She was kept on 
Coumadin, on which was therapeutic. EP was consulted. They 
discussed her at conference and decided that she must optimize 
her weight, thyroid, sleep apnea status prior to anti-arrythmic. 
They believe that, for now, she should move toward beta-blockade 
predominant regimen while down-titrating the diltiazem.

2). Hypotension: Unclear if this is related to her episodes of 
A. fib with RVR. Given her diastolic dysfunction it is likely 
that once pt goes into A. fib with RVR she does not have 
enoought time to fill her ventricles and thus reduces her 
cardiac output. However it appears that is sometimes hypotensive 
irrespective of the RVR. Her BNP was mildly elevated especially 
when compared to her prior results. Her gain in weight, body 
edema and exquisite response to diuresis would point to an 
extravascular fluid overload state. Given that she was 
hypotensive, the original goal currently is to control her A. 
fib; holding her diuretics and lisinopril. Given her stability, 
we began actively diuresing her the day after admission. We held 
her lisinopril on discharge as her pressures were never greater 
than 130/70 
.  
3) Diastolic CHF with EF > 60%- pt's fluid status was never 
clear, clinically. Her lungs were clear and her pitting edema 
was far from impressive. Nevertheless, her obese abdomen may 
have had extra fluid. We used her daily oral dose of lasix with 
prn IV boluses of 20 mg IV to diurese. Patient tolerated this 
well, her fluid balance was between negative 4 and 5 litres 
(nursin notes incomplete with respect to ins). By ___ she 
was in contraction alkalosis with a slight bump in creatinine. 
We stopped the IV lasix and encouraged PO replacement. She may 
need to be put back on an ACEi when her rate control regime is 
worked out. 

4) Hypothyroidism: Was continued on home regimen of 
Levothyroxine. Midway through the admission, we checked the TSH 
as a cause of her presenting Afib. It turns out that she is 
HyPOthyroid and has had elevated TSH for months. We did not dare 
increase her thyroid replacement dosage until her rate/rhythm 
control regime is decided. Clearly, this could exacerbate her 
heart failure. 
.  
5) OSA: sleep apnea and the consequent catecholamine excess may 
be related to her RVR. She must continue BiPAP every night. She 
refused it while in the hospital

6) DM II: Patient on 70/30 BID, ISS on CBGs QID and glipidzide. 

TO BE RESOLVED
1) AFIB WITH RVR - optimize thyroid, weight loss and OSA tx. EP 
reccommended more beta block and less calcium channel
2) Hypothyroidism - pt may need increase in thyroid replacement 
dose and close monitoring
3) Obesity - patient may need professional nutritional 
intervention.

Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted for high heart rate and low pressure. We 
controlled your pressure and rate while removing extra fluid. 
Your heart would race very fast occasionally and we treated you 
with extra heart medications. You were discharged on two heart 
medication. You must follow up with your cardiologist.
.

the hospital between 9pm-9:30pm. Those pills are Metoprolol 25mg 
and Diltiazem 120 mg.
.

pain, the feeling like you are going to faint or any other 
symptoms that concern you.
.

이름 : ______

서비스 : 내과

알레르기 : 스테로마이신/Versed/Fentanyl

진료 의사 : ______.

주요 소견 :
정신 혼란감 및 흉통

수술 또는 침습적 절차 : 없음

병력 개시 :
_____세 연령의 여성으로 DMII, Coumadin에 아피브릴을 받고 있다. 부모님께서는 오늘 아침 기분 좋지 않다며 병원을 방문했다. 진찰실에서 심박동은 120~130대이며 혈압은 95였다. 환자는 심장 리듬 불안증을 호소하며 심근 경색이나 가슴 통증 등은 없다. 딸에게는 항상 수치가 높아 보인다고 한다. 최근에는 체중 증가도 있었다. 당뇨병 관리 중이다.

 과거 병력 :
1. 심방세동
2. 고혈압
3. 이상 지질
4. 폐쇄성 잠재우울증
5. 만성 이형심장
6. 당화혈당 7,9%

사회력 :
_____

 가족력이 :
프리메터 관상 동맥 질환 유전자가 없으며, 다른 가족력도 없었다.

 신체 검사 :
입원 시 :
온도 - 97·3 ℃, 혈관 압력 - 90~110/ 40~52 mmHg, 맥박 - ____RR - 18, 02sat - 98%
일반적으로 NAD였으나 왼쪽으로 눕혀져 있었음
헤엔트 - 무두결, EOM이 완전함, 작은 상처만 있음
목 - 조영제를 사용할 수 없었던 상태
폐 - 원위와 비슷한 거리가 있는 것으로 나타났다.
심장 - 원위를 중심으로 하는 거리가 있으며, 근육 발작이나 기타 현저하지 않았다.
복부 - 비만이었으며, 표면에 점액이 있어왔지만, 현재는 감소하였다.
四肢 - 1 + 피팅 엽록체 증후군이 있었으나 현재는 사라졌다.
신경계 - AAO 3번, 적절하다. CN 전체가 크게 손상되지 않았으며, 촉각 전반에 잘 유지되었다. 힘도 균등하게 유지되고 있었다.
출산 후 변화 :
1) 혈류율 110~130 사이
2)이완된 피팅염증

관련 결과 :
입원의 경우 :

05: 20 PM 혈액검사 - WBC - 5. 5 RRC - 2. 94 * HGB - 8. 2 * HCT - 27. 3 * MCV - 93 MHC - 28. 0 MCHO - 30. 21 * RDW - 16. 23 *

연구 :
CXR - 앞면 사진은 AP 측면 위치 때문에 간단히 복잡했으며, 폐는 확연히 명백하지 않은 상태. 미드스트림은 평범하고, 심장은 약간 커졌으며, 심장이나 다른 것은 없었다. 다발성 압축 골격은 안정되어 있었으며, 척추골격은 비교적 단순이었다. IMPTION - 급성 폐렴이 아니었다. 추가적인 연구 필요.

 요약 :
DMII, AFB, HTNI, HL에 걸린 여자로서 AFB와 RVR 그리고 저혈량이 발생하여 입원하였다. 투여는 가정 치료보다 덜 하였으며, 두 차례 RVR로 인해 심장률이 변동하였으나, 이후 정상으로 회복되었다. 또한, 퇴원 당시에도 음식물 섭취가 많았다. 특히, 밤

History of Present Illness:
___ y/o F with PMHx of HTN who initially presented for an HCA  
visit last ___ with bilateral flank pain, lower abdominal 
pain, and dysuria. UA at that time showed pH 6.5, trace 
leukocytes, trace protein, trace blood, negative ketones, and 
negative glucose. She was given cipro and started on motrin 600 
mg TID. However, when cx returned negative, she was instructed 
to stop the cipro. She then experienced worsening symptoms, and 
presented back to her PCP on ___. Was started back on 
ciprofloxacin. Since then, she has had worsening bilateral ___ 
flank pain, radiating in the the lower abdomen.  She has no 
history of kidney stones, and this has never happened before.  
She developed more diffuse abdominal pain, some chills, as well 
as nausea and vomiting.  She came to the ED for further 
evaluation.  
.  
On arrival to the ED, the patient's VS were Temp:99.3 HR:89 
BP:163/102 Resp:18 O(2)Sat:98. Labs were significant for WBC of 
18, Cr of 1.2, and UA with 16 RBCs. Given concern for possible 
kidney stone, she underwent CT scan. This showed bilateral 
perinephric fat stranding, concerning for possible early / 
atypical pyelonephritis. The patient was discussed with the 
renal fellow. It was decided to tx empirically for pyelo and 
admit to medicine. Of note, the patient did have significant 
pain the ED, requiring IV morphine and dilaudid. VS prior to 
transfer 98.9 65 123/85 16 98%RA.  
.  
On arrival to the floor, the patient's VS were T 97.7, BP 
133/70, HR 54, RR 18, SaO2 96% on RA. This morning she reports 
that her abdominal pain was improved to ___ but still present. 
She has continued nausea and dysuria.  No fevers, chills, CP, 
SOB, hematuria, diarrhea, swelling or rashes.

Brief Hospital Course:
The patient is a ___ yo woman without significant PMH who 
presented from home with bilateral flank pain, chills, and 
dysuria, concerning for pyelonephritis.   
.
# Atypical pyelonephritis:  The patient presented with a 
five-day history of worsening flank pain, chills, and dysuria.  
In the ED, CT abdomen demonstrated stranding around both 
kidneys, concerning for early/atypical bilateral pyelonephritis, 
and she had a leukocytosis to 18K and lactate to 2.2.  She was 
started on IV Ceftriaxone in the ED, and her leukocytosis and 
pain improved.  She was discharged on a 14-day course of 
Cefpodoxime and remained afebrile during her hospitalization.  
She was treated with Tylenol for the flank pain and was able to 
tolerate a full diet prior to discharge.  Of note, the patient's 
two urine cultures on this admission both showed no growth; 
however, she had been treated with Cipro for 5 days prior to 
admission.  
.
# New epigastric pain:  The patient presented with at two-day 
history of epigastric pain, which occurred in the setting of 
NSAID use for her flank pain.  Lipase and LFTs were negative, 
and it was thought that her symptoms were most likely consistent 
with NSAID gastritis given recent intake.  She was started on 
Protonix and Sucralfate and was instructed to continue these 
medications until her follow-up appointment with Dr. ___ on 
___.
.
# ___ due to AIN:  The patient was found to have an elevated 
creatinine on admission, which further increased to 1.4, from 
her baseline of 0.7.  Her FeNa was 2.2% and she was found to 
have urine eos, which is consistent with acute interstitial 
nephritis.  This was likely secondary to either Cipro or 
Ibuprofen, and she was instructed to avoid both medications in 
the near future.  Her creatinine had decreased to 1.1 by the 
time of discharge.  
.
# HTN: The patient has a history of HTN, for which she takes 
HCTZ at home.  Given her acute renal failure, this medication 
was held on admission, and she was instructed to continue to 
hold it until her appointment with Dr. ___ on ___.  
 
Medications on Admission:
Atenolol 25 mg daily  
HCTZ 25 mg daily  
Motrin PRN  
Albuterol  
Ca
Nasal Spray

(1) Tablet, Delayed Release (E.C.) PO Q24H (every 24 hours) for 
13 days.
Disp:*13 Tablet, Delayed Release (E.C.)(s)* Refills:*0*
4. sucralfate 1 gram Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO QID (4 times 
a day) for 13 days.
Disp:*52 Tablet(s)* Refills:*0*
5. acetaminophen 325 mg Tablet Sig: Two (2) Tablet PO Q6H (every 
6 hours) as needed for pain.  
6. cefpodoxime 100 mg Tablet Sig: Two (2) Tablet PO Q12H (every 
12 hours) for 13 days.
Disp:*52 Tablet(s)* Refills:*0*

Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
PRIMARY:
Atypical bilateral pyelonephritis
NSAID gastritis
Acute interstitial nephritis due to NSAIDs and/or ciprofloxacin

SECONDARY:
High blood pressure

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
You were hospitalized for an infection of your kidneys.  You 
were treated with antibiotics and medicines to treat your pain 
and nausea, and your symptoms have improved.  Your abdominal 
pain is most likely due to your recent use of motrin, and has 
improved with medications.  You were also found to have acute 
kidney injury most likely due to recent use of motrin and/or 
ciprofloxacin, and your kidney function has improved during your 
stay.

While you were here we made the following changes to your 
medications:
1.  You were STARTED on cefpodoxime to treat your infection. 
Please continue taking this medication until ___.
2.  You were STARTED on protonix and sucralfate to treat your 
gastritis.  Please continue to take these medications until 
___.
3.  You were STARTED on Tylenol to treat your pain.  Please 
continue to take this medication as needed for pain.
4.  You were STARTED on Zofran, as needed for nausea over the 
next 2 days.
5. We STOPPED your Hydrochlorothiazide because of your elevated 
creatinine.  Please continue to hold this medication until you 
see your PCP.
6. We STOPPED your Motrin, as this likely caused inflammation of 
your stomach.
7. We STARTED you on Senna and Colace for your bowel movements.

It was a pleasure taking care of you!
