Brief Hospital Course:
___ year old man with symptomatic right carotid stenosis was 
brought to the operating room on ___ and underwent a right 
carotid endarterectomy.  The procedure was without 
complications. Postoperatively, he had several issues. 

1.TIA
On POD # 1 he developed a mild fluent expressive aphasia, 
significant for neologisms, with paraphasic errors (word 
substitution) and slight right facial asymmetry and dysarthria, 
without other focal deficits. MRI showed a New small foci of 
slow diffusion, in the left parietal lobe, which may  relate to 
small acute infarcts and stable small acute-subacute infarct in 
the right internal capsule. 
His symptoms completely resolved within a few hours after being 
started on a Heparin infusion.  Later in the day patient was 
noted to have new right neck swelling requiring surgical 
revision with hematoma evacuation.
 
2.Atrial Fibrillation
On POD # 5 Mr. ___ had episodes of artrial fibrillation with 
rapid venticular response. He was briefly on amiodarone. 
Cardiology was consulted who recommended anticoagulation as his 
___ score was 4.  They felt the bilateral nature of his 
original neurological deficet, dysarthria and left sided 
weakness, may have been secondary to atrial fib.  He was started 
on pradaxa and is presently in sinus rhythm.

3.Urinary Retention/UTI
Mr. ___ had several episodes of urinary retention with post 
void residuals of 250-300cc.  He had not been on his home med of 
doxazosin and he also had a urinary tract infection.  We 
restarted the doxazosin and treated his UTI with cipro.  He will 
follow up with his PCP regarding issue. 

He was cleared by speech and swallow for a regular diet.  He has 
no signs of aspiration. He is ambulatory with a slightly 
unsteady gait. He worked with physical therapy who recommended 
home with services.  She was discharged to home on POD #7 in 
stable condition.  Follow-up has been arranged with Dr. 
___ in one month with surveillance carotid duplex.

Discharge Instructions:
You were transferred to ___ from ___ for surgery 
to remove a blockage in your right carotid artery.  This was 
felt to be the cause of the left sided weakness and speech 
problems, called TIAs, that you had the day of admission. 

While you were in the hospital you had problems with an 
irregular heart rate called atrial fibrillation.

We have started you on new medications 
1.pradaxa-blood thinner to prevent complications of clots 
associated with this irregular heart rate.  
2.atorvastatin-for cholesterol
We have arranged follow up with a new cardiologist, Dr. ___.

You also had a problem with urinary tract infection and urinary 
retention, the inability to fully empty your bladder.

We have added new medications, Cipro, for the next 7 days  to 
treat the infection. 

Division of Vascular and Endovascular Surgery
Carotid Endarterectomy Surgery Discharge Instructions

What to expect when you go home:
1. Surgical Incision:
It is normal to have some swelling and feel a firm ridge along 
the incision
Your incision may be slightly red and raised, it may feel 
irritated from the staples

2. You may have a sore throat and/or mild hoarseness
Try warm tea, throat lozenges or cool/cold beverages 

3. You may have a mild headache, especially on the side of your 
surgery
Try ibuprofen, acetaminophen, or your discharge pain 
medication
If headache worsens, is associated with visual changes or 
lasts longer than 2 hours- call vascular surgeons office

4. It is normal to feel tired, this will last for ___ weeks 
You should get up out of bed every day and gradually increase 
your activity each day 
You may walk and you may go up and down stairs 
Increase your activities as you can tolerate- do not do too 
much right away!

5. It is normal to have a decreased appetite, your appetite will 
return with time 
You will probably lose your taste for food and lose some 
weight 
Eat small frequent meals
It is important to eat nutritious food options (high fiber, 
lean meats, vegetables/fruits, low fat, low cholesterol) to 
maintain your strength and assist in wound healing
To avoid constipation: eat a high fiber diet and use stool 
softener while taking pain medication

What activities you can and cannot do:
No driving until post-op visit and you are no longer taking 
pain medications
No excessive head turning, lifting, pushing or pulling 
(greater than 5 lbs) until your post op visit
You may shower (no direct spray on incision, let the soapy 
water run over incision, rinse and pat dry)
Your incision may be left uncovered, unless you have small 
amounts of drainage from the wound, then place a dry dressing 
over the area that is draining, as needed
Take all the medications you were taking before surgery, 
unless otherwise directed
Take one full strength (325mg) enteric coated aspirin daily, 
unless otherwise directed

인식 :
1. 새로운 작은 속도가 느리고 확산되는 점들이 왼쪽 측두엽에 있을 수 있고 소아성 급성 간질환에 관련될 수 있다.
2. 안정된 소아형 급성 하반신 마비가 오른 쪽 내재관에 있다.
3. 중등도의 사구체 증가가 볼륨 손실과 함께 혹은 신경계 aqueduct에 의해 나타난 부분으로 인해 발생할 수 있으며 최근 연구와 비교하여 짧은 시간 동안 변화가 없었다. 임상적으로 상호 작용하며 추적한다.

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ yo female with a h/o schizoaffective 
disorder and chronic kidney disease stage IV that was admitted 
for reported worsening renal function and a fall in her 
hematocrit.  Her Creatinine on admission was 2.8.  Urine culture 
was negative for infection and the urinalysis was unremarkable.  
She was started on IVF on admission as pt appeared dehydrated 
and Cr decreased from 2.8->2.5->2.3 on discharge.  Upon 
obtaining records from her Nephrologist Dr. ___ became 
aware the the pt has chronic kidney disease with a Cr of 2.4 in 
___.  Therefore it appears that the pt is at or slightly below 
her baseline renal function, which is chronically impaired 
reported secondary to a history of lithium toxicity.

#Acute kidney Injury - Her Creatinine on admission was 2.8.  
Urine culture was negative for infection and the urinalysis was 
unremarkable.  She was started on IVF on admission as pt 
appeared dehydrated and Cr decreased from 2.8->2.5->2.3 on 
discharge.  Upon obtaining records from her Nephrologist Dr. 
___ became aware the the pt has chronic kidney disease 
with a Cr of 2.4 in ___.  Therefore it appears that the pt is 
at or slightly below her baseline renal function, which is 
chronically impaired reported secondary to a history of lithium 
toxicity.

# Normocytic Anemia -  Most likely related to chronic renal 
failure. B12 and folate, TSH were within normal limits. Iron 
studies do not indicate deficiency.  LDH and retic count within 
normal limits ruling againt hemolytic cause. 

# Hypernatremia - Per reports, this is a chronic finding.  
Likely caused by decreased free water intake vs. chronic 
nephrogenic diabetes insipidus from previous lithium use. 

# Hyperkalemia - Likely related to renal failure. EKG shows no 
signs of hyperkalemia at this time.  Pt's potassium was lowered 
from 5.2 to 4.5 with a dose of kayexalate. 
  
# Psychiatric History - Pt is committed to ___.  
Appreciate psych recs. Needs 1:1 sitter given psych history.  No 
suicidal ideations/ hallucinations or delusions during her stay.

Pt will be discharged back to her residence at the ___.  
She should have apppropriate follow up with her nephrologist Dr. 
___ to monitor her CKD and f/u with her PCP for an ___ 
anemia work-up.

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,
     It was a pleasure taking care of you at ___ 
___.  You were admitted with what appeared 
to be a worsening of your renal function and a drop in your 
blood count.  We recieved records from your nephrologist that 
you actually have chronic kidney disease and your kidney 
function was close to normal.  We gave you fluids to rehydrate 
you and your kidney function returned to your baseline.  We ran 
a number of tests to find out the cause of your anemia.  We 
believe it may be related to your chronic kidney disease.  You 
will follow up with your primary care provider to look for the 
definitive cause.

이름은 ____이고, 그녀는 __에 입원하여 심장 기능의 악화와 혈액 수치 감소를 이유로 ED에서 평가를 받았다고 한다. 전송된 보고서에 따르면, 크는 _____이었으며, 또한 그녀의 HCT가 35·7→27·7 → 29·4까지 떨어졌다. 고혈압이나 당뇨병 등의 과거 병력이 없다고 주장하였다.
ED에서는 초기 VS 16도 98퍼센트였다. 환자는 배변 검사를 거부하고 소변을 바닥에 뿌렸다. 실험실 결과는 정상적인 빈혈으로 나타났으며, 크기는 2·8였으며, BNU는 54였으며 나트륨은 148였으며 칼륨 5·2이었다. 위험 유체 부위 음극전위음파검사는 음반 없었다. 그녀는 1리정규수를 받았고 이환 시 Vital은 97·6포, 86, 128/88, 13, 99 퍼센트 였다. 정신과 진단은 없었다.
현재 환자는 졸음을 느끼고 있다. 고지혈증이나 당디버프 등 이전 병력이 없다. 지난 몇 날 동안 화학 반응이 있는 것이 있다고 말하며 증상을 호소하지 않았다. 열감이나 발열은 없었으나 두통이 있었지만 치료받지는 못했다. 식물 섭취량은 많은 양의 포도당 음료나 커피만 마셨다. 물에는 관심이 없는 것으로 보인다. 최근 변한 것은 아니며 가족 중에서도 다른 질환이 있었다.

Brief Hospital Course:
The patient was admitted to the orthopaedic surgery service and 
was taken to the operating room for above described procedure. 
Please see separately dictated operative report for details. The 
surgery was uncomplicated and the patient tolerated the 
procedure well. Patient received perioperative IV antibiotics.

Postoperative course was remarkable for the following:

1. Renal co-management ___ hs renal transplant.

2. Social Work consult

Otherwise, pain was initially controlled with a PCA followed by 
a transition to oral pain medications on POD#1.  The patient 
received lovenox for DVT prophylaxis starting on the morning of 
POD#1.  The foley was removed on POD#2 and the patient was 
voiding independently thereafter. The patient was seen daily by 
physical therapy. Labs were checked throughout the hospital 
course and repleted accordingly. At the time of discharge the 
patient was tolerating a regular diet and feeling well.  The 
patient was afebrile with stable vital signs.  The patient's 
hematocrit was acceptable and pain was adequately controlled on 
an oral regimen. The operative extremity was neurovascularly 
intact and the wound was benign.

tolerated on the operative extremity. No ROM.

Discharge Diagnosis:
Bilateral quad tendon rupture
 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - requires assistance or aid (walker 
or cane).
 
Discharge Instructions:
1. Please return to the emergency department or notify your 
physician if you experience any of the following: severe pain 
not relieved by medication, increased swelling, decreased 
sensation, difficulty with movement, fevers greater than 101.5, 
shaking chills, increasing redness or drainage from the incision 
site, chest pain, shortness of breath or any other concerns.
 
2. Please follow up with your primary physician regarding this 
admission and any new medications and refills. 
 
3. Resume your home medications unless otherwise instructed.
 
4. You have been given medications for pain control. Please do 
not drive, operate heavy machinery, or drink alcohol while 
taking these medications. As your pain decreases, take fewer 
tablets and increase the time between doses. This medication can 
cause constipation, so you should drink plenty of water daily 
and take a stool softener (such as colace) as needed to prevent 
this side effect.  Call your surgeons office 3 days before you 
are out of medication so that it can be refilled.  These 
medications cannot be called into your pharmacy and must be 
picked up in the clinic or mailed to your house.  Please allow 
an extra 2 days if you would like your medication mailed to your 
home.
 
5. You may not drive a car until cleared to do so by your 
surgeon.
 
6. Keep fiberglass cast clean and dry. Any stitches or staples 
that need to be removed will be taken out at your follow-up 
visit in three (3) weeks after your surgery.
 
7. Please call your surgeon's office to schedule or confirm your 
follow-up appointment in three (3) weeks.
 
8. Please DO NOT take any non-steroidal anti-inflammatory 
medications (NSAIDs such as celebrex, ibuprofen, advil, aleve, 
motrin, etc).
 
9. ANTICOAGULATION: Please continue your lovenox for four (4) 
weeks to help prevent deep vein thrombosis (blood clots).  If 
you were taking aspirin prior to your surgery, it is OK to 
continue at your previous dose while taking this medication.  
___ STOCKINGS x 6 WEEKS.
 
10. WOUND CARE: Please keep your cast clean and dry. Staples 
will be removed at your follow-up visit in three (3) weeks.
 
11. ___ (once at home): Home ___, dressing changes as 
instructed, and wound checks.
 
12. ACTIVITY: Weight bearing as tolerated bilaterally. No ROM. 
BLE locked in full extension x 6 weeks.

No ROM
Locked extension x 6 weeks
Mobilize
Treatment Frequency:

Monitor skin tears on buttocks and dress prn

신체 검사 : 안정 상태에서 통증이 잘 조절되고 있다. 호흡기계는 정상이며 심혈관계도 정상이다. 소화기계와 장기계의 기능은 모두 정상이고 뇌내 혈액 흐름도 정상의 상태를 유지하고 있으며 정신적으로도 평온한 상태로 나타났다. 피부 상처는 아프다. 하지 근육계는 섬유강철 캐스트가 양쪽 무릎을 고정시키고 있고 말단에는 실리콘 코팅이 되어 있어 손발이 따뜻하다.

검사 결과 : 당뇨병 환자는 다음과 같은 검사를 받았다. Blood WBC 8.26 RBC 3.294 HGB 8.96% HCT 28.42% MCV 85.93 MCH 27.05 MCH C 30.95 RDW 15.04 PLT 123000 Blood WRC 9.83 RBC3.34 * HGB9.03* HCT28.94* MCV87.01 MCH27.51 MCHCC31.64 RDW15.43 PLT120000 Blood 9:24 AM WBC8.23 RBC334* HGB10.19* HECT32.36* MCB86.92 MCH2729RDW160PLT110000 BloodGlucose102UrenaN15Creat132Na136K4.38Cl103HCO322AnGap1610700BloodGlucose107Urena117Creat133Na138K4.82Cl104HCO324AnGap1810200BloodCalcium9.53Phosphorus282Magnesium1620600BloodCa9.81Phosphorous333 Magnesium1820620BloodTacrolimus3690900Bloodcalcium9.55phosphorus283magnesium1630620BLOODENOXAPARINSAFORTHEFIRSTDOSEONPODI BloodGlucosenochange BloodureaNnochange Bloodcreatininochangenochange Blood sodium normal Blood potassium normal Blood chloride normal Blood bicarbonate normal Blood anion gap normal Blood calcium 9.54 phosphorus 284 magnesium 1640620 Blood tacrolimus no change Blood glucose 106 urea nitrogen 118 creatinine 134 sodium 139 potassium 4.91 chloride 105 bicarbonate 25 aniongap 1710200 Blood blood pressure 14090 mmhg pulse rate 88 respiratoryrate 20 oxygen saturation 97 % heart rate 72 beats/min abdomen tenderness present bowel sounds present rectal tone good anal sphincter tight Skin intact Neurological examination revealed no abnormal findings except some numbness in both legs which resolved spontaneously within several hours. She had no fever and all peripheral pulses were palpable. Her mental status was clear and cooperative. She denied any history of trauma or injury. On physical exam, she appeared acutely ill but comfortable. She was able to move all extremities against resistance. All reflexes were symmetric and active. There was no evidence of meningismus. Cranial nerves II through XII were grossly intact. Sensory testing showed diminished sensation below the knees. Motor strength was graded 5/5 proximally and 4+/5 distally. Deep tendon reflexes elicited brisk responses. Plantar flexion was absent. Bilateral lower extremity wounds were noted. Pain management: Initially managed with PCA then switched to oral meds. Foley catheter placed postoperatively. Post op day one started Lovenox for VTE prevention. Follow up labs: Complete blood count, electrolytes, liver function tests, kidney function test, urinalysis, urine culture. Urine output adequate. Chest X-ray unremarkable. Electrocardiogram shows sinus rhythm. Abdominal ultrasound reveals mild gallbladder wall thickening. Prostate gland size normal. Hemoglobin level slightly low. White blood cell count elevated. Platelet count normal. Serum troponin negative. Troponin I positive. Hepatitis panel negative. HIV antibody negative. Syphilis serology negative. Pregnancy test negative. Tuberculosis screen negative. Thyroid profile normal. Vitamin B12 deficiency suspected. Vitamin D deficient. Calcium supplementation recommended. Medications

Discharge Instructions:
It was a pleasure to take care of you after your surgery. You 
have adequate pain control and have tolerated a regular diet and 
are ready for discharge back to extended care facility. 
Please resume all regular home medications, unless specifically 
advised not to take a particular medication and take any new 
medications as prescribed. You will be given a prescription for 
narcotic pain medication, take as prescribed. It is recommended 
that you take a stool softner such as Colace while taking oral 
narcotic pain medication to prevent constipation. You may also 
take acetaminophen (Tylenol) as directed, but do not exceed 4000 
mg in one day. Please get plenty of rest, continue to walk 
several times per day, and drink adequate amounts of fluids. 
Incision Care:
Please call your surgeon or go to the emergency department if 
you have increased pain, swelling, redness, or drainage from the 
incision site.You may shower and wash incisions with a mild soap 
and warm water.Avoid swimming and baths until cleared by your 
surgeon.Gently pat the area dry.You have a neck incision with 
steri-strips in place, do not remove, they will fall off on 
their own. 
Thank you for allowing us to participate in your care! Our hope 
is that you will have a quick return to your life and usual 
activities. Good luck!

Home

cervical stenosis

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Surgery

Your incision is closed with dissolvable sutures underneath the 
skin and steri strips. You do not need suture removal. Do not 
remove your steri strips, let them fall off.
Please keep your incision dry for 72 hours after surgery.
Please avoid swimming for two weeks.
Call your surgeon if there are any signs of infection like 
redness, fever, or drainage. 

Activity
We recommend that you avoid heavy lifting, running, climbing, or 
other strenuous exercise until your follow-up appointment.
You make take leisurely walks and slowly increase your activity 
at your own pace. ___ try to do too much all at once.
No driving while taking any narcotic or sedating medication. 
No contact sports until cleared by your neurosurgeon. 
Do NOT smoke. Smoking can affect your healing and fusion.

Medications
Please do NOT take any blood thinning medication (Aspirin, 
Ibuprofen, Plavix, Coumadin) until cleared by the neurosurgeon. 
Do not take any anti-inflammatory medications such as Motrin, 
Advil, Aspirin, and Ibuprofen etc for 2 weeks.
You may use Acetaminophen (Tylenol) for minor discomfort if you 
are not otherwise restricted from taking this medication.
It is important to increase fluid intake while taking pain 
medications. We also recommend a stool softener like Colace. 
Pain medications can cause constipation. 

When to Call Your Doctor at ___ for:
Severe pain, swelling, redness or drainage from the incision 
site. 
Fever greater than 101.5 degrees Fahrenheit
New weakness or changes in sensation in your arms or legs.

간단한 병동 경과 :
 환자는 선택적으로 C5 - 6 AC DFS로 입원을 했다. intraoperative에서 환자는 외상 적 인공호흡기를 통해 연하구 가려움증을 얻었고 ENT가 이를 삽았다. 나머지 수술은 합병증 없이 진행되었고 그녀는 수술실에서 확관되었다. 그리고 그녀가 further care를 위해서는 PACU로 옮겨졌다., 밤새 102.8도였다. 주문된 CXR 및 UA / UC. mobilize하고 visco lidocain과 마취 목걸이를 추가했다., 아침에 보였는데 목 부종이 약간 증가했고 숨쉬기가 어려웠다. 결정으로 OR로 이동하기로 했고 수술 잘 갔다. 계속해서 intubate하여 ICU로 옴겼다., 환자는 안정 상태였다. 음식물 섭취 시작했으며 그것을 잘 견딘다. 음성 및 삼킴 상담을 받아서 식이 요법 변경을 추천받았다., 그 환인은 안정이었다. 음향 및 삼키기는 얇게 된 음식을 권장한다. 환자는 집으로 출발할 준비가 되었다. 그는 안정 조건으로 집으로 방뇨되었다. 그녀는 독립적으로 걸어 다녔지만...

Brief Hospital Course:
Mr. ___ is a ___ with intractable paranoid schizophrenia, 
hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and cerebrovascular accident 
without residual deficits who was found to be unresponsive in 
bed at his group home.

Active Issues:
# Loss of consciousness: The cause of his loss of consciousness 
was not entirely clear, but was felt in discussion with the 
psychiatry service to be most likely oversedation from multiple 
antipsychotic medications. IM risperidone monotherapy, with 
discontinuation of PO risperidone and PO clozapine, was advised 
henceforward to avoid oversedation. Noncontrast head CT was 
negative for acute intracranial pathology while CTA chest was 
negative for pulmonary embolism or other thoracic pathology. 
There was low suspicion for acute coronary syndrome in the 
absence of acute ischemic EKG changes or troponinemia, and 
cardiac arrhythmia, particularly Torsades in the setting of 
multiple QTc prolonging agents, was felt to be unlikely, given 
nonprolonged QTc on admission and no further events on 
telemetry. In the setting of mild hyponatremia, EEG was negative 
for seizure activity. He was reportedly euglycemic when found 
unresponsive at his nursing, effectively precluding 
hypo/hyperglycemic episode. While he required intubation for 
airway protection in the ___ ED, he was extubated soon after 
arrival to the MICU and remained alert and oriented x3, calm, 
and appropriately interactive without recollection of his reason 
for admission throughout the remainder of admission.   

# Hyponatremia: Mild hyponatremia to 127 likely reflected 
hypovolemic hyponatremia, given improvement to 133 at discharge 
following gentle IV hydration.  

# Paranoid schizophrenia: As above, oversedation from multiple 
antipsychotic medications was felt to be most likely responsible 
for transient unresponsiveness. In discussion with the 
psychiatry service, IM risperidone monotherapy, with 
discontinuation of PO risperidone and PO clozapine, was advised 
henceforward to avoid oversedation. Following extubation, he 
remained alert and oriented x3, calm, and appropriately 
interactive without recollection of his reason for admission 
throughout the remainder of admission.   

Inactive Issues:
# Diabetes mellitus: Home oral regimen was held in favor of 
Humalog insulin sliding scale in house, with resumption of home 
glipizide and metformin at discharge.

# Hypertension: Home metoprolol and lisinopril were continued 
throughout admission.

# Hyperlipidemia: Home simvastatin was continued.

# GERD: Home omeprazole was continued.

Transitional Issues:
* Avoidance of PO clozapine and PO risperidone is advised by the 
psychiatry service to prevent oversedation.
* Thyroid ultrasound is advised for further evaluation of 
incidentally noted thyroid isthmus prominence on CTA head/neck.
* Hematuria on multiple urinalyses is presumed secondary to 
traumatic Foley insertion, but repeat urinalysis is advised in 
the outpatient setting to ensure resolution of hematuria.
* Pending studies: Blood cultures x2 (___).
* Code status: Full.

 
Medications on Admission:
The Preadmission Medication list is accurate and complete.
1. Bisacodyl 10 mg PO/PR DAILY:PRN constipation 
2. Clozapine 150 mg PO QAM 
3. Clozapine 350 mg PO HS 
4. Fleet Enema ___AILY:PRN constipation 
5. FoLIC Acid 1 mg PO DAILY 
6. GlipiZIDE 10 mg PO BID 
7. Lactulose 15 mL PO Q8H:PRN constipation 
8. Lisinopril 2.5 mg PO DAILY 
9. Metoprolol Tartrate 25 mg PO BID 
10. MetFORMIN (Glucophage) 1000 mg PO BID 
11. Milk of Magnesia 30 mL PO Q6H:PRN constipation 
12. Multivitamins 1 TAB PO DAILY 
13. Omeprazole 20 mg PO DAILY 
14. RISperidone Long Acting Injection 50 mg IM Q2W (MO) 
15. RISperidone 12 mg PO HS 
16. Acetaminophen 650 mg PO Q6H:PRN pain 
17. Simvastatin 40 mg PO DAILY 

 
Discharge Medications:

4. Milk of Magnesia 30 mL PO Q6H:PRN constipation 
5. Multivitamins 1 TAB PO DAILY 
6. Omeprazole 20 mg PO DAILY

12. GlipiZIDE 10 mg PO BID

14. Fleet Enema ___AILY:PRN constipation

Extended Care

___

Loss of consciousness

 
Discharge Condition:

Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

It was a pleasure taking part in your care during your admission 
to ___. As you know, you were 
admitted because you were found unresponsive and unconscious in 
your bed at your group home. You were intubated to make sure you 
could continue breathing safely, and then mechanically 
ventilated (a machine breathed for you for a few hours). You 
were transfered to the ICU, where you were extubated. The 
psychiatry team evaluated you and decided that the event was 
most likely due to too much antipsychotic medication, and they 
recommended that you take only Risperdal and not Clozaril. 

We wish you all the best in the future.

이름 : ________________________
Unit No : ___________________________

입원일자 : _______________________________
출 viện 일자 : ________________________________________________________

생년월일 : _______________________ 성별 : 남성

서비스 : 내과

알레르기 및 부작용 :
아무 알레르기가 없으며, 약물 반응도 없다.

진료 의사 : ________.

주소 불만 사항 :
반응성이 없는 상태이다.

중재술 :
 기계적 환기를 통해 삽관하였다.

병력 개요 :
___는 인내할 수 없는 우울증을 가진 사람으로서, 고혈압, 당뇨병, 뇌졸중 후유증 없이 집에서 침상에 누워 발견되었다. 그는 오랜 기간 동안의 우울 증후군은 여러 항정신제를 거부했지만 현재 복용 중인 클로자핀과 리스페리돈이었다. 입원 전날에는 평소와 같이 건강했다고 보고되었으나 담배 한 대 피운 뒤 방 안으로 들어갔다가 몇 시간 후 무감각 상태로 발견되었다.

수술 기록 :
삶장 시술 : 기계적인 호흡 보호를 위해 삽입된 것이다.

현황 :
우울증, 고 혈압 및 당뱅이가 있다. 그는 그룹 홈에서 침대에 누웠다가 발견되어 병원을 찾았다. 그의 가족은 그를 잘못 이해하고 있다고 생각한다. 그는 자신의 치료법을 거부했고, 자신에게 해로운 것으로 믿었다. 다음 날 아침에 흉부 촬영 결과 정상이며, 심전도는 비정상적으로 나타났다. 또한, 그는 흥분한 상태였다. 그는 자발적으로 움직였고, 경련이나 다른 이상 징후는 없었다. 그러나 그는 정신 질환자가 아니라는 것을 보여주는 것이 필요하다. 따라서, 그는 정신질환이 있는지 여부를 확인하기 위한 추가 검사를 받게 되었다.

Name:  ___                  Unit No:   ___

Service: UROLOGY

Chief Complaint:
Left ureteral stone
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
Left ureteral stent placement

 
History of Present Illness:
___ is a ___ male with nephrolithiasis. He has a 5x5 mm left
ureteral stone, in the mid ureter, Cr elevated to 1.8. Planned 
for left u-scope/LL but was febrile to 101.2F in preop holding. 
 
Past Medical History:
FATIGUE                                                         
HEALTH MAINTENANCE                                              
ERYTHROCYTOSIS                                                  
TINNITUS                                                        
NUMBNESS                                                        
SLEEP APNEA                                                     
RHINITIS                                                        
CORONARY ARTERY DISEASE
INGUINAL HERNIA                                                 
  on right, x two 
LAD stent in ___, on ASA and plavix
                                        
 
Social History:
___
Family History:
Non-contributory
 
Physical Exam:
Afebrile, vital signs stable
No acute distress
Warm and well-perfused
Non-labored breathing
Abdomen soft, non-tender, non-distended
Urine pink tinged
 
Pertinent Results:
___ 10:00AM   UREA N-25* CREAT-1.8* SODIUM-142 
POTASSIUM-4.6 CHLORIDE-105 TOTAL CO2-27 ANION GAP-15
___ 10:00AM   CALCIUM-9.2
 
Brief Hospital Course:
The patient was admitted to Dr. ___ service from 
the ___ ED for overnight observation, pain control, and IV 
fluids. He failed to void post-operatively and required Foley 
catheter placement which was complicated by gross hematuria. He 
required continuous bladder irrigation which was titrated to 
clear. His hematuria resolved and his catheter was removed. He 
was then able to void without difficulty.  He was tolerating a 
regular diet.  He was given Toradol and Flomax to help stent 
pain and to facilitate passage of his stone.  At discharge, 
patient's pain well controlled with oral pain medications, 
tolerating regular diet, ambulating without assistance, and 
voiding without difficulty. He is given explicit instructions to 
call Dr. ___ follow-up.
 
Medications on Admission:
1. Acetaminophen 325-650 mg PO Q6H:PRN pain, fever>100 
2. Aspirin 325 mg PO DAILY 
3. Clopidogrel 75 mg PO DAILY
4. Nitroglycerin SL 0.4 mg SL PRN chest pain 
 
Discharge Medications:
1. Acetaminophen 325-650 mg PO Q6H:PRN pain, fever>100 
2. Aspirin 325 mg PO DAILY 
3. Clopidogrel 75 mg PO DAILY 
4. Docusate Sodium 100 mg PO BID 
5. Nitroglycerin SL 0.4 mg SL PRN chest pain 
6. Oxycodone-Acetaminophen (5mg-325mg) 1 TAB PO Q4H:PRN 
breakthrough pain only(score>4) 
7. Tamsulosin 0.4 mg PO HS 

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Urolithiasis

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
-You can expect to see occasional blood in your urine and to 
possibly experience some urgency and frequency over the next 
month; this may be related to the passage of stone fragments or 
the indwelling ureteral stent.

-The kidney stone may or may not have been removed AND/or there 
may fragments/others still in the process of passing.

-You may experience some pain associated with spasm of your 
ureter. This is normal. Take the narcotic pain medication as 
prescribed if additional pain relief is needed. Flomax is also 
prescribed and will help with stent-related pain and stone 
passage

-Ureteral stents MUST be removed or exchanged and therefore it 
is IMPERATIVE that you follow-up as directed. 

-Do not lift anything heavier than a phone book (10 pounds) 

-You may continue to periodically see small amounts of blood in 
your urine--this is normal and will gradually improve

-Resume all of your pre-admission medications, except HOLD 
aspirin until you see your urologist in follow-up 

-You may have burning with urination. This is normal after 
cystoscopy and will self resolve

-Colace has been prescribed to avoid post surgical constipation 
and constipation related to narcotic pain medication. 
Discontinue if loose stool or diarrhea develops. Colace is a 
stool softener, NOT a laxative, and available over the counter. 
The generic name is DOCUSATE SODIUM. It is recommended that you 
use this medication.

-Do not eat constipating foods for ___ weeks, drink plenty of 
fluids to keep hydrated
 
Followup Instructions:
___

간단한 입원 경과 : 환자는 야간 관찰, 통증 조절 및 IV 액체를 위해 ED에서 Dr._ 의무실로 이송되었다. 그는 수술 후 배액되지 않았으며 피제강으로 인해 복잡했다. 지속적인 방광 세척이 필요했고 청산된 것으로 해결되었고 카테터 제거 후 정상적으로 배출할 수 있었다. 일반 식단을 허용받았고 토돌과 플로맥스를 통해 석회암 통과와 고통 완화를 받았다. 퇴원 시, 치료제는 오염 상태였지만, 그의 혈뇰은 사라졌고 카 테터는 제거되었다. 그가 쉽게 배출될 수 있었고, 그는 주치의에게 명확히 설명되어야 한다.

퇴원 약 물 : ①Ac e tamino phen 325 ~650 mg Po q6 h Pr n Pain, Fever>100②As p irin 3 25 mg Po Daily③Clo pi do g re l 75 m g Po Da il y④D oc us ate So di um 100 m g P o Bi d ⑤Nit ro gly cer i n Sl 0.4 m g Sl Pr n Ch est Pa in ⑥O xy co de ne Ac etamino ph en (5m g 3.25 m g ) 1 Tab Po Q4 h Pr N Break th rough pa in On ly Sc ore >4 ⑦Ta msu lo si n 0 4 m G Po hs

퇴원의 처방 : 집

퇴근 진단 : 비루리탈리아즘

퇴직 상태 : 정신 상태 : 명백하고 일관되다. 각성 수준 : 깨어 있고 상호 작용한다. 활동 상태 : 보행 - 독립적이다.

퇴근 지침 : - 당신은 때때로 혈소를 볼 수 있으며 다음 달 동안 일부 긴장감이나 빈도를 경험할 수 있습니다. 이것은 돌조각 또는 삽인 요도 절개 관련일 수 있습니다.

- 그 돌은 혹여서라도 제거되었거나 여전히 가래질 중일 수도 있습니다.

-u re teral 스테인은 반드시 제거하거나 교환해야 하므로 직접 지시대로 추후 검사를 받아야 합니다.

- 아무것도 더 무겁지 않도록 하지 마세요.

- 당신은 계속해서 간헐적으로 소량의 혈장을 볼 수 있지만 이는 정상이며 점차 좋아질 것입니다.

- 모든 예전 약물을 다시 시작하여 아스피린은 추후에만 사용하세요.

- 소변 속에는 화학이 있을 수 있습니다 그러나 이것은 종합 성격이고 스스로 해소됩니다.

- 콜락은 포스터 대변 연기를 막기 위한 것이며 변비나 위약 때문에 발생하는 변비를 막습니다. 디스크는 엉덩이를 감싸고 있는 것처럼 느껴

Brief Hospital Course:
___ y/o female with hepatitis C cirrhosis and HCC recently listed 
for liver transplant who received an offer for liver transplant. 
The patient was taken to the OR with Dr ___ who 
performed the hepatectomy, and Dr ___ who completed 
the transplant.
There were no complications reported during the surgery, and she 
received four liters crystalloid, 1 unit of FFP, 500 mg of 
albumin. She was transferred to the surgical ICU still intubated 
but stable.
The patient received routine induction immunosuppression to 
include 500 mg solumedrol intra-op, cellcept prior to the 
surgery. Tacrolimus was started on the evening of POD 1.

On Post day 0 a liver ultrasound was obtained showing patent 
hepatic arteries immediately post-transplant, but arterial 
waveforms are moderately abnormal with reduced resistive 
indices, though preserved rate of systolic upstroke.
Liver function tests intially increased significatly, however 
they have trended down daily except the alk phos which was 
trending down, then on POD 3 it has started to increase again. 
It was stably elevated to 210 on POD 4 and 5, Total bilirubin 
was 0.8 on POD 5.

Follow up ultrasounds were performed on POD 1, POD 2 and POD 4. 
The ultrasound on POD 4 reports "Patent hepatic vasculature with 
improved arterial waveforms". 

Patient received routine induction immunosuppression following 
solumedrol taper and transition to oral prednisone, she remains 
on 1 gram BID of cellcept, and tacrolimus levels have been drawn 
daily with adjustments to dosing per level.

The patient has been advanced to a regular diet with good 
tolerance, is ambulating easily and is cleared for home. She has 
received the transplant teaching manual and medications have 
been reviewed with nursing, pharmacist and coordinators. Of note 
the patient has been struggling with constipation and was sent 
home with an aggressive bowel regimen.

On POD 5 she was noted to have increased LFTs across the board, 
and another liver ultrasound was obtained. Per the ultrasound 
report; Patent hepatic vasculature.  There is a region of 
turbulent high velocity arterial flow in the anterior right lobe 
of the liver contaminated with venous flow.  This appearance is 
consistent with an AV fistula.  
The following day the LFTs were still elevated but stable from 
the previous day.

The patient was otherwise doing very well and it was determined 
she could be discharged to home with lab followup 2 days 
following discharge.

and you may supplement with things like carnation instant

translated:
이름 : ______
부호번호 : ______

입원일자 : ______    퇴원일 자 : ______


생년월일 : ______     성별 : 여성

서비스 : 외과

알레르기 및 이상반응 : 알레르기가 없으며, 약물에 대한 과민증도 없다.


진료 의사 : ______.

주소 불만 사항 :
C형 간염으로 인한 간경화로 간 이식 수술을 받으려 한다.

수술 내역 :
_____: 간 이식을 시행하였다.

병력 개요 :
_____은 음주와 C형 간경화를 동반하여 최근 RFA 절제술을 시행받고 있다. 환자는 과거에는 알코올 중독과 C형간경화가 있었으나 현재는 소금 물을 마시지 않는다. 또한 몇 년 전의 혈액전환 후 C형 감염이 있었다. 이후 정기적인 검사를 받아서 병력이 있다.

현재 증상 :
현재는 RFA를 한 달 전에 시행받았던 상태에서 회복되고 있으며, 최근 여행을 다녀왔다. 발열이나 기침 없이 무감각이며, 흉통이나 복통도 없었다. 식욕 부진도 없었고, 설사나 황달도 없었다.

구체적 병력 :
위장관 출혈이 있어 위장관출혈 치료를 받았다. 그리고 최근에 RFA 시술을 하였다. 그후 회복되어 최근에 여행을 갔다. 다른 것은 없음이다.

임상 소견 :
VS: 98.5%, 69세, 체중 155kg/85kg, 신장 18cm, 호흡률 97%

일반적으로 안정된 상태이고, 침대에 누워있다. HEENT: 각막색소양, 점막 유분유리, 코는 맑음, 기관지는 가운데 위치. CV: 심박동맥 저하. 홀오스톨릭 현저음이 있고 강직음이 있다. 폐: 청진 가능하며 모든폐부에서 양호하다. 복부: 장음이 나며 잘 닫힌 미들라인 복숭아절개술과 왼쪽 측면 2 cm의 상처가 있다. 온뿔살이 있고 뚜렷하지 않다. MSK: 따뜻하고 잘 공급된다. 2+ 피판 염증이 있는 두말이다. 촉진 가능한 지표가 있다.

관련 결과 :
입원 당시 WBC- 8.45, RBC - 4.07*, HGB - 13.50, HCT - 40.80, MCV - 100 *, MCH - 33.20 *, MHC - 32.90 RDW - 12.40 PLT - 12300 PTT - 30.80 *** Glucose - 74 Urean - 11.99 Creatinine - 0.55 Na - 134.70 K - 3.60 CL - 91.50 AnGAP - 19 ALT - 31 AST - 73 ** Alkaline phosphatase - 176** Bilirubin - 1.08 Albumin -3.00***Calcium - 9.10 Phosphorus - 44.50 MG - 150***

단순 입원 과정 :
여성이 C형 Hepatitis Cirrhosis와 HCC로 최근 등록되었는데, 최근에 간 이송을 받게 되었다. 환자가 Dr. _____에게 간 절제를 하고 Dr. ____ 에 의해 이식되었다. 수술 중 문제점은 없었으며, 4L Crystalloid, FFP 1U, albumin 500mg을 주었다. 환자를 수술실 ICUs로 옮겼다. 환자의 일차 면역 억제는 Cellcept 이전에 수행했으며, Tacrolmus는 POD 01 밤에 시작했다.

POD 0일 간 초음파를 얻었는데, 간 혈관이 즉시 포스트 트랜스플란트 되지만 아테리아 웨이폼이 경미하게 비정상적이었다. 초기 간 기능 테스트는 증가했지만 매일 떨어졌다. 그러나 알칼라인 인산염은 매일 내려갔다가 POD 03부터 다시 증가하기 시작했고 POD 05까지 210으로 고르게 유지되었다. 총 빌리루빈은 POD 04에서 0 8였다.

추적 초음 파는 POD1, 02, 04에 실시되었다. 초음波는 POD4에 보고되는데, '허혈 관'이라고 했다. 환인은 수용성 면역억제를 통해 진행되었으며, Cellcept 1g B

Brief Hospital Course:
___ man with Graves disease, atrial flutter, and relapsed lung 
cancer admitted for hematuria and epistaxis due to coagulopathy 
from supratherapeutic warfarin.  He was given vitamin K in the 
ED and his INR decreased from 8.5/15.7 to 3.3.  Hematuria then 
diminished and epistaxis resolved.  His chronic headache however 
had been worse than usual x3d.  CT head PRELIM was negative.  As 
an outpatient, warfarin was resumed at 3mg daily (down from 4mg 
daily).
.
# Coagulpathy: PTT elevated chronically due to lupus 
anticoagulant.  CT head looking for bleed.  Restarted warfarin 
at 3mg daily if head CT is negative.  F/U INR in several days.  
Outpatient F/U with Urology for hematuria.  He had a recent 
(___) prostate biopsy for an elevated PSA.  Biopsy was 
negative.
- PENDING urine culture.
- F/U Urology for hematuria.
.
# Atrial flutter: Restart warfarin now that INR is nearly 
therapeutic after vitamin K.  He may become subtherapeutic from 
the vitamin K, so INR will need to be rechecked in a couple days 
as an outpatient.  Continued outpatient metoprolol for rate 
control.
.
# Lung CA, relapsed: Finished chemo (cisplatin and etoposide 
concurrent with XRT) ___.  Radiation therapy given ___, 
last fraction.  Anti-emetics PRN.  Magic Mouth wash for 
mucositis.
.
# Neutropenia/anemia: Due to chemo.  Anemia mild, neutropenia 
moderately severe.  Neutropenic precautions.
.
# Graves disease: Methimazole on hold while on chemo due to 
expected chemo-induced myelosuppression.  TSH normal.
.
# HTN: Mild.  Continued metoprolol.
.
# Pain (headache): Acute on chronic.  Likely chronic migraine.  
CT head prelim negative.  Acetaminophen PRN.
.
# FEN: Regular diet.
.
# GI PPx: PPI with bleeding.  Bowel regimen.
.
# DVT PPx: Warfarin.
.
# Precautions: None.
.
# Lines: Peripheral IV.
.
# CODE: FULL.

Discharge Diagnosis:
1. Hematuria (blood in urine).
2. Epistaxis (nose bleed).
3. Coagulopathy (blood too thin).
4. Lung cancer.

warfarin).
 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.
 
Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted to the hospital for hematuria (blood in the 
urine), a nose bleed, and coagulopathy (blood too thin) from 
warfarin (Coumadin).  It is not clear why the blood became too 
thin, but when you restart the warfarin at home, the dose should 
be decreased back to 3mg daily.  You must have the INR level 
checked in a few days.  While you were in the hospital, you were 
given vitamin K to reverse the warfarin (Coumadin), you had 
radiation therapy to complete treatment for the lung cancer, and 
you had a CT of the head to make sure there was no bleeding in 
the head.  The PRELIMINARY report of the head CT was normal.  
Please ask your physicians for the final report on the CT scan.
.
MEDICATION CHANGES: RESTART WARFARIN AT 3MG DAILY.

translated:
이름 : ______.

입원일자 : ____.

생년월일 : ____ 성별 : 남성.

서비스 : 의학과.

알레르기 : Advil/Naprosyn/Robitussing Night Time Cold/Motrin.

진료의사 : ____.

주소 불만 사항 :
에피스타키스와 혈뇨가 있다.

수술 및 침습적 절차 :
없음.

병력 개요 :
환자는 남자로, 병력이 있는데, 그 중에서 폐암을 동반한 경우는 없다. 환자가 최근에 흉부 전문의에게서 받은 치료를 거절하였다. 현재 환자의 상태는 에피스타キ스가 있고, 혈액 검사는 정상이다. 또한 환자는 과민증과 관련된 증상을 호소하고 있으며, 이는 환자의 심장 부정맥으로 인해 발생하는 것으로 추측된다. 환자는 지난 주에 수축기 기능 이상이 없었으며, 이 외에도 다른 질환이나 약물 복용 등은 없었다. 

사회력 :
__ 년도 만 70세.

 가족력 :
폐암이나 기타 암이 알려져 있지 않다. 환아는 유일 자녀이며, 그의 아버지는 사망했다. 

신체검사 :
입원시 신체검사는 다음과 같다. VS : 체온 97·6 ℃, 혀압 174·105 mmHg, 맥박 80회/min, 호흡 16회/min. GEN : 경고 상태, HEENT : 안구 운동 양호, 피부색 백색종양, 결막 투명, 눈꺼풀 젖음, 무질량. NECK : 관통 가능. CV : 규칙적인 리듬, 정상 S1-S2. ABD : 연약, 비대, 장음. MSK : 근육 탄력성과 크기가 정상. EXT : 없음. SKIN : 발열, 온화. NEURO : 지능 정상, 집중력 정상 무점유증. PSYCH : 생각 내용 정상.

결과 :
입원의 실험실 결과는 다음과 같다.
___ 10:45 AM  ___ ___.
___ 일요일 11am 11pm 12pm 1pm 2pm 3pm 4pm 5pm 6pm 7pm 8pm 9pm 10pm 11 pm 12 am 1 am 2 am 3 am 4 am 5 am 6 am 7 am 8 am 9 am 10 am 11 am 12 pm 1 pm 2 pm 3 pm 4 pm 5 pm 6 pm 7 pm 8 pm 9 pm 10 pm 11 p.m. 12 a.m.... 24 hours. 

출 viện 후 진행 상황 :
환인은 출혈과 혈변을 경험했지만, 이러한 현상의 원인을 알 수 없으므로 추가 조치를 취하지 않았다. 환인의 상태는 계속해서 악화되었으나, 환인이 아직까지 위험 요소를 발견하지 못하였기에 추가적으로 조치할 필요성이 있었다. 

퇴원 처방 :
환인에게는 다음의 처방이 내려졌다.
1번 항목 : 메토프롤올 섭취.

Name:  ___                     Unit No:   ___

Liver Biospy

 
History of Present Illness:
Mr. ___ is a ___ year old male with a history of multiple 
myeloma s/p multiple treatments, including numerous chemotherapy 
regimens, Autologous transplant in ___, mini-MUD allogeneic 
transplant in ___, and DLI x4, most recently on ___, 
presenting from clinic with elevated LFTs and a direct 
hyperbilirubinemia. The patient had recently developed evidence 
of graft-versus-host disease after the DLI manifesting as skin 
involvement and elevation of LFTs. He was started on steroids 40 
mg a day, decreased to 30 mg a day last week. His rash has been 
steadily improving. He reports that his skin feels "sandpapery" 
like a sunburn. He also states he has felt more fatigued the 
past several days with new and increasing lower extremity 
swelling. Over the past several weeks, he has also had some 
fullness in his sinus area. Recent CT showed no evidence of 
acute sinusitis and ENT put him on Levaquin for a question of 
infection. He endorses no fevers/chills, nausea/vomiting, 
abdominal pain, constipation/diarrhea, cough, SOB, chest pain. 
 
Past Medical History:
PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY:
# ___: Diagnosed with multiple myeloma after admission for
ARF (creatinine 3.0), anemia, hypercalcemia, ___
proteinuria, multiple lytic lesions, and ___ BM involvement.
# ___: VAD x4
# ___: Micro fracture of right hip, s/p IM rodding R femur
# ___: Pulse Cytoxan
# ___: Cytoxan for stem cell mobilization
# ___: Autologous stem cell transplant
# ___: Enrolled in dendritic cell fusion vaccine protocol 
(___) after demonstrating progressive disease
# ___: Thalidomide max dose 200 mg/day, stopped due to 
increasing ___ protein
# ___: Velcade/dexamethasone x2 cycles with disease 
progression
# ___: Cytoxan/dexamethasone
# ___: XRT to left hip and femur
# ___: Revlimid/dexamethasone x2 cycles on expanded access 
and continued on this through ___ (stopped for pancytopenia)
# ___: Admitted for allogeneic stem cell transplant 
(mini-MUD)
with Campath as conditioning regimen. Donor = A antigen 
mismatch.
# ___: DLI c/b GVHD --> disease stability. Started 
Revlimid at low dose, then found to have plasmacytoma in frontal 
bone.
# ___: MRI C-spine shows extensive myelomatous infiltration 
of left lateral mass of C1 with cortical breakthrough; radiation 
to c-spine, frontal mass; started on Velcade, steroids.
# ___: DLI ___ infusion), weekly Velcade
# ___: Increased Velcade to twice weekly
# ___: Admitted for ___, resolved with hydration
# ___: DLI ___ infusion)
.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY:
# Coronary Artery Disease
- stenting x2 in ___

- during auto transplant

- decreased in severity recently

- has been less of an issue

.

no thrush, no mouth sores.

throughout, + mildly tender hepatomegaly.

bilaterally.

LIVER U/S: The liver appears normal in echotexture without focal 
masses or 
lesions. The previously described right lobe cyst was not 
identified on this examination. Normal flow and waveforms were 
seen within the main portal vein, left and right portal veins. 
Normal flow and waveforms are seen within the main hepatic 
artery. Normal flow and waveforms are seen within the right, 
middle, and left hepatic veins and within the IVC. Flow is 
present within the splenic vein. There is no biliary ductal 
dilatation. 
IMPRESSION: Normal liver vasculature. 
.
___ U/S: 1. No evidence for DVT. 
2. Bilateral ___ cysts, left greater than right. 
.
LIVER BIOPSY:
Liver, needle core biopsy:
Mild portal and lobular inflammation consisting of lymphocytes 
and rare neutrophils, with scattered apoptotic hepatocytes. No 
significant periportal extension/piecemeal necrosis identified.
Foci of dystrophic bile ductular damage with a rare ductular 
infiltrating lymphocyte and rare apoptotic biliary epithelial 
cell. No ductular proliferation seen.
Mild intrahepatocytic and canalicular cholestasis.
No increased steatosis or centrivenular injury identified.
Trichrome stain demonstrates no definite increase in fibrosis.
Iron stain shows mild iron deposition in Kupffer cells.
Note:  The features are consistent with hepatic involvement by 
acute graft host disease. The apoptotic hepatocytes present in 
this case are most likely related to the GVHD (this finding is 
particularly prominent in those cases with a more hepatitic 
presentation), however, a concomitant drug effect cannot be 
entirely excluded. An acute viral hepatitis is unlikely 
(particularly given negative serologies and viral loads). Dr. ___. 
___ notified Dr. ___ of the findings on ___. 

 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ year old male with a history of multiple myeloma s/p multiple 
treatments, including numerous chemotherapy regimens, Autologous 
transplant in ___, mini-MUD allogeneic transplant in ___, 
and DLI x4, most recently on ___, presenting from clinic 
with elevated LFTs and a direct hyperbilirubinemia.  
.  
#. Elevated LFTs/Hyperbilirubinemia: Possible etiologies on 
admission included portal vein clot, Budd-chiari, IVC clot, 
pericarditis, medications, Liver GVHD, hepatitis. Patient had 
negative Hepatitis viral loads in ___.  Levofloxacin and 
atovaquone were discontinued on admission as these can cause 
hepatic failure.  Liver u/s with dopplers showed no clots in the 
liver vasculature and a normal hepatobiliary tree.  Patient's 
LFTs remained elevated, thus decision was made to obtain a liver 
biopsy.  The liver biopsy showed findings consistent with acute 
GVHD of the liver.  Patient was discharged on MMF 250 mg TID, 
and prednisone 30 mg PO daily.
.
#. Eye dryness:  On admission, patient c/o of a "sandpapery" 
feeling on the eyes.  Patient will make an appointment to see 
ophtho for evaluation of GVH of the eye.  He was discharged on 
polyvinyl alcohol-povidone eye drops and will follow-up with 
ophtho in the clinic.

Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Graft-versus-Host Disease
Multiple Myeloma

 
Discharge Condition:
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
It was a pleasure taking care of you while you were in the 
hospital.  you were admitted to the hospital because you had 
elevated liver enzymes.  You underwent a liver biopsy that 
showed you are having graft versus host disease.

The following changes were made to your medications:
1) You were started on Cellcept 250mg three times a day.  You 
should continue this dosing until you are told to do otherwise.
2) You should also continue your prednisone 30mg daily.
3) You were started on triamcinolone acetonide  0.1 % Ointment
4) You were started on dexamethasone  0.5 mg/5 mL Elixir for 
your mouth
5) You were also started on artificial tears.  
6) We STOPPED your levofloxacin and atovaquone because of your 
elevated liver enzymes.

translated:
이름: ________________________
Unit No.: ________________________

입원일자: _______________________ 퇴원일자는: ___________________________

생년월일: ____________________ 성별: 남성

서비스: 의학

알레르기: 바크트림

진료 담당자: _______.

주소 불만 사항: 고혈색소증,

수술이나 침습적 절차: 간 생검

병력 개요: Mr.는 연령 ___의 남자로 여러 차례 다발성 골수암을 앓았으며 많은 화학 요법과 함께 아우토로그네스 이식 및 미니 무드 알로겐 이식을 받았다. 최근에는 클리닉에서 상승된 혈액 검사와 직접적인 빌리루빈 증상을 보였다. 환자가 최근에 피부 관여와 혈구 증가를 보여서 스테로이드 40mg 일일에 시작되었고 지난 주에는 감소되었다. 그의 두피가 햇빛 같은 느낌이고 피부 질환이 꾸준히 호전되고 있다. 그는 신체감각이 더 이상 느껴지며 새로운 하반신 부종도 있다고 한다. 몇 주 전부터 비장 영역에도 가득 찬 느낌이다. 최근 CT에서는 급성 비장염은 없다고 했다. ENT는 그를 레바퀴로 보내었다. 그는 열나 안절임, 구토나 소화불량, 복통, 변비 또는 설사, 기침, 흉통 등 없다.

 과거 병력:
과거 종양학적 병력이 있다면 다음과 같다.

Name:  ___               Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   M
 
Service: CARDIOTHORACIC
 
Allergies: 
No Known Allergies / Adverse Drug Reactions
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
lung nodules
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
1) right VATS wedge resection x 3 on ___

 
History of Present Illness:
Mr ___ is a ___ with melanoma
of the right shoulder diagnosed by Dr. ___ in Dermatology 
after
a shave biopsy of a skin lesion was found to be a malignant
melanoma, invasive, nodular type, level IV, 4.1 mm in depth. He
then underwent a wide excision of the right shoulder with right
modified radical neck dissection on ___ with Dr.
___ pathology of which showed no disease at the
site of the original tumor and 1 of 31 lypmh nodes positive for
melanoma, 2.5cm in maximal diameter with suspicion for
extracapsular extension.  He has been followed by Dr. ___ oncology here at ___, as well as by Dr. ___ of
oncology (___) in ___, who are planning to
start him on interferon therapy now that he has completed his
post-op radiation therapy in ___. He had a chest CT done
___ for surveillance done at ___ that
has two small foci in the right lower lobe highly suspicious for
metastatic disease of the lung that were not present on a CT
Chest done here at ___ on ___. 
 
Past Medical History:
Atrial fibrillation, 
hypercholesterolemia,
gout, 
umbilical hernia, 
diabetes, 
sleep apnea, 
polyps
met melanoma right neck/shoulder ___, s/p wide local 
excision
and right neck dissection on ___, which showed
residual melanoma at the primary site, but a large 2.5 cm lymph
node was noticed with
extracapsular extension and focus. completed XRT
squamous cell ca left hand

 
Social History:
___
Family History:
brother with colon cancer in his ___
 
Physical Exam:
T 98.3  HR 78  BP 124/84  RR 22  SPO2 90% RA
NAD, AOx3
regular rate, irregular rhythm
CTAB, right chest incisions c/d/i with no erythema or drainage
SNTND, obese
extr wwp
 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ admitted to the thoracic surgery service following a right 
VATS wedge resection x3 for pulmonary nodules concerning for 
metastatic foci of melanoma, please see separate operative 
dictation for details of procedure. 
Post-operatively he was taken to the PACU for recovery, where he 
had rapid ventricular response (has chronic afib) that required 
a diltiazem drip for a few hours following evening 
administration of his usual oral rate control medications. The 
morning of POD 1 his HR was under control on oral medicines and 
he
subsequently transferred to the floor. His initial post-op CXR 
showed a right chest tube in place and no evidence of 
pneumothorax. His diet was advanced to regular, he was placed on 
his home medications, and his pain was controlled with oxycodone 
and tylenol. On POD 1 he had no air leak and was clinically 
doing well, so his right chest tube was removed and the 
post-pull CXR showed minimal right pneumothorax in the apex. He 
was restarted on his home coumadin for Afib. On POD 2 his O2 
saturations did fall in to the high 80's in the early morning 
requiring supplemental O2, but he was given a dose of lasix and 
by mid-day his SPO2 was around 90-91% on RA at rest and he did 
not have any issues with desaturating while walking. A repeat 
CXR was performed that showed no interval change in the small 
right apical PTX, and he continued to do well clinically with 
stable vital signs.  He was ambulating and voiding without 
assistance, tolerating a regular 
diet, and his pain was controlled with PO pain medicines, so he 
was deemed stable for discharge home with follow-up in thoracic 
surgery clinic with Dr. ___.

futher investigation.

9. Janumet *NF* (sitagliptin-metformin) 50-1,000 mg Oral BID 
10. TraMADOL (Ultram) 50-100 mg PO QHS:PRN back pain 
11. Verapamil SR 240 mg PO Q24H afib 
12. Warfarin 3 mg PO 2X/WEEK (TH,SA) afib 
___ and ___ 
13. Lorazepam 1 mg PO PRN anxiety 
14. Warfarin 4 mg PO 5X/WEEK (___) afib 

 
Discharge Medications:

2. Carbidopa-Levodopa CR (50-200) 1 TAB PO DAILY 
3. Enalapril Maleate 5 mg PO DAILY

6. Janumet *NF* (sitagliptin-metformin) 50-1,000 mg Oral BID 
7. Simvastatin 20 mg PO DAILY 
8. TraMADOL (Ultram) 50-100 mg PO QHS:PRN back pain

10. Albuterol Inhaler ___ PUFF IH Q4-6 HOURS SOB 
11. Atenolol 25 mg PO BID 
12. Docusate Sodium 100 mg PO BID 
13. Milk of Magnesia 30 mL PO HS:PRN constipation 
14. OxycoDONE (Immediate Release)  10 mg PO Q3H:PRN pain 
RX *oxycodone 5 mg ___ tablet(s) by mouth every 3 hours Disp 
#*60 Tablet Refills:*0
15. Paroxetine 20 mg PO DAILY 
16. fenofibrate micronized *NF* 200 mg ORAL DAILY 
17. Lorazepam 1 mg PO PRN anxiety 
18. Viagra *NF* (sildenafil) 50 mg Oral as needed for sex 
___. Warfarin 3 mg PO 2X/WEEK (TH,SA) afib 
20. Warfarin 4 mg PO 5X/WEEK (___) afib 

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
1) right lower lobe lung nodules

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
* You were admitted to the hospital for lung surgery and you've 
recovered well. You are now ready for discharge.
* Continue to use your incentive spirometer 10 times an hour 
while awake.
* Check your incisions daily and report any increased redness or 
drainage. Cover the area with a gauze pad if it is draining.
* Your chest tube dressing may be removed in 48 hours. If it 
starts to drain, cover it with a clean dry dressing and change 
it as needed to keep site clean and dry.
* You will continue to need pain medication once you are home 
but you can wean it over a few weeks as the discomfort resolves. 
Make sure that you have regular bowel movements while on 
narcotic pain medications as they are constipating which can 
cause more problems. Use a stool softener or gentle laxative to 
stay regular.
* No driving while taking narcotic pain medication.
* Take Tylenol ___ mg every 6 hours in between your narcotic. 
* Continue to stay well hydrated and eat well to heal your 
incisions
* Shower daily. Wash incision with mild soap & water, rinse, pat 
dry
* No tub bathing, swimming or hot tubs until incision healed
* No lotions or creams to incision site
* Walk ___ times a day and gradually increase your activity as 
you can tolerate.

Call Dr. ___ ___ if you experience:
-Fevers > 101 or chills
-Increased shortness of breath, chest pain or any other symptoms 
that concern you.

 
Followup Instructions:
___

병력 개요 :
___은 흑색종으로서 오른쪽 어깨에 진단받아 피부 병변을 절제한 후 오른손 목 부위에서 전이된 것으로 의심되는 두 소견이 발견되어 수술을 받았다. 이후 경피적 조직검사를 통해 원발 종양에는 질환이 없으나 림프절 중 하나가 전이가 되어 2차 치료를 시행하였다. 그후 간경화증으로 인하여 항암치료를 시작하기 위해 방사선 치료와 함께 인터페론 요법을 시작할 예정이다.

 과거 병력 :
골육종인 경우로써는 오른팔 손목 부위를 비롯하여 여러 차례 수술하였으며 최근에도 복막염으로 인해 수술 하였다. 또한 당뇨병과 수면무호흡증도 있다.

사회력 :
여성

신체 검사 :
정맥류, 고콜레스테롤혈증, 관절염, 허리 탈구, 당뱅이, 수면 무호흵증, 결절

환자의 상태 :
우측 폐결절을 주시하고 있는 환자로서 현재는 정밀검사가 필요하다.

퇴원 처방 :
1. 알레르기를 가지고 있지 않다./약물 반응증상을 보이지 않는다.

관찰 결과 :
우석 폐결節

전문적인 정보 없음.

___ hockey player s/p mechanical fall on ice onto L hip, 
transferred from ___ with L FNF. Patient was 
playing in a local hockey tournament when around 8:15pm he fell 
on the ice onto his L hip. He denies HS/LOC. He presented 
initially to ___ where XRs showed a L FNF, for

Brief Hospital Course:
The patient presented to the emergency department and was 
evaluated by the orthopedic surgery team. The patient was found 
to have left femural neck and was admitted to the orthopedic 
surgery service.  The patient was taken to the operating room on 
___ for CRPP which the patient tolerated well (for full 
details please see the separately dictated operative report). 
The patient was taken from the OR to the PACU in stable 
condition and after recovery from anesthesia was transferred to 
the floor.  The patient was initially given IV fluids and IV 
pain medications, and progressed to a regular diet and oral 
medications by POD#1. The patient was given perioperative 
antibiotics and anticoagulation per routine.  The patients home 
medications were continued throughout this hospitalization.  The 
patient worked with ___ who determined that discharge to rehab 
was appropriate. The ___ hospital course was otherwise 
unremarkable.
At the time of discharge the patient was afebrile with stable 
vital signs that were within normal limits, pain was well 
controlled with oral medications, incisions were 
clean/dry/intact, and the patient was voiding/moving bowels 
spontaneously. The patient is TDWB in the left lower extremity, 
and will be discharged on lovenox for DVT prophylaxis.  The 
patient will follow up in two weeks per routine. A thorough 
discussion was had with the patient regarding the diagnosis and 
expected post-discharge course, and all questions were answered 
prior to discharge.

 
Medications on Admission:
None
 
Discharge Medications:
1. Enoxaparin Sodium 40 mg SC QPM 
Start: ___, First Dose: Next Routine Administration Time

Refills:*0
2. OxycoDONE (Immediate Release)  ___ mg PO Q4H:PRN pain 
RX *oxycodone 5 mg ___ tablet(s) by mouth every four (4) hours 
Disp #*100 Tablet Refills:*0
3. Docusate Sodium 100 mg PO BID 
RX *docusate sodium [Colace] 100 mg 1 capsule(s) by mouth twice 
a day Disp #*60 Capsule Refills:*2
4. Bisacodyl 10 mg PO/PR DAILY:PRN constipation 
5. Calcium Carbonate 500 mg PO QID:PRN reflux

Home With Service

___

Left femural neck fracture

 
Discharge Condition:

Discharge Instructions:
Discharge Instructions:
MEDICATIONS:
- Please take all medications as prescribed by your physicians 
at discharge.
- Continue all home medications unless specifically instructed 
to stop by your surgeon.
- Do not drink alcohol, drive a motor vehicle, or operate 
machinery while taking narcotic pain relievers.
- Narcotic pain relievers can cause constipation, so you should 
drink eight 8oz glasses of water daily and take a stool softener 
(colace) to prevent this side effect.

ANTICOAGULATION:
- Please take lovenox 40mg daily for 2 weeks

WOUND CARE:
- You may shower. No baths or swimming for at least 4 weeks.
- Any stitches or staples that need to be removed will be taken 
out at your 2-week follow up appointment.
- No dressing is needed if wound continues to be non-draining.

ACTIVITY AND WEIGHT BEARING:
- Touch down weight bearing left lower extremity

좌측 고관절 통증

좌골 목 부위 CRPP



병력이 있는지 여부 : 없음

환자의 주소 : _,

의무 진단 :
왼쪽 아이스 하키 선수 s/p 기계적인 얼음 위로 좌측 고 관절을 떨어뜨렸으며,
L FNF를 가지고 전달되었다. 환자는 8시 15분에 로컬 아이스하키토플에서 경기 중에 얼음으로 떨어졌다. 그는 HS/LOC를 거부했다. 초기에는 _ 에서 X-ray가 L F NF를 보여서 L F NFS로 이송 되었다.



 과거 임상 기록 :
없음

__


 가족 역사 :
NC

신체 검사 :
A & O, N AD, 통증 조절 AFVSS PE : LLE 절개 d/c/I와 홍반, ____ 실트 s/s/sp/DP/PT WWP



중요한 결과 :
왜건 엑스레이 및 수술 고정 후 왼쪽 고관節 골절

간호 과정 요약 :
환자가 응급실에 도착하여 외과팀에 의해 평가되었고, 왼발목뿔을 발견하고 외과 서비스에 입원하였다. 환자가 ___ 에서 CRPP를 받았는데 잘 견딘다(전문적으로는 별도로 dictate된 수술 보고서 참조). 환자는 OR에서 안정 상태로 PACU로 옮겨졌고 회복 후 병동으로 옮겼다. 환자에게는 IV 액체 및 IV 통증제를 처음에 투여했으며, POD# 1부터 일반 식단 및 경구 치료로 진행되었다. 예방 항균제 및 항혈전제는 매뉴얼대로 시행되었다. 집에서의 약은 이 병원화 동안 계속 사용되었다. ___ 은 재활에 대한 방출이 적합함을 결정했다. 그 외에도 병원과정은 특별히 언급되지 않았다.
퇴원 당시 환자는 열이 없고 정상 범위 내의 안정적인 심박수를 보였으며, 통풍도 자연스럽게 일어났다. 환인은 좌측 하지 TDWB이며, LOVENOX로 DVT 예방을 위해 퇴원을 했다. 환사는 두 번 연속으로 루틴이다. 모든 질문은 퇴원의 전에 답변받았다.


입원 약물 :
없음


퇴원 약품 :
1. 에노카파린 나트륨 40 мг SQ QPM 시작 날짜 : __, 첫 번째 복용량 : 다음 루틴 시간 RX *Enoxaparın 40MG/0.4ML 1 injection sq q pm Disp # *14 Injection Refills *0
 2. 옥시코돈 (즉각 분해) 30 mg PO 4시간마다 PRN 통증 RX *OxycodONE 5 MG 1 tablet(s ) by mouth 4 times a day Disp# *100 Tablets Refills 0
    3. 독산 100mg PO BDI RX *Docusate SODIUM [COLACE] 1 capsules by mouth TWICE a day DISP # *60 CAPSULE REFILLS *2
      4. 비사이콜리드 10mg PO/Daily PRN 장애 RX *BISACODYL 10 MG 10 tablets by mouth once a day DIS # *50 TABLETS REFILLS 0

퇴원 처치 :
집안에서 서비스 제공

기관 :
_____

퇴원 진단 코드 :
좌면 뇌척추 동맥류

퇴장 상태 :
 정신 상태 : 명확하고 체계적.
수준 인식 : 각성 및 상호 작용.
활동 상태 : 대칭 - 독립적 크루치

퇴근 지침 :
처방전 :
- 출국 시 의사의 처방대로 모두 복용해야 한다.
- 가정에서 특정하게 명령받지 않는 경우 모든 홈 메디케이션을 계속한다.
- 마취통증제 복용 중 알코올 금주, 자동차 운전, 기계운영 금지.
- 화장실 운동은 콜라세를 통해 이를 예방할 수 있다.

항공 :
- LoVenox 20mg 하루 복용

부상 관리 :
- 샤워 가능. 최소 4주간 욕

You were admitted to ___ on ___ because you had a fall and 
fractured your right ankle. You were seen by the orthopedic 
surgeons who did not think that you needed surgery. Instead, you 
will need to remain in a cast for 6 weeks and you cannot bear 
weight on your right leg until that time. You need to take a 
blood thinner everyday for the next six weeks to prevent a blood 
clot from going to your lungs while you aren't moving around 
very much.
 

 
While you were here, you also had some chest pain, but we did a 
heart tracing and blood testing to be sure it was not a heart 
attack. This testing was all normal, and we think the pain is 
probably from muscle strain because of the way you were lying in 
bed.

pain. Never drink alcohol or drive with this medication.

miralax as needed for constipation if these aren't working.

non-weightbearing (reassess with orthopedic surgeon at your next 
office)

한국어: 이름: _______ 단위번호: _______
입원일자: ________ 퇴원일: ________

서비스: 의학과
알레르기: 환자가 약물에 대한 알레르기를 가지고 있다고 기록하였다.
진료 담당자는 ____이다.
주요 소견은 넘어졌다.
수술이나 침습적 절차는 오른쪽 하지의 캐스팅이었다.
병력: 요즘까지 DM2를 가진 여성으로서 HTN을 가졌으며 HL과 파킨슨 병이 있었다. CRI로 불참했다. 최근에는 우울증이 있었고, 그 결과 오늘날도 계속해서 우울감을 느끼고 있다. 또한, 지난번에 발생한 부상으로 인해 현재는 통증 때문에 걸음걸이를 할 수 없다. 두통이나 무의식 상태가 없었다. 그녀는 화장실에서 떨어져서 직원이 그녀를 발견했고, 그녀의 발목을 잡아 세웠다. 그녀는 도중에 목욕탕에서 떨어지면서 손발이 얼룩덜러지는 것을 보였다. 이후에도 계속하여 치료받았다. 그리고 지금은 아직도 계속되어 있다. 그녀는 기침약을 복용하고 있으며, 항상 다리 위에 앉아서 시간을 보내고 있다.
혈액검사결과: 혈압은 높았으나 심각하지 않았다. 그러나 이틀 후에는 다시 내려갔다. 그리고 다음 날 아침에는 더 이상의 증상을 나타내지 않았다. 그리고 마지막으로, 그녀는 과거에 여러 차례 같은 일을 겪었다. 그리고 이번에도 마찬가지였다. 그리고 이제는 더욱더 그러하다. 그리고 그녀는 또 다른 일들을 경험했지만, 그것들은 모두 이전보다 덜했다. 그리고 그녀에게는 더 이상 그런 일이 일어날 가능성이 거의 없다고 생각된다. 그리고 그녀의 몸은 매우 건강하였고, 특히 그녀의 마음속에서는 많은 변화가 있었다. 그리고 그곳에서도 그녀는 자신의 몸을 잘 돌보고 있었다. 하지만, 그녀의 몸 속에는 작은 상처가 있어야 했다. 그리고 그것은 그녀의 신체 활동량을 줄여 주었고, 그녀의 체중도 증가되었다. 그리고 아마도 그녀의 뇌와 관련된 문제들도 있을 것이다. 그리고 그의 경우에는 그녀의 뼈가 깨끗하게 생겼다. 그리고 그는 자신의 몸을 움직이는 데 어려움을 겪기도 했는데, 이는 그가 너무 많이 먹어서 그렇다. 그래서 그는 자신의 몸무게를 조절해야 한다. 그리고 만약 그가 자신들의 몸을 움직인다면, 그의 몸은 더 나빠질 것이다. 따라서 그는 자신의 행동을 조절할 필요가 있다. 그리고 이것은 그의 삶에 큰 영향을 미칠 것이다.

FINDINGS: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. 
There is interval placement of a right-sided PICC, terminating 
in the distal SVC/cavoatrial junction. Bibasilar opacities, new 
since ___ are seen, which could relate to atelectasis, 
aspiration, and/or infection. No pleural effusion or 
pneumothorax is seen. Cardiac and mediastinal silhouettes are 
stable. 
. 
CT chest ___:  
1. Even if the majority of multiple subcentimeter pulmonary 
nodules new since ___, are due to the bronchial 
inflammation or infection seen in the left lung, there is still 
a sufficient number of nodules in areas free of inflammation, to 
raise concern for metastasis from reported hepatocellular 
carcinoma. The lesions are too small to promise differentiation 
of malignancy from infection by PET scanning. Depending upon 
clinical circumstances, surveillance may be the most reasonable 
approach, with a repeat scan in no more than three months. 
2. Mild, non-pathologic thoracic vertebral compression 
fractures, new since ___. 
 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ male with HCV/EtOH cirrhosis c/b ___ s/p cyberknife, 
transferred from prison for recently diagnosed pneumonia with 
PICC line, found to have multiple pulmonary nodules concerning 
for metastatic spread of HCC.    
.  
# Chest pain:  Patient admitted with pleuritic chest pain 
following 4 days of zosyn for pneumonia diagnosed at an outside 
hospital.  He was noted on admission to have a large hematoma 
overlying his left chest with nodularity that likely is the 
cause of his chest pain, possibly pleuritic due to splinting.  
On admission, he did not have any fevers, cough, or leukocytosis 
to support a current pneumonia.  His EKG was unchanged from 
baseline, and his resting and ambulatory saturations remained 
stable on room air.  The patient underwent CXR that showed 
nodular bibasilar infiltrates.  He then underwent a CT scan to 
further evaluate lung parenchyma that showed multiple small 
nodules concerning for metastatic malignancy, without evidence 
of pneumonia.  Zosyn was stopped after a 5 day course (day 2 of 
admission) and PICC was pulled.  Given likely primary malignancy 
of HCC, the patient's AFP was checked, and showed increase from 
2295 to 2561 after cyberknife therapy (a sharp trend up from AFP 
275 in ___.  Oncology was consulted for workup of nodules and 
recommended repeat CT scan in 2 months, as nodules are currently 
too small to biopsy.  Patient is not yet a candidate for 
systemic chemotherapy as he recently underwent cyberknife.  The 
patient will follow up with his primary care physician on 
discharge for monitoring of his left chest hematoma and 
monitoring of his respiratory status.  He will follow up with 
his hepatologist and radiation/oncologist regarding his likely 
metastatic hepatocellular carcinoma.  A repeat CT chest was 
scheduled prior to discharge for 2 months from discharge.  
.    
# HCV/EtOH cirrhosis, complicated by Hepatocellular carcinoma: 
Chronic.  Patient is status post cyberknife for ___ with repeat 
procedure scheduled for end of ___. On admission, the 
patient had mild jaundice with chronically elevated T. bili (at 
baseline).  He was without evidence of further decompensation.  
During admission, the patient was found to have multiple 
pulmonary nodules concerning for metastatic HCC, as above.  The 
patient's hepatologist and radiaton oncologist were made aware 
of the new findings.  The patient was continued on home nadolol. 
 He will follow up with his hepatologist and radiation 
oncologist as previously scheduled.  
.
# Pancytopenia:  Patient with chronic mild pancytopenia with 
predominant thrombocytopenia likely due to cirrhosis.  It 
remained stable throughout admission.  
.
# DM2: Chronic.  The patient was continued on home glargine.  He 
was maintained on an insulin sliding scale while in house.    
.  
# HTN: Chronic.  The patient remained normotensive throughout 
admission.  He was continued on lasix and nadolol.     
.  
# Code: full code

# Patient should follow up for scheduled repeat CT chest in 2 
months to evaluate pulmonary nodules.

이름: ____________________    단위번호: _______

입원일자: _______    퇴원일자는: _______
생년월일: ______    성별: 남성

서비스: 의학과

알레르기: Wellbutrin

진료의사: ______

주요 증상: 호흡곤란

수술이나 침습적 시술: 없음

병력내역: 남자 환자가 HCV 및 EtOH 간경화로 인한 간세포암으로서 사이버나이프 후에 발생하여 감염성 폐렴을 진단받아 입원하였다. 재판소에서 최근ly 발전된 폐렴으로 전송되었다. 재 판관은 PICC를 삽인하고 항균제(Zosyn)을 투여했으며, 재활실로 3일간 이송되었고, 이후 교도소에서 전송되어 IV 항균 제는 PICC 선로를 통해 주입되지 않았다. 응급실에서는 초기 혈압 97·2, 심박동맥 64번, 혈중당류 158 / 89mmHg, 호흠률 16번, SvO2 %100%RA가 측정되었다. CXRTED에서는 양측 기형과 결절 형태가 관찰된다. 환자는 내과에 입원했다. 현재 그는 경미한 흉통과 피로감을 보이며, 열, 두드러지기, 가래, 구토, 소변, 변비 등 다른 증상을 부정한다. 과거 병력이 있다. HCV / EtOH 세기관지종양, DMII, HTN, 우울증, UTI, CATARACT SURGERY, TRACH이다. 사회력은 없다. 가족력은 아버지의 전립선 암과 에톡 아부 유전자이다. 신체검사는 다음과 같다. 입원시 검사 결과: 체온 96·6, 혁동 129 / 69 mmHg 60분 20분 98%, 일반적으로 만성 질환을 앓고 있는 남성이 침대 위에 누워 있지만 아무런 압박감 없이 자각 상태였다. HEENT는 황색막 미약하게 노랗게 되며, MMM은 안구 클리어, 나쁜 치아치아와 같은 것이었다. 폐는 청결하며, 튤라리 브레스 사운드와 무음이었다. CV는 정상적인 리듬이고, 무운율, 루브, 갈롭스 없었다. 복장은 연질이었고, 장기 음향이 있었다. 확장에는 없고, 뚝뚝땀이 없었으며, 염증 반응 또는 보호가 없었다. 외견은 완전히 건강했고, 근육량은 없었다. 피부는 왼쪽 乳房에 큰 혈종과 함께 눈살이 찌어 오른다. 퇴원의 검사결과: VS 97 · 3 105 / 60 mmHgt 75 분 20 분 97%. 일반적으로만성 질환이 있으며, 지속적으로 고혈압을 가지고 있었던 것이다. HEINT는 황금색 막 미약하며, MMM과 같은 것이었고, Oropharynx는 클리어였으며, 나빠지는 치아가 있었다. 폐은 청결하였으며, 튀라리 Breath Sounds와 무음을 보였다. CV은 정상 리듰이며, S1-S2는 무운루, 루즈, 갈럽스가 없었다. 배는 연질이며, 장기가 존재하지 않았으며, 회복반응이나 방호가 없었다 Ext는 완전히 건조했으며 근육은 없었다 Skin은 왼팔에 크게 출혈이 생긴 것으로 보이는 것은 그 때문이라고 한다. Pertinent Lab results admit labs: 10pm Blood WBC 4.00 RBC 3.424 * HGB 12.200 * HCT 35.200 MCV 103 * MCH 35.70 * MHC 34.80 RDW 15.20 PLT 243.00 10 pm Blood Neut 79.00 * Lymph 14.80 * Mono 4.40 * EOS 1.00 BASO 0.70 10 PM Blood PLT CPT 10 : 45 PM Blood Glucose 254 * Urine NPN 12 Creatinine 1.10 Sodium 136 Potassium 4 K 104 Chloride 25 Anion Gap 10 10 AM Blood ALAT 27 AST 41 * Alkaline phosphatase 146 * Total Bilirubin 8.300 10am Blood Albumin 3.10 * Calcium 9.30 Phosphorus 3 Magnesium

Brief Hospital Course:
___ yo man with history of HCV cirrhosis (genotype 1, never 
treated), c/b ascites, extremity edema, HE (no known varices, 
last EGD as OSH ___, DM/ HTN/HL, CVA, PVD, COPD, neuropathy 
and MMP who presents to ___ with weight gain, lower extremity 
swelling, and fatigue since discharge.
.
#. Hyponatremia: Admission labs demonstrated Na 120, down from 
125 at recent discharge. Patient reported increase in  weight 
since discharge. He had profound edema in ___ and in the abdomen 
(subcutaneous) with minimal ascites (insufficient for the tap).  
The impression was that his overall fluid status was partially 
due to cirrhosis, however with a component of RHF (question 
cirrhotic CM vs. pulm HTN or combination). His Na improved to 
125 with fluid restriction (<1200 cc) and discontinuation of 
diuretics.  He had a moderate self diuresis of 2L despite 
holding diuretics. He was continued on Tolvaptan at prior dose. 
He was discharged home with plans for outpatient echo and 
outpatient sleep study. He was also set up with cardiology 
follow-up.  He was discharged off the diuretics given the 
hyponatremia and will be continued on Tolvaptan. 
.
#. Encephalopathy: Likely hepatic encephalopathy.  No clear 
localizing symptoms to suggest infectious precipitant. Urine 
culture and blood culture were negative. Insufficient ascites to 
perform paracentesis. Reported compliance with medications at 
home, including lactulose. Symptoms improved with titrate 
lactulose and rifaximin to ___ BM daily.
.
#. Anemia. Normocytic. Likely multifactorial, but never fully 
evaluated (no Fe studies, Folate/B12/TSH wnl recently). Will 
likely need EGD and Colonoscopy at some point for further 
evaluation.
.
#. HCV Cirrhosis. Hx of decompensation, now w/ evidence of 
enceophalopathy. LFTs and bili stable. Cr at 0.9. No PVT on last 
US w/ similar presentation, thus limited utility in this case.
.

병력 개시 :
환자는 ____세 남자로, H/O ESLD는 HCV 간경화증으로 포트럴 고혈압과 복수 및 신경계 장애를 동반하고 최근 입원하여 ARF와 저나트륨 혈증 그리고 부피 과부하가 있는 환자이다. 현재 전립선 클리닉에서 체중 감소 후에 나타났다. 요약하면 환자가 ___에서 ___까지 하여 나트륰 염 수치가 125이었으며, 병원 내에서는 식단 및 약물 비만을 이유로 하는 것으로 생각된다. 중간 투여량은 줄어들었고 소금 함유량도 늘렸다. 나트럼 추이는 퇴원 시점에는 125이었다.
퇴원 이후 환자는 집에서 낮은 나트뇨 음식을 섭취하며 모든 약물을 준수한다고 한다. 발목과 족저의 부종이 있다. 또한 지속적인 피로감을 호소하였다. 열발열, 복통, 설사 등은 없다.
체위관찰은 진행되는 기침과 간헐적으로 흉통이 있으며 심한 경우 운동을 하면 더 악화되었다. 가슴 통증은 뚜렷하게 느껴지며 식후에도 악화되는데, 때때로 불편함과 정맥 압박이 있었다.
구강 관찰은 계속된 단식이며, 구강 관할은 양호하다.
임상 역사 :
- HCV (형태 1)의 간경변증으로 인해 저나토염, 복수, 간신경계장애가 있고 최근 입원이 이루어진다.
- 비만
- 고혔
- 당뇄증
- 뇌졸중은 없지만 잔류 손실이 없었다.
- 이상지질혈증
근육통
- 척추 경화증
우측 하지 신경 압박
- 패드
- 과거의 대변암
- 가족력이 없는 것은 아니다.

translated:
이름 : ____________________    단위번호 : _______
입원일자 : _______     퇴원일 자 : _______

생년월일 : ______   성별 : 여성

서비스 : 정형외과

알레르기 : 스콜로페인

진료 의사 : ______.

주소 불편감 :
오른쪽 팔 통증

수술 내역 :
정복된 오른쪽 원심골 골절을 위한 개방적 감압 및 내부 고정을 받았다.

력 임상 :
이 환자는 미국에서 생활하다가 기계적인 추락으로 인해 오른손 쪽에 부상을 입었다. 초기 비운영 관리를 위해 외래 진료와 함께 외래 병원을 방문했다. X선 촬영 결과 골절 이완이 관찰되었다. 따라서 개방 적 감압 과내부 고정이 필요하였다.

의학 전력 :
뇌막 출혈 후 사고
만성 우울증
 갑상선 기능 저하 증후군
두통
골다공증 HTN
고지혈증 수면 무호흡증

사회 역사 :
______

 가족 역사는 비 공헌적이다.

신체 검사 :
퇴원 시 신체 검사를 실시한 결과는 다음과 같다.
AFVPS
잘 보이는 경련과 대화 가능한 상태
호흠은 평온하고 안정되어 있다.
우측 상반신 : 열린 실장, 배액 없음, 발열 없음, 잘 치유되고 스텐트가 있는 상태. 손 가락을 굽힌다, 펴낸다, 약간의 약점(약 70%)이며 중근 감각이 온도와 강하게 느껴졌다.

중요한 결과 :
___ 0600 AM 혈청 백혈구 8.22 RBC 2.900 * HGB 8 * HCT 25.40 *
MCV 88 MHC 27.50 # MCH 31.30 #
RDW 13.80 PLT ___
--- 0544 AM 혁혈백혈세포 9.55 RBC3.980 * Hgb 11.20 * Hct 34.50 *
MC V 87 M CH 28.10 MCH C 32.30 RDW 14.70 PLT ---
0705 AM 혜산당 87 UREAN 13 CRE 0.7 NA 137 K 3.7 CL 104 H CO ___ GAP ___
---

환자의 주요 수술 또는 침습적 절차 :
오프라인 축합 및 내재적 고리를 통해 오른팔 측실골 골격 유출을 시행하였다.

병력 :
이 여성은 미국에서 살다가 기계적 추락을 당하여 오른발목에 부상의 흔적을 남겼다. 그녀는 미국에서 외래를 시작했으며 초기 비 운영 관리를 권유했다. 이후 외래에서 계속해서 외래였다. X-ray에서는 골절 이동이 관측되었으므로 개방 감압과 내재 조직을 선택했다.

과거 질병 기록 :
뼈 속 뚝뚱함
만성을 가진 사람들
갑상샘 기능 장애
두개골 파열
골밀도증 HT N
고 지혈 증
수면 무 호흡 증

사회 역사지역 :
___

족보 :
비 기여적이었다.

신경 생리 학 :
신체검사시에는 AFVSS로 나타났다. 잘 보이고 주의 깊게 행동하며 호흠이 평온했고 안정되었다. 우측 상반기 : 열려있는 실장 없지만 좋은 치유 상태며 스티커가 있는 상황. 손가락을 구부리고 펴면서 약간 약한 힘(약70%)이었으나 근육 감각은 온도 및 강하게 느낄 수 있었다.

중 요한 결과물 :
___ 시간대 혈액 백혇구 9.52 RBC2.990 * HGb 11.20 * HTC 35.00 * MC V 89 MCH28.00 # MCHO 33.00 RDW14.60 PLT ____
___ 시간 Blood WBC 8.21 RBC2980 * HbG 8 00 * HcT 26.00 MCV91 MCH29.00# MCHO32.00#
R DW 13.80 PL T ___

환자의 간단한 병력을 설명한다.
환자가 수행한 작업은 다음과 같다.
환자는 미국에서의 생활을 하다가 기관지 확장을 경험하였으며, 이는 미국에서 발생하는 것으로 알려져 왔다. 환자는 처음에 미국에서 거주하면서 외래로

Brief Hospital Course:
On ___ ___ underwent coronary artery bypass grafting x4 
(left internal mammary artery grafted to left anterior 
descending artery/Saphenous vein grafted to Obtuse Marginal 
#1/#2/Posterior descending artery) with ___. Cross clamp 
time= 97 minutes/ Cardiopulmonary bypass time= 132 minutes. 
Please refer to ___ report for further 
details. She was transferred to the CVICU hemodynamically stable 
requiring Milrinone to optimize cardiac output. She awoke 
neurologically intact and was extubated on POD#1. She was weaned 
off inotropes. Beta-blockers optimized per Blood Pressure 
tolerance. All lines and drains were discontinued in a timely 
fashion. Psychiatry was consulted for postoperative delirium. 

She continued to progress and on POD# 4 was transferred to the 
step down unit for further monitoring. Her rhythm went into 
rapid atrial fibrillation and was treated with Amiodarone. She 
converted to sinus rhythm, no anticoagulation required. She was 
diuresed for right pleural effusion evident on chest xray. The 
remainder of her postoperative course was essentially 
uncomplicated and on POD# 6 she was cleared for discharge to 
rehab for further strength, endurance and increase in daily 
activities. All follow up appointments were advised. Pt. should 
have a MRA as an outpt. for follow up of possible left renal 
artery stenosis. Please restart metformin when creatinine has 
normalized.

이름: _______________________
Unit No.: _______________________

입원일자: _______________________ 퇴원일자는: ____________________________
생년월일: ______________________________ 성별: 여성

서비스: 심장흉부

알레르기: 페니실린 및 수플라마이드 항균제

진료 의사: ____________________

주소 불만 사항: 운동 중 호흡 곤란 또는 야간호흡곤란

수술 내역: 관상 동맥 교환술 x4(좌측내막동맥을 좌측 전방하행동맥에 이식하고 사파노스 정맥은 후경동맥의 ___과 ___로 이식하였다.)

병력 개요: 연령 ___세 여성으로서 알려진 관상동맥질환이 있으며 상태전형 삽관술, 심근증, 최근 두 차례의 만성심부전으로 입원되었다. 운동중 호흐곤란과 야간 호흵곤란을 주소로 하여 심혈관계 검사를 받았다. 카테터화에서 다발성 관상정맥 질환이 확인되었다. 관상 혈관 재도색술을 시행받았다.

 과거 병력: CAD는 이전에 발생한 것으로 증상을 보였으며, 최근에는 두 번의 만성을 겪었다. 최근의 발작적 밤 시간 호흠곤란으로 인하여 심장カテ터화를 시도했다. 심장재도색시술을 받았고, 이후 심장 재도포를 시행받아 현재 상태이다.

 과목: CAD가 있는 상태이며, 최근 심장 부전을 경험하였으며, 심장 기능검사가 필요하다. 당뇨병, 고혈압, 고지혈증 등이 있다. 복강조영술을 통해 조직학적으로 정확하게 판단할 수 있었다. 외래 진찰 기록에서는 잘못된 정보라고 보고하였다. 간염, 신장신체계능력치, 혈당치는 각각 150~250㎎이었다. 경추골절 치료와 같은 다른 요인들에도 영향을 미쳤다.

 가족력: 아버지 사망 낭종으로 사망하였다. 어머니는 심장질환자가 있고 아들은 심장부전증 환자였다. 딸은 심장암으로 사망하였으나 생후 몇 달 동안 건강했지만 이후 심각한 심장 문제를 가지고 있었던 것으로 추정된다. 심장이 약해졌다는 것은 사실이고, 심박수가 높아서 심장에 큰 위험이 있다는 것이 밝혀졌다. 심장은 심장판막이나 심장벽돌 등의 이상 소견이 없었으며, 흉곧침은 없었다. 폐렴이 없다고 한다. 심장을 촬영하면 심장의 형태나 구조 등을 알 수 있게 된다. 심낭염이나 기타 비위생적인 현상의 경우에는 심장촬영을 할 때 그 부분을 피해야 한다. 또한 심장사진을 찍으면 심장구조나 심장운동을 파악할 수 있을 것이다. 심액은 심장이 손상되어 심장손상이 있다고 하는데 이는 실제로는 심장 손상이 아니라는 것을 보여준다. 심박수는 심장이 움직이는 속도를 나타낸다. 그리고 심장 사진을 찰 때는 심박수를 측정하는 것이라고 한다. 그러나 심장 촬영상 심장 활동량이나 심박수의 변화를 볼 수 없다. 심리학과에서도 심장 관련 연구를 진행하고 있다. 심리가 안 좋다면 심장문제가 더 악화될 수 있어 심장관련 상담을 받아야 한다. 따라서 심장건강 관리를 위해 심장카테터화를 해야한다. 심미학은 심비대, 심비소, 심백반 등이 있는데 심비대를 제외하고 나머지는 모두 심장기관에 해당되는 기관이다. 심비대의 경우에는 원통 모양의 심장이다. 그리고 모든 심장기능은 심폐합류를 통해서 이루어진다. 따라fore 심장기는 심장순환기능이 중요하며 심장 순환기 능력이 떨어져 심장병이 발생하기 쉽다. 특히 심장교정이 잘 되어있어 심장유전자 유전자를 가진 사람에게 심장 유전자의 역할이 크며 심장결핌증이 많아 심장 결함이 많이 발생한다. 따라히 심장보험 가입률이 높은 편이다. 하지만 심장보험이 많은 이유는 심 장보험 가입자들이 대부분 심장 질홀이 있는 사람들이 때문이라 생각할 수도 있다. 따라한 심 장질홀이 없는 사람은 심장 보험 가입이 적은 편이다.

 심장 보호를 위해서는 심장을 보호하는 방법

Active Issues:
# Chest pain/CAD- Pt originally presented with chest pain which 
resolved on admission without therapy. He has a significant 
history of CAD and DM with previous DES to the RCA and Lcirc. 
His last stress test was in ___ without evidence of ischemia. 
Given extensive cardiac history and presentation he was 
monitiored on tele and ruled out for ACS with 3 negative trops 
and an EKG's that were unchanged Pt did not have chest pain 
while in the hospital. He was continued on ASA, plavix, 
atenolol, and isosorbide mononitrate.

# Abdominal Pain: Patient was complaining of pain primarily in 
the RUQ. His abdominal exam was benign exam with mild RUQ 
tenderness on palpation which was reassuring. RUQ US was 
negative for acute cholecystitis but showed a dilated 
gallbladder. Gallbladder HIDA scan was also normal although 
terminated early due to patient discomfort. Pt reported decrease 
in BM suggesting possible component of constipation. He was put 
on a bowel regimen of senna, colace, and miralax and started 
having bowel movements with resolution of symptoms. He tolerated 
PO liquids and his diet was advanced without further abdominal 
pain. He will be discharged on bowel regimen of senna, colace, 
and miralax. We also continued his home ranitidine for 
prevention of GERD. 
 
# ESRD s/p renal transplant in ___. Cr was mildly elevated from 
baseline on admission. After IVF this returned to baseline and 
remained so throughout hospitalization. Pt waa continued on his 
home azathioprine and prednisone.

on his home regimen of diltiazem and atenolol. His BP on 
discharge was 110/62. 
 
# Esophageal spasm: Pt without symptoms. Continued home 
diltiazem. Restarted home viscous lidocaine on discharge.

병력 소견 :
DM을 가진 남자 환자가 흑백 구안, 신장 이식 후, 심근 경색증으로 인한 CAD를 받았으며, 오늘 오전 10시부터 시작된 서서히 발현되는 하반체 가슴 통증과 함께 복통을 호소하고 있다. 그는 마이나타와 비스쿠스 리도카인 없이 어떤 증상의 완화도 없었다. 지난번에 뇌졸중이나 심근경색증은 없었으나 최근 스트레스 테스트에서 허혈 변화가 없는 것으로 나타났다. 내원 이후에는 식후 위험도가 높아지는 우측 상복부 복통이 발생하였다. 기침이나 열, 두통 등은 없고 숨쉬기가 불편하며 nausea는 있었지만 설사를 하지 않았다. 또한 변비가 있었다. 체온은 평소보다 낮았다. 간질환은 없다. 혈액 검사는 양성 트롭니 Tropinin 2회, 2차 집행 중이며, 크레이티닌은 1대 1로 정상이다. ECG는 이전과 같았다. 초음파에서는 담낭 부종만 보였으며, 다른 증세나 장애물은 없었다. X선 사진에서도 급격한 과정은 없었다.

Brief Hospital Course:
The patient was admitted to the surgery service for evaluation 
and treatment following elective toe amputations for dry 
gangrene on both the right and left feet.
 
Neuro: The patient received fentanyl patch, which she comes in 
on from home, with good effect and adequate pain control. When 
tolerating oral intake, the patient was transitioned to oral 
pain medications.  
 
CV:  The patient was stable from a cardiovascular standpoint;  
vital signs were routinely monitored. She was restarted on her 
home dose of coumadin and was not bridged as it was thought that 
for AF she would be able to slowly return to ___ 
state. INR goal ___. 
 
Pulmonary:  The patient was stable from a pulmonary standpoint; 
vital signs were routinely monitored.  Good pulmonary toilet, 
early ambulation and incentive spirometry were encouraged 
throughout this hospitalization.  
 
GI/GU/FEN: 
Post operatively, the patient was made NPO with IVF.  
The patient's diet was advanced when appropriate, which was 
tolerated well.  
The patient's intake and output were closely monitored, and IVF 
were adjusted when necessary.  The patient's electrolytes were 
routinely followed during this hospitalization, and repleted 
when necessary.  
 
ID: The patient's white blood count and fever curves were 
closely watched for signs of infection. Her feet looked well 
throughout with minimal drainage. ___ as started on a 10 day 
total course of antibiotics that is due to end by .........
 
Endocrine:  The patient's blood sugar was monitored throughout 
this stay; insulin dosing was adjusted accordingly. 
 
Hematology:  The patient's complete blood count was examined 
routinely; no transfusions were required during this stay. She 
was restarted on her home coumadin dosing on ___. Her  INR 
was followed and it was thought that she did not require a 
bridge.
 
Prophylaxis:  The patient received subcutaneous heparin during 
this stay, and was encouraged to get up and ambulate as early as 
possible.  
 
At the time of discharge, the patient was doing well, afebrile 
with stable vital signs.  The patient was tolerating a regular 
diet, ambulating, voiding without assistance, and pain was well 
controlled. Physical therapy was working the patient and felt 
that a rehab faiclity was the safest way to proceed to get the 
patient ready prior to returning home.

의사 : ________________________________________
주요소견 :
발목 부위 양측 말단 괴사를 동반한 족부 부종을 주소로 내원하였다.
수술내역 : ____ : 발뒤꿈치 절제술(Right 2nd, 3rd, 4th, Left Great Toe)
병력 및 경과 : 19세 여성으로 과거 우측 하지 교정 수술 후 현재 양측 족지 괴상을 동반하여 절제를 시행받았다.
이력 및 질환력 : 고혈압, 파라옥시즘 심방세동증(Warfarin 목표 INR), 관상 동맥질환(Mitral Regurgitation), 패서미아 증후군(Pacemaker Placement 이후), 골다공증, 위식도 역류증(Gastroesophageal reflux disease), 만성 신장 질환, 폐쇄적 수면 무호흡증, 만성적인 혈액 손실(Anemia secondary chronic disease), 전염증 후신경통(Herpetic Neuralgia) 등이 있다.
사회력 및 가족력 : 아버지 사망 판크레이스CA, 어머니 사망 Heart Disease
체외 검사 결과 : 출퇴院 시점에서 NAD, RRR, CTAB, Abd 소프트 NT ND, Ext: 오른쪽 발은 최소 배출물, 왼쪽 발대족 부위는 최소배출물이다.
순간 혈관검사결과 : 피험자의 순간 혁학적 상태는 안정되어 있었으며, 정맥혈전량은 10.08cc/kg였다.
기타사항 : 환자는 흉부절개술, 복강경조영술, 요법 등을 받았고, 약물 투여는 적극적으로 이루어졌다.
추가 사항 : 환자가 치료 중에 잘 지냈다.
