Brief Hospital Course:
___ h/o cervical + lumbar lami-fusion presenting s/p 
sacral/lumbar trauma with right leg weakness/numbness and 
urinary incontinence concerning for conus medullaris syndrome 
but with MRI L-spine negative x2 for conus/cauda/cord 
compression. He was diagnosed with a CONUS MEDULLARIS CONTUSION, 
the pain and weakness from which resolved during his 
hospitalization. The day after admission, his urinary symptoms 
normalized and did not recur.
.
ACTIVE ISSUES
# CONUS MEDULLARIS CONTUSION: The patient had severe pain and 
weakness of the right leg along with urinary incontinence after 
sliding down a flight of stairs on his buttocks. There was 
concern for conus medullaris syndrome but MRI was negative x2 
for conus/cauda pathology. The day after admission, his urinary 
symptoms normalized and did not recur. His pain and weakness 
improved slowly. He was eventually able to mobilize himself with 
crutches. His pain requirements were substantial and he required 
standing gabapentin (3600mg total daily dose) and oxycontin 
(80mg BID) with hydromorphone PO 4mg q4:PRN breakthrough pain. 
While in house, he also received frequent IV Dilaudid, reaching 
doses as high as 2.125mg q3h. He was given a prescription for 
outpatient physical therapy.
.
# DM1: Asymptomatic, sugars above goal on admission. His 
metformin was held while in house. Lantus was increased from 20 
to 22 and then to 25. His sugars remained high, often in the 
200s and 300s. He was sent home on his metformin with Lantus 25 
HS and his pre-admission Humalog sliding scale. 
.
INACTIVE ISSUES
NONE
.
TRANSITIONAL ISSUES
# CONUS MEDULLARIS CONTUSION: Followed for increased mobility, 
continued absence of bowel/bladder symptoms. Wean analgesics as 
possible.
.
# DM1: Please follow for euglycemia; adjust insulin/metformin as 
needed.

or cane).
 
Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___, 

It was a pleasure caring for you while you were admitted to the 
___. As you recall, you were admitted 
after trauma causing a bruise at the end of your spinal cord. 
You are already recovering well. You are scheduled for follow-up 
with the neurology department as detailed below.

Your medication list has changed:
CHANGED MEDICATIONS:
1. INCREASE Lantus to 25 units at night (continue your metformin 
and sliding scale as written - decrease Lantus back to your 
prior dose of 20 units at night if your blood sugars are below 
100 or if you are symptomatic)

NEW MEDICATIONS
1. START oxycontin 80mg every 12 hours (regardless of whether 
you are in pain or not)
2. START dilaudid 4mg every 4 hours by mouth ONLY if you are in 
severe pain.
3. START gabapentin 1200mg every 8 hours regardless of whether 
you are in pain or not

PLEASE NOTE that all of these medications can cause excess 
sedation and depression of your respiratory drive. Do not take 
these medications if you need to do anything that requires you 
to be alert. Do not drink any alcohol or take any other sedating 
medications whil you are on this regimen. 

Please call your primary care physician tomorrow to make an 
appointment to be seen next week. Bring your prescription for 
outpatient physical therapy to this appointment so that you can 
receive a list of available centers near you. Alternatively, you 
can find an outpatient physical therapy center yourself. 

Call your physician immediately or dial 911 if you experience 
any of the "danger signs" below.

Brief Hospital Course:
Mr ___ is a ___ year old gentleman with a history of DMII, 
benign tracheal mass/stenosis, ESRD, hydralazine induced 
vasculitis, recent hospitalization with pseudomonal bacteremia 
and lower extremity ulcer infection presenting  with worsening 
extremity pain.

#. Non-healing leg ulcers/Lower extremity pain. On admission 
patient with complaint of lower extremity pain and rehab concern 
for persistent/recurrent infection. On admission, patient with 
elevated WBC and malodorous/purulent discharge appreciated on 
exam. Infectious disease, Vascular surgery, rheumatology and 
dermatology. Patient empirically covered with IV vancomycin, 
imipenem. Antibiotics were narrowed when cultures returned with 
rare group B strep and pseudomonas sensitive to ceftaz. Plain 
films were negative for osteomyelitis therefore decision made to 
treat for two week course; end date of antibiotics: ___. 
Prior to discharge, erythema of left lower extremity recurred 
with WBC uptrending to 14 therefore decision made to restart 
vancomycin 1000mg IV QD. First dose will need to be given at 
rehab on evening of ___. 
Additionally right digit biopsy consistent with neutrophilic 
infiltration with concern for Pyoderma gangrenosum. Dermatology 
recommended started minocycline 100mg PO BID as well as dapsone 
25mg daily. G6Pd was pending at time of discharge therefore 
dapsone was discontinued with plan to start with dermatology as 
an outpatient

redose if needed

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr ___ it was a pleasure taking care of you.

You were admitted to ___ in the setting of lower extremity 
ulcers and pain. Due to concern for infection, biopsies were 
performed and you were placed on broad spectrum antibiotics. 
Prior to discharge, antibiotics were narrowed to 
ceftazadine/vanc which you will continue for the next two weeks. 
Additionally, which on IV antibiotics it will be necessary for 
you to take PO vancomycin to treat/prevent recurrent C.difficile 
infection.
In addition to infection, the biopsies revealed an inflammatory 
process that maybe contributing to your ulcers. You were started 
on two medications, minocycline and dapsone for treatment of the 
inflammation. You received these medications prior to discharge 
without appreciable side effect. Dermatology would like to see 
you before resuming dapsone.

It will be important to follow-up with your outpatient providers 
(dermatology, rheumatology) after discharge to ensure ulcers are 
healing well.

Mr. ____은 연령 요우 남성으로 고혈압, 신장 질환, 혈액투석을 받고 있다. 최근에 심근경색 후 수축성 관상 동맥질환이나 비만 등 여러 차례 입원을 하였다. 환자는 최근에 세균 감염 및 C. 디플리콜로 콜라이트를 앓았다. 환자의 현재 상태는 심각한 것이 아니며, 그 외에도 다른 증상을 보이지 않았다.

병력 개요 :
Mr.__는 지난 몇 주 동안 여러 번 입원하여 심근 경색 후 발작이나 불안정한 맥박 등을 호소하였다. 환자가 최근에 재발된 것은 아니다. 환인은 최근에 치료받았으며, 아직도 계속해서 치료를 받아야 한다. 환인의 과거에는 심근 조직학에서 유해성이 없는 것으로 나타났다.

사회력 :
여성

 가족력이 :
어머니가 만성 폐쇄성폐렴이다.

체외 검사 :
혈당 11.8%, 혈중 칼륨 5~6mmol/l, 혀 중 엽산 130~140μmol/l, 알칼리도 체 26~30mEq/l, 전해질 135~145 mmol/l이었다. 또한, 혁동성 위궤양이 있었으나, 이때는 혈청 단백질 72~78g/dl이었으며, 혐식성 간질환은 없었다.

내시경 검사 결과 :
위와 같은 내용이며, 추가적인 검사가 필요하다.

결론적으로, 환인이 심각하지 않아 퇴원할 수 있었다. 그러나, 여전히 환인에게는 많은 문제점들이 존재한다. 따라서, 환인을 지속적으로 추적하며, 필요한 경우 추가적인 처치를 시행해야 할 것이다.

Brief Hospital Course:
___ with pmhx of dementia, CKD, gout who presents with lethargy, 
found to have positive UA, course complicated by 
ceftriaxone-related rash. 

ACTIVE MEDICAL ISSUES:
#  UTI: Patient presented ___ several days of lethargy, found 
to have positive UA. Her initial urine culture was contaminated. 
A repeat urine culture on ___ was pending at time of discharge. 
She was originally started on IV Ceftriaxone 1g Q24H (___), 
which was subsequently stopped due to development of an 
erythematous macular rash. She was switched to IV Ciprofloxacin 
(___). She completed a total of a 5-day antibiotic course 
for an uncomplicated UTI. 

# Hypotension: Patient had reported SBP in ___ and 100s at 
rehab. Daughter reports low volume intake and diarrhea for the 
day prior to presentation. She received IVF in ED. Initially 
hypotensive on the floor but returned to ___ following 
IVF.  Her home anti-hypertensives valsartan and lasix were held 
inpatient while she had poor PO intake. She received IVF boluses 
for hypotension as needed.
Her blood pressures predominantly ranged in the 110s/50s while 
hospitalizated, and her anti-htn regimen was held on discharge. 

#  Diarrhea/mild colitis: Pt with reported multiple watery 
stools recently at rehab. Recent abx use for UTI. CT with 
questionable mild colitis. The patient had no further episodes 
of watery stools in the hospital. No antibiotics were started 
for her mild colitis. 

# Conjunctivitis: Pt with purulent discharge from left eye. Per 
daughter, the patient had recent history of left eye pruritis. 
She completed a 5-day course of  erythromycin ointment QID 
(___) for bacterial conjunctivities. On day of discharge, 
she had no left eye drainage or pruritis. 

# Drug rash: Patient developed erythematous macular rash 
following 3 days of Ceftriaxone on ___. She had no evidence of 
oral mucosa involvement. On ___ eosinophils were noted to be 
elevated (absolute count 1820), but LFTs  were within normal 
limits. She received Sarna ointment for pruritis. Ceftriaxone 
was added to her drug allergies. Drug rash improved on 
discharge.

# Dyspnea and question of CP: Per daughter, patient reported 
dyspnea and chest pain prior to hospital arrival. Her CXR was 
without signs of pneumonia. EKG with LBBB was largely unchanged 
from past. Per daughter, patient is known to become anxious when 
feeling unwell. During her hospitalization, she was saturating 
well on room air and was without respiratory distress. 

CHRONIC MEDICAL ISSUES:
#CKD: Patient with stage IV CKD, with baseline Cr ranging 1.5 to 
2.1 per ___ nephrology note. Creatinine on admission was 1.8, 
which is within her recent baseline and trended up to 2.1 on 
___, likely due to hypovolemia in setting of poor PO intake. On 
day of discharge, her creatinine had trended down to 1.4 
baseline.   

#Anemia: Pt with baseline anemia, likely secondary to CKD. Hgb 
last admission ranging from ___. Hgb on admission 10.9, which 
is around baseline. Anemia notably macrocytic, however B12 and 
folate checked during hospital stay in ___ and were within 
normal limits. Given macrocytosis, MDS was thought to be a  
possible component of her anemia. Her Hgb on day of discharge 
was stable at 9.2. 

# HTN: Her home home valsartan and lasix where held in the 
context of hypotension and elevated creatinine. Her blood 
pressures predominately ranged in the 110s/50s while 
hospitalized. 

# HLD: She was continued on her home atorvastatin.
.
# Gout: She was continued on her home allopurinol.
.
# GERD: She was continued on her home ranitidine.
.
# Anxiety: She was continued on her home low-dose alprazolam PRN 
anxiety.

translated:
이름: ______
Unit No.: ______

입원일자: ______ 제출일자 : ______

생년월일: ______ 성별: 여성

서비스: 의학과

알레르기: 네스포린 / 히드록시클로로퀸 / 세프트리아손

진료 담당자는 ______입니다.

주요 불편 사항은 혼란, 음식 섭취 감소, 물리 소변, 호흡곤란 등 다수이다.

응급실에서 초기 혈압은 97/67mmHg였다. 심전도는 이전과 동일한 상태였다. 검사 결과 백혈구 증가가 나타났다. 소변검사는 대형백혈球을 보였고, 24wbc를 포함했다. 그녀는 세프티아손을 받았으며 병동에 입원하였다. 복부 및 골반의 CT 촬영에서는 경미한 결장염이 관찰되었다. 흉부 X-ray는 폐렴으로 부정적인 결과를 보였다.

대상 수술 또는 침습적 절차: 없음

병력 개요:
______이 오래된 치매, 신증후군, 고혈압을 가진 노인 여성으로서 여러 가지 증상을 가지고 있다. 딸은 그녀가 최근 몇 날 자신감이 떨어졌다고 한다. 딸 또한 그녀의 식욕이 저하되었음을 알렸다. 그녀의 주거지에서의 혈액 압박은 ____~___까지 낮았다. 아들들은 하루 동안 다수의 앙금 변비를 경험했었다.

오늘 아침, 딸은 운전 중 짧게 숨 가쁘다는 것을 느꼈다. 딸이 그녀를 응급실로 데려왔다.

응 급실에서 초음파는 97 / 67 mmHg이었다. 심 전 도는 이전보다 변화가 없었다. 실험실 검사결과 백현 동증이 나타났다. 소변장은 대형 백혇기를 보였으며, 23wbc가 있었다. 그녀는 체스트 트리아존을 받고 병동으로 옮겨졌다. 복 부와 골반 CT촬영은 경미 한 결 장 염을 보여준다. 흡연은 폐렴 없이 부정 적이었다.

환자의 주요 임상 정보:

* 이름: _______ 유닛 번호: _______
* 생년 월 일: _______* 성별 : 여자
* 서비스: 의학
* 알레르 기: 네 스포린 / 하이드록 시 클로 로 퀴 넥 / 세 프 티아 손
* 진료 담 당 자: _______

주요 항목:
여러 가지 불만족: 혼돈, 음식을 먹지 못함, 물 리 소변,숨 가쁜 것

응급 실에서 초기 비율은 96.0/66.0mmH그였다. ECG는 이전 그대로였다. 실패실 검 사 결과 백 혈 구 증가가 발생했다. 소 배 검사는 대규모 백혔골을 보였다. 그녀는 CEFTRIAXONE을 받았다. CT 복부와 골 반은 경 미한 결 장염을 보이고있다. 흰색은 폐쇄증이 없다.

중대한 외과적 또는 침투적 절 차: 없음 과거 병력:
여성은 오랫동안 정신적으로 혼란스럽고 기억력이 약해져 있었던 것으로 알려졌다. 딸 은 그녀가 지난 몇 달간 자신의 마음속에 들어가지 않았다고 말했다. 딸 이 말하는 바에 따르면 그녀는 더 피곤하고 잊어버리는 경향이 있다고 했다. 딸도 그녀가 포화되지 않았음을 알고 있었다. 그녀의 혈圧은 재활센터에서 낮았는데, 특히 sys-tolic 혈壓은 _____였다. 지원 센터에서도 그녀는 여러 개의 앙 금 변비가 있다는 것을 알렸다.

이날 아침, 환자가 운전하다가 숨 가빠지는 것이 시작되어 딸이 그를 응급 료로 데리고 왔다. 응급 실에서는 초기 비탈이 97 67 100 % RA였다.심 전 도 는 이전과 같았다. 실효실 검사의 결과 백색질증이 증가했다. 딸이나 다른 사람들도 그녀가 음식을 잘못먹었음을 알고 있다. 그녀의 맥박은 77/115/60/95% RA였다.

관내 환자:
여성이 오랜 시간 동안 정신적으로 안정되지 않고 기억력이 좋지 않아서인지 daughters는 그녀가 마지막 몇 날 동안 자신감을 잃었다고 한다. daughters는 딸이나 남편이 그녀가 너무 힘든 상황이라고 생각한다. 딸 혹은 다른 가족 구성원이 그녀가 요양소를 떠나지 않는

ECHO (___):
The left atrium is moderately dilated. There is mild symmetric 
left ventricular hypertrophy. The left ventricular cavity is 
moderately dilated. There is severe regional left ventricular 
systolic dysfunction with inferior and inferolateral thinning 
and akinesis. There is moderate to severe hypokinesis of the 
remaining segments (LVEF = ___. No masses or thrombi are 
seen in the left ventricle. Tissue synchronization imaging 
demonstrates significant left ventricular dyssynchrony, because 
of inferolateral akinesis. The delay between left ventricular 
and right ventricular ejection is 13 ms ___ <40ms). The left 
ventricle is dyssnchronous with global synchrony (___) index of 
60 ms ___ <=33ms), although the most dyssynchronous segment 
(inferolateral wall) is also the one which appears thin and 
fibrotic. Right ventricle is mildly dilated and hypokinetic. The 
diameters of aorta at the sinus, ascending and arch levels are 
normal. The aortic valve leaflets (3) are mildly thickened but 
aortic stenosis is not present. The mitral valve leaflets are 
structurally normal. The mitral valve leaflets do not fully 
coapt. Moderate (2+) mitral regurgitation is seen. The left 
ventricular inflow pattern suggests a restrictive filling 
abnormality, with elevated left atrial pressure. Moderate to 
severe [3+] tricuspid regurgitation is seen. There is moderate 
pulmonary artery systolic hypertension. There is no pericardial 
effusion. 

IMPRESSION: Dilated left ventricle with severe regional and 
global left ventricular systolic dysfunction. Significant 
intraventricular LV dyssynchrony, however late segments are also 
likely scarred. Moderate functional mitral regurgitation. 
Moderate to severe tricuspid regurgitation. Moderate pulmonary 
hypertension.

Compared with the prior study (images reviewed) of ___, LV 
cavity has further dilated, LV systolic function is reduced. 
Severity of mitral and tricuspid regurgitation has increased

CXR (___):
FINDINGS:  There is stable cardiomegaly.  Dual-lead left-sided 
pacemaker is in adequate position with leads terminating in the 
right atrium and right ventricle.  As compared to prior chest 
radiograph from ___, there is an increased area of 
opacity in the right lung base with obscuration of the medial 
right hemidiaphragm.  In the appropriate clinical setting, this 
could reflect early pneumonia. There is congestion of the upper 
lobes. There is no definite pneumothorax or pleural effusions.   

IMPRESSION:  Increased opacity at right lung base with 
obscuration of the 
medial right hemidiaphragm. In the appropriate clinical setting, 
this could represent early pneumonia.  Clinical correlation is 
recommended.

ACTIVE ISSUES:
============================
# Acute on chronic congestive heart failure with 
diastolic/systolic dysfunction: EF 30% in ___. After his cath, 
echo showed EF during this admission showed EF ___. The day 
after cardiac cath the patient was noted to be in acute on 
chronic CHF with an elevated, bibasilar crackles without 
significant edema thought to be secondary to NSTEMI. He was 
transferred to the CCU and started on Lasix gtt 10mg/hr and 
required additional dose of metalozone. His urine output 
improved with increasing furosemide dose to 15mg/hr. His 
spironolactone was stopped in the CCU. When the patient appeared 
to be close to euvolemia he switched to torsemide 60mg daily and 
was discharged on this dose. No admission 91.6 kg was his 
maximum weight and discharge weight was 88.0 kg. 
.
# NSTEMI: Given the patient's history of stroke in ___, he 
was admitted for heparin bridging prior to cardiac 
catheterization. He underwent cardiac catheterization on ___ 
without intervention, which was complicated by wire dissection. 
Day after cardiac cath, he developed on going chest 
pain/pressure, diaphoresis and SOB. Cardiac enzymes continued to 
trend upward with a peak of CK-MB 45 and troponin of 1.49. His 
troponin remained elevated beyond when his CK-MB trended 
downwards given his underlying renal failure. At that point, it 
was determined to medically manage the patient with the addition 
of imdur 30mg daily, metoprolol 50mg daily, atorvastatin, and 
full dose aspirin. Given his recent stroke, neurology was 
consulted in regards to dual anti-platelet in addition to 
coumadin given increased risk of bleeding. It was recommended 
that he stay on full dose aspirin and coumadin. His chest pain 
resolved by admission. 
.
# Paroxysmal Afib: Patient was initially admitted prior to 
catheterization for heparin bridging given that he had a CVA in 
___ and there was concern that his recent CVA was secondary 
to embolic event. CHADS2 score was 6. His precath course was 
complicated by one episode of afib with RVR. He was then started 
on amiodarone and was loaded with amiodarone 400mg BID for a 
total of 8g and switched to amiodarone 400mg daily thereafter 
for an additional month. He was rate controlled with metoprolol 
succinate 50mg daily. After cath, he was bridged to coumadin 
with heparin gtt as renal function precluded the use of 
enoxaparin for bridging. After return to the floor from the CCU, 
he did not have any episodes of a.fib with rvr. As per the 
patient, his INR is managed by his PCP and should have next INR 
drawn on ___.
.
# Acute on chronic renal failure: Baseline Cr 1.4-1.6. After 
cardiac catheterization and while the patient was in the CCU he 
was noted to have low UOP and an increase in his creatinine with 
a peak of 3.5. Renal was consulted by CCU team and thought to be 
secondary to pre-renal etiology despite being hypervolemic on 
exam at that time and most likely had vasoconstriction from 
contrast dye as timing was too soon to have developed contrast 
nephropathy. His creatinine improved with diuresis (see above 
for further details). His losartan was initially held in the 
setting of renal failure, but was restarted prior to discharge. 
His discahrge cr was 2.2, which appears to be his new baseline. 
He should follow up with nephrology as an outpatient.
.
# Ventricular Tachycardia: ICD placed in ___ for primary 
prevention and underwent generator change in ___. While the 
patient was in the CCU, he was intermittently with episodes of 
VTach with rates up to 160s-170s symptomatic only with 
dizziness. The patient sustained in VT for >20minutes and was 
subsequently cardioverted on ___. His ICD was interrogated the 
day after by EP and was determined to be functioning properly. 
He was monitored on telemetry after he returned to the floor 
without episodes of VT.
.
# Leukocytosis: Peak WBC 16.8 without any localizing signs of 
symptoms for infection and he remained afebrile throughout his 
course. Urine and blood cultures were negative. CXR was 
consistent with pulmonary edema. Leukocytosis was most likely 
from stress reaction and had resolved by discharge at the time 
his WBC was 9.0 
.
# DM: At home, patient is maintained on combination of oral 
hypoglycemics and insulin. Also of note, patient persistently 
symtpomatically hypoglycemic in AM with home dose of insulin in 
the intensive care unit most likely combination of poor po 
intake and worsening renal function. His insulin was adjusted, 
so dose of nighttime long acting insulin was halved to 15 units 
on day of transfer to the floor. The patient was then 
transitioned back to his home dosing of insulin prior to 
discharge without any episodes of hypoglycemia.
.
# CVA: Given his recent stroke in ___ with only deficit word 
finding difficulties at times, neurology was consulted in 
regards to dual anti-platelet in addition to coumadin given 
increased risk of bleeding. It was recommended that he stay on 
full dose aspirin and coumadin.
.
# Hematuria: While on the heparin gtt, the patient had his foley 
removed and developed one day of hematuria that resolved the 
next day. His hematocrit remained stable with discharge Hct of 
36.4.
.

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

It was a pleasure taking care of you here at ___ 
___.

You came to the hospital because you were having chest pain and 
underwent cardiac catheterization that was unable to intervene 
upon the lesion, but it did cause an injury to the artery. 
Afterwards, you had trouble breathing and were transferred to 
intensive care unit. You needed to have fluid from your legs and 
around your lungs and your breathing improved thereafter. We 
were able to do this with furosemide and your symptoms improved.

As you go forward, it is important to weigh yourself every 
morning, call your primary care physician or cardiologist if 
weight goes up more than 3 lbs.

You were also found to have an irregular heart rate in the 
intensive care unit called ventricular tachycardia and you had 
to be shocked out of this rhythm.

In regards to your atrial fibrillation, you were on a heparin to 
keep you blood thin while we waited for your INR from your 
coumadin to be therapeutic between ___. Since amiodarone 
enhances the effect of coumadin (warfarin), you most likely will 
need less coumadin than previously.

While here, you were found to have slightly worsening kidney 
function and should follow up with a cardiologist.

The following changes were made to your medications:
--START amiodarone 400mg daily
--START torsemide 60mg daily
--START isosorbide mononitrate 30mg daily
--START warfarin 3mg daily, until you have your next INR checked 
and your pcp ___ adjust the dose from there.
--START Metoprolol 50mg daily
--STOP carvedilol
--STOP spironolactone
--STOP furosemide (it is being replaced with torsemide)

진료의사 : ________.

주민증명서번호 : _____________________

환자의 주소는 다음과 같습니다. 환자는 심장관에 대한 필요성이 있어 직접 입원을 하였다. 지난 ___에서 환자가 흉통을 호소하여 발견되었고 보고된 후 여러 차례 흉부 통증을 보였으며, 두 날 전에는 다시 두 번 흉 부 통증으로 인해 병동 진료를 받았다. 또한 최근 뇌졸중으로 인한 혈전 치료가 생각되었다.

현재 환자는 복통이나 압력이 없다고 한다. 그러나 이후 환자는 체위로 매우 앉아 있다. 그의 마지막 투약은 어제 였다. 그의 가장 최근의 INR은 2주 전에 2시간이었다.

혈액 검사는 다음과 같다. 현재 그는 잘 느껴지며 말한다. 시스템 검토에서는 이전에 깊은 정맥류, 폐색종, 수술 시 출혈, 근육통, 관절통, 기침, 붕괴 또는 빨간 소변을 경험하지 않았다. 그는 최근 열병, 경련 또는 발열을 겪었다. 그는 허리나 다리의 운동 불편함도 없다. 모든 다른 검토표시는 음식물 알러지 반응이 없었다. 심장 검사는 흉곽 통증, 실신 증상, 파라옥시즘적 밤 시간 동요, 안경 착용, 패싱 또는 사정 없음과 같은 것이 눈에 띄게 부족했다.

 과거 이력 :
1. 심층 위험 요인 : 당뇨병, 이상 지질, 고혈압

2. 심계 이력 : CABG : ___, 내피 교정 : 마지막 카테터화는 ___ 에서 진행 중인 RCA를 막았습니다.
3. 기타 과거 병력 : CVA (?) Emboli while in __ in ___ reported mostly resolved - OSA 사용하는 사람이다.

사회 역력 :
___
가족 역력 : 조기심박, 아리듬, 심근 질환이나 갑작스러운 심장 사망은 아니었지만 그렇지 않으면 비추여. 물론 가족 역력은 여전히 유익하다.

체외 검사는 다음과 같이 나타났다. VS : 98 126 / 69 83 16% RA 일반적으로 잘 나온 NAD 편안하고 HEENT : EOM I PERR LNCAT 클리어 OP 목 : 연골 및 JVP는 등받이를 하고 있는 상태 CV : nls 1s 2 R RR 무 마그니즘 Lungs : CTAB Abdomen : 가벼운 NT ND BS GU : NO Foley Ext : 1 + DP Radial Pulse Neuro : CN II X II 전체적으로 강하게 유지되는 AAO x3 Skin : Intact

Brief Hospital Course:
MS. ___ is a ___ year old woman with history of metastatic 
pancreatic cancer on
chemotherapy, severe aortic stenosis requiring several
hospitalizations for fluid overload and diuresis who was 
admitted 
for trans-catheter aortic valve replacement(TAVR) on ___. 
She had a successful TAVR with a 23mm ___ valve. Her post 
TAVR echo on ___ showed improved aortic gradients. She is 
being anticoagulated with aspirin and Plavix for this aortic 
valve replacement. Lasix was resumed on post op day 1. 
Metoprolol was initially held to monitor for conduction disorder 
post TAVR but no conduction disease was noted therefore 
metoprolol was resumed. We did not restart lisinopril which she 
states was recently discontinued. She was initially hypertensive 
post procedure with systolic blood pressures of 160s which was 
treated with hydralazine 10mg oral dose once. She was 
normotensive throughout the rest of the hospitalization. She was 
prescribed amoxicillin for SBE prophylaxis.  For diabetic 
management Jardiance and metformin were held during 
hospitalization and she was covered with sliding scale insulin. 
Her diabetic medications were all restarted at discharge. 
She was discharge to home with visiting nurse on ___.

Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted for a trans catheter aortic valve repair 
(TAVR)to treat your aortic valve stenosis which was done on 
___. By repairing the valve your heart can pump blood more 
easily and your shortness of breath and fluid overload should 
improve.  

It is very important to take all of your heart healthy 
medications. In particular, you are now taking aspirin and 
plavix. These medications help to prevent blood clots from 
forming on the new valve. If you stop these medications or miss 
___ dose, you risk causing a blood clot forming on your new valve. 
This could cause it to malfunction and it may be life 
threatening. Please do not stop taking aspirin or Plavix without 
taking to your heart doctor, even if another doctor tells you to 
stop the medications.  

You will need prophylactic antibiotics prior to any dental 
procedure. Please inform your dentist about your recent cardiac 
procedure. One hour prior to your dental procedure take 
amoxicillin 2 gram once.  

Please weigh yourself every day in the morning after you go to 
the bathroom and before you get dressed. If your weight goes up 
by more than 3 lbs in 1 day or more than 5 lbs in 3 days, please 
call your heart doctor or your primary care doctor and alert 
them to this change. Your weight at discharge is 202 pounds.
 
We have made changes to your medication list, so please make 
sure to take your medications as directed. You will also need to 
have close follow up with your heart doctor and your primary 
care doctor.  

Please see your follow up appointments listed below. 

If you have any urgent questions that are related to your 
recovery from your procedure or are experiencing any symptoms 
that are concerning to you and you think you may need to return 
to the hospital, please call the ___ HeartLine at ___ 
to speak to a cardiologist or cardiac nurse practitioner.  

It has been a pleasure to have participated in your care and we 
wish you the best with your health!

History of Present Illness:
___ woman with a history of COPD s/p trach and reversal 
on intermittent home O2, seizure disorder, and prior CVA who 
presents with hypoxia and difficulty speaking. 

Per her SNF, she was noted to be lethargic and hypoxic to the 
___, prompting her to be brought to the ED. The patient is 
unsure exactly why she was brought to the hospital, but says it 
is due to being sleepy and unable to eat breakfast at her SNF. 
She reports taking her oxycodone at 4AM instead of her usual 
midnight dose. She denies any recent illnesses or symptoms of 
fever/chills, myalgias/arthalgias, dysuria, increased diarrhea, 
or worsening cough/sputum. She is complaining of chronic back 
pain. She denies chest pain, dyspnea, abdominal pain or 
nausea/vomiting. She also was complaining of difficulty speaking 
with slurring of her words, which has never happened before. Her 
other neurologic deficits (lower extremity weakness and right 
arm incoordination) are at baseline.  

In the ED, she was hypoxic to the mid-80s on nasal cannula and 
was started on BiPAP. Her CXR was concerning of pulmonary edema 
and she was given 40 mg IV Lasix. She was noted to be 
hyperkalemic and was given calcium, insulin and dextrose.   

She was recently admitted from ___ for hypoxia requiring 
intubation thought to be secondary to pneumonia and COPD 
exacerbation. During that admission, she presented with hypoxia 
to 60% on RA and was intubated after failing a trial of BiPAP. 
She had severe hypercarbia and a primary respiratory acidosis. 
Her sputum grew Moraxella catarrhalis and Haemophilus influenza. 
She was treated for suspected CAP/COPD exacerbation with 
ceftriaxone, azithromycin, steroids, and bronchodilators. Her 
course was also complicated by hyperkalemia, hypoglycemia in the 
setting of new insulin exposure, acute kidney injury, 
bradycardia likely secondary to precedex, and UTI with E. coli 
treated as above.

#Acute on chronic hypercarbic/hypoxemic respiratory failure

#Aspiration and COPD
Patient presented with acute on chronic hypercarbic/hypoxemic 
respiratory failure in the setting of re-timing her opiate 
medications and reported sedation. Differential diagnoses 
include COPD exacerbation, pneumonia, CHF exacerbation, and 
sedative medication effect.  History and exam was not entirely 
consistent with COPD exacerbation and BNP was very elevated.  Pt 
was diursesed and given methylprednisolone in the ED. She was 
started on empiric ceftriaxone and azithromycin for CAP 
coverage. Overnight on ___, she had worsening hypercarbia and 
was started on BiPAP in the ICU. Despite aggressive therapy, pt 
developed acute hypoxia possibly secondary to aspiration and was 
intubated for 24hrs. Her respiratory status improved rapidly and 
she was extubated on ___. 
On transfer to the floor, she continued to improve with 
finishing her course of steroids and azithromycin for a possible 
COPD exacerbation.  Pt was continued on night BIPAP at ___ and 
aggressively diuresed for acute on chronic diastolic CHF. Pt was 
7L negative for the hospitalization and current dry weight in 
224lbs.  Pt should continue on Lasix 20mg daily to prevent 
recurrence CHF and nightly BIPAP at ___ to prevent recurrent 
hypercarbic resp failure. We recommend a follow up BMP on ___ 
0ct ___ to ensure stability.

#Hyperkalemia
K elevated to peak of 6.7, unclear etiology, has been high as 
well in the past. No concerning EKG changes. She was given 
insulin/dextrose and calcium. She was placed on a low K diet 
when no longer NPO and her K improved.   Pt is being discharged 
on daily Lasix, please obtain follow up BMP on ___.

#Acute kidney injury
Cr elevated to 1.4 from baseline 0.7; possibly in the setting of 
infection or poor PO intake. Of note, has history of worsened 
___ with diuresis. Nephrotoxins were avoided, urine output was 
monitored and Cr was trended and normalized. 

#Transaminitis
AST/ALT elevated in 100s. Possibly consistent with viral 
syndrome that may have precipitated respiratory decompensation; 
no documented hypotension to cause shock liver or evidence of 
volume overload causing congestive hepatopathy. LFTs downtrended 
and normalized.

#Dysarthria
Patient reported dysarthria in ED but symptoms have now 
resolved. Possibly recrudescence of deficits from prior stroke 
vs. speech difficulty in setting of AMS from hypercarbia. 
Patient has reported history of CVA, not on anticoagulation. She 
was monitored on telemetry for arrhythmia. Her reported 
difficulty speaking improved.

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,
You were admitted to the hospital because you were having 
difficulty breathing. We treated you both an exacerbation of 
your COPD with steroids, antibiotics, and inhalers. We also 
treated you for a pneumonia with IV antibiotics. We used a 
non-invasive breathing machine called BIPAP to help with 
breathing at night. It is very important that you continue to 
use nightly at home. In addition, you should follow up with a 
pulmonologist to make sure that you get further testing for COPD 
and that you are on all necessary treatment. You also had to be 
intubated briefly because it appeared that you aspirated into 
your lungs, but fortunately this quickly got better and you were 
extubated.

You were treated for volume overload while in the hospital and 
this has also helped your breathing.  It is important to 
continue taking Lasix 20mg daily to prevent recurrence of fluid. 
 The facility will need to check your labs on ___ to make 
sure your kidney's are continuing to tolerate this medication 
well.

It was a pleasure taking care of you!

Sincerely,
Your ___ team

translated:
성명 : ________________________
부호번호 : ___________________________
입원일자 : ______________________________
퇴원일자는 : __________________________________
생년월일 : _______ 년 월 일
성별 : 여
서비스 : 내과

알레르기 및 부작용 :
알려진 알레르기는 없으며, 약물에 대한 과민반응도 없다.

의사 : _______________________.

주소 불편감 :
저혈압으로 인한 기침이 있다.

수술이나 침습적 시술 :
관상동맥시술을 받았다.

병력 개요 :
중증급성 폐쇄증후군 후 경련 치료를 위해 관상 동맥시술했다. 최근에는 중증 급성 폐색전증후가 있었다. 또한, 복통이 있고, 식욕불량이며, 발열과 근육통은 없었다. 환자가 주로 호흡곤란을 느끼고 있으며, 언어장애와 말하기 어려움을 보였다.

신체검사 결과 :
정신 상태는 정상이었으나, 정신 상태는 좋지 않았다. 심박수가 정상이었다. 혈액 검사는 정상이다. 간 기능 검사는 양성 반응을 보였으며, 신경계 검사는 전형적인 증상을 나타내었다.

임상 소견 :
환자의 병력이 있어, 이에 따라 진단하고 치료하였다. 환자는 현재 위험 요인이 없어 안전하다 판단된다.

치료 계획 :
환자를 치료할 때는 항염제를 투여하였으며, 항균제를 사용하여 감염을 예방하였다. 또한 환자의 체온 조절 능력을 높이고, 면역력을 강화시키기 위한 치료법을 시행하였다.

퇴원 처방 :
환자는 퇴원을 원하지 않으므로, 퇴원처방을 작성하였다. 그러나 환자는 훈련을 받아야 하며, 훈훈을 유지해야 한다. 또한 퇴원의 경우 환자는 자신의 건강 관리에 대해 잘 알아야 할 것이다.

퇴실 지시사항 :
안녕하세요! 저희 병원이 여러분에게 좋은 서비스를 제공해 드리도록 최선을 다하겠습니다. 감사합니다!

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old female with history of CLL treatment 
naive, fibromuscular dystrophy, hypothyroidism, complex 
neurological history including "neurologic spells" with TIA 
along with bipolar vs. depression with psychotic features, 
undergoing outpatient work-up for myasthenia ___, who 
initially presented as a transfer from ___ with acute 
fatigue initially concerning for myasthenic flair, found to have 
clinical hypothyroidism. Was evaluated by endocrinology, found 
to have clinical hypothyroidism with TSH elevated at 33 with 
normal thyroid uptake study thought to be in the setting of 
recent initiation of herbal supplements interacting with her 
home synthroid. She was later re-started on her home synthroid 
dosage unchanged with instructions to discontinue her herbal 
supplements. Given her ongoing fatigue, intermittent shortness 
of breath and ptosis, was evaluated by neurology underwent an 
EMG as part of her myasthenia ___ work-up which was negative. 


ACUTE ISSUES
==================
# Hypothyroidism - History of Hashimoto thyroidis maintained on 
levothyroxine 225mcg daily, who presented with acute 2 day 
history of fatigue, in the setting of weight gain and 
constipation. She reported adherence to her synthroid ___, 
however recently started taking weight loss supplements 
including apple cider vinegar and garcinia cambogia 1 week 
prior. Per review of partners records, documented to have normal 
TSH, elevated TPO and thyroglobulin antibodies one month prior 
previously stable on synthroid ___ daily. TSH found to be 
elevated at 33. Thyroid US showed evidence of thyroiditis and 
thyroid uptake study was normal. Her fatigue was likely 
secondary to clinical hypothyroidism, also may be multifactorial 
component with possible progression of non-hodgkin lymphoma 
versus myasthenia ___ considered. Endocrine was consulted, 
she had a thyroid uptake study which showed normal absorption. 
Per endocrine taking her herbal supplements for 1 week can cause 
almost complete lack of absorption leading to her clinical 
hypothyroidism. She was therefore continued on her home regimen 
without dosage adjustments with plan to repeat TSH in ___ weeks. 
Per patient request was provided list of ___ 
Endocrinologists who she would like to establish care with. 
Outpatient ___ labs ordered will need to obtain them 1 week 
prior to her appointment in 6 weeks.

# Complex neurological history "neurologic spells" with TIA

___. After obtaining collateral information from Dr.

consistent with dystonia, "neurologic spells" for upwards of ___ 
years without ever a clear diagnosis. She has been undergoing an 
extensive work-up for myasthenia ___ in the outpatient 
setting given her history of intermittent shortness of breath, 
weakness, and ptosis. During hospitalization, was evaluated by 
neurology here. She had a CT Head with no acute intracranial 
abnormalities. Also underwent EMG testing which was normal 
without evidence of fatigability or myasthenia ___. She was 
continued on ASA 81mg daily and simvastatin 40 mg daily.

noted to have an elevated creatinine up-trended to 1.3. She was 
asymptomatic and was given 500cc of NS with her Cr subsequently

per above that was fluid responsive. Possibly in the setting of 
poor PO intake. There were no infectious signs or symptoms, 
patient was not septic. Her home anti-hypertensives losartan 
100mg daily, lisinopril 20mg daily, and metoprolol 25mg daily 
were initially held. On discharge, was re-started on home 
metoprolol 25mg daily, losartan and lisinopril were held. Will

___ portable CXR on admission: WETREAD No definite

___ CT chest w/o contrast: 5.4x4.3x5.2 macro lobulated mass 
in right upper lung, extensive adenopathy, 12mm satellite lesion 
posteriorly, 3.6x2.0x6.0cm mass soft tissue in right lateral

From ___

NEGATIVE FOR DVT

___ TTE
Conclusions  
The right ventricular cavity is mildly dilated with focal 
hypokinesis of the apical free wall. with depressed free wall 
contractility. The aortic valve leaflets (3) are mildly 
thickened but aortic stenosis is not present. No masses or 
vegetations are seen on the aortic valve, but cannot be fully 
excluded due to suboptimal image quality. The mitral valve 
leaflets are mildly thickened. No masses or vegetations are seen 
on the mitral valve, but cannot be fully excluded due to 
suboptimal image quality. Trivial mitral regurgitation is seen. 
The tricuspid valve leaflets are mildly thickened. There is mild 
pulmonary artery systolic hypertension. There is no pericardial 
effusion. 

IMPRESSION: Suboptimal image quality. Suboptimal image quality 
due to body habitus. Left ventricular systolic function is 
probably normal, a focal wall motion abnormality cannot be 
excluded. The right ventricle is not well seen - the mid to 
distal free wall of the right ventricle is hypokinetic. No 
echocardiographic evidence of endocarditis. If clinically 
indicated, a transesophageal echocardiogram may better assess 
for valvular vegetations.   

___ CXR: As compared to the previous radiograph, no relevant 
change is seen in appearance of the cardiac silhouette and of 
the right-sided pigtail catheter. Also, the right upper lobe 
mass with mediastinal lymph node enlargement is constant in 
appearance.  No new parenchymal opacities are noted.  Mild 
blunting of both the left and the right costophrenic sinus 
persist.  No pneumothorax. 

___ Video swallow: Gross aspiration of nectar thick liquids. 
Penetration with honey and pureed consistencies with risk for 
aspiration. 

___ RUQ US: 1. Sludge-filled gallbladder with a single 
shadowing stone and mildly thickened and edematous gallbladder 
wall. These findings are nonspecific, and if clinical concern 
remains for acute cholecystitis, a HIDA scan could be performed. 
2. Ill-defined hypoechoic areas in the left hepatic lobe are 
incompletely evaluated given the technical limitations of this 
examination, and could represent cysts although solid lesions 
are not excluded. 3. Septated right hepatic lobe cyst. 4. Mild 
perisplenic ascites.

Brief Hospital Course:
___ male smoker w/ PMH HTN, HL who was transferred from 
___ with new diagnosis metastatic 
adenocarcinoma of the lung, with lung, chest wall and 
pericardial involvement transferred for hypoxic respitory 
failure found to have highly resistant pseudomonal pneumonia, 
pericardial effusion growing saccharomyces cerevisiae, and 
anasarca.

___ Course:  Mr ___ began developing 
signs/symptoms consistent with a PNA beginning several weeks 
ago. The pt presented to his PCP who prescribed ___ course of PO 
abx (not sure which abx) completed prior to presentation to ___ 
on ___ w/ reports of persistent SOB/Cough (yellow/brown sputum 
production). On presentation to ___, a CXR was completed w/ 
evidence of a RUL mass vs. consolidation. A CT Chest w/ right 
lobulated lung mass w/ smaller adjacent satellite nodules, 
extensive LAD, a right chest wall mass and a pericardial 
effusion. Pt was started on Levofloxacin for a presumed 
post-obstructive PNA. On ___, a thoracentesis of R pleural 
effusion was completed (w/ removal of over 800cc fluid) - no 
microbiology was sent; cytology w/ evidence of adenocarcinoma. A 
pericardiocentesis was also completed w/ removal of 500cc of 
dark fluid; cytology also c/w adenocarcinoma. Pericardiocentesis 
procedure was c/b Afib w/ RVR controlled with Dilt. ECHO 
completed post-procedure w/ EF: 60-65%. A pericardial window was 
completed on ___, sample ultimately growing saccharomyces 
cerevisiae. Sputum culture on ___ w/ ___ w/ GNR, GPC, GPC in 
clusters); culture positive for Pseudomonas (MDR) sensitive to 
Amikacin/Collistan. Pt was started on Amikacin and Vancomycin - 
first dose: ___. He was ultimately transfered to ___ for 
respiratory failure requiring NIPPV. 

# Hypoxemic respiratory failure: Initially admitted to the MICU 
for NIPPV requirement thought to be multifactorial due to 
pseudomonal pneumonia, pulmonary edema, pleural effusions, and 
lung adenocarcinoma. Improved with NIPPV and treatment for each 
as below, as well as nebulizers, aggressive pulmonary toilet and 
chest ___. patient did not require intubation and was gradually 
weaned to 6L NC.

# MDR Pseduomonal pneumonia: Grew from OSH sputum culture on and 
thought to be post obstructive pneumonia caused by the lung 
cancer. MDR Pseudomonas sensitive to Amikacin/Collistan and 
Cefepime (MIC 8). Patient was treated with amikacin (day 1 = ___ 
to ___ and cefepime (day 1 = ___ to ___, with guidance from 
ID consult team. Bilateral pleural effusions were thought to be 
exudative malignant effusions more than parapneumonic. 
Unfortunately, patient experienced toxic effects of amikacin 
with worsening renal function that precluded his continued 
treatment with the antibiotic and MDR pseudomonas was resistant 
to other antibiotic options preventing alternative treatment 
options. Given this, his rising WBC, and his metastatic lung 
cancer, the patient and wife elected to shift goals of care to 
comfort focused care and ___ was discharged the following 
day to inpatient hospice with Care ___ 
___ House in ___, Phone ___, where he can be 
closer to home and where his dog can visit him.

# Metastatic Lung Adenocarcinoma: Newly diagnosed on 
presentation at OSH. Cytology positive in pleural effusions and 
pericardial fluid. RUQ US for elevated LFTs also suspicious for 
liver involvement. Heme/onc was consulted and recommended no 
further work up or treatment at this time given active 
infections.they states patient could be seen as an outpatient 
only if his clinical status stablizes and palliative treatment 
is still in line with his goals of care. Patient and wife coping 
with ___ from palliative care and social work. The above 
events eventually led to patient being DNR/DNI, comfort measures 
only. Bilateral pleural effusions thought to be malignant, had 
bilateral thoracensteses with right chest tube, left pigtail 
(both removed prior to discharge) by interventional pulmonology 
here at ___ with improvement in respiratory status (R>L). 
Effusions were maximally drained just prior to discharge to 
inpatient hospice on ___. Patient was written for dilaudid, 
zofran, and ativan, which he was not requiring in the days prior 
to discharge. His course is expected to be a difficult one going 
forward given his tenuous respiratory status.

# Pericardial effusion: S/p pericardiocentesis at OSH showing 
adenocarcinoma involvement as well as pericardial window. 
Cultures from OSH grew 4+ budding yeast which speciated to 
saccharomyces cerevisiae. Started Micafungin on ___ until ___ 
when goals of care shifted to comfort measures.

# Atrial Fibrillation: Developed s/p pericardial window. Well 
controlled on diltiazem 60mg Q6h. CHADS2 score 2, but 3 if 
anasarca due to CHF. Patient was not initiated on 
anticoagulation given numerous procedures over his hospital 
course and then ultimate change in goals of care.

# Anasarca: Possibly due to ___ or right sided CHF due to 
restrictive pericardial disease, an addition to poor nutritional 
status (ablumin 2.8). Patient was given ensures TID for 
nutrition. Elevated BNP and improvement with diuresis suggestive 
of dCHF. Bilateral upper and lower US neg for DVT. Patient was 
diuresed early in admission, but this was stopped when renal 
function worsened as a result of amikacin toxicity.

# HTN: Home antihypertensives were held during admission, 
patient was given only diltiazem for afib as above.  

# HL: Home statin was discontinued for elevated LFTs.

#  Stage II ulcers (X2) on sacrum: present on admission. 
Frequent turning, would consult obtatined, optimizing nutrition 
status with supplements. Low dose oxycodone for pain 
(hypotension with higher doses).

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES: 
- Patient failed video swallow with gross aspiration. Maintained 
on honey thickened liquids and regular diet for patient comfort 
and preference.
- Patient is being transferred to inpatient hospice closer to 
home with Care ___ House in 
___, Phone ___.
- If patient would like he may return in a week for pleurex 
placement for breathing comfort. Interventional Pulmonology (Dr. 
___ is aware and will call to schedule 
appointment with patient if this is within his wishes.
 
Medications on Admission:
The Preadmission Medication list may be inaccurate and requires 
futher investigation.

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

It was a pleasure caring for you at ___ 
___. You were admitted because you were having 
trouble breathing that was due to a number of things. You were 
diagnosed with metastatic lung cancer (meaning it has spread to 
other parts of your body), fluid around your lungs which we were 
able to drain, and a pneumonia with a bacteria that was very 
difficult to treat. We tried to treat it with an anitbiotic 
called amikacin, however your body could not tolerate this 
medication and your kidneys began to fail. There were no other 
antibiotics to treat this resistent bacteria. We tried very hard 
to get your breathing well enough to get you home, but you are 
still requiring a lot of support for your breathing and so you 
will be transferred to an inpatient hospice care center near 
your home. We hope this will allow you to be with your family 
and dog more often.

MRI BRAIN: 
There are 2 small foci of slow diffusion in the subcortical left 
parietal lobe 
medially with subtle corresponding hypointensities on the ADC 
map and FLAIR 
images. 
  
There is no evidence of hemorrhage.  There is a chronic 
infarction in the left 
caudate body and adjacent corona radiata.  The ventricles and 
sulci are 
age-appropriate in size and configuration without mass effect or 
midline 
shift. 
  
Scattered T2 and FLAIR hyperintense foci in the periventricular 
and 
subcortical white matter are nonspecific, but may reflect 
chronic small vessel 
ischemic changes. 
  
There is mild mucosal thickening of the ethmoid and right 
maxillary sinuses.  
The mastoid air cells are clear.  Postsurgical changes of right 
lens 
replacement. 
  
MRA BRAIN: 
There is mild signal and luminal irregularity involving the 
parasellar 
internal carotid arteries and right greater than left M1 
segments.  There is 
also mild signal in luminal irregularity of the bilateral P1 and 
left greater 
than right P2 segments.  Findings likely relate to 
atherosclerotic disease.  
Otherwise, the intracranial vertebral and internal carotid 
arteries 
demonstrate flow signal without evidence of focal stenosis or 
aneurysm 
formation. 
  
MRA NECK: 
 Examination is mildly degraded by motion.  The aortic arch and 
great vessel origins are not included.  The common, internal and 
external carotid arteries 
demonstrate flow signal with no evidence of occlusion.  There is 
no evidence 
of internal carotid artery stenosis by NASCET criteria. 
  
IMPRESSION:   
1. Small foci acute infarction in the subcortical left parietal 
lobe medially. 
2. Chronic infarction in the left caudate body and adjacent 
corona radiata. 
3. Diffuse intracranial atherosclerotic disease. 
4. Grossly patent neck vasculature to the extent visualized with 
no evidence of occlusion. 

 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ right-handed man with history notable for CAD s/p 
CABG (___) c/b ITP, PAD s/p bilateral stenting, paroxysmal 
atrial fibrillation (on warfarin), DMII
(diet-controlled) c/b neuropathy, HFpEF, COPD, HTN, HLD (with 
prior statin intolerance due to myalgias), CKD III, carotid 
stenosis s/p bilateral CEAs, OSA (not tolerating CPAP), and gout 
presenting with acute-onset right leg > arm weakness. MRI showed 
more likely recrudescence of previous left periventricular/deep 
infarct. MRA did not show definitive fixed or unstable disease 
in this region. Although MRI read also suggested an  acute 
punctate infarct in the subcortical left parietal lobe, upon 
further review there was no ADC correlate and we do not believe 
this represents an acute infarct.  He was also noted to have 
prominent action myoclonus, which had been documented before, 
and had been treated with clonazepam but led to sedation. We 
started 250mg BID of keppra which led to almost immediate 
improvement in his symptoms. He did have several more episodes 
of right hemiparesis, which lasted briefly and did not reveal an 
upper motor neuron weakness. Likely recrudescence, though no 
infectious or toxic source was identified. He did suffer the 
passing of a sister. He did acknowledge significant anxiety. Of 
note, despite the team and ___ recommendations, the patient 
indicated his desire to be discharged home. He understood the 
risks and benefits and ultimately chose to be discharged home 
with services.

===========================

Coumadin management
- Monitor mood on Keppra and in setting of recent life stressor

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

You were admitted to neurology for acute right lower extremity 
weakness. MRI shows that you did not have a new stroke. You were 
noted to have jerking movements with movement (action myoclonus) 
and you were started on Keppra with resolution of symptoms. 

We are changing your medications as follows:  
- Start taking Keppra 250 mg twice a day

Please remember to weigh yourself every morning, call MD if 
weight goes up more than 3 lbs.

Please take your other medications as prescribed.
  
Please follow up with Neurology and your primary care physician 
as listed below.  

If you experience any of the symptoms below, please seek 
emergency medical attention by calling Emergency Medical 
Services (dialing 911). In particular, since stroke can recur, 
please pay attention to the sudden onset and persistence of 
these symptoms:  

 - Sudden partial or complete loss of vision  
 - Sudden loss of the ability to speak words from your mouth  
 - Sudden loss of the ability to understand others speaking to 
you  
 - Sudden weakness of one side of the body  
 - Sudden drooping of one side of the face  
 - Sudden loss of sensation of one side of the body 
 
Sincerely,  
Your ___ Neurology Team

환자의 상태를 설명하면 다음과 같습니다:

우측 다리와 팔 약화가 있습니다.

수술이나 침습적 절차는 없습니다.

병력은 다음과 같습니다:
신경계 병력이 있으며, 이전에 심근경색증 후 우측 다리가 더 약해졌습니다. 또한, 최근 가족에서 지시받지 않고도 전문의에게 가서 치료 받았으며, 그 결과 현재 우측다리의 운동을 하지 못하고 있습니다. 또한 환자는 지난 밤 잠들 때 오른쪽 다리를 사용하지 않았고, 아침에는 왼손으로 음식을 먹었습니다.

혈액 검사는 다음과 같이 나타났습니다:
현재 혈당 수치가 높아지고 있으나, 이는 당뇨병 때문이라고 합니다. 또한 혈압은 높은 편입니다. 그리고 간염이 있는 것으로 보이며, 이로 인한 위장관 출혈이 발생했습니다.

심각한 증상은 없지만, 과거에 두 차례 이상 뇌졸중을 경험했으며, 이번에도 같은 증상을 보여줍니다. 또한 좌면 부정 감작이 있고, 양팔 모두 움직이지 않습니다. 그리고 발음이 어렵다고 하였습니다.

수업 중에 의사가 방문하여 진단을 내렸는데, 그것은 다음과 같았다:
우측 상완골절과 동반된 손실이 있었던 것처럼 보이고, 특히 우측 상방부위가 불편합니다. 또한 우측 대퇴골절이 있었고, 이러한 상황에서도 우측대퇴골결장이 없었음을 알게 되었습니다. 그리고 우측하퇴골 결장은 없었다.

또한, 우측발목 관절염이 있었으며, 특히 무릎 관절이 아프다는 것을 알게 되었고, 이를 통해 우측 허벅지가 생겼습니다. 그러나 이것은 일회성이 아니며, 계속해서 진행되고 있다고 생각됩니다.

따라서, 우리는 다음의 처치를 권유합니다:
우선 우측허벅지를 조기에 발견하였으므로, 이를 위해 적극적인 치료를 시행할 필요가 있습니다. 그리고 이 과정에서 우측피질종양이 발생하기도 했으며, 이를 통하여 우측척추전문이 생긴 것이 확인되었습니다.
그리고 우측 척추전문을 이용하는 것은 매우 어려운 일이 아닐까 싶었지만, 실제로는 쉽게 해결될 수 있었다고 생각합니다. 따라서, 우석척추 전문이 사라지는 것을 목표로 하는 치료법을 시도해보려고 합니다.

우리는 또한 우석허벵이가 사라져야 한다고 생각하며, 이를 위해서는 우측 피질 종양을 제거해야 할 것입니다. 하지만, 아직까지는 정확한 원인이 밝혀지지 않았다. 따라래서, 우리들은 우석 허벵이를 제거하려는 노력을 기울여보려 하고 있습니다.

우석 허브가 사라졌다면, 우리는 우석 척수를 재건할 수 있을 것이다. 그리고 우리는 우측 체간을 강화시키는 방법을 찾겠다고 생각합니다.

우산을 쓰면서도 우측체간을 유지하면서 걸어볼 수도 있다. 그리고 우리들의 목표는 우석체간이 다시 살아날 수 있도록 하는 것이다. 그러니, 우리는 더욱 힘써 우석 체간의 회복을 도모할 것이다.

우익스텐션을 활용하여 우석첩추를 재건하고, 우선플렉스를 만들어내는 것도 좋은 방법이다. 그리고, 우리는 이러한 방법들을 통해 우석천막을 만들어서 우석 천막을 보호할 것이다. 그렇게 하면 우석역이 사라질 것이다.

그러나, 우식스가 사라지더라도 우석 역이 다시 돌아올 수 있다는 점을 명심하자. 그리고 항상 우석의 안전을 최우선으로 삼도록 하겠다.

우리아이는 우석을 잘 돌보고, 우락분노를 방지하는데 큰 관심을 가지고 있다. 그래서 우석이 건강하게 살 수 있도록 해달라는 부탁이다. 감사한다.

___ w/Hx of CKD, ___ transferred from ___ outpatient for new

Patient notes that he was in his usual state of health until 
last ___, 6 days prior to presentation, when he began 
experiencing rigors/shakes/chills at night, that worsened over 
the course of the week. He also notes dysuria and increased 
frequency with small amounts of urine since ___. 
He presented to ___ outpatient for the above symptoms ___, 
1 day prior to admission, where some tests were done, including 
CMP with bump in Cr to 3.6 and WBC 16K, and he was told he had a 
UTI, and an abx was called in for him. He notes he was told to 
return for repeat tests on ___ (CBC/CMP), day of admission, 
and since he had left already, decided he would pick up his abx 
when he returned. Of note, given rise in Cr he was told to stop 
taking his losartan-HCTZ, but took it the next morning (forgot 
to remove from pill box). He continued with rigors/chills, as 
well as dysuria, frequency, and upon presentation on ___ to 
At___, he was noted to be tachycardic to 130s, in aflutter to 
143 ___levation inferior-laterally, with increased WBC to 
20 with 80% PMNs, Cr 3.9, was given a full dose 325mg ASA, and 
was sent to our ED.
He denies palpiations, chest pain, presyncope, 
lightheadedness/dizziness, or dyspnea. Denies any abdominal 
pain, and no trouble with eating or drinking at home. Had one 
episode of diarrhea earlier in the week, none since. On ROS, 
only other symptom he endorsed was weakness over last few days. 
Also notes R low back pain from mechanical fall 1 week ago on 
the ice, prior to the above symptoms, which is improving. 
Patient largely lives alone, ___ lives with him but not 
around much, and patient takes his own medications using a pill 
box he fills each week.
In the ED, initial vitals: 98.4 80 117/58 16 98% RA
Labs/Studies notable for: UA with 11 WBCs, 2 RBCs, negative 
nitrites, 100 protein, few bacteria, <1 epi; WBC 19.5, H/H 
11.7/35.3 (baseline hgb ___, Plt 219, BUN 58, Cr 3.6 
(baseline <2). A CXR showed no acute process. The patient 
received 1gm of ceftriaxone, 20mg IV of diltiazem, and 30mg of 
PO Diltiazem, and was admitted to the floor. Overnight, 
converted to sinus rhythm on telemetry.
This morning feels symptoms improved, with less frequency and 
decreased dysuria. Notes chills/rigors overnight, but none 
today. Denies any CP, SOB, abdominal pain, no N/V.
Please see nightfloat admission note for home medications, 
allergies, FH, and SH, which I have confirmed with the patient.

==== IMAGING ====
___ ECG:
Atrial flutter with variable block and rapid ventricular 
response. No previous tracing available for comparison.

___ CXR:
No acute cardiopulmonary process.

___ ECG:
Atrial fibrillation with a relatively controlled ventricular 
response. Premature ventricular contractions versus aberrantly 
conducted supraventricular complexes. Compared to tracing #2 
coarse atrial fibrillation has replaced atrial flutter and 
overall ventricular response is somewhat slower.

___ RENAL US:
1. No evidence of hydronephrosis.
2. Enlarged prostate.

___ TRANSTHORACIC ECHO:
IMPRESSION: Prominent flow in the right atrium c/w possible 
atrial septal defect. Normal biventricular cavity sizes with 
preserved regional and global biventricular systolic function. 
Mildly dilated aortic arch. 

If clinically indicated, a TEE would be better able to assess 
the etiology of the prominent right atrial flow.
 
Brief Hospital Course:
Mr. ___ is a ___ w/Hx of CKD, ___ transferred from ___ 
for new onset atrial flutter.

ACTIVE ISSUES:
============
#Atrial flutter
Patient presented with chills/rigors, with dysuria, noted to be 
in atrial flutter in the outpatient setting, sent in to our ED. 
Patient's atrial flutter felt to be possibly precipitated by a 
UTI, and broke soon after admission with IV dilt and PO dilt, 
transitioned to metoprolol for rate control given history of 
CAD. However, patient noted to be persistently bradycardic on 
telemetry ___, asymptomatic), so metoprolol was downtitrated 
to metoprolol succinate 12.5mg daily, with improved heart rates. 
TSH checked and was normal (2.2). Given CHADS Vasc of 4, was 
bridged with heparin to coumadin for anticoagulation (new 
medication for this patient), and INR on discharge was 2.7 on 
5mg coumadin daily. Given his CKD, patient is not a good 
candidate for novel anticoagulation agents. His plavix was also 
stopped given cardiac stents placed a number of years ago, and 
in the setting of starting coumadin, discussed with outpatient 
cardiologist Dr. ___ was in agreement with coumadin and 
aspirin, and stopping plavix. ___ PCP, ___ to 
monitor INR. Patient was set up with outpatient ___ services for 
home services evaluation and medication reconciliation. Consider 
EP consult/cards follow up for ablation if aflutter recurs in 
future.

ECHO was done this admission given last done ___ years ago, 
LVEF>55%. Some concern for possible ASD, recommend TEE to 
further evaluate. Given no symptoms, no hypoxia, and already 
anticoagulated, deferred to outpatient setting. 

#UTI
Patient with dysuria, rigors/chills, with leukocytosis to 20, 
initially started on IV ceftriaxone, transitioned to PO 
ampicillin once urine cultures grew enterococcus sensitive to 
amp. Plan for 7 day course of ampicillin, last dose morning of 
___. Patient's leukocytosis improving, though still elevated 
by time of discharge, afebrile. Had some loose stool initially, 
improved by time of discharge, but advised patient to call PCP 
if any worsening diarrhea to test for cdiff given antibiotics 
exposure.

#Acute on chronic kidney disease
Patient had AoCKD on admission with Cr to 3.6 from baseline 
1.6-1.8, likely related to UTI and possible cardiac congestion 
from initial aflutter, improved with fluids and treatment of 
UTI, back to baseline by time of discharge. Renal US was done 
which showed enlarged prostate, without evidence of obstruction 
(no hydronephrosis).

CHRONIC ISSUES:
====================
#DM II: Per patient well controlled fsbs at home, usually 100s 
(rarely >200), on NPH 48 units at breakfast, 10 units at 
dinnertime, no sliding scale. Last Hgb A1c on ___ was 6.3 
(similar to prior). FSBS here ranging 56-151. Continued on home 
NPH and humalog sliding scale while inpatient.

#CAD: No ECG changes or clinical symptoms suggestive of active 
ischemia. Follows with atrius cards. Continued home aspirin, 
statin, metop started per above for aflutter, ECHO this 
admission with LVEF >55%.

#Anemia:
No evidence of active bleeding this admission, stool guaiac 
negative x3.  Continued on ferrous sulfate supplementation.

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES:
=======================

in AM of ___.
# Started on warfarin 5mg daily for atrial flutter with high 
chads vasc score of 4, INR to be followed by Atrius PCP.

recurs in future.
# Consider TEE in future given concern for ASD on TTE this 
admission, no concerning symptoms this admission.

Home With Service

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

It was a pleasure taking care of you during your recent hospital 
stay at the ___. You came in 
feeling unwell with painful urination, chills and shakes, and 
were found to have a urinary tract infection, as well as fast 
heart rates likely from this infection. You were given 
antibiotics for your bladder infection, and medications to help 
bring your heart rate back to a normal level. You will continue 
to take your antibiotic at home, last dose will be the morning 
of ___ morning). You were also started on a new 
medication to help control your heart rates, called metoprolol, 
and you will continue taking this medication once in the morning 
every day until you see your cardiologist Dr. ___.  Lastly, 
because with fast heart rates like yours was puts you at risk 
for forming clots, you were started on a blood thinner called 
coumadin to try and prevent blood clots in the future. You will 
continue to take this medication once every day, and you will 
have to get your blood levels checked on a regular basis to 
ensure your blood stays thin. 

Lastly, because we started a new blood thinner medication, 
coumadin, you no longer need to continue your plavix medication, 
as it can increase your risk of bleeding. We spoke with your 
cardiologist Dr. ___ agreed to stop plavix. 

We have also arranged for home nurses to visit to help with 
medication management given all of your new medications. Your 
medications are listed below, along with your future follow up 
appointments. It is very important that you take all your 
medications as directed, especially the coumadin medication, and 
go to all of your follow up appointments to make sure things are 
going well. 

Also, if you have worsening loose stools, please contact your 
doctor immediately. 

We wish you the best with your health.

Sincerely,
Your ___ Care Team

병력 :
CKD를 가진 환자로 전해졌습니다. 지난 6일 전에 신속하게 발생한 심방세동으로 외래에서 수혈을 받았고, 그 이후 밤에 체온이 상승했고, 다음날 아침에는 약물 투여가 이루어졌습니다.

환자의 상태는 일반적으로 평소와 비슷했지만, 최근 몇 날 동안은 불편함이 있었습니다. 또한 요실금 및 빈뇨도 있었으며, 이들 증상을 가지고 있는지 여부를 확인하기 위해 다음 날 오전 병원을 방문했습니다. 그러나 그는 그의 로사탄-HCT를 중단하라는 조언을 듣고 다음날 다시 복용했다. 그는 또한 자신의 약물을 집에서 사용하고 있습니다.

내과 병력이 있다면 다음과 같다:

관상 동맥 질환이 있으며, 이전에 진행된 바 있다. 우울증 치료제인 메타포린을 사용하여 관상 동정맥의 80%, 우측 정맥의 경우 70%, 우우측 정격의 경우 우측 측벽의 70%'였다. 또한, 그는 부모님에게서 유전자 검사를 받았다. 그리고 아들이 사망했다. 자매가 당뇄 때문에 죽었다. 형님이 약 한 년 전 사망했다.

사회 역학 :
아버지의 할아버지는 관상동맥질환을 앓고 있었다. 어머니는 뇌졸중으로 사망하였다. 자녀들은 많은 사람들에게 DM을 액화시켰다. 다른 가족 역학은 없다.

신체검사 :
입원 후 신체검사는 다음과 같이 나타났다:
98.8 ℃ 80 ℗ 117 ℗ / 58 ℗ RA

임상 결과 :
尿결핵은 11개의 백혈구, 28개의 적혈球, 음성 니트리드, 102 프로틴, 소량의 세균, < 1 에피; Wbc 19·5, h/h 11·7/ 35·3 (기저 혈당 27); 플릿 219; BUN58; Cr 36 (기초값 <2)이었다. 또한 경추의 확장은 없었다. 환자는 1 g의 세트리아손을 주었고, 50 mg의 IV 디티아즈메, 30 mg의 PO 디티야즘을 주며 입원되었다. 야간에는 변형되었으나 다음날에는 개선되어 있었다.

출원 후 임상 결과는 다음과 같았다:
99.8℃ 107℗/64℗ P81 ℗ RR18 ℗ %RA

일반적인 상태는 안녕하며 편안하다. HEENT는 NCAT이며, EMOI, PERRL은 색깔이다. MMM. OP는 깨끗하다. 목은 연약하지 않다. 림프절은 없었다. CV는 RRR이며, 정상 S1 및 S2이며, 무게 감각은 없었다.

디스커버리 :
MRSA는 없었으며, 항생제는 없었다. 또한 간염은 없었다.
만성 콩팥병은 있고, 만성 위장 장애는 없다. 또한 만성 고혈압, 만성을 앓는다. 만성 당땀증, 만성이 있다. 만성이 있을 때는 식욕이 없고, 식욕불량증이 있다. 또한 흉통, 기침, 배변 없음. 또한 대변은 없었다.

병력 개요 : HPI는 ____에 위식도 우회 수술을 받았으며, 이후 가족들의 예기치 않은 사망으로 인해 지난 한 주 동안 빈번하게 발생하는 가슴 통증은 ____분간 지속되었다. 통증이 등부로 전달되었으나 걷거나 앉아 있을 때 악화되지 않았다. 명백한 유발 또는 완화 요인이 없었다. 체온과 발열이 있었다. 식후에는 나타나지 않는다. CP와 구토 및 땀 그리고 호흡곤란이 동반된다. 이를 '박동'이라고 표현했다. 현재는 ____L가 가슴 박동이고 ____세럼 통증이다. 오른쪽 어깨 통증도 가슴痛과 관련된 것이다. 소변과 가까운 관계를 맺고 있는 조카로부터 감염되어 있다.

허리 팽창 : 이전에는 라시스 20mg이었지만 두 달 전에 자체적으로 중단하였다. 허리가 불편하고 운동 시 더 나빠지는 느낌이었다. 다만, 소변 후에도 나타나지는 않았다. 복부 통증 : 복벽 종양은 3차례에 걸쳐 치유되었는데, 계획대로 정밀 절제술을 하려 했으나 가족들이 죽었다. 병력이 있다.

ED 기록물 : 최근 카트는 년 만에 ___에서 ___였다. 또한 외과의사인 Dr. _____(_____)에게 보였고, 심장 전문가인 Dr.___(_____)와 내과 Dr._ _(___)에게도 보였다.

정신 상태 : 정신적 이상이나 환자는 없다. 신경계 검사는 일반적인 양상을 보였다. 혈액검사 결과는 다음과 같다. 혁산혈구 98%, 백혈球 143-73mmHg, 혈압 64mmHgl, 맥박 20bpm, 산소포화율 100%. ASA 325mg, Lasix 400mg IV 투여. 액체는 투여하지 않았다. 방사선 연구결과는 CXR이며, 심근 경색은 없다고 한다. 부교합은 없었고, 관절통은 없었다. 다른 것은 모두 음성이다. 모든 것이 그렇듯이 이 환자가 경험한 것들이다.

심층 구조 촬영 결과는 심장이 약간 커졌으며, 폐는 평범하다. 흉곧팔관류는 없었다. 심장전도는 정상이었다. 심실격변이 없는 것으로 판단된다. 심초음파는 정중앙이었다. 혐위는 없었다.

심장전도가 정상이었으며, 심실강격변장은 없었다.

환자의 주요 진찰 내용은 다음과 같다:

1. 심각한 가슴 고통
2. 저항성 가슴팍
3. 심방전
4. 심근경색
5. 심폐쇄
6. 심낭종
7. 심골막염
8. 심부전
9. 심뇌졸중
10. 심비대
11. 심질환이다.

심미학과 관련하여 다음 사항들을 확인해야 할 필요성이 있다:

1심장 전도기 검사를 통해 심장의 기능이 정상임을 알게 되었다.
2. 심맥동조가 정상이다.
3. 혜맥동 조건이 좋았다.
4. 혙맥동이 잘 되어있다.

7. 혛맥동을 이용하면 된다.
8. 혝맥동으로 진행되는 경우는 없다.
9. 혞맥동에서는 안 된다.
10. 혘맥동에서의 경우는 아니다.
11. 협맥동에서 진행되는 것은 아니다.

심리 상태는 명확하며, 정신 상태는 정상의 상태이다. 활동 상태는 독립적인 ambulatory 상태이다.

months, from 5 per month to almost every weekend (this is when
husband is at home from work and is able to witness these
events). Husband is not sure the patient is taking her
medications as directed. Reports she is sleeping okay, but 
waking
up at night to go to the bathroom over the past month. Has had
some loose stools which improved after patient stopped taking
dairy products.

The event yesterday came on while she was in the bathroom and
trying to stand up, saw lights as per her usual auras, and found
she was "very shaky" and saw her arms twitch. She does not
remember anything after this other than waking up the next day 
at
___. EMS records show patient lying on floor, with
incomprehensible speech. Husband thinks there was urinary
incontinence, but was not physically there for the event. Per
discharge summary from OSH, patient was reportedly found down in
the bathroom which precipitated a call to ___ by her husband. 
She
was found to have tongue trauma, as well as possible limited
upward gaze, and sent to ___ for further management. Notably,
vimpat level was 9.9 in ___, at OSH had mild leukocytosis to
12.3 with neutrophilic predominance, Na 145, K 3.6, BUN/Cr
___. UA within normal limits. CT head reportedly normal. 
 
Of note, she has a history of complex partial seizures which are
described (per Dr. ___ ___ note) as "she became
quiet and stiff, lasting for about one minute, and then she came
out of it and was confused for 45-60 minutes afterward.  During
the confused period, she moved chairs around and folded towels. 
In the past, her postictal behavior would include such behaviors
as taking her clothes off."  She is on a stable dose of
zonisamide and lacosamide. She has a VNS in place which was last
interrogated on ___. Past EEG in ___ shows "paroxysmal
bilateral and independent interictal epileptiform discharges 
over
the L>R temporal leads," and "two brief electrographic seizures,
37 seconds to one minute in duration, consisting of diffuse high
amplitude 5 Hz rhythmic activity. Clinically, these are
characterized by oral and bilateral upper and lower extremity
automatisms. Lateralized onset could not be determined for these
two seizures as muscle artifact from the oral automatisms at the
beginning of the seizure obscured the lateralized onset.
Interictally, spike and wave discharges isoelectric at F7/T3 
were
seen which represents potentially epileptogenic cortex."

Of note, last seen in psychiatry clinic with Dr. ___ on ___,
when the husband was worried about increased paranoia, 
especially
after recently lowering her clozaril to 125 from 150mg. She
refused to increase this dose and Dr. ___ was concerned she
might be worsening in terms of her psychiatric disease.

On neuro ROS, the pt denies headache, loss of vision, blurred
vision, diplopia, dysarthria, dysphagia, lightheadedness,
vertigo. Denies focal weakness. No bowel or bladder incontinence
or retention. 
 
On general review of systems, notable constipation. Denies 
recent
fever or chills.  No night sweats or recent weight loss or gain.
Denies cough, shortness of breath.  Denies chest pain.  Denies
nausea,
vomiting, or abdominal pain. No dysuria. Denies arthralgias or
myalgias. Denies rash.

___ 05:50AM BLOOD VitB___-___* Folate-17.___ncephalopathy in setting of refractory epilepsy:
Patient has a history of refractory epilepsy, and presented with 
concern for increased seizure frequency in setting of increasing 
paranoia, and possibly psychosis. Patient was placed on 
continuous EEG monitoring and started on her home anti-epileptic 
drugs (lacosamide 250 BID, zonisamide 200 TID). She did not have 
any clinical or electrographic seizures throughout monitoring.  

With respect to patient's concurrent delusional disorder, 
patient was seen by Psychiatry to assist with management of 
medications. Of particular concern was that patient was 
self-tapering her Clozapine dose prior to admission, and she 
presented with sedation and increase in delusional thoughts. She 
was taking 125mg QHS instead of the prescribed dose of 150mg QHS 
that was prescribed by outpatient psychiatrist Dr. ___. Per 
recommendations of inpatient psychiatry team, patient's 
clozapine was uptitrated to 150mg QHS. Unfortunately, this 
change only exacerbated patient's sedation.

After re-evaluation by Psychiatry team and discussion with 
husband, there was concern about whether patient would be 
compliant in taking the full dose of 150mg QHS. Given her 
decompensated psychosis and inability to adhere to medication 
recommendations in the community, as well as acute sedation, she 
was determined to meet ___ criteria and warrant an 
inpatient psychiatric hospitalization due to concerns for her to 
care for herself in the community and continue the taper of her 
medications.

Patient was then planned for a cross-taper, off of Clozapine due 
to her inability to tolerate this agent (sedation) and 
transitioned to Invega (Paliperidone), which had a more 
favorable side effect profile and ability to be a long-acting 
formulation. Invega 1mg BID was started on ___. The decision to 
start this drug was made after extensive discussions between 
Epilepsy and Psychiatry teams, due to its potential for this 
medication to lower seizure threshold. Ultimately, it was felt 
that the potential benefit of improved compliance and control of 
delusional thoughts outweighed risks of lowering seizure 
threshold, given that patient did not have any events on cvEEG 
monitoring. 

Patient successfully underwent cross-taper off of Clozapine, on 
to Invega, per psychiatry recommendations. By ___, patient was 
completely off of Clozapine and on Invega 3mg BID.  She had 
improvement in her delusional thoughts (reporting only 
occasional auditory hallucinations), no suicidal or homicidal 
ideation.  She became more alert as well, returning to her 
baseline mental status per her husband. 

There was likely a component of toxic metabolic encephalopathy 
during hospitalization given clinical findings of asterixis and 
waxing and waning mental status. A metabolic workup was sent, 
including ammonia, thyroid studies which returned normal. UA 
revealed asymptomatic bacteruria, not though to be clinically 
significant. Patient's asterixis presented, however her mental 
status improved after being transitioned off of Clozapine on to 
Invega. Her asterixis was likely multifactorial, largely in part 
due to her existing AEDs. 

Patient was evaluated by physical therapy who did not recommend 
any services, as patient was ambulating independently. 

# History of pulmonary sarcoidosis in remission, OSA
Patient did not have any active respiratory complaints. CXR on 
admission negative for any acute processes. 

#GERD: Patient was continued on Omeprazole/ranitidine at home 
doses.

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES:
- Continue Invega 3mg BID, to follow up with Dr. ___. Follow 
up arranged for next week ___ at 2pm)
- Continue home AEDs as discussed. To follow up with Dr. ___ 
on ___ at 9:30 AM

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,
You were admitted to hospital with concerns for increasing 
seizures and confusion. To evaluate you further, we hooked you 
up to continuous EEG monitoring.  We continued your home 
medications of lacosamide and zonisamide at regular doses.  We 
asked the psychiatry consult team to check to see if you needed 
any changes to your medications. Because the clozapine was 
making you sleepy, we decided to gradually take you off of the 
clozapine and start a new medication called Invega 
(Paliperidone). You were eventually completely off of the 
Clozapine on ___.  You did well when off of the Clozapine, 
becoming more alert and with improvement in your thoughts. 
Moving forward, it will be important that you follow up closely 
with the Psychiatry and Neurology doctors.

의사명 : ______


주민등록번호 : ______



병력내역 :
수정신장증후군으로서 증상은 주로 경련을 포함하여 매년 약 4~5회 발생하는 것으로 알려졌으나 남편은 이보다 더 자주 발생한다고 생각하고 있다. 최근에 발생한 사건도 그중 하나라고 생각하였다.

임상소견 :
환자는 지난 몇 달 동안의 증가된 경련 빈도를 의심하였으며, 특히 최근 클로자릴을 150㎎에서 125㎎으로 감량했는데 이는 환자가 이를 늘리기를 거부하기 때문이다. 또한 밤에 잠시 깨어서 화장실 가는 것이 많았으며 대변 소변이나 배뇨 불순물이나 체액 분비가 있었다. 다만 최근에는 우유제품 섭취를 중단함으로써 대변 변비가 호전되었다.

최근에는 오랜 기간 동안의 치료 후에도 아직까지 정신적 병력이 지속되어 있으며, 심지어는 일부 환자의 경우에는 정신 상태가 악화되는 경우도 있어 조기에 적절한 처치가 필요하다. 따라서 이번 입원에서도 이러한 점들을 고려하여 치료를 진행할 것이다.

1째 질문 : 성인은 1970년 생

6째 질문:

질문 내 용 :
1차적으로는 환자가 자신의 이름을 말해 줄 수 있었지만 이후에는 혼란스러워져서 말하지 못했다. 또한 환자는 자신이 어떤 일을 했는지 기억하지 못했고, 가족들은 환자를 잘 모른다고 하였다. 환자는 현재 복잡한 부분이 있으므로 추가적인 검사를 받았다. 환자와 가족 모두 환자가 현재 복합적인 상황이라고 한다. 환자의 과거에는 여러 가지 문제들이 있어서 환자가 지금의 상태가 좋지는 않다. 환자가 이제 새로운 치료법을 시도하게 되었다. 환자를 관찰하면서 환자가 좋은 반응을 보였고 환자는 이제 좀더 나아갔다. 환자인데 환자는 아직도 많은 문제점이 있고 환자는 다시 한번 관찰해야 할 것 같다. 환인이 이제 조금씩 나아가는 것을 볼 수 있는데 환자는 계속해서 관찰받게 될 것이다. 환인의 상태는 아직도 많이 어려운 상태이며 환자는 더욱 더 나아갈 수 있을까? 환자는 지금부터 시작하여 환자가 더 나은 방향으로 갈 수 있도록 도울 것이다.

Discharge Instructions:
Mr. ___,

You were admitted to the hospital after undergoing repair of an 
aneurysm in your aorta and common iliac artery.  You tolerated 
the procedure well and you are now ready to be discharged home.  
Please follow the instructions below for a speedy recovery.

You should not lift anything > 5 lbs until your follow up 
appointment.

You have staples in your skin.  These will be removed at your 
follow up appointment.  You can leave your incision open to air. 
 If your incision drains anything, you can cover it with a dry 
sterile bandage and replace this daily.

It is very important that you stop smoking.  Smoking cigarettes 
is associated with atherosclerotic disease of the arteries and 
several cancers.  Please follow up with your PCP to discuss this 
further.

Your medications have been carefully reviewed and no changes 
were deliberately made.  You should resume your home medication 
regimen. 

Use pain medicine sparingly.  NEVER DRIVE WHILE ON A NARCOTIC.  
You may take Tylenol every 8 hours.  Remember that some over the 
counter medications contain Tylenol (Acetaminophen).  Make sure 
you keep your daily total to less than 3000mg.

력력 병력 :
Mr. ____은 당뇨병, 고콜레스테롤혈증, 고혈압을 가진 남자이다. 4 cm 크기의 복부동맥팽창과 4cm 크기의 우측공통동맥 팽장은 있었고 심장내막염으로 인해 내피가 확장되어 있어 외과적인 접근이 어려웠다. 따라서 개방교정이 이루어진다. 이에 앞서 Mr. ____는 _____에서 관상동맥 재도체를 받았다. 오늘 정시로 예비수술을 하였다.

심장 : 정상 S1S2
호흡기 : 청결하게 들여보였다.
복부 : 경계 절개를 잘 닫아두었다. 부드럽고 압박되지 않았다. 장 소리가 모든 사분면에서 나타났다.
하반신 : 양쪽 하반신은 온화하고 쉽게 촉감할 수 있으며 피하지 않고 아예 없었다. 피부는 완전했다.

Mr.___은 __에서 복부와 우측 동맥의 개방 수술을 시행하였으며 환자가 잘 견딘 상태로 입원하여 감시되었다. 그는 안정된 상태로 전송되었으며 체온은 안정되었다. 그 이후에도 그의 식사는 일상적으로 진행되었다. 그가 배변했을 때는 POD 04였다.

 POD 02에서는 Foley 제거되고 충분한 양의 맑은 황색 소변이 나오도록 했다. POD 03에서는 그의 집 플라빅이 다시 시작되었다. 시간 동안 그는 안구운동이 안정되었으며 그의 절개는 평범했다. 그는 활동량이 적절했고 충분히 많은 양의 물을 배설했다. 퇴원의 교육은 검토되었다. 그녀는 어떤 질문이나 문제라도 클린릭에 전화한다.

Patient presented yesterday to OSH with chest pain and fever. 
Symptoms began overnight and then today she developed relatively 
rapid progression of rhinorrhea, joint pain, "labored shallow 
breathing", anorexia, dry mouth, joint pains, congestion and 
sore throat. She slept upright to alleviate breathing. Chest 
pain is substernal, worse with exertion, pleuritic and sharp. 
She states it "feels like a really big gas bubble when I burp or 
swallow". On ___ she had a VQ scan at OSH which was negative, 
done for chest pain which felt similar but was more right sided. 
Relatively rapid onset and resolution at that time as well. No 
recent travel, prolonged immobilization, hematemesis, hx blood 
clots.

dyspnea on exertion, paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, orthopnea, 
ankle edema, palpitations, syncope, or presyncope.

stroke, TIA, deep venous thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, 
bleeding at the time of surgery, myalgias, joint pains, cough, 
hemoptysis, black stools or red stools. Denies exertional 
buttock or calf pain. Denies recent fevers, chills or rigors.

___ TTE
The left atrium is normal in size. No atrial septal defect is

regional/global systolic function are normal (LVEF >55%). Tissue 
Doppler imaging suggests a normal left ventricular filling

Summary
___ w/PMH early Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis 
p/w chest pain, fever and found to have EKG signs of 
pericarditis. She was treated with ibuprofen and colchicine and 
improved quickly. She was discharged home in good condition. 

Acute issues
# Acute Pericarditis
Patient's presentation and EKG findings indicative of 
pericarditis, likely caused by preceding viral illness. CRP is 
elevated and was previously normal. Troponins were negative and 
bedside echo with no or small pericardial effusion. Chest pain 
improved after receiving ibuprofen. TTE was without evidence of 
systolic or valvular dysfunction. Ibuprofen 600mg TID and 
colchicine 0.6mg daily was started and she will follow with 
cardiology (at ___ and her Rheumatologist as an outpatient.

above. She was continued on MMF and will follow with her 
outpatient Rheumatologist. We were in communication throughout 
the stay.

weeks when symptoms improve. She was educated on not over

-Brace: You have been given a brace. This brace is to be worn 
for comfort when you are walking. You may take it off when 
sitting in a chair or while lying in bed.
 

 
-Wound Care: Remove the dressing in 2 days. If the incision is 
draining cover it with a new sterile dressing. If it is dry then 
you can leave the incision open to the air. Once the incision is 
completely dry (usually ___ days after the operation) you may 
take a shower. Do not soak the incision in a bath or pool. If 
the incision starts draining at anytime after surgery, do not 
get the incision wet. Cover it with a sterile dressing. Call the 
office. 
 

 
-You should resume taking your normal home medications. No 
NSAIDs.
 

 
-You have also been given Additional Medications to control your 
pain. Please allow 72 hours for refill of narcotic 
prescriptions, so please plan ahead. You can either have them 
mailed to your home or pick them up at the clinic located on 
___ 2. We are not allowed to call in or fax narcotic 
prescriptions (oxycontin, oxycodone, percocet) to your pharmacy. 
In addition, we are only allowed to write for pain medications 
for 90 days from the date of surgery.
 

 
Please call the office if you have a fever>101.5 degrees 
Fahrenheit and/or drainage from your wound.
 

Physical Therapy:
Activity:   Activity:  Activity as tolerated
Encourage turn, cough and deep breathe q2h when awake

Treatments Frequency:
Please continue to look for signs of infection
 
Followup Instructions:
