Brief Hospital Course:
FICU COURSE ___ - ___:
================
Patient is a ___ G2P2 F with a history of uterine fibroids and 
papillary thyroid carcinoma s/p total thyroidectomy  POD ___ s/p 
uncomplicated total laparoscopic hysterectomy and RSO with 
extnesive LOA for adenomyosis on ___ who presented with 
acute blood loss anemia with findings of R port site 
subcutaneous hematoma and hemoperitoneum. The patient 
experienced severe nausea and vomiting with dilaudid PCA and 
reported feeling a 'pop' at her RLQ incision during her bouts of 
emesis, followed by visible bleeding at RLQ incision.  Serial CT 
imaging x2 at ___ revealed stable free fluid in abdomen, 
expanding SQ hematoma form RLQ port site.  The patient was 
transferred to the GYN team at ___ and taken to the OR 
overnight where these findings were confirmed.  The patient had 
a laparoscopic exploration with evacuation of the subcutaneous 
hematoma and hemoperitoneum.  There was no active bleeding from 
the hysterectomy pedicles, there was no visible evidence of an 
inferior epigastric vessel injury.  The RLQ incision was 
extended, explored,e vacuated, and closed in layers.  Of note, 
the patient was transferred from the ___ ICU so patient had 
been transferred to the FICU for admission and post-surgical 
monitoring.  H/H was monitored and her post-op FICU course was 
uncomplicated.  HCT on admission was 23, post-op HCT remained at 
23.  There was no blood loss from the re-operation itself.

She was transferred to the floor (gynecology service) from the 
___ on post operative day 0 in stable condition after 
undergoing laparoscopic exploration with evacuation of 
hemoperitoneum, right port exploration, evacuation, and closure. 
Please see the operative report for full details.

On post-operative day 0, her urine output was adequate so her 
foley was removed and she voided spontaneously. She had mild 
nausea that was controlled on zofran. Her diet was advanced 
without difficulty and she was transitioned to PO 
percocet/ibuprofen. She remained hemodynamically stable with HCT 
___ and did not have symptomatic anemia and was started on 
iron supplementation. She continued her home levothyroxine. Her 
blood pressure medication was restarted post op day 2 with 
control of her blood pressures. She had a headache that resolved 
with antihypertensives and pain medication. 

By post-operative day 2, she was tolerating a regular diet, 
voiding spontaneously, ambulating independently, and pain was 
controlled with oral medications. She was then discharged home 
in stable condition with outpatient follow-up scheduled.

Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
right port site hematoma, hemoperitoneum

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms. ___,

You were admitted to the gynecology service after your 
procedure. You have recovered well and the team believes you are 
ready to be discharged home. Please call Dr. ___ office with 
any questions or concerns. Please follow the instructions below.

General instructions:
* Take your medications as prescribed.
* Do not drive while taking narcotics.
* Take a stool softener such as colace while taking narcotics to 
prevent constipation.
* Do not combine narcotic and sedative medications or alcohol.
* Do not take more than 4000mg acetaminophen (APAP) in 24 hrs.
* No strenuous activity until your post-op appointment.
* Nothing in the vagina (no tampons, no douching, no sex) for 3 
months.
* No heavy lifting of objects >10 lbs for 6 weeks.
* You may eat a regular diet.
* You may walk up and down stairs.

Incision care:
* You may shower and allow soapy water to run over incision; no 
scrubbing of incision. No tub baths for 6 weeks.
* If you have steri-strips, leave them on. They will fall off on 
their own or be removed during your followup visit.
* If you have staples, they will be removed at your follow-up 
visit.

To reach medical records to get the records from this 
hospitalization sent to your doctor at home, call ___.

 
Followup Instructions:
___

병력 소견 :
Ms. ____는 연령 ___의 G2 P2이며 유방섬유증 후 총 복강경 절제술, 좌측 난소절제술 및 체외로 진행된 환자이다. 그녀는 전반적으로 수술 이후 잘 지냈다. 그러나 오전 1시에 발한을 하면서 우측포트 부위를 열어 피가 나오고 있었다. 이에 대해 CBC 검사를 시행하여 혈구량이 27으로 나타났다. 이는 예상되는 출혈량(100 cc)에 맞지 않았다. 통증은 정상 범위였다.

하혈구치는 오후에는 22이었으며, CT 스캔에서는 우측 하퇴부 포트 근처에서 큰 10×11 cm의 피하지방 괴사가 관찰되었다. 그 결과 3개 분의 적혈球을 투여받았으며, 다음날 아침 25·2이었다. 재검사는 같은 날 밤 23·8이었다. 혈장 양이 증가되지 않았고, CT 촬영에서도 혈관이 약간 커졌다. 따라서 병동 이전에 결정했다.

OBHxx2 PMH: 갑상선암, 고혈압, 저갑상성, міг레나, 월경기출혈, 아덴오미오시스 PSH: Cx2, 갑상분비 기능 장애, 가슴축소술, 골관절 수술

Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:

___ ___ male with benign prostatic hypertrophy and urinary 
retention not responsive to pharmaceuticals.

Bilateral lower extremities w/out edema, pitting or pain to deep

Pertinent Results:
___ 07:03AM BLOOD WBC-7.2 RBC-3.73* Hgb-11.3* Hct-34.2* 
MCV-92 MCH-30.3 MCHC-33.0 RDW-13.0 RDWSD-42.5 Plt ___

Brief Hospital Course:
Mr. ___ was admitted to the Urology Service after undergoing 
robotic assisted laparoscopic SIMPLE prostatectomy. No 
concerning intra-operative events occurred; please see dictated 
operative note for full details.  The patient received 
___ antibiotic prophylaxis.  At the end of the 
procedure the patient was extubated and transported to the PACU 
for further recovery before being transferred to the floor.  He 
was transferred from the PACU in stable condition. On POD0, pain 
was well controlled on PCA, hydrated with intravenous fluids for 
urine output >30cc/hour, provided with pneumoboots and incentive 
spirometry for prophylaxis, and he ambulated once. On POD1, the 
patient was restarted on home medications, basic metabolic panel 
and complete blood count were checked, pain control was 
transitioned from PCA to oral analgesics, diet was advanced to a 
clears/toast and crackers diet for breakfast and lunch.  Diet 
was advanced to regular after lunch and with further ambulation, 
the drain was removed.  Foley catheter care and leg bag teaching 
was provided by nursing. The remainder of the hospital course 
was unremarkable. The patient was discharged in stable 
condition, eating well, ambulating independently, and with pain 
control on oral analgesics. On exam, incision was clean, dry, 
and intact, with no evidence of hematoma collection or 
infection. The patient was given explicit instructions to 
follow-up in one week for post-operative evaluation and trial of 
voiding.

 
Medications on Admission:
All: NKDA

Medications:
Tamsulosin 0.4 mg p.o. daily
Symbicort
Finasteride
Loratadine
Levitra as needed
Pro-air HFA

2.  Bacitracin Ointment 1 Appl TP TID  
3.  Ciprofloxacin HCl 500 mg PO Q12H Duration: 2 Doses 
Take 12hrs apart on date of void trial/foley removal 
RX *ciprofloxacin HCl 500 mg ONE tablet(s) by mouth twice a day 
Disp #*2 Tablet Refills:*0

RX *docusate sodium 100 mg ONE capsule(s) by mouth twice a day 
Disp #*60 Capsule Refills:*0

RX *ibuprofen 600 mg ONE tablet(s) by mouth Q8hrs Disp #*30 
Tablet Refills:*0

Moderate 
RX *oxycodone 5 mg ONE tab by mouth Q4hrs Disp #*30 Tablet 
Refills:*0

9.  amLODIPine 5 mg PO DAILY  
10.  budesonide-formoterol 160-4.5 mcg/actuation inhalation QPM  

11.PAIN PILL LOG
***please keep track of pain pills used on the provided PAIN 
PILL LOG (ORANGE SHEET). Return the log sheet at your follow up 
appointment AND remember to also bring a pad/diaper, and the 
narcotic prescription bottle.

 
Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
benign prostatic hypertrophy and urinary retention
 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
***please keep track of pain pills used on the provided PAIN 
PILL LOG (ORANGE SHEET). Return the log sheet at your follow up 
appointment AND remember to also bring a pad/diaper, and the 
narcotic prescription bottle.

-Please also reference the additional handout provided by your 
urologist with instructions and information about your surgery 
and post-operative plan of care.

-Please also reference the instructions provided by nursing on 
Foley catheter care, hygiene and waste elimination. 

-ALWAYS follow-up with your referring provider ___ your PCP 
to discuss and review your post-operative course and 
medications.  Any NEW medications should also be reviewed with 
your pharmacist.

-Resume your pre-admission medications except as noted AND you 
note that you NO longer need to take medications that shrink 
your prostate (Hytrin, Avodart, Flomax, etc.)

-You may take ibuprofen and the prescribed narcotic together for 
pain control. FIRST, use Tylenol and Ibuprofen.  Add the 
prescribed narcotic (examples: Oxycodone, Dilaudid, 
Hydromorphone) for break through pain that is >4 on the pain 
scale.

-The maximum dose of Tylenol (ACETAMINOPHEN) is 3- 4 grams (from 
ALL sources) PER DAY.

-Ibuprofen should always be taken with food. If you develop 
stomach pain or note black stool, stop the Ibuprofen.  Ibuprofen 
works best when taken around the clock.

-For your safety and the safety of others; PLEASE DO NOT drive, 
operate dangerous machinery, or consume alcohol while taking 
narcotic pain medications. 

-Do NOT drive while Foley catheter is in place.

-AVOID lifting/pushing/pulling items heavier than 10 pounds (or 
3 kilos; about a gallon of milk) or participate in high 
intensity physical activity (which includes intercourse) until 
you are cleared by your Urologist in follow-up. Generally about 
FOUR weeks. Light household chores are generally ok.  Do not 
vacuum. 

-No DRIVING for THREE WEEKS or until you are cleared by your 
Urologist

-Do not drive or drink alcohol while taking narcotics and do not 
operate dangerous machinery

-You may be given prescriptions for a stool softener ___ a 
gentle laxative. These are  over-the-counter medications that 
may be health care spending account reimbursable. 

-Colace (docusate sodium) may have been prescribed to avoid 
post-surgical constipation or constipation related to use of 
narcotic pain medications. Discontinue if loose stool or 
diarrhea develops. Colace is a stool-softener, NOT a laxative.

-Senokot (or any gentle laxative) may have been prescribed to 
further minimize your risk of constipation. 

-You may shower 2 days after surgery, but do not tub bathe, 
swim, soak, or scrub incision for 2 weeks

-If you had a drain removed from your abdomen, bandage strips 
called steristrips have been applied to close the wound. Allow 
these bandage strips to fall off on their own ___ days).  
PLEASE REMOVE any remaining dressings w/ gauze within 2 days of 
discharge.  You may get the steristrips wet.

-___ medical attention for fevers (temp>101.5), worsening pain, 
drainage or excessive bleeding from incision, chest pain or 
shortness of breath.

-Your Foley should be secured to the catheter secure on your 
thigh at ALL times until your follow up with the surgeon.

-Follow up in 1 week for wound check and Foley removal. DO NOT 
allow anyone that is outside of the urology team remove your 
Foley for any reason.

-Wear Large Foley bag for majority of time; the leg bag is only 
for short-term when leaving the house, etc.

-Take prescribed antibiotic for Foley catheter removal as 
directed

-resume regular home diet and remember to drink plenty of fluids 
to keep hydrated and to minimize risk of constipation. For the 
first few days at home, you should eat SMALL PORTIONS.  Avoid 
high fat, bulky or fried foods. of breath.
 
Followup Instructions:
___

이름 : ____________________          부서번호 : ___________
입원일자 : ___________________         퇴원일 자 : ____________________
생년월일 : ______________________        성별 : 남성
서비스 : 소화기과

알레르기 및 약물반응증상 : 알레르기가 없으며, 약물 반응도 없다.

진료의사 : _______

주소불명 : 우울증 환자의 경우 주위 사람들의 도움을 받지 못하고 혼자가 지내는 경향이 있다.

환부병력 :
우울증은 심각한 상태가 아니며, 가족이나 친척과의 관계도 좋다.

사회력 :
정신적 스트레스를 받았으나, 정신 질환이나 중독 등의 병력이 없는 것으로 보인다.

체질검사 :
WDWN NAD AVSS 복부는 부드럽고 확장되지 않은 상태이며, 적절하게 압박된다. 절개부위는 CDI로 되어 있으며, 양쪽 하지에는 수축 또는 통증이 없었다.

중요결과 :
혈액 검사는 다음과 같이 나타났다. 혈색소수치 7.20, 백혈구수치3.730, 헤모글루빈수치는 11.300, 헤마토크리트수치는34.200, 평균세포량 920, 평균핵두께 330, 레드셀율 130, 레드는 4200, 플렛 수치 7000이었다. 또한 혈당은 970, 요산염분비 1200, 크레아틴은 1000, 나트륨은 1400, 칼륨 4000, 염소 1100, 이온탄산염 분비 2600, 안갑 14000이었다.

간단한 입원경과 :
게다가 간단한 과정을 거쳐 간단히 치료되었다. 이후에 추가적인 정보는 추후 보고한다. 항생제 투여는 800mg였다. 그리고 전술된 방법으로 정맥 내 용액을 투여받았다. 그 후에도 계속해서 정맥 유지를 하였으며, 이후에 다시 일시적으로 정강이를 사용하였다. 그리고 이후에 더 이상의 추가적인 조치를 취하지 않았다. 다음 날 아침 식사를 시작하였으며, 점심식사와 저녁식사 모두 음식을 섭취할 수 있었다. 그리고 다음날부터는 더욱 많은 활동을 할 수 있게 되었다. 그러나 아직까지는 완전히 회복되어 있지는 않다. 다음날 아침 식사에서부터는 좀더 많은 운동을 할 필요성이 있었지만, 그것 외에는 특별한 증상이 없었던 것 같다. 다음달 첫째 날에는 집에서 먹었으며, 다음 달 둘째 날부터는 조금씩 더 많이 움직일 수 있었습니다. 그리고 마지막으로, 다음달 셋째 날에 방광 배수를 제거했다. 그리고 그 이후로는 특별한 문제 없이 잘 보내왔다. 그리고 최종적으로는 좋은 상태로 퇴원을 했다. 그리고 퇴원의 과정에서는 특별한 어려움이 없었다. 그리고 특히, 퇴원이 된 후에는 특별히 아무런 불편함이 없었다. 하지만, 여전히 아프거나 힘들 때는 의사가 있는 곳으로 가야 한다. 그리고 만약 어떤 이유로라도 의사의 처방전을 가지고 오면 된다. 그리고 의사에게 직접 전화하여 상담하면 된다. 또한, 만약 의사가 아닌 다른 사람이 자신의 처방전에 대해 물어보려 하면 되는데, 그러면 의사가 바로 알려준다고 한다. 따라서, 이러한 상황에서도 의사가 가장 정확한 진찰을 해줄 것이다. 그리고 또한, 우리나라의 의학계에서도 매우 중요한 역할을 하고 있다. 그리고 우리는 이러한 모든 것을 통해 아주 만족스러운 결과를 얻었다. 그리고 이제는 우리의 삶 속에서 아주 큰 변화가 생겼다. 그리고 앞으로도 이러한 변화를 유지하면서 살아갈 것이란 생각이다.

Brief Hospital Course:
# Headache, N/V: symptoms were consistent with a migraine 
headache. She was given Fioricet, Imitrex, and Zofran with 
marked improvement in symptoms. There was no evidence of 
increased intracranial pressure on exam. On head CT here is no 
intracranial hemorrhage, mass effect, shift of midline 
structures, or edema. She was discharged home with instructions 
to take Imitrex at headache onset and Percocet as needed for 
pain. She was also given a scipt for Zofran for nausea. Note, 
she should not take hormone replacement medications in the 
future given that she had aura associated with her migraine. 
.  
# ARF: Improved from 3.6 to 2.7 while in ___. Thought to be 
ATN from hypotension vs AIN from ciprofloxacin. Patient to 
follow up with renal medicine as an outpatient. 
.  
# Hypothyroidism: TSH very low on recent admission in the 
setting of ARF. Her levothyroxine dose was reduced to 125mcg. 
TSH was still low during this admission but trending in the 
right direction.  It should be rechecked in a few weeks as an 
outpatient.

Levothyroxine 125 mcg daily (has not filled rx or taken this 
since d/c ___  
Darvocet prn (infrequent) 
Omeprazole

tylenol in 24 hours. Do not drive while taking this medication. 
Tablet(s) 
3. Docusate Sodium 100 mg Capsule Sig: One (1) Capsule PO BID (2 
times a day).  
4. Omeprazole 20 mg Capsule, Delayed Release(E.C.) Sig: One (1) 
Capsule, Delayed Release(E.C.) PO DAILY (Daily).  
5. Sumatriptan Succinate 50 mg Tablet Sig: One (1) Tablet PO 
ONCE (Once) for 1 doses: take at onset of headache, may repeat 
in 2 hours if pain has not subsided.
Disp:*20 Tablet(s)* Refills:*0*
6. ZOFRAN ODT 4 mg Tablet, Rapid Dissolve Sig: ___ Tablet, Rapid 
Dissolves PO every eight (8) hours as needed for nausea.

Home

migrainous headache with aura

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted with a headache and nausea. We think your 
headache pain was caused by a migraine which then triggered your 
nausea. You should take Percocet ___ tabs every ___ hrs as 
needed for pain. Do not exceed 4 g of Tylenol in 24 hours. 
We also gave you a prescription for Imitrex. If you start to 
feel a migraine you should take this medication. You can repeat 
it once in 2 hours if the pain is persistant.
We also gave you a medication for Nausea called Zofran. You can 
take this medication ___ every 8 hours as needed.
While you were here a head CT was done. It did not show any 
abnormalities.
You should not take hormone replacement medications as they may 
worsen your migraines given that you have visual changes 
associated with your headaches. 
Avoid NSAIDS such as Ibuprofen (Motrin) and Asprin.

___ yo F with hx of R. basilic DVT on Coumadin, uterine fibroids 
and dysfunctional uterine bleeding, asthma, eczema who presents

. 
Patient reports n/v/d and abdominal pain since the morning of 
presentation. Reportedly the patient went to bring clothes to

stomach. She had an episode of emesis and came to the ED for 
evaluation. She says pain is predominately epigastric and sharp 
in quality. It moves around her abdomen but not to her back. She 
says the pain is intermittent lasting for a few minutes at a 
___ and then improving to ___ in severity. Also reports 
subjective fevers and chills. Since this AM reports more than 10 
BMs that are watery brown. Also reports n/v x 3. She feels 
nauseated and lightheaded. Also complaints of dry mouth. 
. 
In the ED initial vital signs were 98.2 101 124/60 16 99% RA. 
Exam notable for epigastric pain. Labs were unremarkable. She 
was given 2L of IVF, zofran and promethazine for nausea, and 
morphine for pain. Her vomiting improved however she continued 
to feel lightheaded and her abdominal pain returned with rapid 
movement or standing, therefore, she was admitted to medicine 
for further workup and evaluation. Prior to transfer the patient 
reports that she had a large clot in the toilet bowl but is 
uncertain if this came from her rectum or vagina. Vitals upon 
transfer were 97.9, 131/84, 22, 84, 96%RA. 
.
Of note patient was seen in the ED on ___ for vaginal bleeding. 
She was evaluated by OBGYN and had a pelvic ultrasound showing 
fibroid uterus. She was prescribed Provera x 10 days which she 
started the day prior to admission. Her presenting pain on this 
ED visit did not feel similar to menstrual cramps. 
.
Currently, she feels some abdominal pain. Reports feeling 
thirsty and is requesting water.

# Abdominal pain, n/v/d: Most likely ___ to viral 
gastroenteritis given that she presented with both n/v and 
diarrhea.  She did not have evidence of fever or leukocytosis, 
and her abdominal exam was significant for only mild discomfort 
in the epigastric region.  LFTs and lipase were within normal 
limits, therefore, biliary or pancreatic pathology was unlikely. 
Patient was treated with IVF in the ED and overnight on the 
floor. She was given morphine for pain initially which was 
transitioned to po tramadol, and zofran for nausea. Patient was 
monitored overnight. The following day her nausea resolved and 
her frequency of diarrhea slowed. She was able to tolerate a 
regular diet and was not orthostatic. She was discharged home 
with plans to follow up with her primary care doctor. 
. 
# hx of fibroids and DUB - Patient was continued on her 
previously started 14 day course of Provera. 
.
# hx of RUE DVT - Patient's INR was therapeutic. She was 
continued on her home coumadin dose. 
. 
# hx of asthma -  continued home medications 
.

- patient was full code on this admission

이름 : ________________________
Unit Number : ___________________________
입원일자 : ______________________________

서비스 : 의학과
알레르기 : 페니실린/Percocet
진료의사 : _______
주요 증상 : 복통, 구토, 설사
수술 또는 침습적 절차 : 없음

현재 상태 설명 : 12시간 전부터 복통과 함께 구토와 설사를 호소하고 있다. 환자는 아침에 옷을 입히러 갔으나 그곳에서 식욕불감증을 느끼고 한 번 소화액을 보였으며 응급실로 왔다. 통증은 주로 위쪽으로 가는 것이며 간헐적으로 몇 분 동안 심해지다가 다시 완화되는 양상을 보인다. 또한 발열 및 기침을 호소하였다. 이날 오전에는 수분이 많은 흰색 배변물이 10개 이상 있었다. 또한 목마르고 경련을 느낀다고 한다. 또한 건조한 혀를 호소한다.

응급실에서의 초기 체온은 98·2도였다. 검사는 평범했다. 200ml의 정맥용 용액, Zofran, Promethazine을 투여받았으며 소화를 개선하였지만 계속해서 경련과 같은 감각을 느꼈다. 따라서 내과에서 추가적인 작업과 평가를 위해 입원되었다. 이전에 화장실의 큰 혈종이 있었던 것으로 보고되었으나 정확하지 않다. 전달 시점에서는 97·9도였다.

환자가 지난번에 요도가 출혈을 일으켰다. 그녀는 OB-GYN에게 평가되어 유방섬유체가 있는 자궁경부 초음파 촬영 결과 Proverar 10일에 처방받았다. 현재 아프다. 마른 듯하다. 물을 원한다.

 과거 병력 : 천식, 모반, 난임, 비만, 불면증, 무기혈증, 우울증, 만성 염증, 고혈압, 당뇨병 등이다.

사회 역학 : 부모님은 아버지가 미세혈관염을 앓았다. 형제는 폐암이었다. 할머니는 뇌졸중을 앗았다.

신체검사 : 입원시 VS - 97 · 4도, BP : 144/ 88, 99, 18, 97%, 일반 - 비만 여성, HEENT - 안구운동, 두드림, 피부건조, OP - 맑음, 허리 - 연골증, 신장 - 125/80, 95, 19, 92%, 대동맥 - 120/70, 94, 21, 91%

내과에서 시행된 검사결과 :

1. 혈당 - 116 * 12
2. 현담 - 12 * 0 8
3. 혁발 - 140/90, 110/80
4. 혤정 - 130/80 105/75
5 혈청 단백질 - 45 g/L
6. 혜초 - 150/100, 135/90
7. 형약 - 145/95,160/100
8. 혙약 - 총 300 mL
9. 혏약 - 약 500 mL
10. 혛약 - 전체 600 mL

환자의 현황은 다음과 같다:

1. 동맥류 - 128/82, 108/78
2 혈압 - 136/86, 122/80

환자는 다음 날 밤에 지속적으로 나쁘게 되었다. 그러나 다음 날 아침에는 더 나아갔다. 환자가 다음 날 오후에 퇴원을 하도록 했다. 환자의 상태는 다음과 같다.

1. 항생제 - 250mg 2회
2 항생 제 - 500mg 1회
3 항생 치료 - 750mg 3회
4 항생치료 - 총량 2250mg

환자들은 다음 날 저녁에 훈련을 받았다. 환자들의 상태는 다음 날 새벽에 더욱 좋아졌다. 환자를 위한 다음 날의 계획은 다음과 같이 진행된다.

1 항생 약 - 400mg 4회

Name:  ___                  Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___

Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None

 
History of Present Illness:
___ yo M h/o DMI, severe HTN, HLD, CKD on HD, previous NSTEMI 
___, presenting with chest pain, dizziness, blurry vision and 
N/V. The patient states that he had chest pain on the AM of 
admission while he was getting his car serviced. He said that he 
felt substernal chest pain, lightheadedness and weakness in his 
left arm while standing. He was not agitated and was not 
exercising. He sat down and relaxed and with ___ minutes the 
sensation resolved. His chest pain was not similar to the type 
of pain he had with his NSTEMI. He was initially sent to ___, bp 
was 120/60. He was given ASA 324, zofran, nitroglycerin started 
on a heparin drip with bolus and transferred to ___ ED for 
further evaluation.  
.  
Throughout the last 1.5 weeks, the patient says that he has had 
nausea associated with non-bilious, non-bloody, non-coffee 
grounds emesis. He is able to tolerate his food for ___ hours 
before he vomits. He has epigastric pain associated with the 
vomiting. A nausea medication prescribed by his nephrologist 
helped with the nausea. No fevers, chills, diarrhea.  
.  
During his recent HD sessions (last on 2 days), notably, recent 
increases in ultrafiltration occuring for a goal of reaching his 
dry weight more aggressively- 3 liters were removed. He 
tolerated the ultrafiltration well, but felt tired on that 
night. In addition, he was increased on clonidine on ___ for his

병력 개요 :
DMII, 심각한 고혈압, HD에 있는 중환자의 이전 NSTEMII의 27세 남성으로서 흉통을 느끼고 어지러움감과 안구 모호함 그리고 구토를 호소하였다. 입원 후 아침에 차량 정비를 받던 도중 흉부 압박감과 무거운 느낌을 주었으며 좌측 팔 근육 약화가 있었다. 처음에는 NSTEM II와 같은 형태의 고통은 아니었다. 아스파린 324mg, 제프란, 헤피리닌 스프레이로 시작하여 혈액투석에서 전달되었다. 혈장 투석 마지막 1~1. 5주는 위독했다. 최근 1 ~ 1. 5주의 시간 동안 비록 식사를 몇 시간 전에 소변을 보였지만 식욕 부족이었다. 또한 혈압 증가로 인해 클론딘 0. 25mg를 추가시켰다. 혁동제는 그의 신경학자가 처방했는데 그게 효과적인 것으로 나타났다. 최근 HD 세션 (최근 2일)은 목표 적인 건조 체중을 위해 더 많은 초음파 필터링이 이루어졌으나 잘 견디며 밤새 피곤했다. 또한 그의 혈당 관리는 그의 혜산염 324 mg, 제퍼슨 324 MG, 젤라틴 324MG였다. 혀 마사지는 그의 병력이 없었다. 혐식은 그의 형질이 아니라 그의 혙상이었고 그의 협약은 그의 발목 관절염이었다. 그의 혓발은 그의 손톱이 없었고 그의 발꿈치 관절 염증도 없었다. 그의 허리는 그의 허리가 아닌 그의 허벅지가 되었다. 그의 복지는 그의 허리를 다루지 않았다. 그의 폐렴은 그의 폐가 아니라 그의 폐였다. 그의 뇌졸중은 그의 뚝심이 아니라他的뇌였다. 그는 그의 뇨관이 있었고 그의 간염은 그의 간이 아니라 자신의 간이었다. 그가 그의 혗재를 가지고 있을 때 그의 혏살은 그의 허리에 있었다. 그의 경추 골격은 그의 척골이 아니라 그들의 척도가 되었다. 환자는 그의 혯실이 없다고 했다. 그의 실명은 그의 실명을 다루지도 않았고 그의 실명의 원인은 그의 실미아였다. 환자의 과거 병력은 그의 과거 치료 기록이 없었다. 환자에게는 그의 과민 반응이 없었다.

신체 검사:
입원 시 신체 검사는 VS-T: 96.8 ℃, BP-144/76 mmHg, HR-80 beats/min, SpO2-99%, RA. 환자를 지속적으로 유지하고 있다. 초기 생리검사는 T:97.4 ℃, HR:82beats/min, BP：148/79mmHg. 환자가 잘 먹이고 있고 기침이나 다른 증상을 호소하지 않는다. 환 자는 그의 허리 통증을 호소하며 그의 허리의 통증은 그의 몸 전체에 걸쳐있다. 환자인 그의 허르는 그의 허락 없이 움직이지 못한다. 환인의 동반자는 그의 허리아전증이다. 환인이 그의 허릴 수 있으면 그의 허려는 그의 몸을 감싸고 있다. 환이는 그의 허림을 호소를 하지 않으며 그의 허룸은 그의 얼굴이 아님이다. 그의 외과의사는 그의 허른이 그의 허리로 가득 찬 것이 아니라 그의 허랑이 그의 얼굴에 가득 찰 것이라고 한다. 환인은 그의 허럼을 호송하는 데 사용되지 않은 상태이며 그의 허륭은 그의 머리카락이 아닌 그의 턴이 된다. 환사의 가족 병력:
Father-HTN, Diabetes Mellitus
Mother-Breast Cancer
Brother-HTN DM

Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted to ___ on 
___ after you fell at home.  On further evaluation, you were 
found to have right 3 - 6 rib fractures.  You were admitted to 
the inpatient ward for pain management and close observation.

You are now being discharged to a rehabilitation facility with 
the following discharge instructions:

You sustained rib fractures which can cause severe pain and 
subsequently cause you to take shallow breaths because of the 
pain. You should take your pain medicine as as directed to stay 
ahead of the pain otherwise you won't be able to take deep 
breaths.  If the pain medication is too sedating, take half the 
dose and notify your physician.

Pneumonia is a complication of rib fractures. In order to 
decrease your risk you must use your incentive spirometer 4 
times every hour while awake. This will help expand the small 
airways in your lungs and assist in coughing up secretions that 
pool in the lungs. 

You will be more comfortable if you use a cough pillow to hold 
against your chest and guard your rib cage while coughing and 
deep breathing.

Symptomatic relief with ice packs or heating pads for short 
periods may ease the pain.

Do NOT smoke.

Return to the ED right away for any acute shortness of breath, 
increased pain or crackling sensation around your rips 
(crepitus).

Narcotic pain medication can cause constipation. Therefore you 
should take a stool softener twice daily and increase your fluid 
and fiber intake if possible.

If your doctor allows, non steriodal ___ drugs are 
very effective in controlling pain (i.e. Ibuprofen, Motrin, 
Advil, Aleve, Naprosyn) but they have their own set of side 
effects so make sure your doctor approves.

text:
Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   M
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
Patient recorded as having No Known Allergies to Drugs
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
Cough, shortness of breath 
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None

 
History of Present Illness:
Mr. ___ is an ___ male with PMH significant for asthma, 
dementia, likely COPD and gait disorder who was sent to ED by 
his nursing home after 2 days of worsening cough and tachypnea. 
History limited due to the fact that patient is demented and 
speaks ___. History obtained from daughter who is 
patient's HCP with help of ___ interpreter. Per reports, he 
desaturated to the low-mid ___ range on room air earlier in the 
night at his nursing home and EMS was called. He was given 
albuterol nebulizers en route with improvement to 97-98% O2 
saturation on ___ L NRB en route to ___.  

On arrival to the ED, his VS were: temp 104.2F, HR 130s, BP 
192/98, RR30 and O2 saturation level 100% NRB. In ED, he 
received 4L NS IVFs, Combivent nebulizers x 3, Solumedrol 125mg 
IV x1, Tylenol 1g x1, and IV Vancomycin and 4.5mg IV Zosyn.  
  
On arrival to the FICU, patient appeared to be anxious and 
breathing rapid shallow breaths in the high ___ range with O2 
saturations in the high ___ on 5L NC. He also displayed 
accessory muscle use and had audible wheezes on exam.  
  
ROS: Per patient's daughter he denies headaches, chest pain, 
abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea, dysuria, hematuria. Daughter 
states he had one episode of emesis about 3 days ago and he has 
had ___ days of productive cough. In addition, patient's 
daughter denies any history of any known MIs, PEs, CVAs in Mr. 
___.  

 
Past Medical History:
-asthma  
-dementia /Alzheimers type  
-gait disorder  
-dysphagia  
 
Social History:
___
Family History:
Unable to obtain given limited ability to communicate.
 
Physical Exam:
ON ADMISSION:
Vitals -Temp:96.6F axillary, BP: 110/42 HR: 111 RR: 28 02 
sat:99% on 5L NC  

GENERAL: patient with pale, sweaty complexion, ill appearing and 
breathing rapid shallow breaths with some accessory muscle use 
noted  
HEENT: Normocephalic, atraumatic. No conjunctival pallor. No 
scleral icterus. PERRLA/EOMI. Dry MM. OP clear/upper dentures.  
NECK: No LAD. No JVD. No thyromegaly.  
CARDIAC: Rapid but regular rhythm, Normal S1/S2. No murmurs, 
rubs or gallops.  
LUNGS: Decreased breath sounds at RML and crackles over right 
base, poor air movement bilaterally. Some expiratory wheezes 
noted bilaterally in mid lung fields.  
ABDOMEN: Soft, NT, slightly distended, No HSM  
EXTREMITIES: No edema or calf pain, 2+ dorsalis pedis/ posterior 
tibial pulses.  
SKIN: No rashes/lesions, ecchymoses, pale skin  
NEURO: CN ___ grossly intact. Preserved sensation throughout. 
Moving all extremities but limited strength testing due to 
status. Gait assessment deferred  

ON DISCHARGE: 
Vitals stable
CV: regular, no mrg
PULM: scattered rhonci
ABD: soft, NTND
NEURO: responds to name, non-verbal.  No focal deficits
 
Pertinent Results:
DISCHARGE LABS:
CBC:  WBC-15.3* RBC-4.90 Hgb-14.4 Hct-42.6 MCV-87 MCH-29.5 
MCHC-33.9 RDW-14.2 Plt ___

CHEM 7: Glucose-155* UreaN-48* Creat-1.7* Na-140 K-3.5 Cl-102 
HCO3-24 AnGap-18
 
Brief Hospital Course:
Mr. ___ is an ___ male with PMH significant for asthma and 
dementia who presents now with imaging, labs and physical exam 
findings consistent with acute asthma exacerbation in setting of 
a RLL PNA and new sepsis presentation.  He had a complicated 
medical course and ultimately it was determined to focus on 
comfort care given the patient's end-stag dementia and chronic 
aspiration. He was discharged to hospice in stable condition.

# Goals of Care:  After a long discussion with the family and 
the palliative care service, it was determined that the family 
would like to focus on comfort given the patient's end-stage 
demetia and chronic aspiration.  Would recommend morphine prn 
for dyspnea or pain with bowel regimen and oxygen or fan as 
needed to control respiratory symptoms.  Additionally, would 
consider scopolamine for control of secretions if clinically 
indicated.  

# Sepsis/Pneumonia:  Patient presented with fevers to 104, 
respiratory rate in 30___, and tachycardic to 130s with systolic 
blood pressures in the 90's.  He was admitted to the ICU and 
treated with intravenous antibiotics and improved.  He was 
transferred to the floor.  He had 2 other episodes of acute 
respiratory worsening requiring ICU transfer and non-invasive 
ventilation.  These were thought to be secondary to aspiration 
of secretions and food.  He completed an 8 day course of 
antibiotics for hospital acquired pneumonia after the second 
acute worsening.  Family meeting and goals of care as above. 

# Chronic Aspiration:  Likely from demetia though speech/swallow 
study was essentially normal.  Given that goal of care is 
comfort, would allow patient to eat and drink if he wants, but 
he does not need to. 
# Acute Renal Failure: On presentation, patient's creatinine was 
1.4 with a peak of 2.1.  Ultimately improved with fluids to 1.7 
without further improvement. 

# Dementia:  End stage, long standing hisotry of Alzhemers.  
Goals of care as above. Patient appears somewhat confused and 
anxious on exam. Would avoid sedating medications. 

# Code Status:  DNR/DNI, confirmed with family.

# Contact: Granddaughter ___: ___ or ___.  
Daughter is at ___.
 
___ on Admission:
-Lactulose 30ml qdaily  
-MVI qdaily  
-Milk of Magnesia -30ml qdaily PRN  
-Fleet Enemas PRN  
-Robitussin DM -5ml q8h prn cough  
-ipratropium/albuterol 0.5/3 mg qid prn wheeze  
-trazodone 25mg q6h agitation/insomnia  
 
Discharge Medications:
1. Senna 8.6 mg Tablet Sig: ___ Tablets PO BID (2 times a day) 
as needed for Constipation.  
2. Bisacodyl 5 mg Tablet, Delayed Release (E.C.) Sig: Two (2) 
Tablet, Delayed Release (E.C.) PO DAILY (Daily) as needed for 
Constipation.  
3. Ipratropium Bromide 0.02 % Solution Sig: One (1) neb 
Inhalation Q6H (every 6 hours) as needed for shortness of breath 
or wheezing.  
4. Albuterol Sulfate 0.63 mg/3 mL Solution for Nebulization Sig: 
One (1) neb Inhalation every four (4) hours as needed for 
shortness of breath or wheezing.  

 
Discharge Disposition:
Extended Care
 
Facility:
___
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Primary:
End-Stage Demetia
Pneumonia
Sepsis
Asthma
Dysphagia

 
Discharge Condition:
Stable.  

 
Discharge Instructions:
You were admitted on ___ with pneumonia and an infection 
in your blood.  You were initially treated in the intensive care 
unit with IV fluids and antibiotics and you improved.

Because you have end-stage dementia a family meeting was held 
and the decision was made to focus on comfort.  Therefore your 
medication regimen was changed to focus on comfort.  The 
facility you are going to is the nursing home you've been in.  
They will manage your symptoms of shortness of breath or pain 
with medications to reduce those symptoms. 

Additionally, it was determined that you aspirate your saliva 
into your lungs which causes lung damage and shortness of breath 
and may cause infection.  Unfortunately, there is no way to 
prevent this from happening.  

You were started on a medication called Clonidine which is a 
patch.  This is to control your blood pressure because very high 
blood pressure and worsen breathing symptoms. 

It was a pleasure meeting you and participating in your care.

 
Followup Instructions:
___

ED에서는 4리터의 정맥 용액을 주었고 콤피넷 네블라제와 솔루메드롤 125㎎ IV, 티옴올 1그램, IV 반코마이신과 함께 4ℓ의 정강염을 주었다. 

ED에서의 상태는 다음과 같다. 온도 104°, 맥박 130번, 혈중 산소 포화율 100%, 혈장 크리티닌 1·4㎒, 혁발 192∕98㎜, 복용량 4リ터의 신체 검사 결과는 다음과 같이 나타났다. 또한 4 리터의 국소 신경계약물을 주어 4 ℓ의 신경 계통을 확보하였다.

환자의 병력은 다음과 같다.
______ M에 대해 4단계 담관암종으로 전신 치료를 받았으며 최근 C23 일제 cisplatinum / gemcitabin을 투여받았다. 현재 복식근염과 관련된 심각한 식후 복통으로 입원하였다. 그의 과거는 ____에서 진단되었고 그는 gem / cis ____로 시작하여 유방암 및 우측 수막증으로 진행되었다. 이제 로벤옥스를 사용하고 있다.

그가 세 주 전에 발생한 심각했던 복통은 확산되며 음식을 먹은 후 몇 시간 뒤에 발생하며 한 번은 3주 전에 구토했지만 지금은 주저함이다. 또한 잠시 동안 깨우치지 않아 식사를 하는 것이 불가능하다. 다뇨나 발열도 없다. 다른 증세도 없었다. 가정에서는 매우 활동적인 상태였다. 더 많은 옥소코돈을 집에서 사용하지만 그게 얼마나 도움이 되는지는 알 수 없다. 현재 통증은 _____이고 최대까지 증가했다.

임상 검사는 혈압 114 / 78, 맥박 68, 체온 99 ° F이었다. 클리닉에서의 실험실 결과는 중독성이 있는 신체검사가 눈에 띄었다.

전신 검사의견:
일반적으로 열이나 기침, 밤발모 등 없음.
HE ENT: 구강 내 출혈이나 고통스러운 삼키기, 액체나 고형물에 대한 감수성, 비강 압통, 콧구멍 분비물 등의 소변이 없거나 부드럽다.
CARDIO: 흉통이나 흉압, 운동 시 증상이나 박동이 없는 경우.
Pulmonary: 호흡곤란이나 객담, 혈액분출 등 없음. GU: 요로 기능 이상이나 배변 변화 없음.
MSKE: 관절염이나 근육통, 골풍경 등 없음 Dermatology: 피부염이나 가려움증이나 피부 파괴 없음 Neurology: 두통, 시야 변동, 이완감 혹은 국소 신경학적 증상이 아니다 Psychiatric: 우울증이나 불안 같은 느낌이 없다 모든 다른 전신 검사음성 부정.

과거 병력이 있다.
내과 역사:  ____ 처음에는 설사였으나 이후  ____에서 황달되어 의학적 평가를 받아서  ____ 에서 두 차례 ERCP 시행하였는데 여기서 담관 스텐트 삽입되었다. cytology는 초기로는 결정되지 않았으나 추후 연구에서 선암종 확인되었다. 외과적 조사 계획이었으나 조직검사에서 췌장암 종양으로 나타났다. 그리고  ____ 때 E. Coli 패혈증으로 인해 합병증이 있었다. Gemcitabinedicine/Cisplatinum system chemotherapy를  ____에 시작하였다.  ____ 이후 치료가 보류되었고  ____때 CT에서 진행되는 것으로 나타났고 우측hydronephrosis도 함께 가지고 있다. Gem citabine  ____와 CISPLATIN  ____를 각각 사용하였다. Single agent gemcit abine  ____, 그리고 결국  ____ CISPL AT IN  ____을 사용하기 시작하였다.

사회 역학:
____~

가족 역학: 어머니는 고혈압이며 아버지가 나이  ____년에 사망했고 동생은 건강 문제가 없다. 그는 세 명의 아이를 가지고 있으며 아들은 장애인이고 딸은  ____ 질환이 있다.

체외 검사:
입원 당시 체외 검사는 144/90HR 80RR 18 % 99°F T 89.9° F였다. 일반적으로 나쁜 상태이며 잘 걷는다 HE ENT: MMM, 구강내 출혔거나 고타게 삼킨 적이 없었으며 경추, 초두, 목덩어리 림프절, axillary lymph node, thyroid enlargement 모두 없었다 CV: RR, normal S1-S2, no S31 S4 MR G PULMONARY: CT AB GI: BS +, soft, no mass or splenomegally. RUQ tender but no guard rebound. Bilary drain in situ, no drainage LIMBS NO EDIMA, CLUBBING, TREMOUS OR ASTERIXIS;

Coronary Description
The coronary circulation is co dominant.
LM: The Left Main, arising from the left cusp, is a large 
caliber vessel. This vessel bifurcates into the

LAD: The Left Anterior Descending artery, which arises from the

a stent in the proximal and mid segments. There is a 70% 
stenosis in the distal segment. There is a 100%
stenosis in the distal segment.
The ___ Septal Perforator, arising from the proximal segment, is 
a small caliber vessel.
The ___ Septal Perforator, arising from the distal segment, is a 
medium caliber vessel. Collaterals from
the distal segment of the LAD connect to the proximal segment.
Cx: The Circumflex artery, which arises from the LM, is a large 
caliber vessel. There is a 46% stenosis
in the proximal segment. There is a 46% stenosis in the mid and 
distal segments.
The Left Posterolateral Artery, arising from the distal segment, 
is a medium caliber vessel.
RCA: The Right Coronary Artery, arising from the right cusp, is 
a large caliber vessel. There is a stent
in the proximal, mid, and distal segments. There is a 46% 
stenosis in the distal segment.
The SinoAtrial, arising from the proximal segment, is a small 
caliber vessel.
The Right Posterior Descending Artery, arising from the distal 
segment, is a medium caliber vessel.

Discharge Instructions:
 You were transferred from ___ to ___ to have a 
cardiac catheterization. This was done because you had an 
abnormal stress test at ___, and also an ultrasound of 
your heart showed that the pumping function  (called "Ejection 
Fraction (EF)") was significantly decreased (your EF is 20%, 
normal is 55% or greater). Your prior stents were still patent 
without issues. You had some mild to moderate blockages in a few 
of your coronary arteries, but they did not require a stent. The 
pressure in your heart while it relaxes was slightly elevated.

 Instructions regarding care of the access site in your wrist 
are included with your discharge information.  

 Please continue your current medications with the following 
changes:  
 - Decrease torsemide to 20 mg daily

Weight at discharge is: 203.6 pounds. 
We are sending you home with ___ services.
If you have any urgent questions that are related to your 
recovery from your hospitalization or are experiencing any 
symptoms that are concerning to you and you think you may need 
to return to the hospital, please call the ___ HeartLine at 
___ to speak to a cardiologist or cardiac nurse 
practitioner.  

 It has been a pleasure to have participated in your care and we 
wish you the best with your health!  

 Your ___ Cardiac Care Team  
 You were transferred from ___ to ___ to have a 
cardiac catheterization. This was done because you had an 
abnormal stress test at ___, and also an ultrasound of 
your heart showed that the pumping function  (called "Ejection 
Fraction (EF)") was significantly decreased (your EF is 20%, 
normal is 55% or greater). Your prior stents were still patent 
without blockages. You had some mild to moderate blockages in a 
few of your coronary arteries, but they did not require 
intervention. 

 Instructions regarding care of the access site in your wrist 
are included with your discharge information.  

 Please continue your current medications with the following 
changes:  
 - Decrease torsemide to 20 mg daily (A new prescription was 
provided for lower dose.)
 - Start raniditine 150mg every evening. This is an additional 
medication to treat your GERD/reflux/heartburn. A prescription 
was provided. (Though this is an "over the counter" medication 
which can also be purchased at your local pharmacy.)

You should weight yourself daily, If your weight goes up 3 lbs. 
in one day or 5 lbs in one week, please call your cardiologist. 
****Weight at discharge is: 203.6 pounds. 

We are sending you home with ___ services. You were seen by 
physical therapy who recommended a rolling walker. A 
prescription was provided for this. You will continue physical 
therapy per ___. 

You need your renal function labs drawn on ___. A written 
order/requisition was provided. The results will be faxed to 
your PCP and cardiologist.  

If you have any urgent questions that are related to your 
recovery from your hospitalization or are experiencing any 
symptoms that are concerning to you and you think you may need 
to return to the hospital, please call the ___ HeartLine at 
___ to speak to a cardiologist or cardiac nurse

 It has been a pleasure to have participated in your care and we 
wish you the best with your health!

이름 : ________________________    병실번호 : ____________________________
입원일자 : _______________________    퇴원일 자 : _______________________________
생년월일 : ___________________     성별 : 여성
서비스 : 내과
알레르기 : lisinopri l/omeprazole/Coumadin/Cephalex i n/Niferex/simvasta tin/prava statin/Rosi glitazon/metopr ol/
수술 또는 침습적 시술 : 심장 카테터화
환자의 주소는 다음과 같습니다 :
주민등록번호 : ________________________________________________________
전화번호 : _______ - _______ 전화번호 : 없음
주소지 : _______________________________________________

의사명 : _____________________
진료내역 : 호흡곤란
증상 및 증상 : SOB
심혈관계 경력 : 심근경색증, 허혈성 심방부전증, 만성 심부전후 EF 55~20%, 고혈압, 고콜레스테롤 혈증, 제2형 당뇨병, 만성이중신염
임시 진단 : 심정맥관 삽입 후 중간 벽 이상 양상 보인다.
치료계획 : 심계측 촬영에서 중간벽 이완을 보여서 심장카테터화를 시행하였다.
가족력 : 부모와 형제 모두 건강함.
사회력 : 없음.
 가족력이 있는 경우에는 해당 사항을 기재한다.
체온은 정상이며, 환자는 소변을 본 적이 없다.
안면 피부 검사는 정상이다.
호흡기는 평활하며, 폐렴세포검사가 가능하다.
심박동식은 정상의 범위에 있다.
손목 접속부는 안정되어 있으며, 손발은 온도감각이 잘 되어있다.
팔꿈치 관절은 통증이 없으며, 발바닥은 압통이 없다. 팔꿈치는 완전히 회복되었다.
허리 근육은 강하고, 하지 근육의 움직이는 것이 자유롭다.
골반은 둔한 편이고, 복부는 가볍고, 배설물은 많아졌다.
대퇴부 골절은 없었다.
만성 심근 경색증으로 인해 심장 기능 저하를 보였으나, 현재는 심장 함수가 약간 감소된 상태로 전향하여 치료받았다.
심장 기능 시험 결과 심장 EF 50% 미만이었다.
혈액검사결과 혈당은 높게 나타났다.
현재는 심장이 과도하게 작용하는 것으로 판단된다.
혜음은 심하지 않으며, 체온은 상승되지 않았다.
혐담증은 심했지만, 최근에는 개선되었다.
현우증은 있었으나, 지금은 괜찮다.
혓추출량은 증가했다.
협산분비는 증가하였으나, 위궤양은 없었다. 간질환이나 신장 질환이 있었다.
혖은 심하지만, 식욕은 좋다.
심장은 불규칙하나, 맥박은 정상을 유지하고 있다.
형은 심했고, 흉곧은 없었으나, 요로 장애가 있어야 한다.
혙약은 사용되고 있으나, 효과는 크지 않은 듯 하다.
유전자 검사에서는 유전적인 면역 결핍이 발견되었으나, 그 영향은 큰 것은 아니다.
혠은 심하기 때문에, 항바이러스제를 투여해야 할 필요가 있다.
심리는 심했으나, 현저한 증상은 없는 것 같다.
혝낭종이나 비뇰판염은 없었다 그러나, 조직학적으로는 변화가 있을 수 있다.
현미경 검사를 통해 원인을 파악할 수 있었다.
심리가 심해서, 항균제를 사용하면 된다.
혯은 심했던 것을 알았으니, 항암제를 복용하자.
혴는 심했는데, 아직까지는 별다른 증상이 없어왔다.
혗은 심었던 것을 알고, 항염증제를 먹으면 되었다.
혹는 심졌다고 생각되므로, 항생제를 처방받으라.
혮은 심렸다고 생각되는 부분이 있는데, 항 염증제가 필요한 것이다.
혲는 심더니, 항산화제를 섭취하면 된다.

resources that would be available to her, but the patient was 
not amenable to what was available and asked to leave. Her 
ourpatient psychaitrist who follows her regularly was contacted

------------- Vitals: 98·5·78·126/76·19·96%
ED에서 초기 혈압은 다음과 같았다.
arrival에 따라 응답할 수 있었으며 식품 섭취, 추락, 외상, f/C, HA 또는 통증을 거부했다. 그러나 역사적으로 신뢰성이 낮다. 그녀는 입원 당일에 모든 약물을 가지고 있었다.

ED에서는 혼란 상태와 관련된 환자가 있었다. 관찰 결과는 다음과 같이 나타났다.
관찰 결과 : QRS는 112이었으며 종결 R파는 나쁜 형태를 가졌다. Cittalopram은 드물게 나트륨 채널 폐쇄와 관련이 있으며 프로메타지네는 QTc 길이를 증가시켰다. Lab 결과는 유방암 12·9(림프 42·7), 크 0·9, 혈청 독성 음성이었다. Urine독성은 아직 확인되지 않았다. Pt는 2amp 사중탄산염, Bicarbonate GGT를 받았으며, 반복적인 EKG는 QRS가 105였다.

MICU에 도착했을 때 잠들었지만 스텐날 루브에 깨워졌으며 빠르게 회복되었다. 그녀에게는 무작위 노출이 있을 가능성이 있으므로 토익스러지는 것이 좋다고 했다. 그러나 그녀의 안정적인 임상 상태 때문에 추가 개입이 필요하지 않았으며, 그녀는 HIV 예방 접종을 시작했고, 감염병으로 이어질 수 있다고 했다. 그녀는 심각한 중재 없이 병실로 옮겨져서 그곳에서 복용해야 한다. 그녀는 집에서 정신 건강 약물과 메테돈을 계속 사용하고 있다. 그녀는 아마도 일요일 밤에 발생한 사건 때문인지 폭발적이고 폭풍 같은 행동을 보였으나 결국에는 요구를 받아냈다. 사회 서비스는 또한 가능한 리소스를 제공하는 데 도움을 주었다. 그러나 환자는 무엇인가를 원치 않아 떠났다. 그녀의 외래 정신科 의사가 연락해 왔다. 그녀는 경찰 보고서는 없었다. 그녀는 POLICE REPORT 파일럿이 아니었다. 그녀는 Narcan 2회 투여받았으나 효과가 없었다. Fingerstick은 106이었다. ED에서 초기 비율은 98 · 5· 78· 126· 75· 19· 96 %였다. Arrival에 따라 환자는 단순 질문에 답할 수 있었다. 환자는 어떤 식품이나 물건, 외상의 흔적이 없었으며, 그러나 그의 역사를 믿을 수 없다는 것을 알렸다. 그는 자신의 약들을 모두 들고 갔다. ED에서의 관찰은 혼란 증세와 관련되어 있었다. 두뇌는 3 mm 균등하게 반응하며, MM은 건조했으며, 근육통이나 rigidity는 없었다. 그는 2MG Versed, 그리고 20 MG IM Zypreza를 받았다. ECG는 QSR 112로 눈에 띌 만큼 특징이 있는데, 이는 나트럼채널폐색에 관한 Morphology를 갖는다. Cittlopram은 희귀 인 경우 Na Channel Blockage와 관련있다. Prometheazine은 QTc lengthening을 초래한다. Lab result는 WBC12· 9(Lymph 42 · 7), CR 0 · 9, Serum Toxin Negative, Urine Toxin Pending이었다. Pt가 2 amp Sodium Bicarb, Bicc Carb GGT을 받았는데, 그것은 Na Channel Toxicity에 대한 것이다. Repeated ECG showed QRS to be 105. On arrival to Micu, Pt was sleepily awake to sternum rubs but rapidly became drowsy again. She had improved significantly regarding mental status, requiring no further

___ 07:00AM BLOOD WBC-9.6 RBC-3.66* Hgb-10.2* Hct-30.9* 
MCV-84 MCH-27.9 MCHC-33.0 RDW-12.4 RDWSD-37.8 Plt ___
___ 07:00AM BLOOD Glucose-157* UreaN-65* Creat-3.5* Na-143 
K-4.5 Cl-102 HCO3-28 AnGap-13

IMAGING/REPORTS
===============
___ Renal US
There is no hydronephrosis, definite stones, or worrisome masses 
bilaterally. Echogenic appearance of the renal cortex is 
concerning for chronic medical renal disease.  The right kidney 
measures 9.7 cm and the left kidney measures 12.3 cm. The 
bladder is mostly decompressed.
IMPRESSION: 
Echogenic appearance of the kidneys concerning for medical renal 
disease.  No hydronephrosis.  Limited evaluation of the bladder 
given decompressed state.

___ CXR:
PA and lateral views of the chest provided.  Low lung volumes.  
Lungs are clear. There is no focal consolidation, effusion, or 
pneumothorax.  There are no signs of congestion or edema.  The 
cardiomediastinal silhouette is normal. Imaged osseous 
structures are intact.  No free air below the right 
hemidiaphragm is seen.  Clips in the right upper quadrant noted.
IMPRESSION: 
No acute intrathoracic process.
 
Brief Hospital Course:
Mr. ___ is a ___ year-old man with a history of IDDM, CAD, gout 
who is found to have acute on chronic renal failure. Nephrology 
was consulted and this was thought to be due to a combination of 
pre-renal etiology from a recent illness on vacation versus AIN 
from unclear antibiotic/treatment regimen. Steroids for possible 
AIN were considered but held due to stable clinical status and 
his kidney function slowly improved with supportive care over 
the course of his hospitalization.

ACUTE/ACTIVE ISSUES
===================
# ___ on CKD
Last Cr 3.3 ___ (previously ~2s), up to 8.2 on admission. 
Suspect that he may have had an AIN given WBC casts and possible 
new medication exposure in the ___. There may 
also be a component of prerenal azotemia given improvement in Cr 
with IVF and relatively low urine Na. Uric acid nephropathy also 
possible given elevated serum urate but no crystals on light 
microscopy. ___, RF negative, Leptospira Ab pending on 
discharge. He was given bicarbonate and sevelamer for low 
bicarbonate and high phosphate on admission, but these were held 
on discharge as his renal function returned to its recent 
baseline.

#DM2
On home Insulin regimen, ISS. Having trouble getting a 
glucometer at home. Diabetes educator consulted, will provide 
glucometer and a small supply of test strips today, and also his 
home sliding scale was discontinued, he will follow up in ___ 
___ clinic for continued titration. 

CHRONIC/STABLE ISSUES
=====================
# LFT Abnormalities, resolved
Cholestatic predominant pattern of liver injury on admission. 
DDx includes drug reaction (in setting of ?AIN) or congestive 
hepatopathy given moderate hypervolemia on admission. No focal 
tenderness on exam c/w cholecystitis. LFTs resolved without 
intervention. Found to be Hep B non-immune.

# Polyarticular joint pain (L knee, R elbow)
# Gout
Prior flare in ___, treated with short prednisone taper. Does 
not appear to have an acute gout flare on exam. 
- APAP 650mg q8h PRN
- Held colchicine on discharge due to still slightly elevated 
renal function and already on allopurinol.

# CAD: Continued home ASA and statin.

# HTN: 
- Continued home amlodipine, carvedilol, and atenolol
- Holding lisinopril until PCP/Nephrology follow up

# Anemia: at baseline

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES
===================
[] Would repeat BMP within one week to ensure stability / return 
to baseline.
[] Consider restarting lisinopril at follow up, also consider 
increasing this and decreasing/discontinuing carvedilol and 
atenolol give some episodes of sinus bradycardia while 
inpatient.
[] Could restart daily colchicine as long as renal function 
returns to baseline / remains stable, but would consider holding 
it given already on allopurinol and no recent gout flairs.
[] Should have hepatitis B vaccination as was found to be 
non-immune with no prior exposure this admission.
[] See by diabetes educator for re-education about glucometer 
and pens. ISS discontinued due to concern for 
frailty/hypoglycemic events at home. He should continue to 
follow with them in clinic for insulin titration.

내력은 다음과 같습니다.
이 환자는 당뇨병에 걸려 있고 심근 경색증을 앓고 있습니다. 그는 몇 날 전부터 다리와 팔꿈치 통증을 호소하고 있으며 혈액 검사를 받았습니다. 그는 병원을 찾았다. 이 환자의 가족력이 있다. 그의 혈당 수치는 높으며 혈압도 높다. 그는 약물을 복용하지 않았다. 그들은 혈중 크레아틴 수치를 측정했는데 이는 이전보다 높은 수준이었다. 그는 잠을 잘 못 자고 피곤하며 식욕 부전 증상을 보였다. 그는 소변량이 좋다고 하였으나 실제로는 그렇지 않다. 체온은 정상이며 발열이나 기침은 없다. 그는 뇌졸중 후유증으로 인해 걷는 것이 어렵다는 것을 알게 되었다. 그는 지난 해에 두 번 투석을 받았다. 그는 항문 주사기를 사용할 수 없다는 것을 알고 있었다. 그는 심한 불면증을 겪었지만 이를 극복했다. 그는 과거에 담낭염을 경험했고 현재에는 그러한 증상이 나타나지 않는다. 그의 근육통은 가벼웠다. 그가 경험하는 것은 단순히 무기질이다. 그는 최근에 심각한 합병증 없이 사망하였다. 그의 상태는 안정되어 있었으며 이후에도 계속 유지되었다. 그의 심혈관계는 좋은 편이었으며 심부전이 없었다. 그의 폐렴은 완전히 회복되었으며 흉곽 엑스레이에서 아무런 이상 징후를 발견하지 못 했다. 그의 동맥경화증은 진행 중인 것으로 알려졌다. 그의 간 기능은 양호하였으며 위장 장애는 없었으며 대변이 정상적인 양을 배출하였다. 그는 비만이 아니며 체중 감소가 없는 상태였다. 그의 맥박은 정상의 범위 내이고 혈류 흐름도 원활하다. 그의 관절은 통증이 없어졌으며 골반의 움직임 또한 자유롭게 이루어지고 있다. 그러나 그의 신장은 작아서 운동 능력이 떨어지는 상황이다. 그의 말초신경은 정숙하여 활동성이 낮았다. 그의 정신 상태는 명확하며 의식은 일상적으로 유지되고 있다. 하지만 그의 기억력은 저조하며 집중력을 잃었다. 그의 언어 표현은 적극적이며 사고력은 평균 정도이다. 그러나 자신의 생각을 제대로 표현하기 어려운 점이 많았다. 그리고 그의 행동은 조심스럽고 반응 속도가 느렸다. 그의 지능은 평균 이상이며 학업 및 직업 수행 능력은 평범하다. 그러나 사회적 상호작용은 미흡하며 개인적 관계에서도 문제점이 발생한다. 그의 생활 습관은 규칙적이지 않고 음주 및 금연 여건은 나쁘다. 그리고 건강 관리도 충분하지 않은 실수를 하고 있다. 따라서 그의 삶의 질은 만족스러워 하지 못 한다. 그의 교육 수준은 고등학교 졸업 이상이며 직업은 종교인이 아닌 일반직업을 가지고 있다. 그리고 결혼 상태는 아니다. 그의 가족 구성원은 배우자가 하나밖에 없다. 그리고 자녀는 딸이 한 명이다. 그녀의 나이는 35세이며 그녀의 생년월일에 대한 정보는 제공되지 않았다. 그녀는 아버지에게 전화로 인터뷰를 요청하였다. 그녀가 하는 말을 듣고 싶다면 다음날 오라. 그녀는 외모가 예뻐보이는 여성이다. 그리고 그녀의 태도는 친절하며 협동적이다. 그녀는 자신감이 강하지만 지나친 자기 자신감은 아닙니다. 그녀는 자신의 욕구를 이해하는데 어려움이 있으므로 더 많은 관심을 가져달라고 부탁드리고자 한다. 그녀의 꿈은 행복하게 살고자 하는 것이다. 그녀의 목표는 성공적인 결혼과 함께 아이들을 키우고자 한다라는 것이다. 그녀는 아직까지 자신의 진로를 결정하지 못한 상태이다. 그녀를 위해서는 더욱더 많은 사랑과 지원이 필요하다. 그녀의 이름은 ____입니다. 그녀의 연락처는 ____입니다..

Mr. ___ is a ___ year old right handed man with past

wide open eyes staring around room.  Was unable to respond to

verbal function slowly returned with first responses of "why?" 
to any requests, and finally full appropriate responses with 
following commands.  Of note, Mr. ___ was agitated and 
angry with any questions for a period of time after his initial 
event. 

Approximately 10 minutes after his event, questioning continued 
with the patient noting he did not remember his previous 
presentation, or myself (who had taken care of the patient 
during his ___ admission).  He noted the events which have 
occurred which are what he describes as "Electrographically 
negative" mostly involve him being unable to respond; however, 
he is aware of what is occurring which makes him quite 
distressed and bitter. He notes always having some jerks in his 
head and upper extremities in varying degrees during these 
events.  

During the interview, Mr. ___ had a second event which 
began with no premonition, aura, or signal and was characterized 
by loss of speech in the middle of a sentence, extending his 
arms in varying degrees to his head, turning first to the right 
then left for around ___ minutes with some confusion. During the 
event sudden jerking movements of his head both to the right and 
left, myotonic like contractions of his arms, with his legs 
alternatively flexing at the hip and knee and releasing 
repeatedly. Mr. ___ said these actions were not voluntary 
upon resolution of his symptoms.

His last tonic-clonic character occurred in ___ at his

Brief Hospital Course:
# Neurologic:
On admission, the patient was started on continuous EEG 
monitoring with which multiple push button events in the first 
24 hours revealed none of the witnessed episodes associated with 
electrographic events.  Over the course of the following ___ 
days, the lamictal dose was decreased 100mg per day with Onfi 
started at 5mg qhs, then BID after the first day. 

Mr. ___ continued to have events with the same morphology 
over the course of the next eight days, with posturing, gazing 
around, and unresponsiveness.  Of note, these events were all 
recorded on EEG with no electrographically associated component. 
 His Clobezam was increased to 20mg BID on which he was 
discharged.

# Cardiovascular:
Telemetry was initiated along with EEG monitoring which revealed 
no specific ectopy or abnormal events.

# ___: 
The patient was evaluated for ambulation, however, despite their 
requests for rehabilitation, Mr. ___ declined.  Home 
services were established with the patient and outpatient 
appointments were made.

continuous EEG to further characterize your seizure disorder and 
change your anti-epileptic drug regimen from Lamictal 
(lamotrigine) to Onfi (clobezam).  While you were being 
monitored, several push-button events were recorded; however, 
none of the events coincided with any change in EEG suggesting 
highly that the events are non-electrographic events.

Please continue using the Clobezam as prescribed, and continue 
to follow up with your appointments as scheduled.
 
Followup Instructions:
___

The left atrium is mildly dilated. The estimated right atrial

>55%). There is mild (non-obstructive) focal hypertrophy of the 
basal septum. Right ventricular chamber size and free wall

is mildly dilated. The aortic valve leaflets (3) are mildly

very small circumferential pericardial effusion without evidence

regurgitation. Normal biventricular cavity sizes with preserved 
global and regional biventricular systolic function. No definite

of ___, mild mitral regurgitation and a very small

Brief Hospital Course:
___ y/o RHF with HTN who presents with new left sided weakness
facial droop and dysarthria.  ___ did not show any evidence of
bleeding or infaction.  However, her examination is consistent
with a new stroke.

NEURO:
Patient was admitted as code stroke with dense L hemiparesis. 
Not given t-PA because of time of symptom onset. Initial CT, 
CTA/P in ED did not show any acute stroke or vessel pathology. 
Patient was admitted to stroke service. Blood pressure was 
allowed to autoregulate, and home BP medications were initially 
held. Patient was started on full strength ASA and simvastatin. 
Fasting lipid panel and HbA1c were within normal limits. 
Since imaging did show small vessel disease, it was presumed 
that patient had subcortical lacune due to small vessel disease. 
Given patient could likely not tolerate MRI due to back pain and 
age, repeat CT imaging was obtained after 3 days. On repeat CT, 
there was small right medial pontine infarct, which is likely 
affecting the corticospinal tract on the right, causing her 
dense L hemiparesis. 
TTE showed mild valvular disease but no etiology for stroke and 
no significant change from prior.
Her neurologic examination remained stable. She was restarted on 
___ for BP prior to discharge.

RESP:
H/o asthma. Patient continued on home inhalers and chronic 
prednisone. She had no acute respiratory issues. 

ID: Had positive UA. Although she was afebrile with normal WBC 
and no symptoms, she was started on ciprofloxicin which she has 
tolerated in the past, for a 7 day course. 

___: Pt discharged to rehab facility.

Main complaint: Right Lower Quadrant Pain

Present illness history: This is a 31-year-old man after liver transplantation in 2019 (follow-up children in 2020), situs inversus, vascular problems such as IVC obstruction and azigos vein stents. He came to our emergency room with progressive onset of right lower quadrant pain and bilateral leg swelling lasting one day. Associated symptoms included nausea, no temperature rise.

Emergency Department Initial Vital Signs: Temperature 97.70%, Heart Rate 78 beats/min., Blood Pressure 120/80 mmHg, Respiratory Rate 18 breaths/min., Oxygen Saturation 95%. Lab results revealed white blood cell counts of 12,500 cells/mm³, hemoglobin 12 g/dL, hematocrit 40%, mean corpuscular volume 90 fL, mean corpuscle hemoglobin concentration 29.50 g/dl, red blood cell distribution width 13.80%. Peripheral smear findings were neutrophils 65.80%, monocytes 7.70% eosinophils 1.50%, basophil 0.80%.

Abdominal computed tomography scan demonstrated enlargement of the right ovaries with multiple fluid-filled cysts. Bilateral Doppler ultrasonography failed to show deep vein thromboses. Hepatic venogram showed no thrombotic lesions. Pelvic examination revealed a large hemorrhagic cyst on the right side with no sign of torsional twisting. Ob/GYN recommended admission to the internal medicine ward for serial examinations and pain management because of various comorbidities. Onward care would be provided according to the wishes of the internal medicines team. There were no active complications identified during his visit to the transplant clinic either.

Upon arrival to Internal Medicine Ward, he remained stable. Minimal abdominal discomfort occurred upon movement. Currently there is no nausea present.

Otherwise, review of systems reveals no febrile illnesses, chilies, vomiting, diarrhea.

Last Updated on ___ year old gentleman with a PMH significant for HCV cirrhosis 
complicated by ___ s/p lobe resection in ___, who presented on 
post-operative day ___ from craniotomy for a subdural hematoma 
with fever, rash, and hypotension.
.
#. Hypotension and Fever: There was immediate concern for sepsis 
on presentation to the ED, although no apparent source was 
isolated and no significant fever was recorded in the hospital 
(had 100.4 on admission to the ED). Sepsis workup was negative 
including CXR, UA, Urine and Blood cultures. Final blood cutlure 
results are still pending. Given recent craniotomy the 
neurosurgery service was consulted and was not concerned for CNS 
infection. A RUQ ultraound was performed that confirmed a 
moderate amount of ascites and patency of the hepatic vessels, 
but the abdomen was not tender and the suspicion for SBP was 
low. Adrenal insuficiency was ruled out per cosyntropin test. 
The patient did receive a dose of Vancomycin and Levofloxacin in 
the ED but none were continued in the ICU as the patient 
remained afebrile and the ICU team's suspicion for infectious 
process was low. The patient recieved a dose of IV steroids in 
the ED and subsequently recieved a 3 day course of Prednisone 
60mg. Dilantin was considered as a possible etiology for his 
presentation, especially given the acute renal failure and 
associated morbilliform rash, as a type IV drug reaction, 
including DRESS, though no eosinophilia was noted on 
differential. Adittionally patient had recently been started on 
Keflex so anaphylactic shock due to allergy to cephalosporins is 
another possibility. Both dilantin and Keflex were discontinued 
and should be avoided in the future.  The patient remained 
afebrile and normotensive during his ICU stay and the day after 
admission was transferred to the oncology service. He remained 
stable on the oncology floor and is now discharged back to rehab 
facility.  
.
#. Acute Renal Failure: Patient was admitted with a serum 
creatinine of 1.2, up from a known baseline of 0.9 to 1 likely 
pre-renal failure in the setting of hypotension. His Cr. on 
discharge was 0.9. Renal functions and electrolytes should be 
followed in the outpatient setting.  
.  
#. Elevated Liver Enzymes: ___ Hepatitis C Cirrhosis and 
Hepatocellular Carcinoma: Patient failed Interferon and 
Ribavirin in the past. Patient with known multifocal HCC 
recurrence re-confirmed per RUQ ultrasound on this admission.
.
# Metabolic Acidosis: initially normochloremic with slightly 
elevated AG, then hyperchloremic with normal anion gap. Likely 
initially ___ to tissue hypoperfusion given the elevated lactate 
on admission. Lactate was 3.1 on admission and decreased to 1.3. 
Also contributed to by renal failure. Bicarbonate trending up on 
discharge.  
.
# Anemia: at baseline of ___. Had initial drop of Hct 
secondary to rehydration and resolution of Hemmoconcentration, 
Hct back to baseline at discharge. 
.
#. Hypertension: Anti-hypertensives were held in the setting of 
hypotension. Tamsulosin 0.4 mg was restarted on discharge.  
Amlodipine continues to be held on discharge
.
#. Hypothyroid: Patient was continued on Levothyroxine without 
event. Of note patient found to have increased palpable right 
lower thyroid lobe. Further workup of this finding may be 
considered in the out patient setting.
.
# Code status during this admission: Full

2. Tamsulosin 0.4 mg HS

10. Keflex

You were admitted because of rash and low blood pressure. You 
were treated with intravenous fluids and steroids and your 
condition quickly improved. We believe this event may have been 
due to reaction or allergy to medications you were taking either 
Dilantin (phenytoin) or Keflex (cephalexin). Please avoid these

.

.

.

환자는 요양에서 열감과 몸살, 통풍 등이 있고, 특히 오른쪽 갑상선 종괴나 신경근 마비는 없다. 또한 환자가 admit된 것은 요양시였다. 

입원 당시 VS 101 70 80/60/20 95%. 환자는 음극성 세포 증가증이 있으며, 특히 요양에서는 심각하지 않다. 

요양 때 초기 VS 102 71 81/61 21 93%. 환인은 음독이나 식욕 이상이 없었으며, 특히 환자는 약물을 복용하고 있는 상태였다. 또한, 환자는 항문 출혈이나 소변 색깔 변화 등의 징후가 없다고 한다. 

중재는 진행되고 있지만 아직까지는 정밀 검사가 필요하다.

환자의 현재 상황 :

환자는 요산, 디abetic mellitus, HT NN을 가진 27 세 남자로, 요산 치료제를 받고 있지 않은 상태에서, HT N을 포함하여 여러 가지 약물을 복용 중이었다. 또한, 그는 요산을 받았고, HT NA와 같은 다른 질환이 없었다. 환자가 퇴원하기 전에, 그는 여전히 HT NA를 받았다. 따라서, HTNA는 환자를 위해 중요한 것은 아니었다.

환자는 2 일간 집에서 지내었고, 이후 HT NA가 필요 없는 상태에서 HT NA만 받았다.

환자의 상태는 다음과 같았다.
환자는 HT NA로 인해 HT NA에게 접촉할 수 없었다. HT NA는 환자가 HT NA에 대해 알고 있다고 생각하는 것이다.
